0.Review: Light in style, I like the little touch of sweetness and cooked agave. This one is a nice sipper.

1.Review: En nariz: Roble, vainilla, miel, butterscotch,  cerveza, sidraEn boca se confirman deliciosamente los aromas, resaltando la fresca e intensa cereza.

2.Review: Atanasio AnejoI smell cooked agave, light honey and dark brown sugar along with a floral note. I taste the sweet cooked agave and then some allspice with the cinnamon punching through. I then get a light American whiskey note ( oak barrel and whiskey ). The body is nice and the finish is pleasant but light. This is a good balanced Anejo where you can enjoy the age and agave equally. Well done Atanasio. Salud!

3.Review: Lots of Berries and oak stand out on this one. Very enjoyable sipper

4.Review: Bottle 92, Lote 1Nose:   Ripe berries, melon and a suggestion of hard cider. Cinnamon, and an aromatic blend of allspice, powdered ginger and nutmeg. Background aromas of butterscotch, vanilla and caramel. This is all held together with an oak presence that does not overwhelm the agave. Flavors:   Vibrant and vivacious profile. Caramel with assertive pepper and cinnamon. Yet sits nicely on the palate with silky fruit notes of cantaloupe drizzled with honey. Finish:   There is butterscotch retrohale, with pepper and light salinity. This loses some points on price point.  It is nearly double the price of the repo. But a fine tequila, none the less.

5.Review: Great oak and agave base - with nice lingering finish. Some cinnamon and citrus with bit of vanilla. Very nice and liking it more the more I sip.

6.Review: Nose:AgaveCaramel VanillaCinnamon Flavor:OakPepperCinnamon Getting agave and pepper on the finish.

7.Review: Nov 18, 2022tasted at distillery. such an amazing tour. good tequilas!

9.Review: Overhyped for my pállate at least.. it has great aroma sits good in your mouth but as it goes down it burns .. I May try it again as I had it going against reserva de la familia añejo and extra añejo tasting the race was not fair. The price is overpriced for my taste..

10.Review: Such a balance between complex agave and smooth aroma and flavours. A must try.

11.Review: An elegant Añejo. Many times an añejo will be too okay, too sweet and whiskey like. This añejo is very earthy to me which is amazing. It’s a sweetheart earthy, mineral flavor for me.

12.Review: Wood and weet agave on nose and palate. This is one of the best añejos I have tested. Slight and enjoyable burn.Agave dulce y madera en nariz y paladar. Este es uno de los mejores añejos que he probado. Un ligero ardor que se disfruta y complementa el sabor.

13.Review: I met Chris Morris who is the US Ambassador for the Atanasio brand of Tequila.  Me being an Anejo connoisseur, was recommended to the Atanasio Anejo by my friend AyMan who owns M&R Liquor in Cypress, TX.  The very first time I sipped it I was a fan.  I recently did a tequila tasting event for a bunch of guys who knew very little about Tequila and it was hands down the Atanasio Anejo was the clear favorite among 10 other Tequila’s in its peer group.  If you are in the Houston area, send me a note and I can hook you up with a place to get it.  Or, if you are not in Houston, you can find it on siptequila’s website.  Also, follow me on my YouTube Channel  Tequilla Heffe ( with and H).  Cheers and more to come!

14.Review: This is an Añejo I can get behind!Beautifully balanced, touch of spice and heat.Great strong long finish.

15.Review: Aroma - caramel, butterscotch Flavor - butterscotch, faint oak, vanilla Finish - smooth and warm

16.Review: Sweet taste.Honey. Round, no slice.Warm on the tongue

18.Review: Vegetal on the nose… clean, some hay ….. slight burn, black pepper, on the mouth with some natural sweetness, cooked agave …. Light and fruity… citrus….. very complex

20.Review: Pretty solid Blanco, a little musky on the nose, heavy agave with some light citrus notes.

21.Review: Cooked agave, lime, black pepper. Nice from aroma to the finish and at a decent price. No additives and transparency on the label!

22.Review: NOM 1499|Nose brings a sweet grassiness and some agave. Really that almost creamy but grassy note is the most prominent note. Lemon custard notes, very “rounded”. On the palate, it’s agave, some brininess, a touch of olives. Surprisingly sweet but not cloying by any means. Overall super solid offering. I definitely enjoy this much more than the añejo. I’d love a high proof version of this. I won’t stock the aged expressions but I’ll probably keep the blanco around.

23.Review: NOM 1499|Fresh grass and citrus, light grapefruit and some minerality and cooked agave on the nose….. smell is very light.  Some burn up front doe sent last long… cooked agave with some black pepper … slight alcohol at the end and light feel

24.Review: NOM 1526: No surprise the original line is all treasure bottles. This blanco has a great viscosity with gorgeous sexy legs! Chewy AF, warm cooked agave, eucalyptus, lemongrass, Bazooka Joe, crisp apple, so clean and complex for a blanco.

25.Review: NOM 1499|No way for this to live up to the original 1439 and the most common NOM 1526, but it is a worthy follow on to those two iconic releases. A bit rough around the edges this Blanco presents agave, pepper and some natural sweetness with a pleasing mouth feel. A spike of ethanol at the end knocks this down just a bit.Rating 1000 by my account. Memorable

26.Review: NOM 1499|Very drinkable, but the finish is just a bit too hot for me. Almost a burn, but it does fade. And if you use it for fresh made cocktails, it’s more a perfect fit.

27.Review: NOM 1499|Real nice balance flavors from a contract distillery. Well made. Great to sip or mix

28.Review: Original Corrido is one of, if not, my favorite blanco ever.. total unicorn tears for sure. Agave, chaulk, sugary sweet grassy pureness...Unbelievable -Nom 1526the new NOM 1499 version would be more like an 87-89 for me

29.Review: NOM 1439|NOM 1439 blanco. A not too sweet entry, and lots of white pepper. Great stuff if you can find any.

31.Review: NOM 1526|Love it. You can pick up a lot of agave in the nose. I love peppery highland tequilas so this definitely pleases my profile. A great value for a really well made blanco.

32.Review: NOM 1526|Aromas of grass, dirt and citrus are pretty subtle. Also hints of agave and alcohol. Smooth, peppery flavor with floral notes (can't believe I'm saying this but a distinct presence of a rose floral flavor...that's a new one). The finish is long and satisfying. A very good blanco tequila.

33.Review: NOM 1526|This one always reminds me a lot of the 7 Leguas blanco. The aroma has the same snap peas smell (but possibly even stronger). The flavor is a lot more mild though. You still get the agave but not as much pepper. It's a great blanco but I prefer 7 Leguas just a little bit more.

34.Review: NOM 1526|The nose has a very nice roast agave presence with pear notes and a moderate amount of alcohol aroma. It features good agave and citrus fruit in the mouth, with a mildly bitter finish.

35.Review: NOM 1412|1412 Nom is significantly more complex in every way compared to their 1499 Nom. Nose is now almost a Fortaleza olive now. Sweet cooked agave, light earth and vegetal notes, tons of olive and brine which follows through to the palate. Finish is longer, less citrusy but still lingering sweet agave paired with pepper. Delicious and a great sipping blanco at $47.

36.Review: this rating is for Corrido blanco from NOM 1526. tho the label says cristalino, this wasn't a cristalino in the sense they are today (this was not aged and stripped of flavor with additives to make it sweet). in this case, the word "cristalino" was used as an adjective meaning crystal clear.In a blind tasting we did back in 2014?, this came out on top with Fortaleza (didn't note the Fortaleza lote - damn it; we didn't realize that back then).anyway, from what I remember, this BLANCO from NOM 1526 is top 5 all-time. I want to revisit it but only have one bottle left!

37.Review: NOM 1499|This is an exceptional blanco. Rich, sweet agave on the nose. Some citrus, a little spice and just more sweet agave. Aroma follows through on the taste as there’s an incredible agave taste. Perfect balance of sweet and spicy. This is an awesome value at $47.99 and regular available at my local liquor store.

38.Review: NOM 1499|NOM 1499Aroma is agave-forward with nice earthiness (soil, cut grass, minerality) that’s balanced by lemon and lime peels. Aroma carries through on the flavor that’s bolsters by an olive salinity which leads to the finish that’s long with cooked agave, black pepper, and citrus.

39.Review: Corrido blanco (NOM 1412)Nose:  Nice agave prescence, vegetal, lemon-rind, black pepper, anise, and fresh cut grass.Tastes: The aromas are equally represented on the tongue. Nice savory agave, and the pepper pops nicely with good warmth from the alcohol. Mouth feel is buttery and clean. It goes down smooth, and finishes well. Here's a good agave-juice that could serve double duty as a sipper, or a mixer for a quality Margarita or Paloma.

40.Review: Corrido Blanco is a very good blanco from NOM 1412, $59 @ Ferment and Still.  Reminds me of Yeyo but with a $20USD higher price tag.  Lost a few points on affordability. Aroma: Bright. Bold sweet nose of cooked agave and black pepper. Citrus, cinnamon, and vegetal notes. I found the nose softens and improves with time after opening the bottle.Taste:  A chewy sweetness and a buttery moutfeel. Cinnamon warmth with a big punch of cracked pepper.  Light notes of melon, citrus, and anise. Finish: Fades quickly.  Hints of sweetness and pepper with a slight undesirable bitterness at the end.

41.Review: NOM 1499|Nom 1499. Nice agave flavor but a bit hot. Great mixer juice though!! My bottle had floaties.

42.Review: tons of agave pepper mint citrus. not the same as the old release but still very good.  nom 1499

43.Review: NOM 1499. This one opens later. Fresh cut agave, pear and grapefruit in the aroma. Cooked agave, citrus and anise with in the mouth. Finishes with a grassy fruity taste. Pretty good sipper but would go well in a mixed.

44.Review: nose apricot citrus mint alcohol taste lovely minty citrus with enjoyable warm peppery finish

45.Review: NOM 1499|Lots of agave & brine on the nose that carries through to the palate with some white pepper & citrus. Hint of sour (not a bad thing) on a medium long finish. Solid!

46.Review: NOM 1499|All I can say is loads and loads of agave….

48.Review: NOM 1526|Nice Earthy Agave nose and flavor, consistent batches.  Guitar pick tie to name a nice touch.

49.Tequila: Reserva de Los Gonzalez Extra Añejo Cristalino
49.Review: Big agave nose with vanilla, sharp ripe fruit and light pepper. No overbearing oak present. Flavor:   Silky sweet agave, pepper, an undercurrent of butterscotch, round barrel spices and a hint of citrus rind. Finish is medium long with butterscotch and warming pepper.

50.Tequila: Reserva de Los Gonzalez Extra Añejo Cristalino
50.Review: Note: This review is for the regular XA - not the clear version.This may be the most delicately flavoured tequila I’ve had.  It is like an excellent agave forward reposado but mellowed beautifully by additional time in barrels.  I get a bit of citrus and vanilla on the nose, with more vanilla, butterscotch and leather on the palate.  A nice long but very soft finish - the softest peppermint finish I’ve had with just a touch of smoke.  What a wonderful tequila!

51.Tequila: Reserva de Los Gonzalez Extra Añejo Cristalino
51.Review: a must buy when you are visiting Mexico as it is not available in the US. beautiful cooked agave with amazing barrel spices, cherry, plum, dark chocolate and vanilla. very sippable and extremely enjoyable. I always oickmup a bottle when I visit Mexico.

52.Tequila: Reserva de Los Gonzalez Extra Añejo Cristalino
52.Review: Gonzales deliver quality and price, amazing taste and great finish

53.Tequila: Pueblo Magico Tequila Reposado 100% de Agave
53.Review: NOM 1463|the only label I know from Magdalena, Jalisco  whatta surprise nice aroma and flavor.  couldn't find it again :(

54.Review: This a delicious blanco, cement fermentation give a different dimension.  Great flavor profile, of citrus, cooked agave, light pepper. Price point is on the high side, but it is excellent

55.Review: A – This baby has an earthy, lactic funk that is unreal. I’m getting cooked agave, mushroom, olive, strong minerals, black pepper, cinnamon, bell pepper, mint, grass, citrus (especially orange peel), hints of tropical fruits, walnut, licorice, and more. If I had any self-control, I’d continue smelling, but I had to dive in. Excellent aroma. If my senses and memory serve me, I’d compare this to Cascahuin Tahona.T – The aroma foreshadowed the taste, but I highlighted the cooked agave, mint, cinnamon, and some green pepper. Again, this thing is a sipper.F – This has a clean finish, warming the entire way down. It certainly left me wanting more.Overall – I want more of this and hope I have this in my collection. This is delicious tequila.

56.Review: Blind tasting-N- white pepper, tropical fruit, vegetal and grassy T- caramel, honey, pineapple, jalapeno, well balanced MF- oily F- long fading from the sweet notes to a pepper spice

57.Review: Complex aroma with agave, olive brine, minerals, and earth. On taste I’m getting more olive brine and earth. I can see where this would be great for people who love that earthy olive brine flavor, but it’s not tops for me. Tasted this blind and will have to revisit. It’s also quite expensive and that knocks some points off.

58.Review: A powerhouse scent of sweet agave, black pepper. It tastes of pepper, wet cement, and citrus. A classic Blanco. Medium length, consistent, peppery finish. A tad hotTook a couple points off for price, but this is solid Blanco

59.Review: Santanera Tahona BlancoNOM 1123The nose is bright. I immediately smell agave and clean crisp lemon / lime citrus. There’s a nice underlying minerality with a hint of damp earth. The cooked agave is right up front. It’s buttery. There’s a nice oily mouthfeel where the citrus and earthy brine appear right before a nice fresh jalapeño pepper finish. There’s an underlying natural agave sweetness that runs throughout the sip and into the finish. My small sample ran out so I’ll have to buy a bottle to continue this review. I’d like to rate this great tequila higher but the stiff price tag hinders the score. Salud!

60.Review: Aroma:  agave sweetness, citrus, grassy, minerals, floralFlavor:  medium visclus, subtle sweetness, slight pepperFinish:  roasted agave, medium/long

61.Review: Cooked agave, earthy, grass, pepper, and celery in the aroma.

62.Review: Nose:   Minerals, citrus zest, sweet hay and a fleeting waft of celery. A hint of sulfur and a slight umami note. Flavors:   Round agave sweetness. Medium oils with creaminess. But on balance, a bit thin compared to other #1123 offerings. Pepper, anise and almond paste. Somewhat subdued tasting profile in comparison to the aromas. Finish:   Pleasant, balanced.  An easy sipper. It reminds me of a slightly scaled down, flavor diluted Cascahuín Tahona.  My second pour is growing on me…At $2080 pesos, this loses a point on value.

63.Review: Sweet nose, interesting aromatics. Nice viscosity and well balanced on the tongue. Natural agave sweetness on the tongue and a good strong finish with some tip of tongue ethanol and mid tongue roast agave.

64.Review: Aroma: nose is fantastic. Exactly what i like in a tequila. Vanilla, cooked agave, hint of cinnamon. smells like a highland. Taste: unfortunately doesnt live up to the nose. Loses some of the agave and vanilla. loses some of the complexity the nose had. Adds minerality Finish: solid finish. Watery. Terralta?

65.Review: Feb 25, 2023SANTANERA TAHONAtasted blind in pepe's tahona blind 2/25/23Note: these samples were 1/2 oz so it was a bit challenging to get the full essence. I let it sit about 20 mins to open.nose: Anise, agave, pepper, white pepper, vegetal, grass, some funky cheese, malalactic notes.taste: Nose is more complex than taste and finish is a little flat.Deducted a few points for value, at $125 i prefer calle23, Ocho Puntas or 7L70, i.m.o.Rated 86 TMM = aroma excellent,  flavor good, finish shirt, value avg

66.Review: Lote: TBK02.22 bottled on apr’22. Gray front label.Aromas: sweet cooked agave! Floral aromas! A touch of citrus.Palate: the sweetness of cooked agave is so intense it is as if it were sweet agave white rock sugars, if it exists I think it would taste like this! The citrus keeps it fresh, creamy mouthfeel. Finish is medium to long and the sweet agave white rock sugar persists with a hint of pepper spiciness. Wow!

67.Review: NOM 1123 and Tahona crushed sold me.  Spicy pepper dominates the palate.  Was hoping for a little more agave - maybe the lack of copper?

68.Review: So tasty! Had it at a barCould rate higher but it’s $$$ Notes coming soon…

69.Review: A well made Blanco with a long history of making great tequila. One of the few 100 percent Tahona crushed agave tequilas out there. Priced right. Drink very well, some heat, some spice, over all very good

70.Review: El Tesoro Blanco starts with bright aromas of agave melded with citrus and vegetal minerality, with some light hints of basil. The taste is all silky cooked agave with some notes of spice, which carries through into a finish of herbs, black pepper, and the sensation of biting into a freshly cooked agave. One of the best blanco tequilas out there.

71.Review: Fantastic stuff. Nose punches you with agave and other hidden things like vanilla, citrus, even grassTastes similar to the nose with the exception that pear also comes through strong and is delicious!

73.Review: On the nose, loads of cooked agave and some salinity, definitely getting minerals. A honey like sweetness, very appealing. On the palate, honey first, and an aromatic sweetness like agave nectar. Tons of agave, and it’s very oily, completely coats the mouth beautifully. A little bit of spice, but really the agave and honey notes are stealing the show. I get a little bit of aromatic floral notes but it’s faint. Overall, an banger from Carlos Camarena. On my first tasting, I didn’t love it but now that I come back to it, I am finding this to be absolutely fantastic. This is, in my opinion, the platonic ideal of blanco tequila. It’s not necessarily the best I’ve ever had, but it is, in all aspects, very good with no discernible flaws.

74.Review: Lote 10 from new bottling. El Tesoro is very balanced and I think can be liked by most people, in Mexico it feels expensive vs. other (better imo) offerings but in the US it’s a good value.

75.Review: Nose:   Agave and fruity entrance. . Mango, citrus, anise, minerals and vanilla-ginger-spicy goodness. A hint of lactic. A floral presence. This has an “ebullient” bouquet. Flavor:   Oily agave flavor with hints of cinnamon and spice.  Rounded fruit notes. Perfect dose of pepper for balance. A good all purpose blanco.

76.Review: I smell the agave, minerals and floral notes. It’s soft. I taste naturally sweet agave and white pepper along with some anise. The finish is nice and clean but short. Overall it’s a well made tequila that’s slightly on the sweet side.

77.Review: One of the best blancos I have tried.  Easy to sip but complex with not a lot of bite. I would sip this all day and makes a great margarita as well

78.Review: This is an absolute favorite for me. From nose to finish this tequila delivers. Agave shines throughout with slight sweetness and citrus with just a touch of brine. Velvety with robust flavor and just enough spice, consistent with each expression.

79.Review: As solid as they come, agave to be found around every corner and the price is tonight to beat. This is one of those reference products that new producers should taste before they decide on their profile....it’s a classic.

80.Review: This is filled with a nose of sweet cooked agave, light anise, very light vanilla, definite citrus, and definite black pepper. On taste- you get the citrus and the delicious sweet cooked agave, grass, citrus and black pepper. This is a really solid tequila.

81.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave, citrus, and some pear and pineapple notes. Also some degree of black pepper and earthy, grassy notes, but not necessarily mineral notes.Taste : Cooked agave and black pepper spiciness. Some earthy, grass notes. Light celery, citrus, and medium oils. I actually got a little bit of vanilla from this which is an interesting sight for a blanco, but it doesn't take away from the experience.Finish : Short to medium length with more spice and agave. To a lesser extent some greener, vegetal notes from before.This Blanco has some really good spice that goes well with the other flavors. I can find this for $36.99 USD so there's a lot of value as well.

82.Review: Free tasting at local liquor store, county/gov operated. Aroma: cooked agave, pepper, oak, green olives, and honey-vanilla. Flavor: cooked agave, pepper, greens, honey-vanilla. Nice but short finish, barely no after taste.

83.Review: Nose = Nice pop of sweet agave. No heat on the nose either, very even keel, subtle almost. Super pleasant. Taste = Oh yes. Agave forward, citrus, some pepper. Very well balanced.Finish = Nice and long. Warm but not aggressive. Vanilla at the end with a bit of sweetness.For 44$ @ Old Town Tequila it’s solid value. Easily a sipper and would mix well.  Would recommend to a friend

84.Review: Man do I like this! Full agave and some tartness to this Lot ETNP-B-001. Not a sweet product in the slightest I can see this being offputting to some drinkers. Stone ground, wood vat fermented, copper pot distilled and all El Tesoro de Don Felipe.

85.Review: A very full bodied blanco. Complex, smokey, pepper, all mixed with cooked agave. And made the right way. Good tequila.

86.Review: This is so good! Very traditional all around, a well made tequila. Nice salty mineral aroma, agave bursts through in the flavor. A very satisfying mouthfeel and finish. It’s a shame that more tequila isn’t made this way, I have never tried a tahona tequila that I did not like and respect.

87.Review: Blown away by this blanco. Amazing nose and terrific in cocktails.

89.Review: Solid tequila at this price point. Agave, floral, mineral spice on the nose. Agave forward,  buttery, mineral, grass with good viscosity and warm lingering finish.

90.Review: Smell is like sweet grass; flavor is vegetal; finish is smooth, very mild burn; overly minty aftertaste

91.Review: Absolutely gorgeous nose, lovely flavors with agave and sweetness and pepper. My absolute favorite finish so far, evolving into sweetness and agave that lingers on the tongue. Probably my favorite sipper right now.

92.Review: as a beginner taquila drinker, to me the alcohol was the dominant sent and flaver. it also tasted "earthy". Anyway i used it mainly with honey and a freshly squeezed lime.

95.Review: Floral Smooth A nice Agave peppery noteNice finish

96.Review: Floral, light, bright, clean aromaGood flavor on impact, and it has a nice decay

98.Review: Lot B-019 This is a well-done expression, but it falls down a little bit with the one component that is subtle, which would really round it out for me—the sweetness. Because of that, it sometimes tastes unbalanced. Sometimes though, it’s exactly what I want…. In all other respects, it's very good and I would buy it again.

99.Review: Batch no B-008 // NOM 1139Date on bottle 08/05/2019

100.Review: Excellent well rounded blanco.  Good for all occasions!

101.Review: I don’t know what everyone else here has gotten to taste that is so well received because the batch I tasted from this brand is nothing to write home about. It’s just really flat. Nothing memorable at all from this offering. Nothing complex or interesting, just boring. I’d take Avion Silver any day of the week against this or even the lowly rated Cazadores. Even Espolon hits much better.

102.Review: Strong agave. Powerful flavor. Bit syrupy.

103.Review: Aroma- bright agave and citrus, mineralityTaste- starts creamy and playful, but then the cooked agave shinesFinish- like you had a piece of cooked agave from the oven, but with alcohol

104.Review: Bright citrus and mellow pineapple on the aroma. Very delicate finish.

105.Review: The nose is lovely. Cooked agave, citrus, spice, a touch floral, some minerality. Somewhat savory, maybe notes of leather. Really good. Rich, thick and coating mouthfeel. Very enjoyable. Palate has balanced sweetness, rich cooked agave, and citrus with a hint of floral character. Finish is lasting and strong. Lots of agave and minerals. Very good.

106.Review: Solid Blanco, a must addition to your tequila lineup.

107.Review: Strong Agave, decent amount of black pepper, some light sweetness.  Not super complex for me at the moment.

108.Review: Very approachable, regularly available Blanco , the terror shines on this tequila great cooked agave , subtle citrus , pepper and long finish .

109.Review: Lot of cooked agave and a punch of spice (black pepper, cinnamon) that mellows a bit on the finish. Definitely has some grip to it compared to a Pasote or Fortaleza blanco. More complex than I was anticipating. A good sipper, but curious to try in a cocktail given it’s spiciness.

110.Review: Updated rating 9.23.22 - reading my last notes I gotta say I get many different characteristics. Aroma still on point about the same. Taste this time getting a sweetness almost immediately followed by a ripe agave flavor very thick mouthfeel. +2 on flavorAroma: very earthy smell; you can almost smell the tradition in this blanco. Briny/olive smell to it and def herbaceous!Flavor: you can taste the dirt almost; very minerally, I suspect from the spring water at La Altena. The agave is greener than the baked or sweeter agave notes. This is a viscous trago.Finish: lingers around a bit some pepper and heat at the end

112.Review: Smoothe taste fora blanco.  Not terribly distinctive but I’m not looking for that in a blanco. I will definitely have it again

113.Review: This was a pour at Verde Restaurant. Nose was initially thrown off as the server put a lime on glass edge. That said the nose was full of cooked agave and some white pepper with hints of citrus. Very nice mouthfeel. The blanco has good minerality with some earthiness and citrus as well. Finish Is fairly long with loads of pepper then back to citrus.  Very nice sipper

114.Review: Probably my top tequila under $100 bucks. Amazing finish, I will buy a bottle every time.

115.Review: Nose is full of cooked agave and minerality —like slate. There are also citrus notes of lime and grapefruit. Mouthful is nice and silky with flavor of cooked agave and minerals. Finish is warm and full of natural sweetness although lingers to more peppery feel. Overall a very nice blanco and a rare find for me while I was traveling in New Mexico.

117.Review: In the bottle aromas of vanilla and caramel. In the glass pepper scents fill the smelling senses. Smooth finish very light burn on the back end but smooth going down.

118.Review: Definite citrus aroma, thick mouthfeel, a little harsh but great when it sits.

119.Review: Aroma: grass, minerals and agave.  Palate: White pepper, minerals, celery upfront and anise, black pepper toward the back-end - lovely and refreshing.  The finish lingers enough but just a touch of bitterness which was disappointing to me.  However, the flavours and its oily/buttery mouth feel more than makes up for it.

120.Review: Rats, I really wanted to like this Blanco after my Step-dad raved about it but had a hard time finding any positives here.  On the nose, bland and nothing compelling stands out…tastes follow same theme - no herbal, no agave, no oily mouth coat and totally lacking any finish.  Sadly, nothing really pops for me on this very simple and extremely disappointing bottle of tequila -So bland I can’t even say it’s good value - will end up as a mixer for ranch water on a hot day.  I can’t even recommend this to a Noob as an intro sipper…give me my Fortaleza, G4 or even Don Abraham Blanco’s and I’m completely satisfied  - pass on this y’all, Mb.

121.Review: Sweet cooked agave with white pepper and a very well balanced finish. Harmony and drinkability are very high. This is the tequila I will buy newbie tequila drinkers. Solid blanco.

123.Review: Like a standard tequila on steroids - sharper. A bit of spice on the finish. $38 a bottle

124.Review: Very herbal Mint, thyme, bright Not sharp - balanced Pairs well with chorizo and Parmesan Goat cheeses pair well with tequila Good with a cocktail with citrus

125.Review: Much like tequilaSmootherSubtlePepper noteTajona process tequila Copper pot distilled Highland tequila

126.Review: Agave citrus, herbs, thyme, mint, lemon verbena, light mouthfeel

127.Review: Bright red pepper, chile paquin, pairs w parm and chorizo, sharp, strong finished

128.Review: Has a lot of sweetness honeysuckle notes with a bunch of agave and very light fresh aroma Taste has some briny salinity that is pushed to the front and the the sweetness of the agave comes in with the finish it is a just the smallest amount of peppery finish and then still honey agave great overall flavor not alot of contrast it smells similar to how it tastes the mouthfeel is very impressive with this one love the briny smooth mouthfeel

129.Review: Fantastic aroma of agave with slight grassiness.  Maybe the best smelling Blanco I’ve experienced.  Super oily mouth feel.  Flavor of cooked agave with a hint of citrus changing to a nice pepper.

131.Review: On the nose, I get loads of cooked agave with a distinct caramel grassiness that’s similar to Tapatio, but more intense. On the palate, it’s smooth, buttery agave with honey and caramel. Just a touch of heat at the end. Overall, it’s similar to Tapatio, but deeper/more caramel. It does have more anise/licorice as well, which translates to more bitterness, which I’m not a fan of. The buttery, caramel wears off slightly after a couple of weeks and becomes more anise/bitter.

132.Review: This has to be one of the best traditionally made tequilas and at the price such a great value! On the nose I get loads of cooked agave, some citrus, lots of black pepper and a hint of fresh cut grass. Flavours are a lot of the same, big hits of agave and citrus with a peppery finish. This is a must have to any tequila lovers bar!

133.Review: Batch 013: Tons of agave upfront with a slight olive brine on the nose. super clean on the pallete, soft mouthfeel, and wonderful flavors of agave, pepper, and olive. Lingering finish that makes you want to go back again and again.

134.Review: Love this so much! Good amount of agave and grass with this. Tastes so fresh

135.Review: An absolutely beautiful blanco. Agave forward with a lot of brine. Absolutely amazing in a Margarita and in my top 3 of all time. Truly magical

136.Review: Nose - great cooked agave nose, almost a smoky agave. I like this part of El Tesoro. Palate - nice highland agave - not as sweet as some, but the cooked agave and pepper are here. Good.Finish - really nice finish. Not too long, just the right amount of pepper, less agave on the end, but still very good. Overall I really like El Tesoro. Tastes very, I guess, pure. Great agave and a nice, peppery smoky change from something like a NOM 1579 sweet agave. Very good.

138.Review: Lot 10. beautiful nose, cooked agave, fruity like mango and apricot medium alcohol nice mouth coating, peppery, hints af brine and dates, apricot very nice.lingering pepper finish.. I recommend.

139.Review: Slight agave nose,  bright fruity taste turns bitter through to finish

140.Review: I’d like to start by saying I love the bottle and the very tasteful stone wheel statue as part of the cork, it’s great. The juice itself is very good for a blanco. It’s interesting in that it tastes almost of olive while still staying true to the 100% agave flavors.

141.Review: The aroma is gentle and appealing, natural agave and natural greens.It’s smells fresh and comfortable.Dry mint with dash of ocean essence, nice anise pinch, small kick of nice alcohol, that doesn’t make you go away but all the opposite.The taste is just it’s aroma, fresh, of peppermint.It warms the mouth perfectly and stays in your palate with great body and respecting the same note, tone and volume.It is a great tequila to enjoy at the table with family and people that are worth your time.I liked it and it’s a tequila that is for sure a must have in your collection.If you can afford it, it is easy a daily sipper.

142.Review: Wonderful agave on the nose. Semi creamy mouthfeel with medium to high heat on the pepper and plenty of agave flavor goodness. Long pepper finish. For me this is not a sipper, but has the robust flavor needed to carry through in a fantastic margarita!

143.Review: Sweet, soft, caramelized cooked agave is everywhere on the nose along with citrus and peppery notes. Perfect level of natural sweetness on the palate; lots of agave as well as hints of grass, earth, and green bell peppers. Just a touch of heat on a long, gentle finish.In terms of flavors, there’s nothing too crazy going on here. However, this is still a fantastic representation of an agave-forward, high-quality blanco. It’s just exactly what good tequila should taste like. Highly recommend!

144.Review: This Blanco is so good. Rich and creamy. The finish is fantastic and last for a long time. The nose is sweet, grassy, floral agave. The palate is all cooked agave with some sweet and pepper. What a spectacular pour.

145.Review: Sweet with floral notes mint and pepper, good sipper.

147.Review: Felt like I stole it at only $29 a bottle. Bought every bottle they had. Carlos Camerena is a Wizard. My favorite expression of the lineup because the agave flavor is so rich

148.Review: Light aroma of cooked agave that is more earthy and grounded in agave. Easy body with a lot of green earthy waves that develop into the farmland tastes of fresh sunlight and cut agave. Some subtle black pepper notes but still a bit of lime citrus is the background. What a finish that is smooth but still warming with a bit of heat to warm the mouth but not the chest.

149.Review: You want a raw fresh tasting agave tequila this is it!

150.Review: Strong smell but much smoother taste

152.Review: Great tequila especially for the price can’t beat this tequila will absolutely be one of the best ones you can find.

153.Review: I used to really like this one. Then I tried Casamigos, which I did not care for. Going back to this one, I detected subtle similarities to the Casamigos (birthday cake or sugar cookie notes) that have now made me like this one a bit less. Still a good blanco for the price though.

155.Review: sweet agave spice vegetal citrus nice earthy taste

156.Review: Nose: Great agave nose with some spiceTaste: Agave, earthy pepper with hints of citrusFinish: Warm and sultry- a beautiful finish to an excellent blanco

157.Review: A clean sipper. Almost floral. Lovely. Worth every peso.

158.Review: Aroma - sweet agave, citrus, salt Flavor - agave, minerals, vanilla Finish - medium heat, typical El Tesoro (love it)

159.Review: Agave, black pepper, citrus, vegetal, mint and mineral. One of my favorites.

160.Review: We rated El Tesoro Blanco Tequila today. About 10 of my compadres and comadres. It’s great for sipping. Why? The pepper hit is about 2-3 seconds when you shot it. But when you sip it’s soft and smooth with a little bite on the pallet then it goes down the throat smoothly. When you shoot it, you will feel the pepper burn on the delay. We tasted butter, sugar cane, and very faint citrus tones. We could smell heavy butter, and some citrus. Over all for the value and price it’s a good tequila. The price is about $35-$50. Enjoy my friends!

161.Review: A solid, additive free tequila. A bit pricey in my area though. Really like it.

162.Review: Wow...I like this juice more than Forteleza. Has more bite (in a good way) & complex flavors.  Picked it up for 39.99 very good buy for the quality!  If you like a good blanco this will not disappoint you.

163.Review: Very green and agave forward. VegetalChewy mouth feel, agave

164.Review: Great, yet dare I say uninspiring for the price point? I mean, you can get Fortaleza for the same money... I prefer the Tapatio range from this Nom.

165.Review: Green agave Herbs GrassHoneysuckle Viola flowers

166.Review: An amazing blanco, tons of cooked agave and a peppery bite. Thick oily mouthfeel, coats your tongue and teeth. Leaves a lingering sweetness and chilled sensation on the very end.

167.Review: Sweet agave, smooth, easy to drink

168.Review: An excellent blanco.Nose: Clean and sweet vegetal agave. Citrus, pear, and white pepper notes. Very light and enjoyable.Palate: Light, balanced, and clean.  Same as the nose.  Finish: A short to medium with lingering agave, vanilla and pepper.  A wonderfully smooth sipper.

169.Review: Smooth tequila with an earthy finish. Great tequila for a great price.

170.Review: Subtle aroma, very flavourful- agave, citrus, pepper, and earth in the finish with no burn. Highly recommend.

172.Review: Smooth yet complex. Fairly new new into the realm of high quality tequilas, but this is definitely the best blanco I’ve yet to try

173.Review: Very well rounded tequila with a nice pepper and vegetal taste with a smooth finish

174.Review: Earthy sweetness with a great agave aroma and finish. Absolutely one of my favorite blancos.

175.Review: Very prominent nose of agave and vegetal/earthiness. Flavor started out the same, but then brought in some citrus as well. Burn on the finish was minimal, especially for a blanco.

176.Review: Aroma: raw agave, salty ocean/sea aromatics, lime, peppercorns, little alcohol. Everything is very subtle. Taste: nice and oily texture, vanilla, citrus, peppercorns.

177.Review: Update…the more I drink El Tesoro, the more I like it. Subtle aroma that is nicely balanced. Solid flavor that hits agave in the beginning and pepper in the finish. A slight sweetness at the very end. An excellent blanco at an affordable price. Definitely will be on my shelf.

178.Review: Aroma starts with sugary agave then blends into floral and citrus. Flavor is a bit of burn followed by rich, oily, smooth agave. Never ending up as sweet as it smells and never burns more than first bite. A perfect balanced Blanco  with no lean one way or the other. The standard by which all should be compared.

179.Review: Good Agave on the nose & tongue, lil bit of heat, very nice finish & not too sweet. Get you some of this old school style blanco, it will make you happy you did

180.Review: Smell:  smoke, lots of agave (both green and cooked), alcohol and a hint of lime.Flavor:  heavy anise/black licorice, some sweetness, cooked agave,  citrus (lime and orange), wood/charcoal, minerals and interestingly a hint of spearmint.Nice finish .. especially if you like anise /black licorice and orange.  The finish is somewhat hot and earthy but with a lingering anise.  I like this and I'm not usually a Blanco fan.  I'd serve this neat or maybe with one small ice cube and fresh orange slices to nibble on with it.  Hmm, maybe a fresh sprig of mint in it...

181.Review: The more I drink of this the better I like it, it’s turning into a great sipper. The score is going up.

182.Review: Lots and lots of agave, great for agave lovers!Agave on the nose and on the palate, clean and delish

183.Review: Heavy oil and mineral taste, like olive oil. Nice sipper when an Anejo is too sweet.

184.Review: Solid blanco but not my wheelhouse.

185.Review: El Tesoro Blanco is mellow, bright, refreshing taste. It has notes of mineral, citrus, chalk, perfect sweetness with that agave kick.

186.Review: Strong agave flavor with a smooth Smokey finish

187.Review: Authentic cooked agave aroma, sweet on the palate, lots of citrus, white pepper, and highland earth. Very well done

188.Review: Now that's just how I like a blanco, hints of copper and squanch, mildly raunchy yet suave and delightful!

189.Review: This is the tequila that made fall in love with tequila

190.Review: A great go to after a hard night in the ring. Batch B-009

191.Review: definitely agave forward taste followed by strong pepper flavor. this is a very good blanco, not artificially sweet. you can tell this is all natural and old school methods. very good, i highly recommend.

192.Review: My first sipping Blanco. I'm really impressed that its so good for the price! Same price as Cabo Wabo and yet 100x better!!

193.Review: I rated it a little lower on value because it’s expensive near me. I’ve heard it might be cheaper in some locations which would bump the score even higher. Overall, this is one of my all time favorites.

194.Review: Clear Fresh and crispy  creamy body Aroma: Cooked Agave  citrusy green olive hint earthyHerbal like mint aroma like  rainy evening Taste: light heat  black and white pepper corn creamy lightly sweetness  of butterscotch Strong finish fade-out heated  black peeper & sweetness Highly recommended it’s honest Tequila  great for sipping before meal and mixing citrus expand the agave flavor. Gracia Maestro Carlos Camarena  & Salud !!

195.Review: Great blanco. Top 5 on my list for sipping or mixing. Not surprising that I switch back and forth between this and Tapatio....I tend to go with Tapatio more often though for the extra value.

197.Review: Definitely get the pepper notes, no citrus for me. Flavor also peppery and earthy. Delicious.

198.Review: Fresh agave, citrus and earth in the nose. Briney, cooked agave, honey in the mouth. Vegetal, floral, white pepper in the finish. This is a great go to, summer sipper.

199.Review: Good agave nose with pleasant sweet citrus along.  Flavor is good, lots of agave and pepper especially as it begins it’s finish.  Finishes a bit hot though and not as complex as I had hoped for but really hangs around after the sip, wow.  With this line I think I prefer (in order):  anejo, repo, then this blanco.  Don’t get me wrong it’s solid, but for the money I’m going to Siete Leguas blanco first.

200.Review: Really enjoyed this. Drank neat. Good mouth feel, very smooth sipper. Mild nose; agave.

201.Review: Very good with notes of cooked agave, pepper, citrus, mint, anise, kiwi, flowers, and pears

202.Review: Tight in nose, cooked agave and opening to some floral, green pepper, medium body, nice sweetness of cooked agave, white pepper, butterscotch, good ending leaves with oily finish,  peppers and agave. This was rated higher in the app, but I was a bit disappointed with the complexity at the $50 price point.

203.Review: Very Good and Authentic Blanco that u can easily find in The USA... A great go to tequila for any party  or mixed drink!!!!

204.Review: This is an excellent blanco with lots of baked and raw agave shining through on the nose. Aromas of green veggies, bell pepper, black pepper, and citrus are also present. There is an underlying earthy, mineral quality as well. Flavor is exactly what you expect from the nose, with a stronger white pepper presence that I really appreciate. I'd say this is on par with Siete Leguas.

205.Review: A very solid agave forward blanco. Great on the nose. A bit of alcohol aroma. Agave and pepper with citrus and flowers. Flavour is agave with pepper, citrus, grass. Excellent body with a decent oily finish. Could not go wrong with this for margs or as an evening sipper. Earthy as well. $55 at the BevMo in Bellingham, Washington. Outstanding oily finish!Nothing at all fancy or complex here. Just a good solid agave forward blanco with a fantastic oily finish that is long lasting. Re-rated in July, 2020 and bumped to a 92. Actually found this at a BC Liquorstore in Vancouver. Simply magnificent.

206.Review: Fresh agave nice light medium long finish with a bit of a creamy feel. I’m liking this new bottle.

207.Review: Batch B - 00840% ABVInitial nasal impact is sweet and somewhat warming. Sweet agave and fruit on the aroma.Oily mouth feel with adequate alcohol.Sweet cooked agave, cinnamon and earth on the flavor. Floral and citrus follow. There is some mineral on the retro nasal. Is this the perfect tahona crushed blanco? Not many stand up to it.Certainly a benchmark, traditionally made blanco. Carlos Camarena sets the bar with this El Tesoro blanco. Well priced. It is a must have.

208.Review: This is consistently a sub-$35 bottle in my area, and at that price it’s a darn good value, very few quality, tahona-produced tequilas at that price. This lacks the richness of something like Fortaleza but offers a certain drinkability that makes it very likable. The nose is smoothly balanced agave, neither too peppery nor too citrusy, with a light undercurrent of that wet-cement-after-summer-rain smell. The palate is similarly well balanced, leaning less toward earth or pepper than toward citrus, maybe like tangerine, and even a puff of cotton candy. The finish is smooth, easy, solidly lasting — good old green agave. This is a quality product, deeply respectable not in a staid, personality-less way, but in the you’ll-never-be-ashamed-to-have-this-around sort of way. Definitely recommended.

209.Review: Ultra light on the nose, agave notes deep through, some grassy tones.Again, light on the pallet, very soft, non aggressive blanco

210.Review: Nose is pretty clean, citrus with some green agave tones.Flavour is a bit hot, a floral slightly soapy hits me mid way. Finish is long, not as much agave throughout as I would like.

211.Review: This is a nice find in my area for under $30. Love the cooked agave start and pepper hints of fruit pepper and cooked and raw agave finish.

214.Review: sweeter smell versus taste.  smooth finish.  pepper comes through with slight citrus

215.Review: Very peppery finish with a sweetness. Very nice

216.Review: My favorite product of their line. Good flavor of floral and fruity variety.

217.Review: Very smooth, slight alcohol on the finish. A little smoky / black pepper with a citrus sweetness, almost lime / pineapple on the nose. No strong vegetal notes, very well balanced. My favorite blanco to date.

218.Review: I get a wet cement aroma with some agave on the nose. That cement and limestone flavor is overpowering the taste buds in an inoffensive way. No burn. Very pleasant. I think this may be my second favorite blanco I've ever had.  Both bottles I've had are from batch 005. I hope it stays this way!

219.Review: Excellent blanco with complexity and character. Cooked agave, mineral, mint & pepper.  Slight mineral/citrus entry immediately followed by an agave explosion, nice thick & peppery mouthfeel with medium finish. This may be the blanco I take when “ stranded on a desert island” ...

220.Review: Excelente aroma, tierra mojada, vainilla, agave cocido, en boca agave dulce, floral solo que me pareció astringente Eso fue lo que no me encanto.

221.Review: Excellent tequila aroma and flavor. The only thing holding it back is the finish.

222.Review: On the nose is fresh agave, floral and green notesTaste is agave and pepper. The finish is peppery and light but lingers a bit with a nice bit of oily feel on the tongue. This is a great blanco. Simple and clean.

223.Review: WOW!!!! Smells like smashed cooked agave, with a pleasant sugarcane “feel” at the back of my noses.

224.Review: This is a really good Blanco for sipping.   The aroma is nice but not overpowering, has a good Agave flavor and finishes clean.   Is a clean Tequila.  Doesn't tend to give me a headache.

225.Review: Amazing update to a classic. big agave nose with notes of grass and greens. This Blanco is full in the mouth and long finish. Add this to your collection if you want a traditional blanco. Another great Carlos Camerana product

226.Review: Not the best. Long finish but not a fan of Blancos

227.Review: Lush grassy earthy profile, absolutely delicious. Beautiful mouthfeel, medium spicy with a terrificly long finish. Outstanding.

228.Review: Nice French oak, chocolate, some agave on the nose and In the flavor with cinnamon and caramel finish is short and a little spice

229.Review: Chocolate, vanilla french oak aroma and flavor. Good but simple. No layers of flavor.

230.Review: French oak evident with a subtle chocolate aroma. Caramel and cooked agave flavor. Sweetness comes out in the finish. This is a pleasant tequila that many people will like.

231.Review: The best Anejo I have tried and I have tried hundreds.  Aroma heavy on agave. Nice mouth feel but not coying. Taste tropical fruits, cinnamon and faint hints of fennel.  Obvious benefit from french oak. As good as it gets

232.Review: Nose: cook Agave, oak, dried fruit, vanilla, and wet cement Flavor: Caramel, coffee, peanut brittle, sweet fruit Finish: nice finish, starts with coffee moves to a fruity sweetness with some accompanying heat.

233.Review: Aged in Tennessee oak barrels 24 months. The fairly dark  copper color appearance belies relatively benign whiskey notes. Nose:   Lots of fruitiness, spice, agave and sweet oak notes. Vanilla, toffee, chocolate, dried fruit and a hint of wet earth.  Flavor:   Coffee, caramel, pepper, cloves, powdered dried ginger and background agave hanging in the wings.   Nice fruitiness follows the aroma. Fairly viscous with a blooming heat. Finish :  The finish has an almost French oak quality going on, married with vanilla and heat. This is an assertive profile.

234.Review: Sweet smell on the nose, kind of a Tiramisu dessert smell, coffee, agave at the end.Taste is sweet with a slight burn and a oaky medium finish.I enjoy it, however, is not my first choice as the price is comparable with a Cascahuin A単ejo, TAU A単ejo , G4 A単ejo and Ocho A単ejo which I like the most.

235.Review: Vanilla caramel with strong finish oak and smoke

236.Review: A step up from Tezcazul repo, more oak flavor and more intense flavors all around. Vanilla, butterscotch, cinnamon and a bit of allspice. An interesting tequila.

237.Review: Very little aroma but a bit of snickerdoodle (cinammon, butter). The bottle has a 2006 tax sticker and may need more time to open. Sweet agave flavor and black pepper finish. Simple but a solid sipper.

238.Review: Cooked agave, earth, vegetal aromas and flavors. Thick and oily mouth feel. Medium length finish. Not super complex, but a solid product nonetheless. (Bottle has a a 2006 Mexican tax sticker on it.)

239.Review: Nice balance. Agave sweeteness, caramel, citrus, plum, white chocolate, berries on the nose. Hints of cinnamon, honey, berries, caramel, going down. Slightly thinner than I like, but still a decent XA.

240.Review: Nose has nice touch of honey, caramel notes. Slight butterscotch & agave on the palette. Great lingering sweet, caramel aftertaste.

241.Review: Delicious! I wasn't expecting it to be so tasty.

242.Review: Outstanding Reposado from, where else? NOM 1414 and Sergio Cruz doing what he does best, producing delicious Tequila. $30 a bottle makes this a real treat and bargain.

243.Review: Nice agave on the nose. Not a complex repo but very easy to sip. No heat, very enjoyable. Another nice tequila out of 1414.  Bonus points for price

244.Review: Solid, affordable ($37 @ Ferment and Still) reposado. Extra points for affordability.Aroma: Subtle. Cooked agave, tangy plumb citrus, light oak, and black pepper in the initial nose.  A bit of carmel and cinnamon spice in the back end. Taste: Initial punch of black pepper that is quickly overtaken by cooked agave and cinnamon. The oak appears and then disappears. Light on the palate, almost no heat. Quite pleasant.Finish: Long with a sweet cinnamon warmth that rides atop of the cooked agave.

245.Review: Very enjoyable sipper!  Aromas of agave, oak, caramel, citrus & spice.  Creamy, buttery agave & caramel flavors.  Zero heat, pepper or alcohol burn on this super smooth finish.  Definitely bonus point on value.  I’m so glad you don’t have to spend $50 to get a reposado like this one.

246.Review: Such a great value reposado. Packed with really good in your face flavor that’s easily approachable. Just the right amount of oak flavors and tons of notes of mint and bell pepper. Excellent priced reposado that can be used for an everyday supper

247.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
247.Review: 2017 bottling. Vanilla, caramel, lots of pepper, whisky obviously but not as much as other expressions, alcohol heat but normal for the higher proof.

248.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
248.Review: Very nice ripe agave nose. Vanilla, fudge, citrus. Light flavor of agave and bourbon. Interesting finish. The Sazerac barrel really delicately infuses it's flavor into the tequila. It's quite delicious with a slight bourbon taste. But also has a slight bit of sweetness and finishes with a hint of citrus and a touch of white pepper. Great sipping tequila.

249.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
249.Review: Nosing this next to a pour of Sazerac Rye made it very easy to pick those same elements out in this anejo. It also helps reveal the elements that make this tequila and a very good one.    Flinty, minty comes to mind with flinty notes being the minerality of the blanco aged to anejo and the minty notes from the rye barrel. The main drawback is simply price, a little high for a niche product.

250.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
250.Review: Very interesting spice aroma with underlying fruit. None of the strong whiskey aroma from the Stagg or RVW. Wow, rich, complex spice flavor and no real hints of whiskey. To my taste, the clear winner (by a mile) of the 3 a√±ejos. Medium-long finish with rich spice and warmth.

251.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo

252.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
252.Review: Wonderful nose on this, and the finish is elegantly spicy. Fun!

253.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
253.Review: Omg. Drinking the Corazon Sazerac Rye anejo makes me ask where's the damn pastrami? Again, not my normal anejo, but holy hell. 45%. Really warming, rye toast. I'm buying every bottle on the shelf due to the fact it's not produced anymore. found it for $79.99, a decent price seeing what others paid. nose is Bens Deli with cooked agave sweetness to balance it out. carries in to the flavor, no mustard on this pastrami on rye but some pickle tang. great balance for what it is. I want rye toast right now, I don't care what's on it. not your traditionally made anejo, but it hits on all cylinders for what it wants to be. a really fun sipper for sure. I'm going back for more

254.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
254.Review: Pleasantly surprised at how much I liked this one. The flavor is sweet with a lot of the barrel coming through but the heat in the finish is the kicker that put it over the edge (in a good way) for me.

255.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
255.Review: Fantastic!! Great change to the normal tequila with the rye

256.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
256.Review: Is it scotch or is it tequila?

257.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
257.Review: I like this whole lineup as i own 2 bottles of the sazerac 18 yr . rye . this one i liked a tad bit more then the other 2 expression i have . great experiment..

258.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
258.Review: Nice anejo, the rye finish adds some depth and spiciness I enjoy

259.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
259.Review: A delicious tequila when you fancy something toned down (I'm avoiding saying smooth, oops gone done it now). It's tasty but don't expect to it to be full of agave.

260.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
260.Review: Tasted at Winter Drams event in Seattle in Jan 2017. Sight scent.  Almost elusive nose.  Sweet honey on the front with noticeable alcohol quickly following.  A little sharp.

261.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
261.Review: Light hints of oak in the nose. No initial burn at all, very smooth going down...traces of the rye on the tip of the tongue. Leaves a great flavor and nice coating in the mouth.

262.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
262.Review: Interesting twist on this tequila. The various barrels nearly turn it into something totally different. Excellent craftmanship. However, for the tequila purist, this is more of a whiskey, due to the aging and barrel treatments...

263.Tequila: Expresiones del Corazon Sazerac Rye Añejo
263.Review: Blind taste tested.  Sweet vanilla, caramel, high test nose with winey, scotch undertones. Light straw color with a medium body.  Tastes of Agave sugar and again with the scotch undertones.  A lot of heat throughout with a fiery white pepper finish. Very dry but the complexity points it out an an Anejo.  Now that I know what it is, I really enjoyed this uncharted rye whiskey barreling.  90 proof And no wonder we call it quits after a glass full of this one.

264.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo

265.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
265.Review: Rich aromas of tobacco, dried fruit (apricot) and slight white chocolate. Sweet agave, piloncillo and raisin taste. Wish it was more viscous but it’s real and tasty!

266.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
266.Review: Smells pretty damn great. Cherry, raisin, tobacco, and lots of oak. Flavor has all of the above, plus cooked agave, especially in the finish. There’s some nice barrel spice that comes in during the middle of the finish. Overall a solid product for people who like aged tequilas.

267.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
267.Review: Very fruity, mineral flavors with topical barrel notes. Very good.

268.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
268.Review: Got this on a cruise to Cozumel 8 years ago. Still remember how much I enjoyed it, just cannot get it where I live!

269.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo

270.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo

271.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
271.Review: got it in Cozumel, possibly a bait and switch.

272.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
272.Review: I had several drinks of this on vacation in Cozumel at a tasting and it was fantastic, but they wanted $200 or $300 for it. I had never heard of it before and wasn’t sure what a fair price was for it, but it was amazing.

273.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
273.Review: The best I have ever had, wish I could get it in the states. :(

274.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
274.Review: Bought on a Tequila tour in Cozumel.  Amazing drink! Great to sip like a awesome bourbon.

275.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
275.Review: The absolute most amazing Tequila I have ever tried...and I try a new one every time I see one I haven’t tried before.

276.Tequila: Regalo de Dios Tequila Extra Añejo
276.Review: The most flavorful and smooth tequila I have ever tasted! It is not only delicious but the flavors are some that I have never had before. It is so pure and easy to drink!

277.Review: Subtle nose and palate. Easy to drink but nothing exciting here and left me wanting more.

278.Review: Soft nose of cooked agave, honey, combed cotton. Tiny hint of rubber ball. Thick in the glass and pleasantly luscious in the mouth. Coats the whole palette. Tastes of raw agave, white pepper, vanilla and a bit of jalapeño. Spicy and fairly long finish with a little burn. A bit of acetate at the end. An easy drinker overall. Worthy effort, and a good trade up for Casamigos and 818 drinkers.

279.Review: Cooked agave along with a bit of anise and black pepper in the aroma but also a distinct petroleum/rubber note that really throws things off. Spicy pepper in the open, mid and finish of flavor along with distinct mint. Also, just a hint of that petroleum/rubber at the end. Finish is medium with mint lingering.Note: petroleum/rubber aroma note diminishes significantly after 10-15 minutes but to my nose is still there.March tequila tasting - blancos, 03-24-2022

280.Review: Not at the level of 1 or 2 this has some bitter vegetable taste in the mouth with less natural sweetness than 1 or2.

281.Review: Luna Blanco, 28 days in wood. A fuller bodied blanco, balance of cooked agave, mint, and a slight spice

282.Review: On the nose I’m picking up some agave, vegetal notes, and anise. There’s a lot of flavors to go around including agave, vanilla, light oak, vegetal, citrus, mint, and cinnamon. There’s a hint of heat but overall the wide range of flavors come across creamy. Very nice!

283.Review: Nose of faintly sweet vegetal aromas with notes of lime juice. Slightest hint of oak and vanilla. Light consistency, flavor is pleasant but mild, similar to the aroma. The flavor comes through on the finish, with a slightly sweet agave, which then leads into notes of black pepper. Also has a nice lingering warmth on the finish.A delicious, well made, blanco tequila for sipping.

284.Review: Fresh agave floral on the nose ….. aroma changes as it sits and opens up ….. black pepper on the mouth….

285.Review: The smell of freshly cut agave from the fields fill my glass followed by white pepper, dry earth, and a touch of caramelized tropical fruit. While light on entry, this tequila is thick, chewy, and bold; proper - in every aspect.

286.Review: Aroma: cooked agave, olives, cinnamon, rosemary.  Palate: vanilla, agave, caramel, citrus and mint.  Finish: some berries, pepper, vanilla.  Finish medium-short. Tequila is clear silver color. Edit. I left it air for 1/2 hour and the sweet agave and vanilla expanded on flavor while the peppery hide behind.

287.Review: Briny green olives. Mint. Citrus notes on finish.

288.Review: Agave on the nose.  Taste us mint, black pepper, nice viscosity.  Finish is peppery.

289.Review: Not big on Anise flavors, you can tell the quality is there though

290.Review: Very clean, peppery, herbacious and floral flavors on the tongue, citrus and agave on the nose. Pleasant finish. Pretty bottle with good quality juice inside of it. Love that it is woman-owned.

291.Review: I had my wife rate this one with me as well.  Very soft on the palate initially.  Very light vanilla.  Builds with pepper and strong mint that lasts quite awhile.  This one will be a great introduction to some of my family and friends that are not as keen on tequila.  Might win them over!

292.Review: Really like sipping on this one, the barrel imparts lots of natural vanilla sweetness but it’s not overbearing at all. Besides the fresh agave/citrus/mint presence there’s also a very distinct flavor I haven’t picked up from any other blanco - almost like a raisin/overripe apple note. It’s gotten even better after opening up for a few weeks. Extremely easy to drink and my guests love the bottle! I would love to have this on hand all the time, I just wish it was easier to get ahold of.If you’re looking to put friends onto really good, well-made tequila, this and G4 are the best of the “converter bottles” I’ve tried. Amazing stuff!

293.Review: Really crisp and clean. Mint and pepper and anise with a fair amount of agave. This is really bright and sweet.

294.Review: Anise, ripe agave, pepper, slight white oak wood presence on the nose Minerality, agave, loads of citrus, lots of pepper for the medium to long finish

295.Review: Smooth, light pepper finish, cooked agave, herbals present, mint, anise - subtle citrus- delicious all the way around- terrific sipper- cool-ass bottle too!

296.Review: Clean Aroma . Nothing over powering.Taste is also clean with nice heat and pepper on the backend. Very enjoyable Blanco.

297.Review: Lots of sweet baked agave on the nose as well as light citrus, anise and caramel. On the palate theres an immediate burst of flavors including sweet cooked agave, raisen, anise, caramel and a soft  peppery finish.  No burn at at all and very easy ti sip. Happy to know that its confirmed additive free. The gorgeous bottle is a bonus. I would gladly bring this to a party or give it as a gift.  Great job Inspiro!

298.Review: Lote LTG21351119, bottled on March 2020.Nose: mineral, wet stone, light citrus. Palate: light sweet cooked agave! Citrus, good sweet & sour balance, light pepper spiciness.Finish is medium, light sweet cooked agave with light pepper persists.

299.Review: Sweet cooked agave, not an overpowering agave aroma. Slight citrus, almost like orange peel on the back end. Champagne Yeast and 8 year hand picked agaves used on this brand out of NOM 1560.

300.Review: A sweet fruity blanco tequila, that caught my attention for its crisp and zesty profile that keeps you indulging on it. Can be a versatile tequila as a sipper and a mixology component. Looking forward to explore with it on cocktails:Aroma: Agave is present but somewhat muted for my preference. Would like to know the maturity of the agaves, but can definitely assume its between 5-8 yrs. Also obtained, sweet fruity aromas as apples/pear along with earthy/grassy notes. A subtle back aroma of tangerine and an extremely friendly white pepper presence (please note its a 38% ABV). Minimal alcohol presence, this can be dangerous in the good way!Flavor: A bouquet of fruity notes that keep you wanting more. Eager to know the brix volume of the agaves, and the fermentation process to have such a fun and complex expression. Fruity: apples, pear, nectarine Citrusy: orange, tangerine, orange blossomsHerbal: sweet red bell pepper, sweet mintSpices: white pepper & jalapenoOther: mineralTexture/Finish: Warm sensation and buttery entrance, no harsh alcohol detected. Medium bodyA must try, definitely on the natural sweet side of tequila. Price is excellent!

301.Review: Purchased in June 2022 for USD85.Color: dark amber, maybe. I'm not a color expert, but it is on the darker side, for an añejo. Aged 24 months.Aroma: caramel, vanilla, spicy barrel notes that I don't come across often. Quite pleasant. Agave takes a backseat; it's presence is minimal.Palate: Very similar to the aroma. More noticeable agave. Not sure what barrels were used, but I don't detect any particular spirit (e.g. whisky or cognac) and I like that.Finish: spicy barrel notes linger. Dry/bitter cherry, perhaps.The spicy barrel notes remind me of Don Felix añejo.

303.Review: SUAVE ANEJO $190 Oldtown1522 los valles confirmed additive freeorganicHigh-pressure autoclave Nose: Caramel, oak, some citrus, brown sugar, a little heat on top. Nose settles down after it opens and gets betterTaste: more oak than sweet. not badFinish: medium to long Rated 84 but waaay overpriced so points off

304.Review: Out of the bottle: agave on the glass sides, bottom edge is agave and caramel, center glass springs out more agave and slight smoked off the top of glass, pear, a slight nose of creamed sherry!Taste: slight bite, then agave, smooths out very nicely.Finish: smooth, agave after wards,

305.Review: This drinks more like a barrel aged gin than tequila. notes of juniper berry, vanilla and oak spice dominate the palate. the finish is very flat and boring. Incredibly overpriced tequila.

306.Review: The bitterness found in the reposado is less pronounced in this one, but still present. The caramel/toffee aroma is quite pleasing, and I wish it was more present in the flavor.

307.Review: The finest taste in years produced by CESAR VITARI, CEO, THE SUAVE SPIRITS INTERNATIONAL, INC.

308.Review: Gift from a friend. Quite thick in the mouth yet not too sweet as sometimes is the case with more viscous tequilas. Nice white pepper finish with some alcohol numbing.

309.Review: nose citrus alcohol spicetaste citrus hot peppery with harsh finish suitable for Margaritas

310.Review: a solid organic blanco. would make a great mixer! nice pepperiness to this one with some herbal / anise to it

311.Review: Oaky flavor finish with a hint Citrus aroma

312.Review: It was attractively priced at Total Wine and I got what I didnâ€™t bargain for. I thought it might make a good mixer but it fell flat there too because I immediately got a bizarre chemical tire rubber flavor. Cannot recommend.

313.Review: 3 Amigos Blanco is a fine blanco that punches well above its weight ($25 @ Total Wine). Honestly, I wasn't expecting it to be this good. This can do double duty as a mixer and as a sipper.Nose: Beautiful.  Clean, vegetal, bright green agave and a splash of black pepper. A hint of lime citrus and jasmine. The initial alcohol on the nose dissipates after a little time in the glass-it is not off putting.Taste: Slightly sweet in the initial draw.  Medium viscosity and a slight oilyness with a balanced warmth.  The taste mimics the nose, but is it does have a little harshness. Still, very good.Finish: Long peppery warmth.

314.Review: There's a bold flavor to this that I really like, especially in blood orange margaritas. The price, however, prevents me from regularly buying this tequila. Only when it goes on sale.

315.Review: NOM 1570|NOM 1570.  Citrus fruity flavor. Not a great aroma, but tastes good. Not a bad alcohol burn aftertaste. Overall impressive.

316.Review: Aroma is agave and citrus, clean but not complex.Flavor is more interesting, nice, changes into more complex over time.Nice after taste, not too hot from alcohol.Overall a clean, quality, good value tequila.More for mixing than on the rocks.

317.Review: This tequila carry a very strong smell and taste, but can pair well if mixed.

318.Review: This blanco slides smoothly down the center of your tongue and before it rests seductively in the rear. A slight alcohol burn followed but quickly dissipated. Cooked agave and vegetal flavors coat the mouth, works well at room temperature. For the price it is well worth keeping it in the bar stock and for use with the higher class mixed drinks.

319.Review: Great mixer! Very fair price for the quality.

320.Review: Expensive for an organic. Cannot tell much flavor between organic and non blanco.

321.Review: Great rustic aroma and taste. Has a formidable "bottom end" on the flavor. Flavor has a slightly too bitter center, but still sip worthy. Finishes long and warm. For the $ (35.00) this a SOLID repo. Recommended for sure.

322.Review: NOM 1499|NOM 1499. Agave, vanilla, pepper, oak, cinnamon, and honey. A bit floral on the nose. Bought in Mexico. Pleasant surprise.

323.Review: NOM 1079|Water Street Imports lote 101 - delicious nose of creme brûlée, caramel, and butter scotch. Nose might be the star, as Palate is softer, again notes of caramel and some roasted agave. Silky and round in the mouth, the finish closes with some baking spices.

324.Review: NOM 1499|This is soooo soft it’s hard to believe the ABV! Agave flavour is there but not enough to make me rate this amongst my favourites, there is something else present in the background that I don’t love...kind of chalky?!?

325.Review: NOM 1499|Aroma:   Oak and barrel spices. Ripe dark fruit and citrus. Musty root cellar and a hint of vanilla. Flavor:   Viscous sweetness that has an odd taste, vaguely reminiscent of odors found in an older persons closet - weird, I know....Closes out with cocoa and light pepper.Maybe just a bad bottle?

328.Review: NOM 1079|Beautiful aroma. Nice agave flavor. Not incredibly complex but well balanced.

330.Review: NOM 1499|Glad to be able to buy it again here in the states. Bought my first bottle in Mexico. I do enjoy a little bite in my tequila. This is smooth with a bite for good measure. Always a couple bottles here at my house.

331.Review: NOM 1499|The initial smell of butterscotch is enticing and gourmand. I can pick up smells of agave but it's outshined by caramel sweetness and oak. This iare some mineral notes as well. On the palate is overt sweetness with a dash off pepper, very non-offensive, the agave once again is but a squeak compared to the butter pecan taste and white pepper. The finish is aight' but what I don't care for is the chemical taste that lingers in my throat.

332.Review: You can't go wrong with this Tequila Reposado. it's really good!

333.Review: NOM 1499|Bright nose, smell is fresh tickles the hairsRoasted Agave, Minerals, tongue tingleNeutral sweetness, warm finish

334.Review: NOM 1499|$80Mellow citrus tones in aromaFlavour. Mellow heat. Authentic throughout Best bottle (growler of tequilas)

335.Review: NOM 1499|The Blanco is present in this expression. Straight forward vanilla, oak and pepper with some agave sweetness … medium finish.

336.Review: NOM 1499|Aroma: Peet moss. Organic, earthy. Cantaloupe. Salted Cucumber. White pepper

337.Review: NOM 1499|Love the design of these bottles. Aroma - pepper on the nose then the roast agave comes out Flavor - unique. Agave, white pepper, then melon. There’s a candy flavor but not artificial. Finish - smooth with lingering pepper, no burnSurprisingly complex, especially if you let it open in the glass.

339.Review: Heavy notes of roasted agave, whisky barrel definitely makes it worth it

340.Review: NOM 1499|A slight vanilla aroma with a mild sweet taste and mild peppery finish to match. Will need to try more and adjust score appropriately. Cost $44.99 + $6.93 shipping

343.Review: NOM 1079|Incredibly easy to drink. Reminds me of a smoother version of 4 Copas. Light vanilla, mostly agave. No after taste, smells a bit sweet.

344.Review: This was a tequila worth the money.

345.Review: NOM 1499|This juice is outstanding. wonderful aroma. complex flavor but not too overpowering that it wouldn't make a great cocktail. best to sip neat. better neat sipper than most anejos I've had. def a keeper. only a few critques: many flavors that fade suddenly, not much staying power. and the packaging: half awesome, half wtf? the labels are printed on a terrible printer and look blurry

346.Review: Love this juice! Great nose, complex and smooth, nice finish

347.Review: Smooth. $43 October 2016. Sippin tequila. Have it neat. Little spice finish.

348.Review: Impressive Tequila. Very powerful aroma of agave, wood, vanilla and spice. Likewise, very powerful initial flavor of agave, vanilla, cinnamon/spice that pleasantly transitions to a smooth finish. Beautiful bottle as well. Great tequila.

349.Review: Current NOM 1499. I am not sure how this 1921 Repo compares to the versions at previous NOMs, but I will say that this is my favorite sipping tequila. I've tried a few tequilas at this price point that weren't much better than tequilas 1/2 the price. This is not true for 1921.  To me, this tequila is superior.

350.Review: Very mild, roasted agave, honey, nutty. Enjoyable.

353.Review: Cork broke off trying to open bottle. Way over priced for the quality . Fancy bottle ,but lame tequila .

354.Review: One of my very favourites. As it does not appear to be available for purchase in Canada, I am forced to go to Mexico regularly to resupply. What a terrible tragedy. :)

355.Review: NOM 1535|Wonderful aroma and good finish. Sweet, but agave comes through.

356.Review: NOM 1079|Wonderful aroma and finish. Sweet, but agave comes through.

359.Tequila: El Tesoro de Mi Tierra Blanco
359.Review: Nose:   Minerals, earth, citrus, herbs and agave. Flavors:   Ripe agave, cherry, anise, and minty basil. Balanced pepper to round it out.

360.Tequila: El Tesoro de Mi Tierra Blanco
360.Review: Nice clean agave and a citrus finish.

361.Tequila: El Tesoro de Mi Tierra Blanco
361.Review: Nose is a bit one note, you do hit a bit of varnish in there but grassy and green.Not necessarily my cup of tea, some chocolate and cherry there. Not nearly enough agave for me.Finish mirrors the nose, with a very abrupt and drying finish.

362.Tequila: El Tesoro de Mi Tierra Blanco
362.Review: Excelente Tequila comprado en Cabo San Lucas! Super rico y suave!

363.Tequila: El Tesoro de Mi Tierra Blanco

364.Review: Light straw color with some floaters, much like the blanco had. Complex unique nose:  Cherry, berry, vanilla, lemon, lemon rind and almonds. Crazy flavors (in a good way):Pepper, earth, ripe agave, ripe fruits and snickerdoodle spices.  Maybe a touch of mustiness. Pepper, cookie spices and agave linger in harmony.

365.Review: Simple tequila but real and tasty. Green agave aroma burnt off to reveal mint, jalapeño and cinnamon. Medium, oily mouthfeel with a slightly funky finish, or else I would’ve rated it higher.

366.Review: Green agave and jalapeno and bell pepper aromas. Some cinnamon after it opens up. Agave and some spicy flavor with a medium oily mouthfeel. Bottle has a 2007 Mexican tax sticker.

367.Review: Creamy mouth feel, sweet barrel notes, sweet agave, great looking bottle and fair price from 1146

368.Review: Nose: dried fruit, clove, oak, agave, vanilla, and earth. Flavor: whiskey notes, allspice, wood, very light mouth feel. Finish: short with lots of pepper

369.Review: Aromas:   Big bold spicy nose. Dried fruit, vanilla, whisky oak, cedar, lactic and floral add multiple dimensions. Flavors:   Cloves, cinnamon, allspice, caramel, vanilla and agave. Nice pepperiness.

370.Review: Overall solid tequila. Has lots of character and smells and tastes like a natural product.

371.Review: This brand had been around for some years and initially consisted of just an añejo. Some years later and there is a full line of b, r, a. Wood and whiskey notes on the nose along with some alcohol. Well balanced in the mouth with roast agave sweetness, some nice oak and caramel finish. Reminds me of the 2 year Purasangre Añejo from 1146.

372.Review: Classic barrel aromas of caramel, vanilla and almond. The flavor begins with a nice caramel sweetness which carries through to the finish but soon after the sweet start a mild heat begins and blends with the sweet opening. The finish is relatively short.7/25/2014

373.Review: Clean profile, great sweet smell. Delicious tequila. Nothing much to add, everything been said below!

374.Review: Aroma - caramel, nuts, dried fruitTaste - spice, thick coating, woodFinish - peppery, balanced, not long lastingOverall it is a good anejo

376.Review: Amber in color. Sweet cooked agave, allspice, whiskey, cinnamon, vanilla and caramel on the aroma.Buttery mouthfeel. Dried stone fruit, caramelized agave, allspice, oak, whiskey barrel. Medium finish with sufficient heat. A tequila from the great NOM 1146 that isn't often talked about. A bit whiskey forward, but enjoyable. Would be rated higher by those that prefer whiskey forward anejos. A very reasonably priced anejo

377.Review: The flavor on the nose is slightly sweet with a spicy mid palette and a smooth overall finish. Best at room temp on its own

378.Review: Thanks Jonathan for this rare one in Pahrump.

380.Review: what is my first better quality tequila but Still a favorite even though it doesn't meet the extra Anejo qualities

381.Review: Good flavor and great finish. Can only find in Mexico right now.

382.Review: Still a favorite from my early tequila exploration. Lots of sweetness on the nose and light bodied.

383.Review: Butterscotch nose with a full earthy caramel taste and a spicy finish. You can taste charred barrel at the end. Very enjoyable.

384.Review: A great classic  añejo tequila that was readily available in Mexico 5 -8 years ago. Now coming back to New york , possibly other markets.It will be interesting to see if it has changed at all.

385.Review: Pleasant Fruity and peppery aroma . Ditto for the flavor . A bit warm on the finish , but very sippable . Purchased at discount Costco price so a few extra value points . Overall , a decent tequila .

386.Review: Good value .. the 80 proof has a nice finish . not to much vanilla.
