821.Review: Tasted along with Avion (which I really enjoy), and this was even better.  Bright, crisp, clean, and smooth from start to finish.  Finish and aftertaste is where this really shines, as the nose and taste is well balanced rather than distinctive. $44 for the 1L.

824.Review: Nice. Simple.Has backbone. Tastes proper made. NoUnique flavors but good

825.Review: LOTE: TB-05039/01/202040%1 ltrInitial nasal impact has a nice prickle with sweet and sour notes.Aroma of cooked agave, jasmine, lime, grapefruit, cinnamon, honeysuckle and pepper.Oily mouthfeel with generous heat.Pepper, cinnamon, grapefruit, lime zest dominate the flavor. Some grass on the retro nasal.The pepper holds on the long finish of this great blanco. Everything you could ask for in a classic blanco. Added bonus: about $35 - 40 for a 1 ltr bottle and a screw cap for easy travel. Another awesome tequila from Carlos Camarena

826.Review: Loved the 1L bottles, and what’s inside is equally excellent. Starts off with a whiff of something like rubber cement and/or plastic. That sounds bad, I know, but it’s minor enough to just sort of be unique and endearing, as it coexists with a very good, thick nose of agave, a little fruity, not especially peppery, and just a hint of wet pavement. Palate is very good, green agave, lightly sweet, medium+ body, and with very excellent smooth and lasting finish. This is really great stuff and the value is superlative - the epitome of the perfect house tequila.

827.Review: True agave flavor. Traditional craftsmanship really shines.

828.Review: OMFG! New fave. The aroma is wonderful. The flavour sensational. FANTASTIC tequila and a true Blanco. I detected earth, agave, citrus..... Strong agave. Excellent oily finish. Very peppery. The bottle is simple and old school. And that is not a bad thing. Doing 1 on 1 comparisons. 1.5 ounce warm in a tumbler Tapatio Blanco vs Herencia de Plata Blanco. Winner (by a fairly close margin might I add) - Tapatio Blanco!!!!! Herencia has a bit of a mediciney alcholol aroma but wonderful floral and citrus flavour. Smokey and fruity. The Tapatio just plain kicks ass. Solid cooked agave. Peppery. Great oily finish. The Tapatio..... Just plain SOLID tequila.

829.Review: I get aromas of cooked agave, citrus, and black pepper, along with a spicy, earthiness. After opening up, there are vegetal notes and raw agave. The flavor has a nice spiciness and follows the aroma. Very earthy, and strong white pepper. Finish was medium length and spicy. If you don't mind spicy tequilas, this is the way to go!

830.Review: Aroma : Plantain, alcohol Flavor: Sweet flavour. Alcochol not too strongGood sipping, great value

832.Review: Smells soapy or citrusy but earthy

833.Review: Very complex with wide variety of aromas, old school tequila with a bite but full of bold flavors

834.Review: Citrus, finish is like sucking on a lime peel

835.Review: A wonderful aroma of pineapple and agave. Agave, black pepper and alcohol flavor. The alcohol flavor does not overwhelm, it is balanced with the other flavors perfectly. An excellent finish. Such a bargain for the quality of this juice. In all aspects, this is what a tequila should be. Outstanding!

836.Review: Crisp, floral, beautiful. An amazing blanco, and it comes in a litre bottle for the price of a 750. Buy two when you see it.

837.Review: Black pepper, fruit, slight alcohol burn.

838.Review: Fresh agave, citrus, lemon and flowers on the nose. Vanilla, cooked agave and pepper in the mouth. Earthy butter, roasted nuts and fruity in the finish. Same as the Reposado, if you can find it, buy it.

839.Review: I don’t usually go for lowland peppery Blancos, but I can happily drink this tequila all night. You very much know you’re about to drink a tequila the second it hits the nose and there is no denying the Agave taste and peppery finish. It is surprisingly clean though so can happily sip this straight. It does make a mean margarita though!

841.Review: Great blanco nose! Agave, citrus, hints of spice and a shuttle creaminess.Classic blanco, great agave flavour and finish

842.Review: The leading value tequila. Extremely tasty and priced so you can mix it!

844.Review: strong agave pepper spice. good smooth sipper.

845.Review: As complex as a blanco can be, the appealing mouth feel to this tequila is unique and bright. Spiced notes contrast its sweet note, making it an interesting sip. -EA

846.Review: Got surprised, this distillery works nicely the profiles. Packing very poor doesn’t make honor what is inside. Like it to try it today.

847.Review: Very light agave on the nose; nice fruity agave notes across the palate; fantastic clean finish across the back of the tongue; very fair price for a authentic, quality made tequila.

848.Review: This is a very unique flavor. I am getting a little bit of anise/ black licorice.

849.Review: Well, floral is the keyword here.  Nice and fresh taste, lots of agave during and after, very light burn to finish - kind of numbing and very nice.  I think I understand the new mown grass references now - a bit of that as well.  One of my first blancos, and I like.

850.Review: Thick in the glass as the legs slowly appear. Nose is earthy and slight mineral notes with a lot of cooked agave. The taste follows suit with the nose but adds some pepper and just a touch of alcohol. Finish is a little lingering but is very nice, the agave sweetness is most noticeable. Very nice blanco.

851.Review: My go to Blanco (when I don't want to fork out more cash for Fortaleza). Cant beat the value on this exceptionally good blanco, nothing beats it within price range. My friends laughed at the bottle but were amazed once they drank it.

852.Review: Smooth, full Agave body, slight burn/pepper finish. A very clean blanco.

853.Review: Could not possibly finish better, elite finish, got the bottle for 20 bucks, amazing Blanco.

854.Review: Aroma Alcoholizado, fresco, Sabor dulce, mucho a agave, un poco seco agarroso, a mi parecer un poco complejo, recomendado para una persona adulta, de 35 a√±os en adelante, que hayan tenido experiencias o les agrade el tequila derecho

855.Review: COLOR: PlatinumNOSE: Sweet roasted agave, floral bouquet, dried fruits, clayTASTE: Bright clean agave, carmalized agave, white sugar, lime, pepperFINISH: Medium body, medium finish, clean and smooth

856.Review: The process of making this tequila should be the bench mark for everyone else. Congrats!!

857.Review: Great agave nose. A little light and floral mid tongue with a mild finishing burn and sweetness. Easy sipperAt $28/L its a huge bargain and worth having in your rotation. Big fan of the  value to taste ratio.

858.Review: I think this tequila is above average it's not complex it's just a great clean TEQUILA. I get sweet, agave, lime, peper, mild burn with a (root beer) finish.

859.Review: Aroma loaded with green but sweet agave and a touch of parmesan cheese. Smooth and clean taste with flavor of sweet agave coupled with a little pungent earthiness, black pepper, and hint of smoke. Nice black pepper finish that gives way to mint, citrus, and anise.Overall, this is one of my favorite Blancos since it's so full of agave throughout. Such a mellow but flavorful profile. I noticed as it oxidized I picked up a lot more of the odd flavors like the cheese and especially anise. I'm not a big fan of licorice, but I dig this Tequila.

860.Review: aroma; agave, fresh, slight spicynesstaste; medium body, smooth, fresh agave, peppery (spicier with food)finish; smooth, low to no burn, sweet

861.Review: This tequila has gained cult status among bartenders and there is no question why. Fantastic value. Brite and fresh with distinct agave and spice notes. Very well rounded whit no off flavors. Great for cocktails but can hold up to the best straight up.

862.Review: first draft:this blanco doesnt try to do too much. the flavors aren't too loud, but are tightly bundled together nicely. oily, agave, tart-citrusy, peppery, anise nuances on the finish. this is the blanco to beat. perhaps not the most inviting for first timers, just because of how agave-y and earthy it smells, but it has surprisingly little alcohol burn. the peppery cream soda finish lasts just under a minute.it is inexpensive enough to be the go-to blanco, and has a special place on my shelf. makes me want to try the 110 proof varietal even more. great stuff.

863.Review: Very peppery.  Totally mixed up at the start, coming out really strong, and making me think it more than 80 proof.

864.Review: Pleasant aroma a hint of alcohol. A little heat on first taste. Quite smooth with a peppery lingering finish.The price alone makes it a must have in the collection!!The wife likes it in Margaritas (as do I) but quite nice as a sipper as well.

865.Review: Raw agave & heavy vegetal notes predominate the aroma.  Raw agave fruit sweetness on the palate balanced by mineral & grass.  Finish is pleasant & lingers with pepper notes.  I really like Mr. C's quality/price ratio on the Tapatio line!

866.Review: Great tequila without the high $$$ price IMHO.

867.Review: Great tropical fruit on the nose, that disappears on the tongue.  Very herbaceous,and grassy.  Great mouthfeel and huge finish.

868.Review: Cleaner agave than 110. Smoother, more citrus, less pepper. Lovely and AMAZING value.

869.Review: Nice mix of pepper and sugar.

870.Review: Well balanced nose and taste of agave.

871.Review: On sale at La Europea, Polanco, DF for 229 Mexican pesos

872.Review: Fantastic fresh tequila. Great for margarita.

873.Review: Initial impression is that something is overshadowing characteristics that I like.May re-review later.

874.Review: Nose: cooked agave, wet earth, some light mint, and cut grass Flavor: sweet cooked agave, earth, anise, olives, and slight fruitiness Finish: starts with some fruit and moves to black pepper spice, is a long dry finish.

875.Review: Solid tequila but overall I felt the smell & taste were both a little too mellow for my liking

876.Review: Subtle aromas with cooked agave, some anise, grass and a tiny bit of olive. Dominant agave flavor, with more olive in the finish. This is a nice, clean, pleasant tequila.

877.Review: Herbal, grassy nose with a hint of olive, anise and wet earth. Sweet, cooked agave flavor,  nice mouthfeel, and light minty finish. Very pleasant.

878.Review: Delicious with sweet aroma and complex taste.  A touch of alcohol lingers at the end.

879.Review: De-Nada' blanco is a wonderful spirit; subtle, soft, affordable and addative free. Ferment and Still @ $43 and Saratofa Wine Exchange @ $36.  Extra points for affordability. Aroma: Bright, clean and inviting on the inital nose.  Sweet cooked agave, lemongrass floral notes, and olives up front.  Followed by herbal spearmint, black pepper, pineapple citrus, and anise. Taste: Soft with a delicate sweet and dry mouthfeel.  Just a tiny bit of black pepper heat on the initial taste. Cooked agave, grass, and black pepper dominate.  Mint, earth, and a mild salty oliveness on the mid palate.  Finish: The finish is excellent.  I'll steal from Don Heiser: 'starts with some fruit and moves to black pepper spice, is a long dry finish.'

880.Review: Excellent sipper, stumbled upon it while visiting NY. Reminds me of G4, Teralta etc, easy to drink. Grassy, some earthy, some cooked agave presence but very mellow. Not sure I’d mix it! Maybe on ice with a squeeze of lime or I’d stick to sipping. After a couple glasses in I’m feeling a bit of a sweetness.

881.Review: Incredibly smooth, yet still getting lots of cooked agave and a pleasant natural sweetness on the finish. Enough character to mix in a cocktail; however, I enjoy drinking it neat and on the rocks. Fantastic.

882.Review: From 2009 or there about. Nose:   Mature, sweet agave immediately on the nosing. Cut grass, lemon/lime citrus, with floral and spice undercurrents. Flavor:   White pepper and spices playing nicely with the rich, caramelized agave presence - which is impressive and abundant. Finish:   A pleasant melding of warming pepper and cinnamon heat, a hint of anise, and the creamy sweet agave.

883.Review: Quite mellow on the nose with roast agave and a bit of alcohol. In the mouth this is very tasty with some bell pepper, cooked agave and natural sweetness. The distillery this is from produces Dos Armadillo and is the new home of Pura Vida after their disaster at Xamay. Nicely done.

884.Review: Not particularly notable. Smooth with a fair spice finish. consumed as part of a familia featuring all three expressions. Largest Featurea is the natural spring water well, but not much else. Agave is buried but present. Looks to be a very modern production which may work to its detriment.

885.Review: Almost no aroma present very very light agave. I was surprised to find no alcohol on the nose. But wait it’s very present once you taste it. Hot and bites back! Short lasting like the finish which was flavorless. I’m not a blanco fan so take this review with a grain of salt and a lime.

886.Tequila: One With Life Tequila Extra Añejo
886.Review: A little bite, sweet oak flavors. A fair XA. A little pricey out of the gate.

887.Review: Tasty juice! Agave, oak, caramel, spices, cherry. Nice long finish. Wonderful butterscotch on the nose as well.

888.Review: Very good anejo. Very balanced oak, agave, pepper, fruit (grilled pineapple). Extremely good.

889.Review: see my tasting notes here. https://youtu.be/rxiRUMSR9Ws

890.Review: I rated this tequila blind, during the 2013 Spirits of Mexico competition in San Diego.

891.Review: Smell,  although suitable,  strong in herbs. spices and herbs are bold at finish. watery not a full body tequila. wood is present. Value is a little too much. but great comparison to good extra a√±ejos

892.Review: I picked this up for $49.99 a liter and I am so glad I did.the nose is full of roasted agave with hints of Vanilla and caramel.  getting some plum like fruity notes as well.then I took a sip and the creamy buttery agave flavor followed by the nice oak awesomeness with a little vanilla mixed in.the finish is solid oakiness fading to a slight bitterness with some peppery heat.  this is a very nice Anejo and well worth the price.  if you see it.. get you some!!

893.Review: Nose:   Oh WOW!  Gigantic ripe fruit immediately assaults your senses. Then big agave and unobtrusive hints of oak. Next a pleasant dry pungent nuance, licorice, vanilla and a slight lactic note.  This all works flawlessly and delivers complexity and a silky roundness. Flavor:   Ripe berries, peaches, cinnamon, cloves and allspice. Oiliness, anise, honey and pepper. Huge reverence is shown to the agave. This is a must have tequila.

894.Review: Lovely aromas of raisin, cream soda and caramel. Rich, full mourhfeel, packed with flavor and a raisiny finish.

895.Review: Nice subtle cream soda and dried fruit nose, with a tiny bit of licorice. This is not overly done, which I really appreciate. Vanilla and gentle barrel spice flavors. Feels very full and round in the mouth. As usual, a well-done product from this respected brand.

896.Review: From the glass I can smell the huge agave and dried fruit presence. The fruit is on the darker side, like a prune or raisen. As I bring the glass closer, oak, licorice, caramel, vanilla, and honey introduce themselves. All romas are very well rounded and play nicely with one another. Flavor: sweet agave and honey hit your senses 1st followed quickly by oak, baking spices, anise, and a soft warm pepper finish. The Agave isn’t overpowered by aging, which I prefer as a blanco lover. This is definitely a must have for any collection!!

897.Review: freaking delicious. nice barrel notes but still smacking you in the face with cooked agave. tasted at locos taqueria in boston

898.Review: very oak forward. caramel vanilla baking spices ripe fruit sweet cooked agave. very nice finish

899.Review: A wonderful Anejo that serves up baked agave, caramel, vanilla, white pepper, baking spices, oak...Amazing what agave+water+yeast+wood+time+execution can deliver. Thanks NOM 1123 ‘Valley Sowers’!

900.Review: Agave Cardamom Orange flowerWell integrated oak+acidity

901.Review: Cooked and burnt caramel, honey and agave sweetness  on the nose with lots of oak Cooked agave, caramel, smoke, and oak on the palate

903.Review: I haven't actually had this one. I just mixed it up with the Siembra Azul anejo. can't figure out how to delete a rating. peace be with you

904.Review: I liked this one.  Solid. Lots of honey in aroma and finish but. It overly sweet.  I found it to be a bit thin in body.

905.Review: Light wood and wine barrel notes. The agave shines here. Cooked agave, light red fruit flavors. Very balanced.

906.Review: Floral, agave, sweet red wine, and hay on the nose, this smells great!I taste nice notes of agave and black pepper. Flavor is a notch below the amazing smell, as its got a slight bitter twang like over tart fruit. Nice legs but the finish is fairly short.

907.Review: Cooked agave, minerality, grapes on the nose.  Cooked agave black pepper , minerality grapes on the mouth… long finish

908.Review: Lightly floral with a clean minerality melded with cooked agave aromas on the nose. Light sweetness on the palate, mild and pleasant. A dry finish with a delicious burst of agave and light pepper, mixed with lingering floral notes. Update: On a blind test, detected more bitterness on the finish.

909.Review: Nose: cooked agave, essence of red wine, ripe red fruit, floral, light citrus, wet dirt, fresh cut hay, and some mintFlavor: cooked agave, with nice cooked agave sweetness, creamy mouth feel, black pepper, some fruitiness, and mint mid palate Finish: short and peppery

910.Review: a nice marriage of a slightly high-proof blanco and a Bordeaux Wine barrel. It's fruity and floral, and it's unique and well made. Lot1(172)=89, Lot2(237)=91, Lot3(311)=91

911.Review: Aroma:   Cinnamon and spice. Anise and vanilla Fruity, apple, plum and ripe berries. Flavor:   A mineral spritz to the palate. Agave, almond, licorice. Subtle pepper that gains traction as it opens up. A rich buttery/salty feeling on the tongue. A very easy sipper - but still has enough going on to hold your attention.  The brief barreling in Bordeaux casks creates an enigmatic profile. The total package works. Finish:   Short but pleasant. A hint of tannic bitterness.

912.Review: This Blanco has been rested for 29 days in wine barrels from Bordeaux, France. That gives this Blanco tequila a very pretty rose gold hue. I first smell agave and minerals before a floral fragrance appears. The fragrance is light and sweet with a hint of red grapes. It’s a very pleasant experience. I taste the agave first and foremost but simultaneously some minerality and muted pepper appear. Throughout the sip there is a hint of a juicy red plum and grape notes that continues into the finish. The pepper quickly gives way while the sweetness stays.  The finish is short but it it leaves you wanting another sip. If a tequila could be light but flavorful and simple why still having complexity then this is it. Every Blanco and Reposado lover should have this tequila in their collection. Salud!

913.Review: First impression is that the nose is excellent, but also a bit more pleasing than on the palate. The palate is definitely delicious, though.I've not had many blancos rested in oak, but this is definitely nice. Suave's lunar rested blanco comes to mind.Great creaminess that I associate with the process at Cascahuín. The wine barrel adds a dynamic to the tequila that I'll have to study more to better appreciate it.

914.Review: Fun! Different. Bravo to those in life willing to take risks and try new things.Tasting notes to follow. I’ll have to sit with this longer…

915.Review: Earthy sweetness. The agave is there, clearly, but it’s more rounded off and I’m getting something like a custard, maybe flan. On the palate, I’m immediately struck by how little heat there is for an 82 proof tequila. Very oily and almost creamy, lots of agave. This one evolves quickly, I’m getting earthy and olive brine notes, reminiscent of Fortaleza for me. But then my next sip is all agave and maybe a hint of grape. A very dry finish, clean and the earthiness lingers. This is definitely a good tequila. It’s tasty, drinks super easy, and it has a simple complexity to it. On some sips, all I get is cooked agave, in others I get that earthiness and olive brine, and the barest hint of grapes. No two sips were the same for me. Very interesting, but at $75 + $15 for shipping + taxes, you’re looking at nearly $100 per bottle and that’s where it loses points for me. I wonder if this would hold up as well in blind tastings. Update: Trying the third batch and this is fantastic. Finish is much longer, very earthy and vegetal. I bought two bottles and I’m happy I did. Maybe my palate has changed but I’m enjoying this much more than the first batch. Still a little pricy but very good.

916.Review: Agave really shines through on the nose. There’s a nice citrus aroma along with some oak and a healthy amount of vegetal aroma. The flavor is very well balanced. An agave sweetness comes through. What I love is the grape/fruitiness that comes through so well. This tequila is so easy to drink. Refreshingly light but also a juicy mouth feel. It’s a pleasure to drink.

917.Review: Aromas of wet earth, mint, hay, slight olive, and definitely a touch of wine grapes from 29 days spent in Bordeaux barrels, but the Cascahuin blanco elements are what shine. Sweet cooked agave in the mouth with a touch of black pepper in the back, and medium oiliness. No real finish, but this one sure is easy to drink!

918.Review: I guess a tequila can be both simple and complex at the same time. This is a totally different flavor profile for Cascahuin, which has just been on a roll with great releases. This one has a lot of agave, fruit, grapes (from the wine casks it rested in), some butter and hay in the back, but lots of natural sweetness to make it delicious. The finish is short and clean (“smooth!”) which makes this insanely easy to drink. It has a slightly dry finish and lingering mouthfeel. I’m going to buy a case of this if I can!

919.Review: Lote: 3Aroma:Earthy. Wet ground. Flavor:AgaveHeavy earthinessMineralsA little bit of fruitI feel like it’s been over-hyped. I was disappointed with the first tasting. It’s a good blanco, not a great blanco for me.

920.Review: Lot 311.  Day 2 notes.Aroma: Rustic.  Cinnamon.  Mint.  White pepper.  Violets.  Light blood/red meat.  Taste: Clean.  Naturally sweet—diluted cane sugar.  Minimal tobacco, slight tannin.  Cooked agave.  Artichoke dipped in drawn butter.Feel: moderate viscosity; round mouthfeel.Finish: short.  About the only negative here; finish is gone in under half a minute, and is simply a cane sugar note.  Very little else. Other folks say they get the fruitiness of the wine in this; I do not.   I get zero wine or barrel presence, in fact, save for the gorgeous pink hue.I need to do a side by side of this and Tahona.  I’d think they’d compare quite well.

921.Review: This one is a good scent on the nose. Upfront you get this nice smell of citrus notes and hint of agave. The taste a very earthy taste, but the finish is very nice and so pleasing

923.Review: Lot 3. Fascinating. Very complex and different. Peppery and grassy and earthy. Bordeaux barrels are imparting such a uniqueness I don’t normally get, with a strong 1123 presence in the base.

925.Review: The French oak wine barrels make a statement in this blanco.  A fruity, cinnamon flavor with a long satisfying finish. Another interesting and unique blanco from NOM 1123.

926.Review: Delicious!! Wine barrel influence is on the first taste. Silky, creamy, honey, cooked agave, minty, peppery finish. One of my favorites.

927.Review: 2nd Batch. This is different and I love it. Lovely bouquet of roses, baked agave, orange blossoms, citrus, freshly cut grass all in the nose. The fact that the barrels originally had cabernet sauvignon compared to other varietals. Alongside trademark Cascahuín flavors such as cooked agave, grass, mouthwatering minerality, citrus these Bordeaux barrels add a unique layer. After these Cascahuín flavors pass the tastes and aromas of boysenberry, black currant, potting soil, cassis, and plum. As an old world wine lover this is a fantastic blanco. Now I’m curious what a blanco rested in Beaujolais barrels would taste like…

928.Review: Lot 237. Take Cascahuín blanco… add some rose water to the nose, palate, and finish, and you end up here. Pretty darn nice.

929.Review: LOTE 237, bottled 300522.Color: very pale yellow.Nose: intense sweet cooked agave! A touch of wood note, minerality. Light citrus & a hint of grapey notes. Floral aromas. Palate: intense sweet cooked agave with wood spiciness that doesn’t overpower, clean & fresh. Good sweet & sour balance like a grapefruit, a combination of sweetness, citrus and bitterness! Finish is medium to long, sweet cooked agave, citrus and enjoyable bitterness persists! Wow!

930.Review: Second Lote limited to 1,400 bottles. Out of Cascahuin distillery. N: Minerals, citrus skins, Oaky/Anise, Agave, Vegetables/grassy, Smokey, Pepper. Sawdust/Musk T: Cascahuin! Mineral, citrus, apple skins, dried pineapple, light red fruits/berry, Anise, Fresh Oak, Dry. Disconnect it’s a Blanco with huge Oak influence that overtakes the Agave. But that’s what makes it unique and worth trying.

932.Review: Montagave tasting 10/11/22, again 10/15, 10/22the more I drink these, the more I like them both. they are sooo easy to sip, especially lote 2...Lote 1Darker pink colorNose: agave, fruit, and red wine (on the right nostril, to the left side of the glass)Palate: sweet agave with some fruit, a little heatFinish: medium, dry, with a little fruit and some warmth that lingers. just how I like it.Viscosity: thick but not too thick. Very goodLote 2Lighter colorNose: agave forward with some aniseTaste: sweet agave, fruit, a littl4e pepper, seems a little hotter than lote 1, in a good way Overall comparison between lotes 1 and 2:They are both quite good. I get more wine notes with 1. I like 2 better = sweeter more agave with anise, less wine notes. With 2, the finish is a little hotter, more peppery, in a good way. Legs on both are good

933.Review: The aroma is rich and buttery. There’s a touch of smoked meat and woodsy earth on the palate along with bright, tangy blueberry, spicy cinnamon, hay, fresh green herbs and honey.

934.Review: Agave forward, with a tangy wood finish from the wine barrels. Very smooth, buttery mouth feel. Subtle might and clean finish.

935.Review: A nice fruitiness from the Bordeaux wine barrels, with a little bitterness and burn in the finish.

937.Review: Montagave (NOM 1123)NOSE:  Cooked succulent sweet agave, florals, jalapeño-type pepperyness, light lemon-rind, grassy/mint, and bourdeaux wine oaky barrel notes, licorice.TASTE: Good juice on the palate that is equally expressive of the aromatics. The barrel oakiness is just a bit more subdued on the mouth.  Creamy mouth feel, and a nice balanced alcohol influence that   allows the agave and bourdeaux influences to finish pleasantly...  great sipper, indeed!

938.Review: I really enjoyed this tequila, so much flavor, especially if you let it sit for a few minutes. Cooked agave, black pepper, some spiciness and o get a woody finish. Great stuff.

939.Review: Montagave Heritage, Lot 237 (300522), $75 USD shipped direct.Aroma: Bold earthy nose that reminds me of Cascahuin Plata.  I get an arid clay earthiness, minerality, walnuts, and hay up front with the lightly sweet cooked agave. Foral grapefruit and honey with touch of cinnamon spice from the wine barrel.Taste: Balanced and buttery mouthfeel. A little cinnamon and balck peppr heat.  Agave shines along with the fruit character of the wine barrel.  A touch of  minerality and brine comingle with tangy citrus and sweet grapes flavors. This is really a light and easy blanco to sip.Finish:  I want to echo Nick Salcedo's thoughts; 'A dry finish with delicious burst of agave and light pepper, mixed with lingering floral notes.'

940.Review: A nice over all balance of flavor. Lots of cooked agave. It’s very oily which I love. The finish is what does it for me. Nice hints of the Boudreaux barrel really shine through. I do wish it was a bit cheaper. Not sure the price falls in line with other premium blanco pricing.

941.Review: Fruity floral faint citrus. good viscosity. flavors similar to the nose, floral, fruit, mineral. agave. bright. slightly bitter sweet finish. good. a nice variation to the usual. not my exact flavor preference matched with the price, wont be a regular for me. good nonetheless and one id encourage others to taste to find their likings.

942.Review: Incredible bottle. Aroma is top notch: agave, citrus , floral notes. Taste has agave all throughout, pepper, and a sweetness of red fruits and oak. All flavors are in harmony . It coats the mouth so well and most of the flavors for me, came after I swallowed the juice. It settles on the palette, and remains there.

943.Review: Incredible aroma. The flavor for me did not match the incredible smell.

944.Review: Very nice blonco. On the nose it has the typical cascahuin nose f agave, baking spices, minerality, right into a fruit like ripe grapes. The taste is wow very complex. Has a nice grape sickle taste (think of an orange crème sickle popsicle but with grape instead of oranges… but not artificial all natural tasting). Very good.

945.Review: Really good rested blanco, lost some points for price. Aroma- agave, slight floral, slight oak sweetness Taste- agave, slight oak and vanillaFinish- agave punch Re-tasted in a blind rosa test and had to take a couple points off for bitterness in the taste and finish.

946.Review: There's a lot going on here nice viscosity with lots of flavor. Grape influence shines through while maintaining the agave. Vanilla cinnamon mint Amos present. Must at to a collection.

947.Review: Aroma and color are attractive. But that’s where it ends. Flavor is lacking in strong agave notes. Finish is short and poor.  Points off for all that and also unsure if I would drink it again. More points off for price. I actually wonder if people’s rankings were influenced by the NOM.

948.Review: Montagave Blanco Heritage ventures into a merge of the Old & New World by merging Tequila craftmanship and Bordeaux distinctive personality. This Blanco tequila rests in Bordeaux wine barrel for 29 days to create an attractive rose-gold champagne color hue that instantly catches anyone's eyes. Once you dive in, you're received by a fresh and floral aromatic bouquet that is complemented by the agave richness and invites you to delight on it. Aroma:Fresh and crisp floral/fruity profile, that doesn't overpower the cooked agave presence. Both layers work on a very balanced way and provide just the right complexity for any drinker to get curious about what's next. Sweet citrus and baking spices nuances also say hello towards the end. Notes: cooked agave, plum, grapes, dried cherries, apple, orange, flowers, white pepper & baking spices. Mineral personality. Flavors:This profile has a creamy/buttery entrance with minimal alcohol attack (obtained from a malolactic fermentation). The cooked agave sweetness has been maintained, but also elevated from the berry-like symphony obtained from the aging method. It is slightly complex, but very enjoyable for any type of drinker, meaning notes are very friendly and familiar making it easy to sip. As you keep sipping, notes evolve towards a fruity layer composed of grapes, plum, prunes, licorice, and dried fruits. Accompanied by a sweet citrus presence of orange and grapefruit, leaving just a small tart touch. The finish does leave a spice kick (white pepper, cinnamon & nutmeg) that I wasn’t anticipating, but is still great.The end is short and tannic (dry), a sensation I mostly enjoy in wine, but pleasant in this profile. Notes: cooked agave, butter, prune, grapes, cherries, berry, dried fruit, grapefruit, orange, licorice, baking spices, raisins, mineral. Price: slightly overpriced at $75+

949.Review: Aroma is fruity, grassy, and sweet. Agave in the middle of the bouquet. Flavor is agave, citrus, brown sugar, and mineral. Well balanced and full bodied.

950.Review: slightly aged in wine barrels and you can definitely tell from the looks of it - nice pink hue. As for the juice itself, amazing! Agave sweetness on the nose, hints of the wine definitely come through, a little brininess. Very refreshing to drink. A little spiciness throughout but finished smooth, hints of the wine come through, lots of agave. It has a nice sweetness as you finish each sip. I have to say that I’m a big fan of this one!

951.Review: I’m not an expert tequila drinker, but it is delicious and has an incredible story. The family connection and influence of traditional tequila practices mixed with french heritage makes a flavor that is very fun - and embraces the spirit of joy and celebration with friends and family. It’s not just excellent in “Aspen ranch water” or topped on a traditional margarita, but as a sipping tequila it’s also exquisite. It’s a beautiful bottle to add to our bar cart, and thankfully more are coming.

952.Review: incredibly clean and smooth. begins w light grape/fruit notes that give way to a clean vegetative/agave finish. well balanced and rounded. great mouthfeel. enjoy the clean taste without the vanilla additives that are found in some. no sense of heat from the alcohol. have moved my single malts to the back of the shelf. three fingers and a couple of cubes. a great expression of tequila. looking forward to what comes next from montagave.

953.Review: Incredible agave. Get berry/dried fruit notes with a super clean finish and incredible texture. Impressed how easy it is to drink at 41%. This is the type of tequila that makes people stop and ask about it as soon as it catches their eye. Beautiful craftsmanship and ready to stock up.

954.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
954.Review: Nose:   Initial round rum note wrapped in light oak and spice. Dried fruit: citron and apricot. Fragrant fruitiness, subdued perfume aromas, and an appealing muted sour note. A touch of vanilla and ginger. Everything here is singing in tune. Flavor:   Cantaloupe, tropical fruits and agave richness. Grilled pineapple basted with melted butter, dark brown sugar and sweet jerk spices.   Some pepper heat and tannins play on the back palate on the finish.

955.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
955.Review: This is, by far, my favorite Ocho Single Barrel release!! Great aroma of dried fruits up front, chocolate and heavy butter aroma. Just awesome!! Complex aroma that keeps evolving, real nutty. Great character thanks to its 92 proof!! Agave taste is present, but well balanced with the cask taste providing oak and maple. Pepperish taste up front, light spice.

956.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
956.Review: Surprise surprise, another gem from the Ocho lineup. This tequila is really sweet but not in the gross way that additives make it sweet, it’s all from that amazing rum! This is just begging to made into an old fashioned!

957.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
957.Review: Rum cask , Darker in colour Flavours of orange

958.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados

959.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados

960.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
960.Review: Sweet honey rum sort of smell very pleasant like a good cologne, can definitely taste the rum cask making for a pretty smooth flavour and finish, a very sweet tequila for sure!

961.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
961.Review: Beautiful nose, I like that the higher ABV helps push the complexity of the barreling to the fore front. Loads of spicy rum tones and dried fruit.On the palette the blend of the barrel sweetness and agave is nicely integrated, spice and heat create a nice balance with a little bit of salinity deep on the finish.

962.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados

963.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
963.Review: White pepper, Cuban tobacco, agave, mint. Long finish. Nice warm sweet finish.

964.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
964.Review: Tasted the Barbados and Jamaica Plantation barrel series side by side. The Barbados is incredible! One of the best tequilas I've had a d definitely one of my favorites. Flavors jumping out of the glass.I was less fond of the Jamaican barrel finished expression, although I'm not typically fond of funky Jamaican rum either. As all things Ocho puts out, it's a top quality product so I probably would drink it again but wouldn't choose it from a lineup or pay for it if something else was available.

965.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
965.Review: sweet, delicious agave juice. rum on the nose, brown sugar finish. will definitely drink again

966.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
966.Review: Light nose, kind of bananay.Agave taste with banana as well.

967.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
967.Review: Sweeter than most anejo. 700 ml bottle not 750. 2017.

968.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
968.Review: Agave is still very noticeable here for an Añejo; interesting aspects to this include maple, caramel & tropical notes, and a wonderful body coupled with a smooth finish. Naturally sweet due to the rum finish.A seriously amazing tequila... if you can find it, buy it.  Probably my favorite Añejo; just wish there was more of it available.

969.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados

970.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
970.Review: A little too strong for me :(

971.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
971.Review: Stronger finish than non cask aged Notes of caramel, vanilla and spiceSugar cane and run flavours come through from the cask

972.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo - Cask Finish - Plantation Barbados
972.Review: Caramel, sweet plantain aroma. Gold amber rum flavour. Lingering finish.

973.Review: NOM 1459|Beautiful bottle with a very well executed extra añejo. It has some bite to it and some pepper notes, in my opinion always welcome given they didn’t try to hide them with additives. Great sipper and a looker for sure.

974.Review: Great price for either a liter or 750ml. And pretty solid XA in a cool bottle which is uncommon.

975.Review: NOM 1173|Awesome hand painted / beautiful bottle. This XA is full bodied, a lot of wood and caramel flavors. Scored high for the value/price, you can’t beat it

976.Review: NOM 1173|Pretty neutral on the nose, nothing pulling me in and getting the blood flowing. Semi sweet, wet wood and almonds, short finish that fades into my short memory.*NOM 1173

977.Review: NOM 1173|Dark amber appearance. Nose:   Butterscotch and vanilla. Ripe dark berries,  jammy fruit aromas, and citrus. A cider note, sharp earthiness and undercurrents of oak and cedar. Flavor:   Round butterscotch flavors with some nuttiness. Moderate pepper heat, citrus and orange peel. I expected a more opulent mouth feel. Finish:   In the  finish, the “moderate” pepper heat and barrel spices build to a crescendo. As the decrescendo transitions in, there is pleasing butterscotch and anise, with hints of cedar shavings.

978.Review: Very oaky, good value for XA, bottle is amazing.

979.Review: NOM 1137|This XA from 1137 has the distinct Cofradia profile but nothing that really differentiates it from other product from the distillery. Good but not great.

983.Review: NOM 1459|Le nez n’est pas très agréable pour moi. Ça sent le sotol. Presque le vomis… Mais en bouche c’est délicieux. C’est soyeux et tout le monde l’adore.

984.Review: love the bottles. gorgeous! grand mayan used to be one of my favorite tequilas 8-10 yrs ago. it is a bit sweet for me now. my rating is based on old notes. very sweet. one small glass with dessert.not sure if there are additives.

985.Review: NOM 1459|One of my favourite tequila’s!!  A little sweetness followed by a little black pepper kicker. An amazing tequila to sip on.

986.Review: NOM 1459|Grand Mayan XA is one of the best values out there. Currently priced at $95 at total wine this XA exhibits everything I love about tequilas. Vanilla and subtle oak and cinnamon on the nose, very pleasant and refined. A little sweeter note but has pepper and subtle bite so you don’t forget you are drinking a tequila! Extremely well made sipper!I tasted it a while ago first and remembered it differently than it is now. I remembered it as darker and more barrel first taste and smell, now, I think they might’ve changed the recipe recently.

987.Review: My first bottle was definitely tainted. Perhaps by the clay bottle or a bad cork? The second bottle of this was very pleasant, with sweet vanilla and oak notes, although there is something about the nose I find off putting.  A decent bottle to introduce noobs to sipping tequila.

990.Review: NOM 1459|$160Wicked aroma:whiskey if thinking/tequila if thinking

992.Review: Nose- loads of oak up front, vanilla, little dried fruitTaste- oak, cinnamon, butterscotch, vanilla, little nuttiness, white pepper Short finish

993.Review: NOM 1459|Genuinely this is very good and flavourful, I try to stay away from additives but I’ll give this an exception

994.Review: vanilla,  oaky, white pepper,  caramel,  alcohol  in aroma ultra smooth, sweet agave, vanilla, with a mild caramel, semi sweet chocolate finish empty glass aroma, all spice with a touch of cinnamon and vanilla

995.Review: Caramel notes on the aroma that are present but still mild for an Extra Anejo. Super smooth flavor that’s bold yet sweet. Sippable with a good finish but it’s a little chemically. Overall great Tequila but the finish doesn’t quite drive it home.

996.Review: For the money it’s not worth it.. at least for my palette.

998.Review: NOM 1459|Woodsy and spice on the nose. Great structure, complexity and cooked agave on the palate. Finishes long and rounded.

999.Review: NOM 1173|Very smooth. No burn after. Would reccomend if you have the money.

1000.Review: NOM 1459|Visual: Looks like apple cider vinegar. Not very bright or clear. It does leave nice long legs and tears on the glass.Nose: not very complex nose. Heavy oak presence and alcohol. Almost tastes like I’m drinking whiskey. Some earth, vanilla, prunes, coffee, and vinegar.Taste: Oak dominates, some cinnamon, whiskey,and vinegar.Finish: the finish is nice and long, but withou great flavors. Im getting a mix tangerine and coffee.This tequila was gifted to me, but there is no way I would pay the retail price for this. Its not bad, but It doesn’t taste like tequila to me.

1001.Review: NOM 1173|Sweet.  Not as complex as Tears of Llarona, not as distinct vanilla as Cava de Oro or as almond as Dos Artes.  Definitely a sipper, but trails other 3 slightly.  Beautiful centerpiece & great for those trying extra Añejo for first time.

1002.Review: The aromatic notes of cognac, sweet agave, oak, and a hint of lemon zest or flora note.  My nose is not as adept as others. So you may pick up other notes that I do not. The first touch on the tongue is sweet agave, almost of a liqueur. At mid point it fully blooms as a extra Anejo, complex, deep agave. Hint if cinnamon, all spice and strong oak. Finish with an oaky, smoke and a bit of chocolate. Very oily with no to very little bite. A fine tequila for the money. I would take this over Don Julio 1942. Which was my benchmark for years.

1003.Review: Jack bought for Mom.  Very slight smoky flavor.  Not overly complex to my palate.  But nice

1004.Review: NOM 1173|Very overpriced tequila Alcohol flavor but not smooth For $100+ not a good price

1005.Review: NOM 1173|I’ve had way better for the price

1006.Review: Sweet taste, doesn't lingerSmooth taste, sweet.Tastes like it's not just agave for sweetener.Round flavors.

1007.Review: NOM 1459|Short and round on pallet, hits low

1008.Review: NOM 1459|Aroma - sweet agave, caramel, barrel spicesFlavor - cinnamon, caramel, oakFinish - very smooth, lingering barrel spices and caramelI suspect some additives but still a delicious EA

1009.Review: Light agave Creamy CaramelVanilla/oak Banana Light citrus notePepper++boozeMed to low acidHigh toast on barrel Slight malo???Shorter finish

1010.Review: Walnut banana bread Cigarette ashy after taste ( in a good way ) Lingering finish

1011.Review: Lots of maple, honey, caramel and mineral notes on the nose Low oakiness and lots of caramel and honey notes, similar to a 1942 with smoother mouthfeel

1012.Review: Aroma: Alcohol forward, Scotch, caramel burnt, Taste: medium body, faint smoked wood, prunes, not too sweet, medium astringency. Finish: little lingering,

1013.Review: sweet notes of butter and cooked agave with aroma of clove and pepper corntaste burbon barrels cigar ashesorange

1014.Review: Opens with a nose of butterscotch and toasted oak.   Hints of vanilla and chocolate with a soft finish.

1015.Review: Really tasty, though rather sweet, extra anjeo. Nice flavors of oak in the background that don’t overpower the tequila flavor. I contacted the Distillery and they informed me that it’s additive free. I would still like to see them participate in the certified additive free program

1016.Review: NOM 1459|Nose is pretty thin, at first glance the liquid seems very viscous.On the palette very light and then lots of barrel. Not heavily grounded in agave but an interesting spirit.I do enjoy the dry finish paired with the light body.

1017.Review: NOM 1459|Light on the nose. Lots of oak on the palate with vanilla and cooked agave. Nice smooth finish.

1018.Review: Notes of oak, caramel, chocolate, and smoke.

1019.Review: NOM 1173|Wonderful, warm and inviting aromas, caramel, toffee, vanilla, roasted nuts, coconut, toasted marshmallow. Rich and creamy texture with good weight in the mid-palate. Elegantly smooth and long clean finish.

1020.Review: NOM 1173|Nice vanilla taste with a great finish. Great for shots!

1024.Review: I put this right up there with the best tequilas available. Smooth, with a slightly Smokey finish, hint of almond. But with that, comes a price. Costco has been the best place that I’ve found to purchase this tequila at a bargain.

1025.Review: NOM 1173|Vanilla, some pecan, great finish and smoothness. No harshness

1026.Review: Very smooth, no bite. Decently priced.

1027.Review: Poured and let it breathe for 20-30 minutes. Enjoyed this very much!

1028.Review: Had less sweetness than I’d like in an extra añejo, and more forward with the agave. I can see where people might like this kind of vegetal profile, but I prefer more barrel.

1029.Review: Somewhat whiskey like as you might expect but a good mixture of flavors.  Smooth & reasonably enjoyable.

1030.Review: NOM 1173|This XA is an excellent value in the 1.75 liter bottle. $100 @costco for essentially 2 bottles of XA tequila. The aroma is good with sweet flavors of vanilla and oak and some cooked agave. The flavor is ok and still has some agave flavor. It is sweet but not too much. The finish is the best part...really smooth but still tequila.  A little bite (in a good way) going down.

1032.Review: NOM 1173|I'm always trying new tequilas and Grand Mayan had a cool bottle so I bought it as a gift. But when my friend and I tried it, we were blown away with how good it is. I think this is now my all time favorite tequila regardless of price.

1033.Review: NOM 1173. Brilliant XA with notes of chocolate, citrus, pepper, agave, and caramel.

1034.Review: wow! I tried this blind and it is a keeper. really strong caramel nose but sips without sweetness. tastes of vanilla and chocolate with a smooth if underwhelming finish.

1035.Review: NOM 1173|smell. agave oaky vanilla taste.bitter peppercelery salty hot pecan finish.nice bite refreshing the grassy field before ocean air

1036.Review: NOM 1173|Spicy on the nose. Pepper and warm on the tongue. Little woody for my palette. And it let me know it was there on the finish.

1037.Review: NOM 1173|I liked this,however, I found it to be a bit too one dimensional.Overall a smooth dinner but slightly thin in body and has some caramel and nuts but left me want a bit more in the glass.

1038.Review: Nasty bite in the finish leaves me unable to recommend.

1039.Review: NOM 1173|while tequila purists may scoff at the lack of agave flavor, this is THE tequila to introduce neophyte tequila taster. nose is slightly lacking, however it makes up for it in the finish. pure velvet.

1040.Review: NOM 1173|Smooth but not especially complex for a tequila this old.

1042.Review: NOM 1173|$120, very good tequila, a little expensive. Flavors are explosive great finish.

1043.Review: Very complex with a long finish that seems to pick up steam after you think it's over.  Not sure I love the taste per se but the complexity will bring me back

1044.Review: NOM 1173|It's nice and smooth, but there are other extras and even anejos I prefer. 10/16/16 - Updated after enjoying a few more pours. Earthy and smooth, hints of caramel and butterscotch on the back of the tongue. Has a rich and inviting nose.

1045.Review: NOM 1173|Good aroma, some pepper to it and not sweet. Still like this but my flavor profile has changed some or this bottle is a little different from the previous - so down from 91 to 89. Price paid for 750ml was $64.99 + $5.70 shipping NOM 1173

1047.Review: Great flavor and value as far as an ultra anejo goes and the bottle is a work of art. Makes a nice vase afterword. I want more of this one, top favorite at the moment.

1048.Review: NOM 1137|light on agave, big on flavor. may not be for the tequila purists, but for rookies, this one will have them coming back for more

1049.Review: NOM 1137|NOM 1137. Lots of woody notes with a hint of dark chocolate and agave. Nice rich dark color to it and it tastes like the aroma. A nice sweet flavor of chocolate/Carmel /pepper/woody and hint of spice. Nice long finish with little to no burn. This a must have for a tequila drinker.

1054.Review: I love this tequila next to 1942 it's awesome go to go under $100!

1055.Review: nice aroma a pleasent sweetness builds as it warms not over powering that you forget it is tequila .. very nice sipper . worth trying and a very nice bottle to add to any collection.

1056.Review: Quixote review only.  Love the caramel in the taste. The aftertaste is long and complex. I liked the first sip a lot but the more I have the more the aftertaste feels too overpowering.

1060.Review: NOM 1137|Smooth as you would expect from an anejo like this.

1061.Review: Tasted at Just Tacos restaurant and bar in Oahu, Hawaii in a wine glass.  Dark color with nose of Cognac.  Long slow tears.  Smooth, almost whiskey like in taste, not agave.  Slightly smokey with no burn.  Nice sipper!  A

1062.Review: Blind tasted. This one has a medicinal funky smell and taste. It's like if it were from a plastic bottle that imparted its taste to it. This is the only sample I really didn't care for, let alone its hefty price! But all considering I suspect the sample might have gotten somehow spoiled.

1064.Review: Woody on the finish, but the oak flavor doesn't come through as much in the flavor.  I have a hard time rating the value, as $290 just seems awfully high.

1065.Review: Nice big fruit, vanilla and agave sweetness on the nose. This carries over to the  flavor with a nice combo of alcohol and barrel. Nice peppery finish with a balanced amount of sweetness and alcohol warmth. Nice tequila.

1066.Review: It's nearly a liquor. Thick and peppery, also spicy. This is terrible, but if it wasn't $300, this would make SUCH a great cocktail mixer. It needs a dark maraschino cherry.

1067.Review: Wonderful aromas and flavors of wood, stone fruits, nuts, clove and a hint of vanilla.  A rich viscosity that lead to a warm and lengthy finish. Thoroughly enjoyable, but the price is a deal breaker

1068.Review: Rated blind. Deep amber color. Very slow thin legs. Nose of lightly toasted virgin oak. Smooth entry, thick and buttery, giving way to toasty oak and dark chocolate flavors. Excellent finish.This is amazing all the way around and I would certainly drink it again, but not too often at this price. I would recommend it to anyone interested in paying top dollar for aged tequila. However, given the choice between one bottle of this or almost four bottles of Fortaleza Añejo, I would have to give my money to the latter.

1069.Review: Dark amber colorBig spicy noseBaked AgaveCitrusOakSpicy warm finish

1070.Review: From a blind tasting. More depth of flavor than sample 4, which it was compared with. Fewer bourbon notes more of a french oak or cognac vibe.

1071.Review: The aroma is very oaky but is also slightly briny. The flavor continues to be very oaky but also has a slight note of vanilla. The finish is very strong lingers for a while. Too much oak for me but I could see how others would love this XA.

1072.Review: UPDATED 12/24/2018: Incredibly rich and complex aroma filled with fruit (cherry, apple, pear) and oak. Strong tannins present immediately. Flavor doesn’t have the same complexity as the aroma. (This one has the highest ABV of the entire line at 45. Is the higher alcohol content displacing some of the flavor? Not sure but something is missing.) Flavor does has have some noticeable spice and a bit of fruit sweetness. Moderate to short finish.12/24/2018 - 6th Annual Xmas XA tasting

1073.Review: Amazing stuff. Defies physics showing how no age is too old for tequila. Has an amazing peppery agave caramel vanilla fruity citrusy flavor.

1074.Review: 12/31/17- Aroma is upfront with honey, vanilla, maple, agave, smoke and oak.  Have to take a deep inhale to get aromas.  Taste a bit of sweetness and then hit with the white pepper and heat.  Creamy but long finish with the heat on the throat.

1075.Review: it is a tasty spirit. my viewpoint is that a tequila should taste like it is a tequila. through using different barrels to age, the taste is more of a good armenac or cognac...and for the price you could get 3 other good xa's

1078.Review: Aromas of anise, sweet caramel and oak. Similar flavor, but a bit flat (perhaps because it’s 38% and an older bottle). Spicy finish I don’t really enjoy, but otherwise a nice, simple tequila that doesn’t cost much.

1079.Review: I like the aroma of this. It's a slight bit rustic and real, which is a good thing. Caramel and dried grass/hay are present in both the aroma and flavor. I don't get any signs of additives at all. The mouth feel is a little bit thin, but still pleasant. Finish has a tiny bit of spiciness to it that some may consider rough, but I really like it. Once again, signs of a real tequila. This is a Mexico-only product, so if you see it, grab it!

1080.Review: Very good but lacks flavor. Very smooth, great for shots

1081.Review: So wish I could find in America.It is my favorite by far!

1082.Review: Simply delicious. Super smooth, with a lot of flavor. Picked up a bottle at a tequila tour in Cozumel.

1085.Review: Great tequila from 1414, it's getting hard to find so stock up if you find any

1086.Review: A favorite. Tropical fruit & floral nose. Sweet agave with tropical fruit & butter toffee spicy finish!

1089.Review: NOM 1439|has a strong alcohol bite! maybe a good mixer for cocktails but it's not very enjoyable alone.

1090.Review: NOM 1439|Starts Woody and grassy, then the vanilla takes over.

1091.Review: NOM 1439|Exceptional Tequila.  Wonderful aroma and the finish is sooooo smooooth!  Cannot buy in states yet.

1092.Review: Nice natural sweetness and great viscosity with slight oiliness. Nose is roast caramelized agave with a mouth full of same on the first and subsequent sips. Finish fades to some lingering sweetness with subtle alcohol on the tongue. A nice treat. Thanks Remy.

1093.Review: Aroma has big punch of sweet agave, pine,  pineapple, citrus, minerals and a lactic note. Medium body, flavors of pineapple, pepper and green apple and vanilla. Long, balanced, satisfying finish.

1094.Review: A bit soft on entry, this reminds me most of ArteNOM 1079 blanco. Fairly viscous in the mouth this has a grated parmesan cheese element to it as do some early NOM 1079 1921 blanco releases or earlier Fortaleza blancos. Great mouth feel and nice finish. With some fennel and pepper this is a tasty, rare sipper24/06/2018

1096.Review: Bumping up a few points after revisiting.  I've come around to this one.  Agave comes through nicely on the nose.  Barrel influence is very minimal. Slight bitterness on the end.  Nice but my least favorite of the line

1097.Review: Black pepper on the nose and mouth …. Tobacco with some citrus. Lightly aged not overly oaky.  A little heat …. Not too complex but leaves you trying to figure out the aromas and tarting notes … Good balance….Good juice

1098.Review: Whoa! This whole lineup was an unexpected delight! The repo is full of agave, a touch of sweetness, citrus, slight oak, grass, and finishes almost dry. Buy it and try it.

1099.Review: Has a pine-like aroma, with citrus, some tobacco and mint. Flavor has vanilla, cooked agave, some oak. Quick finish, with a hint of barrel spice. Medium mouth feel. Smells and tastes like a natural tequila. Huge points for value, which can make this a regular sipper.

1100.Review: Aromas of anis, citrus, slight green agave and floral notes. Green agave, citrus, light pepper flavor and a punchy anis finish. Not bad but a little perfumy for my palate.

1101.Review: Nose:   Nice fruity agave, cinnamon and ginger snaps, orange peel and minerals. Nose fades a little quickly, but while it hangs around, it is great. Flavor:   Spicy baking spices, black pepper, vanilla and almonds, a touch of anise, with a silky mouth feel. Agave shines through. Medium length finish, but it invites you back for more. 1 liter price is $300 pesos, from Feliciano Vivanco,  home of Gran Dovejo.This is a combined rating of an older Viva Mexico from 2014, and the current “squat” bottle iteration currently available.The older repo rocks. Nice oily anise and agave, with balanced barrel spices.

1102.Review: Tasted older bottling bottle (2002) Soft in the nose,Light fruity aromas not much agave stands out. With buttery, black pepper, with small hint of oak towards the end. 200 pesos MX only2018 bottling 38%alc Had definitely a lot more cooked agave in the nose  and flavor with a hint of ginger,black pepper 550 pesosBoth great deals

1103.Review: Aroma: Very light. It's hard to pick out any distinct notes. It opens up a bit after time and there's subtle notes of vanilla and orange blossom.Flavor: it's very interesting. Once again, it's hard to pick out anything distinctive. There's a little pepper but the one thing that stands out most is the orange again. There might be a hint of almond as well.Finish: The finish is light but not a surprise for 38%. It hangs around for a bit but it's nothing big and bold.

1105.Review: Viva Mexico reposado (40%, imported by Viva Mexico) is not overly complex, and in some ways is very much a traditional repo as it is not overly sweet, but all in all, its a solid tequila, especially for $16!!The nose is much softer than the blanco, and is buttery sweet with hints of banana, pear and black pepper. But it lies to you (LOL!), as this tequila has a kick!! Jalapeño and black pepper with tobacco earth tones and a touch of sweetness before the long citrus peel finish.  This reposado is just as big and machismo as the blanco...maybe even BIGGER!

1106.Review: Blind tasted Viva Mexico against G4, Volans, Flecha Azul, Clase Azul and Mijenta.  Viva Mexico won the Blind Taste!

1107.Review: Enjoyable repo from Viva Mexico, aroma was a little faint  with some agave, little black pepper, and alcohol. Fruity, floral taste for me,  with plenty of agave and black pepper, slight hint of jalapeño. Nice medium oily finish, the flavor hangs out on the to ge for a minute. Nice!

1108.Review: NOM 1414, Viva Mexico Reposado ($43 @ Ferment and Still)A light, enjoyable reposado that is reasonably priced.  Well made. I would drink again, but it's not my favorite reposado.Nose: Delicate.  When letting this sit in the glass, I will get similar notes that Grover picked up: Pine-like with citrus and tobacco. More often, I get a fruit forward nose with cooked agave, cinnamon, mandarin orange, plumb, tobacco, nutmeg, pepper and very like oak. I wish the nose had a larger presence. Taste: Mild butteryness with a slight cinnamon and peppry bite.  The balance, depth and boldness of the other notes are too light for liking: almond, oak, and vanilla.   Enjoyable, not but not sensational. Finish: Much like the blanco, the reposado provides a long finish: Cinnamon wamrth and slightly sweet agave.

1109.Review: The aroma is hard to place. Reminiscent of orange? Good and smooth

1110.Review: Buttery and smooth for this lovely repo

1111.Review: Aroma is good with cooked agave and the richness of the red soil from Los Altos but with a whiff of alcohol. Taste is incredibly smooth with tons of buttery agave and light brown sugar.  Finish is. Ice and long with some welcome heat down the throat. Yum. ¡Viva Mexico!

1112.Review: Like this a lot. Great agave, light caramel, little oak, anise, pepper. Nice oily mouthfeel with a medium finish

1114.Review: Aroma y sabir frutal a un excelente precio.Uni de los mejores reposados que he provadoFrutal Nose and taste at a bargain price. One of the best reposados I have drink

1115.Review: Get lots of herbal notes, Anise and black licorice on nose. On palate get the same subtle spice and sweet cooked agave. A very well balanced Reposado. The finish keeps me wanting more. A daily drinker in my house.

1116.Review: Aroma - agave, pepper, oakFlavor - agave, pepper, vanilla, oakFinish - medium, lingeringanother solid tequila from NOM 1414

1117.Review: Very first time trying this blanco from 1414 and wow, I’m sold! Lots going on here. This is a bright blanco with aroma of what you think a naturally made tequila would taste like but with a punch. Lots of pepper at the front so might not be for everyone but it’s not overwhelming it’s bold but in a good way. Middle is cooked agave. Mouthfeel not that full but that’s fine with me finish just right gets sweet towards the end, maybe tasting graham crackers!Juan Lobo definitely takes some pages out of the Viva Mexico  book!

1118.Review: First time around, not feeling it. The Anejo was very good when I tried it. Every once in awhile I feel that it just may be an off night.. but my first experience was tough.

1122.Review: This Añejo has a nice honey color. You can smell sweet cooked agave, orange peel, brown sugar and barrel notes. I taste the cooked agave right away with some dark citrus notes. You can taste the wood from the aging on the back end right before a nice medium finish. Overall this is a very pleasant Añejo sipper that should be added to any tequila connoisseurs collection. ¡Salud!@AustinTequilaConnoisseurs

1123.Review: Additional aging here adds some barrel sweetness and more obvious pepper and spice on the aroma. Very nice finish of shortish duration.

1124.Review: Tons of agave in this carried by the 55% ABV, some citrus, pepper and a long finish round out this little known high proof Blanco.

1125.Review: Allow this one to open up for a few minutes and you’ll get a super subtle lactic vibe. Some mint in in the aroma too, but not overly complex. Flavor has lots of sweet cooked agave, easy to drink. Oily mouthfeel. This is a good long-term sipper that I will definitely drink again.

1126.Review: Light cinnamon nose, oily mouthfeel and a red hots cinnamon finish. A slight lactic funk that I like.

1127.Review: Nose:   At first pass, the aroma is a bit timid. But given a swirl or two, the nose jumps alive. Clean, flinty minerals. Mint, cinnamon and juicy fruit gum tinged agave. Herbal notes of sage and thyme.  A gentle waft of white and green peppercorns. Flavors:   Sweet creaminess, medium viscosity and a nice pepper/cinnamon punch that builds in intensity. Savory salinity. Herbals follow the nose.  And just a whisper of vanilla and anise peek through. Finish:   This is an easy, solid sipper. I’ve been told by the brand owners that they want to keep Don Rico at an approachable price point.

1128.Review: Very light nose but some bold flavors with agave, pepper, and tart berry. Small tasting, will need to revisit.

1129.Review: N: Cooked agave, celery, slight herbal, aniseT: Anise, cooked agave, sweet peppersF: peppery sweet agave, slight herbal vegetal note

1130.Review: I like the Blanco best! Lots of agave notes and taste. The blending of both highland and lowland agaves gives this juice a complex mouthful with citrus, herbal, anise and peppery flavors. Can sip it all day.

1131.Review: Need to revisit, had a small sample

1132.Review: Cooked agave with hints of citrus, pepper and anise.

1133.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo (Single Barrel) - Los Fresnos 2013
1133.Review: Really enjoyed this Añejo, wood doesn’t overpower the juice. It kept its core elements of cooked agave, baking spices, light fruity notes and finished with that whiskey-feel buttery complexity. A must in anyone’s bar.

1134.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo (Single Barrel) - Los Fresnos 2013
1134.Review: 54.57% / 109.14 proof. Not for the faint of heart! I keep it in the freezer.

1135.Tequila: Ocho Tequila Añejo (Single Barrel) - Los Fresnos 2013
1135.Review: a unique tequila for the collector. like other camerena products it's on the shorter side of oak ageing for an Anejo (12 mo). it really opens up with a little resting in the glass. the barrel strength (110) provides a lot of heat on the finish and agave flavor.

1136.Review: The difference between the squat bottle of Viva Mexico and this Origen, according to Sergio Cruz, is in the cuts and oxigenation. Nose:   Subtle and pleasant. Slightly floral, fruity with some spiciness. A dash of minerals and citrus.Flavor:   Natural sweetness, cinnamon and robust pepper. Light vanilla, light salinity. Medium weight in the mouth. A little heat on the way down. Simple and straightforward. For the price point, this is Big Bang for the Buck as a sipper or mixer.

1137.Review: An oldie from Destilería Cascahuín, 2006 stamp. Some evaporation. Nose:   Starts with a mild nutty/wood note.  Follows up with cloves, vanilla, nutmeg and rich ripe agave. On the herbal vegetal side are celery, fennel and a hint of pine. Flavor:   A fleeting floral undercurrent gives way to buttery toffee, licorice and medium pepper. It seems to bloom in the mouth, giving you the sensation of eating a creamy, rich, decadent dessert. Nice mouth feel. Finish may have suffered a tad from the less than perfect fill level. Nonetheless rewarding. Neck tag says, “Caballo de Hacienda, where we wait patiently 9 years so that we reach the total ripeness.”  Don’t see that these days!

1138.Review: Old school tequila! Still agave forward.

1139.Review: Bottle has a 2007 tax sticker on it.  Aroma is pleasing. Agave, earth, anise aromas. Agave, vanilla, butter flavor. Medium light mouth feel. Well balanced. Super old bottle, not being made anymore. Cork broke while opening, so if you find one of these, be careful!

1140.Review: Another great find while in Las Vegas. Tobacco and green olive brine on the nose. Buttery and peppery at the same time.

1141.Review: Aroma: This one has a very complex aroma. I get a slight hint of agave and grass giving it that earthy tone. I also get olive and apple which gives it a nice salty/sweet balance.Flavor: Very earthy. I get the agave and grass notes right upfront with a hint of clay and a little bite of pepper. I also get that saltiness from the aroma but it's not exactly olive.

1142.Review: First off, the packaging/bottle is cool and unique - the coffin-shaped bottle and skull on the stopper. the agave mohawk on the skull is a bit much though. Aroma of grass, olive, agave and mint. All very subtle. Immediate pepper/fire on tasting but blends to herbaceous, minty taste. Finish is long and lasting.

1143.Review: Clean sweat agave entry. Brine & mild fruit mid palate with pleasant heat at the end.

1145.Review: NOM 1499|Delicious, as a cream liquor, take this baby over Baileys any day

1146.Review: NOM 1499|Fantastic in coffee. Prefer over Irish cream

1147.Review: Like a Tequila cream with a hint of cinnamon and chocolate.  A great desert sipper (like Irish Cream)...

1148.Review: NOM 1535|Coffee on the nose; creamy agave across the tongue, bitterness on the back of the palette; as I am not a coffee drinker, this “after dinner” or “aperitif” is not for me;

1149.Review: It's not really fair to rate this as a tequila, but as a liqueur it's simply awesome! Definitely my all time favourite tequila cream liqueur!Loads of agave, coffee, chocolate, cream and cinnamon - great to add to coffee, but awesome to sip on its  own.

1150.Review: This would be great with coffee.. Hover, I don't drink coffee.

1151.Review: If your person it takes cream in your coffee substitute crema de tequila in your coffee and what a great way to start the morning

1152.Review: Purchased 1st time in Playa del Carmen at Sam's Club.  Great flavored tequila.

1153.Review: Tasted at home, chilled and with two cubes of ice.   I'm a fan of Baileys so this is somewhat similar.  It's hard to judge this like tequila,  however, it is different than Baileys.  I don't think  better, but very good.  It a little thinner and has a slight aftertaste, slightly bitter.  It's very good and I've rated it accordingly, but if I want creame alcohol, think i'll stick to Baileys and if I want tequila, I'll drink tequila... ????

1154.Review: NOM 1420|Spicy on the tongue but never heavy or syrupy in mouthfeel. The french oak aging adds an element of floral notes missing from XA aged in used bourbon barrels. I really like this.

1155.Review: was a treasure to find this in old town san diego

1156.Review: Not a very good tequila at all

1157.Review: Caramel, custard and spice make this añejo a nice treat. Some slight bitter oak notes on the finish don't detract from the overall impressions. This is from an older bottling that I purchased when WA state was still in the liquor business but the synthetic cork is providing a nice seal to the bottle.

1158.Review: I find this juice it was on my todo list at again a mom and pop it’s sum good stuff.  And they had 9 more bottles minus the 2 I bought and the man already said I been having this for a while don’t nobody no how good it is

1159.Review: The nose is very light with some agave and baking spice of cinnamon and clove. In the mouth is where this shines with the barrel spice and roast agave. A tingly finish with some hints of bitterness round out the reposado.

1160.Review: orange blossom, caramel, baked agave, petrol

1161.Review: Mild agave & spice aromas.  Oily mouth feel.  Fantastic agave, caramel & cinnamon flavors.  Super smooth finish.  Excellent value at $35 at Old Town.

1162.Review: Clean smelling Smooth and easy to drink.  Clean finish.  Vanilla flavore

1163.Review: SPOILER ALERTWe are tasting a vintage bottle from the 90s. Our guide to the good tequila life shared that this tequila was the first to be made by a woman for women. This predisposes us to like it. Love it. Adore it. Feel nationalistic pride for it. And, the label's flag is a rainbow, which includes all of us. No snark here, just feeling humbled by those who have gone before us and for inspiring us to be our best every day. We can't believe how good this is. Best tasting day yet!

1164.Review: El Olor: Light fragrance. Not heavy. Mostly vegetal and peppery with a pleasant hint of orange blossom. Probably one of the best parts of this Tequila. El Sabor: Thin and watery with a weak presence. Tastes like it smells with an additional oak note. Not too strong.El Final: The pleasantness of the finish fades quickly and leaves a bitter after note in the throat and back of the tongue. Overall not a great Tequila. Not bad and it has tons of potential. But for the price range I buy Tequila at, there is better for less.

1165.Review: Light smell, light taste and light finish.  Not bad but not flavorfull or distinctive enough to be a favorite

1166.Review: Natural cork. Cheap bottle. Burn on finish. Very dark color for a repo.

1167.Review: Good for newbie women, very mild

1168.Review: A sample provided by a friend. Not a big fan.

1169.Review: Big agave on this which I love. I catch some pepper and a hint of olive at the end. A bit hot on the finish but I like it!!

1170.Review: It's ok and great for $28.99, but overall it is yeasty with an  vanilla cream taste ah alcohol on the nose and in the mouth. You're better off upgrading for a few dollars more.

1171.Review: Solid tequila. I was skeptical, but its a very well-balanced juice. Very agave forward on the nose. It has that earthy smell and feel of a valley tequila, but it finishes with the minerality reminiscent of a highlands pina. When you smell it, it screams tequila valley/town. And they do source their agaves in los altos and distill in el valle. Its a very solid tequila. I enjoyed the aromas and first impression better than the finish.

1172.Review: Yep, same style as other contract brands that are popping up like moles and it’s fucking delicious! Agave is around every corner, it’s a tad boozy but that just compels me to add lime and triple sec. great find!

1173.Review: Not bad but put off by the finish.

1176.Review: Pretty much what I (personally) want from a Blanco: supremely prominent agave, honeyed, clean, understated; only the mildest vegetal undertones. Short and sweet finish.

1177.Review: More burn than I expected on the nose; citrus and asparagus. Agave notes are more subtle on the tongue.Pleasant mouth feel, smooth, surprising peppery finish.

1178.Review: Nose is nice and light, very subdued classic blanco aromas. Very light on agave through the palette but it’s a nice approachable blanco. Finish shows more toasted agave notes.

1180.Review: Rated the Reposado, not the Blanco.

1181.Review: aroma is agave with some citrus.  Initial taste is agave heavy with some mineral, but the finish ruins it for me.

1182.Review: Cooked agave and citrus. Pleasant flavour, barely any aroma.

1183.Review: Very smooth tequila with a ton of flavour on the tongue. Love the minimalist packaging! Great price, would definitely buy again!

1184.Review: Lush creamy nose, lots of agave. Thick and rich. Earthy, spicy, terrifically deep finish. This is a top-drawer Blanco. Five stars.

1185.Review: Tip of the nose has lots of ripe tropical fruit. Lovely soft entry, full of flavour. Sweet agave, wet stone, vegetal. Thick mouthfeel, no bitterness. The softness gives way to a fantastic black pepper spice finish.Very mature, well balanced Blanco. Really fantastic sipper. Up there with 7L, Fortaleza, Tapatio, Suerte etc.

1186.Review: 5 yr high proof xa, nutty, barrel notes, sweet Carmel and vanilla, hazel nut, finish ended quickly. Price point is obviously high so the value score lowers a little.

1187.Review: Full of oak and barrel spices … cooked agave and vanilla on the nose … black pepper on the mouth probably due to it being 100 proof.

1188.Review: Butterscotch and caramel, with agave and slight mint note. Body comes in hot, even considering the abv, fades quickly. Immediate hit of pepper, oak and tannins. Dances on the back of the tongue nicely. Overall a little short and hot.

1190.Review: Aroma: Love this aroma. It's very complex. Orange blossom, cinnamon, oak, and a bit of vanilla. Flavor: Strong upfront. I get a little oak, banana and vanilla. Slightly bitter on the finish. Not overpoweringly oaky which I like. Definitely solid. Just wish the finish wasn't quite as bitter as it is.*Blind Tasting*

1191.Review: Very aromatic, herbal nose, cummins, caraway seeds backed by agave sweetness. Taste starts with sweet agave, herbal notes carries thru, red fruits mingling with spices/fennel, fat-er mouthfeel. Long memorable finish.

1192.Review: Not a smooth as I expected for a 5 year

1193.Review: Love the 50% abv. After all with cask matured distillate, it’s the ethanol that delivers the aroma and flavors. And Dulce Vida delivers! So much going on here. Baked agave, caramel, baking spices, stewed fruits, brine, some minerals, vanilla for sure, flowers, pencil lead...you get the point. 91 all day long.

1194.Review: A whisky and wine lovers tequila.  a beautiful nose that has red berry notes floating in with tequila and oak, grilled red peppers.On the palate wine comes to the fore and then tequila notes, sawdust and finishes with soft drying tannins.

1196.Review: Wonderful aroma. A little harsh throughout the taste beginning to end.

1197.Review: So much burn... the strength of the proof is the first thing that hits you — and it’s a doozy. Once you get over that, the flavors are actually amazing, and you can really get that cooked agave, and oak. Finish lingers because of the proof but for the right crowd (high proof scotch drinkers) this could be fun to put in a flight

1198.Review: Beautiful color to it and looks very delicious Nose has floral,oak,cinnamon, vanilla and alcohol.Lots of oak,cinnamon followed buy alcohol taste with a nice heavy body. Shorter finish then I thought it would have with the higher proof but you can still tell it’s 100proof. I found it for $90 and at that price it was well worth adding a bottle to the collection.

1199.Review: Very strong alcohol rush, good flavor though

1200.Review: Great stuff with notes of cooked agave, maple syrup, raisins, pineapples, sultanas, dark chocolate, honey, caramel, bananas, vanilla, peaches, apricots, almonds, cinnamon, chili, and coffee.

1201.Review: Sweet floral nose, hint of cinnamon.  Body is light and airy, notes of cinnamon, vanilla, and pepper.  Finish floats away like a mist.

1202.Review: Lote 001 reposado. Oak and agave spice in abundance. Thanks Kelly Cash

1203.Review: Not bad. Decent aroma and taste. Finish is harsh with alcohol.

1204.Review: Flavor is mild but very smooth finish.

1205.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1205.Review: Much like smelling salts can "snap you to", this Lote 1 is a punch to the taste buds. Raw agave on the tongue, black pepper, anise, minerals, and heat (in a great way). This would be great if you're willing to mix in a cocktail, hard to justify at the price. This is an amazing tequila

1206.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1206.Review: Lote 02|Lote 2-SNose:    A big assault of agave. Minerals, grapefruit rind and a light juniper berry aroma. A handful of Italian herbs and mintiness. Flavor:   Oily, peppery and enticing. Melting brown sugar dusted with cinnamon. Citrus and ripe mango, and of course big bold agave. Coats the tongue with a buttery, long fading finish.

1207.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength

1208.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1208.Review: Lote 02|Long, warm, complex. Lote 2 / Exceptional tequila.

1209.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1209.Review: Lote 01|Beautiful nose and palate. Nice finish.  A well rounded blanco.

1210.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
