1210.Review: My first venture into Wild Common, and what an adventure it is. Good lord, the nose is gorgeous. Agave for days, very noticeable minerality. There’s a light brininess, and a creamy citrus note, very orange peel for me. So fruity, and shockingly little ethanol for the proof. The palate is a real treat. One of those rare high proofs that you can tell is a high proof more because of the intense flavor than the alcohol. So much agave and minerals. Very clear white pepper, citrus, and tropical fruit.I would say that this is a little bit of a splurge bottle at $80+, but I’m still going to give it 5/10 on score because it’s really a step above. I’m not a normally a huge fan of the Cascahuin flavor profile, but this is exquisite. This is the Cascahuin I’ve been looking for. I ended up picking an entire case, because it really is that damn good.Edit: I am revising my review. Bumping this up to 6/10 on value and 30/30 on flavor. This is, to me, the best blanco currently in production. I haven’t had anything that beats it, and I keep going right back to it. When I’m in my blanco phase, this does it. When I’m in a repo/añejo phase, this still is amazing. I take a month off of drinking, and this is what I want to come back to. Honest to God, this is my favorite tequila. I’m sorry Tapatio 110, but you’ve finally been unseated.

1211.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1211.Review: Not as approachable on the nose as the Blanco but damn near perfect on the palette. Balanced flavour and oily, I fucking love this Tequila.

1212.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1212.Review: One of the 3 best blancos I’ve ever had. Absolute agave bomb. Tons of natural sweetness. Incredible balance.

1213.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1213.Review: Nose: cooked agave, citrus, mint, ripe fruit, green plantain, mineral, ginger and star anise Flavor: cooked agave, oily mouth feel, slight bitterness, spice of white pepper, citrus, ripe melon and mangoFinish: is long, peppery and the cooked agave sweetness stays with you

1214.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1214.Review: Wild Common Blanco - Still StrengthClean cooked agave emits from the glass. It’s agave all day. There’s some alcohol presence (100 proof - 50% ABV) along with a clean mix of celery, lemongrass and some wet minerals / brine. There’s an underlying sweet note that dances in the background. The nose is very fresh and clean.The taste of cooked agave fills your mouth and every part of your palate. It’s viscous and creamy. There’s an herbal and peppery presence behind the prominent agave. There are hints of green olives and peppers; bell peppers and poblanos. The proof / ABV is pleasantly apparent. The finish is mostly buttery agave with some peppery alcohol tingle. It’s excellent and it begs you to take sip after sip. Well done Wild Common, we’ll done!

1215.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1215.Review: Fresh spring, minerality and minty in the nose… big punch of agave.. also dry hay… cooked agave with minty with some sweetness

1216.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1216.Review: Tons of agave on the nose, along with, apple, pepper, hay, and some high proof punch. Flavor has loads more agave, bold baking spice, and sweet fruit hiding underneath. This one has all the hallmarks of a great high proof—it’s viscous, makes your mouth tingle, and has a long finish that comes in waves. Excellent HP for blanco lovers!

1217.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1217.Review: This is one of the best blancos I’ve had. I’m a huge fan of the brand and this is another winner in the line up. I get a ton of agave and its got a creamy mouthfeel. Higher proof is there but very refined and not over powering. This is definitely worth purchasing once available. I look forward to seeing how this evolves from Lote to Lote.

1218.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1218.Review: Clean, bold agave flavors dominate this exceptional tequila blanco. Bright citrus, cinnamon, and anise lead the way while the velvety mouthfeel envelopes your palate. Once the mid-palate arrives is just a rush of cooked agave! A true ride that remains long, warm, and complex. This tequila is for agave purists with the highest of standards.

1219.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1219.Review: Lote 1-SNose:   The fragrance of buttered toast covered with dark brown sugar, then lightly sprinkled with cinnamon. A snappy bombardment of carbonic acid-like minerals, a dollop of the signature #1123 funk and the aroma of fully ripened honeydew melon. A mellow undercurrent of green peppercorns, powdered ginger and dill weed. Flavor:   Entrance pops with fiery white pepper; and anise delivers a backup punch. Yet, it’s a silky heat. It is oozing caramelized agave richness. A bevy of spices ping around the palate, piggybacked atop thick buttery viscosity. Subtle fruit and floral components: mango, melon and green banana; honeysuckle and sweet citrus blossoms.  A vibrant multi sensory flavor experience - soon to be the agave lover’s holy grail.

1220.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1220.Review: did somebody say pepper? Remember when I said distilleries all make distinct tasting products? How the hell does cascahuin do it?! We his couldn’t be more different from their main line but still delicious. No burn, all the pepper. Wow. Still have a bottle of gran legado blanco. I’m feeling an 1123 tasting coming up.

1221.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1221.Review: Lote 01|Wow! One of the best high proofs I have ever tasted!That’s it, not more needs to be said. Well done.

1222.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1222.Review: Lote 1. Complex aromas begin with alcohol ( due to high proof), agave, spices, light floral, minerals, and a dark sweetness I can't identify but seem familiar to me. mouth feel medium viscosity even for a high proof. Flavors include agave, minerals, black pepper, alcohol,  and heat on the back end.  I added a few drops of water and WOW. The flavors extrapolated with buttery agave, a darker mineral, floral, black pepper and carmel sweetness. if you like still strength blancos, get yourself a bottle.

1223.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1223.Review: Great high proof Blanco!  Taste/aroma of agave, minerals, mint, citrus with light pepper.  Nice warm finish, you wouldn't know it's 100 proof!

1224.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1224.Review: LOTE 270 bottled on 050822.Nose: concentrated sweet cooked agave! Resinous, light herbal, a touch of citrus, a touch of black pepper, minty & mineral. Floral aromas.Palate: concentrated sweet cooked agave, good sweet & sour (bitter) balance, minty, thick mouthfeel, through nostrils I can sense raw agave.Finish is long, the good sweet & sour (bitter) balance prolongs the finish, and the sweet cooked agave and floral aromas persist!

1225.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1225.Review: WOW! Beautiful. Lost points on value.. I couldn’t go higher than a 6 on value.

1226.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1226.Review: And after another glass from this bottle, which was cracked a few weeks ago… bumping this to a 90. Excellent high proof blanco, one of several.

1227.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1227.Review: First high proof I’ve had, I absolutely loved it.  Aroma is amazing, slight alcohol, strong cooked agave with a citrus fruitiness.  You get a nice peppery mineral bite on the pállate followed by a nice creamy enjoyable sweet funky finish.  Really good sipping blanco and outstanding mixer that doesn’t comprise its agave flavor.

1228.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1228.Review: Lote 270, bottled 050822; Big fan of 1123 & Cascahuin; been purchasing Wild Common from SipTequila from the start, just forgot to review the HP. Agave, mineral on the nose; warm vanilla, slight pepper across the front; slight alcohol burn on the backend with vanilla, banana (possibly?) & agave; another excellent offering, just wish the price point was slightly less.

1229.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1229.Review: amazing high proof blanco. sweet roasted agave cinnamon baking spices anise sweet fruit. long complex creamy buttery finish. one of my top 3 blancos. everything they do is the best.

1230.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1230.Review: Enjoy high proofs a little more than lower abv's because they generally impart deeper richer flavors and this is no exception. This is fruity and peppery with lots of agave. Really good.

1231.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1231.Review: Jesus, Mary, and Joseph… Aromas of sweet agave, pear, citrus with pure agave flavors with a sweet finish. Edit: 11/22/22As I’ve been drinking it I’ve been getting lots of ripe celery notes midway through the finish.

1232.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1232.Review: Bright, fresh, and vibrant nosePalate is agave and mineral forward, little saline… medium-thick oily mouth feelComplex and lingering finish. There is a slight anise note on the finish but it’s not an overly astringent one, leaves a pleasant after taste.Delicious!

1233.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1233.Review: Signature NOM 1123 nose. A quick whiff is enough to know that it's going to be excellent juice. The nose is crisp, mineral and a tiny bit lactic - you get some heat from the alcohol, but it's not overpowering. Once you take the first sip though... an explosion of flavors. Cooked agave, fruitiness, vegetal notes, and a long finish. Medium mouthfeel with character that leaves you wanting another sip.

1234.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1234.Review: tasted at LATF 9/22Need to revisit and add notes

1235.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1235.Review: This brand NEVER disappoints me! Love this- they just know what to do- from start(nose) to finish -it’s pretty darn close to perfection for me- Still strengths can be tougher to sip- for my palate anyway- this- I had to make myself stop- so much happening- and no sense that it’s packing an alcohol punch - complex-smooth - buttery and citrusy- in the best way- another rating over 90- you guys are consistent!

1236.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1236.Review: Nose is a a little underwhelming but man oh man when this hits the palate it is an agave bomb! Citrus, brine, agave, rich mouth feel followed by a long peppery finish.

1237.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1237.Review: Right to the top of the list of high-proof blancos for me. The aroma is on par with the regular blanco, which is basically perfection. Can’t get over the aroma. Same minerality and sweetness you get from the blanco and Cerro de Luz. The overall flavor profile is similar to the blanco. Get more anise with this one, but just the right amount. Spice and heat because, well, it’s 50% ABV. Wild Common seems to be pumping out the very best of NOM 1123.

1238.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1238.Review: Just wow… this is really good. Nose- tons of agave, minerality, white pepper, hay,  mint.. gives a sense of freshness. Taste- sweet almost bad bananas, cinnamon, littler minerality, white pepperVery very nice

1239.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1239.Review: Aroma, agave...boom! Then lots of minerals, even salt. Flavor, yep, agave is the first to say hello followed by clean minerals, lemongrass, pepper and faint cinnamon. Truly a work of art and of artisans. The whole WC line is just phenomenal even the deep and complex mezcal. Its obvious Bardon knows what he likes, knows what he wants, and produces it as such. Not trying to compare apples to apples but has that nice cinnamon bite and and heat that PM Spirits SS has only the agave shines through stronger in this one. Yow, it's good!Updated, the more it opens up the more vanilla agave not only push through but balance. It's hard to kick Fortaleza SS out of bed but I have to think about me for a change.

1240.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1240.Review: Wild Common Still StrenghLote 270 (05.08.22)Silky, complex, with a wonderful high proof heat - your gonna feel it.  I put this up there next my favorite blancos; Fortaleza Still Strengh and Fuenteseca Cosecha 2018.Nose: Out of the gate, you get hit with clean, beautiful carmelized cooked agave, white pepper, and earthy notes of hay and limestone. A bright, clean nose that has depth, complexity, and balance.  Followed by honeydew melon, tangerine-lime citrus, maybe even the slightest hints of raisins.  Slight notes of green olive saltiness, mint, and lemongrass.  There is a lot to take in and things are constantly changing as this sits in my glass.Taste:  Creamy. Buttery.  A nice sweet and salty dance in the the mouth with a delicious white peppry heat, too.   You really want to chew this to get all it has to offer.  Floral and herbal notes jump out right away, followed by the more fruity notes.  Anise, bell pepper, carroway seeds,  banana-pear  fruits.  Traces of limon and green olives.  Finish: Long lingering heat and sweet agave with a complementary floralness.

1241.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength

1242.Tequila: Wild Common Tequila Blanco Still Strength
1242.Review: Amazing! Smooth, clean, agave flavors that dominate from start to finish. Buttery, sweet nose, with hints of melon and green pepper. This bottle will not last long on my shelf.

1243.Review: On the nose, huge punch of agave. Very vegetal, earthy, and mineral forward. Very herbal and “green”. An interesting floral note.On the palate, the agave is clearly the star of the show. White pepper, very earthy. I’ve heard a lot of people get minty notes and I’m not personally, but there’s something there that I can completely see being considered a mint note. Can’t put my finger on it, but it has that cool and fresh quality. Overall, a delicious tequila. Definitely have some if you can find it. There may be a bottle somewhere. I’ve seen it priced in the $130 range and that is too high for me personally, but at the $90 I found it at, I’m definitely happy with it.

1244.Review: Beautiful in the glass with a really nice clean, not at all syrupy viscosity. The aroma for me is grass and white pepper. Fresh out of the bottle, the first taste was a burst of flavors and heat. By the second sip my palate had adjusted to the higher proof and it was really delicious! I taste the grass but am picking up a sweeter profile with licorice, anise, and maybe even a hint of vanilla. Nice lingering warm finish making me want more!

1245.Review: Clean citrusy zest aromas melded with cooked agave. Sweet and viscous across the palate. Amazing burst of pepper and vegetal flavors on the finish. This is a special tequila.

1246.Review: Very well rounded, love everything in the nose stays around for awhile, flavor is great and the finish punch of floral, earth and fire at the end.

1247.Review: The heavens.  The platinum standard of tequila

1248.Review: Very unique and I think it’s a really good tequila. Looking at the reviews I thought I’d like it a lot more. The nose is nice. I get vegetal, agave and citrus. You definitely feel the heat when it hits your tongue. The more I drank it the more I liked it. Complex. Pepper, agave, vegetal and citrus for me. The finish it a little hot. I would definitely recommend giving it a try. Fun, unique tequila.

1249.Review: Bold and flavorful Aroma: cooked agave, licor anise, mineral, flowers, green bell pepper, mint, melon, vegetal, earth.  Palate: Well water, agave, natural sugar, mint, cloves, gooseberry, butter cream, vegetal, fruity, black pepper. Finish: black pepper and lots of agave, mint, arugula, coffee beans, sugar, butter, fruits.This tequila takes a place above the TOP shelve brands, and next to my three favorite blancos I’ve had up to 4/2021

1250.Review: Big agave nose up front. Vegetal and earthy, with green olives and bell pepper. The entry is not what you'd expect from an over-proof spirit, not as harsh as others in the category. It is oily and palate coating. The finish is long and complex, a mix of bitter/sweet/heat. Fantastic stuff.

1251.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave, herbal, grass, and mint notes hit first, then cinnamon, earth, and some minerality. Like many high proofs, the longer you let this open up the better.Taste : Bright and crisp cooked agave with black pepper, cinnamon, citrus, grass, mint, and mineral notes. There is light spice here and just the right balance of buttery agave sweetness. The texture is thick and oily, and the extra alcohol is barely noticeable considering the higher ABV.Finish : Very long and prolongs all the previous notes with some new emphasis on green olives and butter.Very complex tequila with lots of depth, but every note is distinct and works together in just the right way. This is one of the few times I've had to cut myself off because it's that good. Every tequila fan NEEDS to try this.

1252.Review: I felt this had a lot heat. The alcohol is high obviously. Good mineral and floral notes. Rustic Blanco traits of cooked agave. Citrus notes are over taken by the heat.

1254.Review: A bit pricy, but well crafted tequila is worth it. Best Blanco I’ve had in years. I hope it continues to be made.

1255.Review: The nose is deep and rich. Grassy, earthy, and sweet with loads of agave. I also get notes of banana. Despite the high abv, this is a refined flavor profile. Vegetal with Cooked agave that transitions into a pink peppercorn kick. Lingering heat that dances on the tongue and back of throat, a real treat.

1256.Review: Herb and chocolate on the nose, nothing sharp or overpowering, just warm and inviting. Really rare in my experience for a tequila to taste exactly like it smells but this does just that. Dark chocolate, cherry, marzipan, you get the picture.

1257.Review: Wow, I don’t think i ever had such an interesting, complex, deep blanco. As a huge fan of high-proof blancos, this was amazing to me. The aromas and notes kept on coming. Tons of agave, earthy, herby, citrus on the nose. Despite the high ABV, it wasn’t hot at all. Lots of minerals on the palate. Vegetal, grassy, briny and citrusy. I tasted in both my Riedel and a high-alcohol glass and saw no difference. I believe the price is commensurate with what is inside. Well done, Sophie.

1258.Review: This blanco tequila is special! It’s made from the smaller ripe agaves called “Criollos” and it come in at the higher proof of 98.6 (49.3% ABV). I first detect the smell of fresh agave and citrus peel but then there is a sweet almond finish. I taste a lot of agave, bright citrus, white pepper and some brine. The high ABV accentuates the flavors without ruining the finish. The finish is unlike any other finish I’ve experienced. There is a pleasant tingling thats long and a sweet. The $97 price is high but it’s still worth it for a one of a kind. If you’re an aficionado then you must add this to your collection. Salad!

1259.Review: This is a great blanco tequila in the “traditional” fashion. The aroma is full of vegetal notes - cooked agave, dirt/earth, green pepper and mint. The flavor picks up on the aroma and begins softly with vegetal flavors then evolves to a spicy black pepper and cinnamon. Finally, a bitter almond flavor emerges and carries into a long, lingering finish.This blanco takes a spot among some of the truly great blancos in the tequila universe. The aroma, flavor and finish combine into something special. However, with a price of $85 (from Astor Liquors) this blanco is double the price of other great blancos (Siete Leguas, Suerte, 123). So, it is hard to score the Criollo highly on value.11/03/2018

1260.Review: Aroma: Very unique aroma. I get a lot of mineral notes (clay, wet rocks) and also mint, cinnamon, and flowers. Not something that I've ever experienced before.Flavor: Very smooth for a high proof tequila. I still get a lot of the mineral notes and a lots of mint. There's almost a buttery flavor as well.Finish: Incredibly smooth. I'm surprised it's high proof because there is no burn but finishes really smooth and hangs around.

1261.Review: On the nose I get cooked agave, floral notes, mint, some sweetness, and earthiness. The flavor is full of agave, vegetal, is creamy with a hint of cinnamon. The finish is long with agave and pepper.

1262.Review: Nose:   Initial wave of aromas is almost overwhelming. There are many layers here. First sally brings rosemary, hierbas finas, mineral notes and the aroma of wet river rocks. There’s lots of sweet agave and floral suggestions. Hints of cinnamon, toffee, licorice, mint. A touch of dandelion. Flavors:   Rich luxurious mouth feel, juxtaposing with vibrant notes of pepper, cinnamon and cloves. Super creamy agave sweetness.  Lite nutty hint. Finish:   It blooms and lingers, and blooms and lingers....  I want more in my glass!Edit 9/24/2018This is truly in a class unto itself. Nothing I’ve ever had compares:   It tickles, assaults, surprises and awakens all your senses.

1263.Review: This stuff is absolutely amazing. I get aromas of citrus, a nice light smoke, light mint, fresh sweet agaves, and a naturally sugary and sweet aroma, with the slightest hint of cinnamon and some floral. The taste on this high-proof showed medium to thick oils, a little bit of heat, some anise, minerals, earthy, delicious sweet cooked agave, citrus, green fresh raw and bright, slightly fruity but smooth considering the abv, with a little touch of olive brine.There's a touch of pepper and spice that comes on at the very finish, which is a long amazing ride. I never rate this high. This is special, regardless what the price is, and needs to be tried by everyone who loves quality blanco tequila.....a must!!

1264.Review: Oh my. This is a special treat. Difficult figuring out where to start, so I'll begin at the end and work forward. Let's start with the finish. Killer, long lasting, super pleasant, naturally sweet, and evolving on your palate. For me, I really love a finish that does 2 things: 1) prolongs all of the things you love about the aroma and flavor, and 2) adds something new that the aroma and flavor didn't -- a surprise, if you will. This does exactly that. The finish brings a nice creamy, buttery, clean lingering end to each sip. Try this and you will feel waves of character evolving long after you've swallowed. Flavor: Cooked agave (omg, tons!) black pepper, some vegetal, and mineral notes as well on the palate. A solid example of what tequila can be, should a creator put their heart into it. The beauty here is in the subtleties and the delicate approach it takes. Agave is honored and respected, and allowed to give us its natural gifts.Aroma: This is high proof, so the longer you allow it to open up, the more you get to experience. Don't rush this one because you'll miss a lot. I picked up on cooked agave, earth, and pepper immediately. After some time I detected some cinnamon and mint. Then brine/salt. Then butter. The evolving complexity of the aroma here is impressive. Let it open up and keep checking back to see what other gifts it wants to give you.Bravo, Sophie, for your part in the creation of this masterpiece.

1265.Review: Delicious, creamy and filled with fresh notes of mint, flowers, cream soda snd cinnamon. What a nice surprise in a different variety of blue agave. High proof (49.3%), but you’ll barely notice because it is well balanced.

1266.Review: Made from agave of a certain size, the Criollo Blue Agave stays small at maturity. Roast agave and floral notes along with some alcohol evident in the aroma. In the mouth this almost 50% ABV Blanco just blooms...rosemary, pepper, roast agave and on and on with a finish that lasts a looong time, long time. The open bottle was obtained in the US and is slightly different from the autographed MX release. Excited to see this in wider distribution. Somewhat pricy but bold enough to justify it I think.This really is about Sophie's brilliance as a fermenter and distiller. 10072018

1267.Review: I was fortunate to pick this up at little mark up so it does get value points.Nose: very nice, agave, floral, zestPalate: Wow, the balance of “dark” earthiness, pepper and brightness of citrus rind, mint, floral notes is well done!Finish: I wish it would last days, but it is medium long and just right.What a great sipper, it is fun to drink if that makes sense

1268.Review: Smoke cooked gave sweet fresh mineral buttery feel incredible legs. I forgot is about 50%

1270.Review: This is hands down one of the best blancos I’ve ever had. Complexity and different notes in every sip. Theirs a nice heat that is more like a warm hug than a kick to your esophagus that permeates all the way through to finish. The first sip can maybe be a tad harsh because of the high proof you’ll need to acclimate yourself to it and every sip beyond that is truly special.  I had some nice agave notes right off the bat then evolves into a floral grass kind of note then elements of drupe like fruit notes and pear. Get some white peppery notes and spices again with a comforting heat all the way to finish. Amazing

1271.Review: a superstar of tequila. the legs and aroma alone are indicative of a truly special bottle. it's an absolute agave bomb, layered with mint, grapefruit citrus, pepper, and herbs. goes down extremely smooth but makes you feel warm inside. fantastic expression and craft.

1272.Review: High expectations for this blanco were not high enough!The most amazing aroma I’ve experienced. Very clean with piercing agave, lime, grass, and layer upon layer of complexity. It took me forever to get around to tasting it, the aroma is that intoxicating.A complex and joyful flavor bomb! So clean. And a finish that lingers and toys with your mind.The taste has some sour notes on my palate that dings it a point or two for me. Overall a great blanco that deserves to be sipped and savored.

1273.Review: very unique, hard to place the exact aromas and flavors but it's very complex, especially for a blanco

1274.Review: Super clean aroma.  Sharp agave.  Green olive, fresh pressed olive oil.  Hay.  Lime zest.  Caramel, burnt sugar.  Lavender? Maybe even an iron/red meat note?  Digging just how many layers are here.  Happy just smelling it.  Perfect viscosity.  Sticks, but is not cloying.  No heat whatsoever.   Longest finish I’ve had from a tequila—not just blanco, but all tequila.  Lingers forever.  And makes you think about it days later.  Glass smells hours later as well.  Just a masterpiece of a tequila.  Heck.  Masterpiece of a spirit.  It is not cheap.  But is well valued given the uber high quality of the product.

1275.Review: Aroma is nice…mint…mineral..clean earthy. Long fresh finish.

1277.Review: Wonderful blanco. A complex nose containing sweetness from cooked agave, fresh green vegetables and fruit, minerals with anise and spices (cinnamon, cloves, pepper). Hint of tobacco smokiness also. Mouthfeel is oily and warm without a burn (this is higher proof). Flavor is dominated by sweet cooked agave which is nice. Finish is the best part as it lingers long and sweetness intensifies and some floral notes arise amidst warmth of anise and baking spices.

1278.Review: Nose = agave and citrus Taste = agave, melon, and light minerality Finish = amazing for high proof! Lots of agave and no alcohol burn - yummy!

1280.Review: on the pallet, it's crisper and cleaner than 7 up, amazing finish as well.

1282.Review: This bottle has been on my wish list for quite some time. Purchased from flaviar.com…they finally delivered something worthwhile! Very, VERY floral across the nose; more mint, herbal notes across the tongue, very different from so many others; across the palate, more mint, flowers & light honey; finishes VERY well balanced & is a decent deal at $100, way better than 1942, Primavera & other celebrated brands. UPDATE, it is now $200+!!! What in THE WORLD? Many, MANY bottles that are less than $80 that I’ll support.

1283.Review: To mirror what someone else noted, fruit loop like scent with floral and cucumber essence balanced with agave notes. Flavor is agave, peppery, clean and pure. Finish, for a higher proof is about as perfect as it gets. Enough burn to punch through but never overpowering. Very sweet and unique Criollos.

1285.Review: Aroma is cooked agave, citrus, tint of floral, fruit loops? Palate: Minerality and cooked agave, balanced with melon and citrus. Just a slight sweetness that compliments the white pepper finish. Mouth coating viscosity. Finish lingers on the tongue, enough to make me want another sip. Easy drinking for the proof. Delightful pour.

1286.Review: This really does check all boxes. Agave. A little spice. A little kick. Nothing artificial. Well done.

1287.Review: Aroma - alcohol and agave Flavor - heat immediately and moderate burn throughout; one of the longest finishes that I’ve tasted; sweeter on the back end with baked agave I suppose I expected more out of this blanco; I’ll revisit at later time Update round 2: Aroma - wet grass green agave on the nose maybe some nutmeg and still some alcohol but not as much as first try - adjusted 1 point upwardFlavor - wet grass confirmed; heat and numbness of full mouth; sweet something and immediately changes to wet grass or something vegetal. Long finish as before Still not sold on the hype and price tag - decent HP blanco but not 100 good at least not at this point for me. I’ll revisit later in the week

1288.Review: Brine, green olive and green pepper on the nose. White pepper, grapefruit on the tastebuds. Long finish of white pepper.

1289.Review: I bought this 2 months ago, finally got around to tasting it.  WOW!! this stuff is sensory overload. NOSE: you name it, it's here... agave, pepper, grassy, mint, citrusy grapefruit/orange flesh, earthy vegetal minerality, light smokiness.MOUTH: Muy delicioso, sweet agave! All the notes on the nose are equally represented in the taste. There's an intense initial hit of flavors and peppery alcohol, but it quickly smooths out and has a great mouth feel, and finishes light and smooth. I love all expressions of Tequila, but blancos are my favorite... Calle 23, Criollo is solidly in my top 3.

1290.Review: Absolutely amazing!  My favorite Blanco of all time. Layers of complexity. Incredible nose, smooth, silky, sexy mouth feel. Rolls down your throat. So many flavors and an incredible finish!  There was a lot of love and passion put into this tequila. So sad that once it’s gone, it’s gone.

1291.Review: One of the best blancos I’ve had!Didn’t even noticed it was a high proof, it was so easy to sip. A must have in your bar!I love the complexity of this tequila, and the subtle notes in every context below:Aroma: cooked agave, herbal & sweet citrus, grassy/earthy, white pepper & sweet hintsFlavor: agave, sweet mint, orange/tangerine, orange blossom and a rich mineral end. Texture: medium to rich and oily mouthfeel, such a warm buttery sensation that exemplifies its delicious silky profile. Minimum alcohol presence

1292.Review: Wow- this is complex- floral At times - peppery too- so unique - probably one of my favorite blancos - tongue is tingling as I comment - if you like a ton of levels and changes as you sip- grab this for sure

1294.Review: Go get this. Very nice clean and exciting blonco. Loads of agave (baking spices), citrus, fruit, and lots of pepper on the back end. Very nice

1295.Review: This time around tasting the Criollo expression of Calle 23 changed my thoughts some. its agave forward and balanced throughout. This is a complex expression of a tequila blanco. The viscosity of the high proof (98.6 proof) is nicely apparent it gives it a silky texture. Not over buttery as I first thought, its just right and not to sweet at all. It has many layers some fruity notes and earthiness. I still feel that the Fuenteseca Cosecha 2018 is much better at the same price and other very good tequila blanco hp at a lower price point. I still highly recommend this and the Calle 23 blanco.

1296.Review: Aroma:Cooked agave,Michigan cut grass,peppermint patty,cinnamon stick,lime notes,herbs. Taste: Fresh Agave, Buttercream frosting,sweet/creamy agave .Mouthfeel is oily~thick~heavy...layers of flavors that push your palate to make your mind think about the moment and the beauty of what a women(and helpers) can do with agave and the perfect beautiful land of Mexico as the backdrop...This in my opinion is the Creme de la creme(French) of blanco tequila,pun is intended because Sophia Decobecq is a true master.

1297.Review: A stunning Blanco. The viscosity is amazing! Sophie Decobecq hits the bullseye!

1298.Review: Smell and taste anise up front. Savory. Unlike anything else…unique stuff.

1299.Review: Wow! Sweet, spicy, a little heat but not overwhelming, just incredible. Very smooth unique flavor, almost a bit fruity, definitely a bit peppery - Really enjoyable. Best blanco I have had in a while!

1300.Review: Slightly above average nose, clean and citrusy but nothing mind blowing. The flavor is quite good with sweet but clean agave with more mint than vegetal notes. Finish seems a touch hot. The biggest drawback really is the price point versus G4 108. It’s nice, but for the money, I’d rather have 2 bottles of the G4 108 really. The more I sip the more I like it though, so perhaps I might bump a few points in the future. Definitely takes a hit on the value portion of the scoring.

1301.Review: Quality. Alc string bc proof. But not full of heat or pepper. Kinda citrusy. Good complexity & finish.  Dont totallu love heat

1302.Review: 9/8/22this is my 2nd bottle. I let this sit for over an hour and it is delicious. got more anise on the finish this time. still lovin it.5/20/21 Finally opened the Calle 23 last nt. It was yummy. Hit u in the face with sweet cooked agave. Nose: In addition to the sweet cooked agave, I got some mint, floral, earthy/vegetal scents and a touch of pepper. Taste:  Sweet cooked agave and that special fruity taste (I call it bubblegum flavor like I get with Paradiso), the mint is still there as is the vegetal flavors and the pepper is more prominent in the taste than nose.

1303.Review: A delightful sipper with a diverse profile and a fascinating story. Sophie Decobecq is onto something that is truly unique from any tequila I have ever tasted.On the nose I pick up strong agave with a trace of mint, while it sits more floral on the palate introducing what I would almost equate to a lavender taste, among a bouquet of other flavors.The alcohol content of the high-proof is certainly there but you almost forget because the finish is so smooth. Yet just enough lingers to leave a light tingle on your tongue while you wait for your next sip.

1304.Review: Mostly pepper and vegetal notes with nice cooked agave at mid palate, slightly sour finish. Enjoyable but not my favorite over proof.

1305.Review: I’m sipping this at Quinta Don Jose served by Charlie himself!  Nose is full, sweet agave, followed by mint and light earth with a tad of pineapple appearing.  This is definitely nearly 100 proof.  It finishes well, definitely doesn’t disappear quickly.  Nice thick legs, I will say however I do prefer the oily profile I get from tahona crushed juice but this stuff is very good.  A bit overpriced but very respectable.

1306.Review: Aroma - cooked agave, citrus, celery, pepperTaste-cooked agave, oily, peppery, light smokeFinish - long oily delicious

1307.Review: A very fruity nose and palate. A warm kick on the finish. The alcool is present but fortunately the flavors and aromas are stronger. Worth the value.

1308.Review: Aroma - took some time to get through the alcohol then roast agave and backing spicesFlavor - complex, many spices, almost barrel like (amazing for a Blanco)Finish - lingering, smooth with a late burn

1309.Review: Wonderful aroma, incredibly smooth considering the proof. Love this one!

1310.Review: The Everest of tequilas.  Absolutely delish.  Astounding.  Close your eyes and enjoy the aroma and flavor journey.

1311.Review: This stuff is crazy. It's an agave bomb. -The nose is so big that my GF can smell it several feet away. It's the most agave forward tequila I've had. There is also mint and minerals in the nose. -The palate is more agave, mint, minerals, vegetal, and strong pepper. Not the pepper that hits you hard, but pepper that builds in intensity and stays with you. There is a definite brininess to it as well. -The finish is lightly sweet as the agave fades. The pepper hangs in a bit longer.  The final remnants are the brine and the minerality.  They have packed a sack lunch because they will be staying a while. This is honestly so powerful that I don't think I'd want it every day. This tequila is so profound, it reminds me of a quote from Kill Bill 2. I paraphrase:If you're gonna compare this tequila.. ...you compare it to every other tequila ever made - wasn't made - like this.

1313.Review: What an outstanding product! I honestly recommend everyone to give it a try, it definitely can reconcile people who aren't big fans of tequila in general. IT'S A MUST!

1314.Review: Wow! Absolutely delicious. Rich, sweet agave aroma and flavor. White pepper, green bell pepper. Full, oily mouth feel. Mild, simple finish. Perfect for sipping neat. Do not waste this excellent spirit by mixing it.

1315.Review: This is a unique Blanco... similar to when you wrestle Mascarita. His peppery speed and earthen moves blend unique talent and size for a fantastic match!No12614

1316.Review: Intense peppery taste with a remarkable vanilla cream finish. If pepper is your thing, then this one is a clear and unrestrained expression.

1317.Review: This newcomer to tequila ( 3 mths in) is quickly finding out who the real artisans of tequila are, and this is one amazing high proof blanco.. even the label on the bottle tells the story behind Calle 23 Criollo.. thank you Sophie! Outstanding!

1318.Review: Creamy nose up front. Vegetal palate, a little spicy (more white pepper than black) - interesting savory stuff, for sure. Good, but would I regularly shell out $90 for a bottle to keep it in the rotation? Probably not me personally, but YMMV.

1319.Review: I usually prefer tequilas that have been aged a little but this blanco  has so much flavor that it has become an instant favorite. Sweet earthy aroma and lots of complexity in the flavor. The only downside is the price but well worth it.

1320.Review: I love Sophie and her work so my rating could be biased.. However since others rated this tequila so high my feelings may not cloud this judgement too much. This is an extremely unique tequila that is a must try for anyone serious about tequilas. Most producers I met kind of despise these small "criollo" agaves, yet this tequila contradicts that. An amazing expression I love how long the finish is and how it evolves. To me it is kind of earthy and minty on the nose with agave notes. It has a nice long finish with peppery, minty, agave flavors, than it evolves into jusicy acidic fruity like apple and then in the end it has some vegetable, earthy, drier feel to it. It feels like riding a rollercoaster.

1321.Review: Smokey smell, brick ovenFleeting taste, not fulfillingSmooth finish

1323.Review: Tasted at Don Quinta Jose hotel. Good solid blanco. Aroma taste and finish are good.

1324.Review: This Criollo it's outstanding in everything from its history, its creation and its quality. It takes me to a valley in the mountains surrounded by a forest, just after it rained, those are the smells and flavours it makes you experience this Tequila.Incredible good.It has a mix of minerals and sweetness.Notes of cooked agave all the time, with notes of well water and wet stones. Aromas that I truly love.Flavours of cooked agave, pepper, vegetables minerals and of fresh rain, with sweetness that is not overpowering, just right, and there is also the bitterness of cacao.

1325.Review: Beside the agave it is quite floral with hints of violet and mint and spices like anise, fennel and caraway seeds. It also has a slightly tart/tangy  touch to it.

1326.Review: so good!! agave, vegetal sweet finish. good viscosity. update: found a bottle at a local bar that i’m drawing down before tapping into my personal batch

1327.Review: One of my favorites—not just favorite blanco, but one of my all time favorite tequilas.  Surprisingly sweet.  A tad hot on aroma but opens up really nicely.Honey, cream, cooked agave, vanilla, Thai basil, some pepper, and green apple.Complex, sweet, super enjoyable.

1328.Review: One of the Best Blancos I’ve Ever Drank!!Truly Special , With lots of Flavor and interesting notes and texture... Definitely a go to For me Now !!

1329.Review: This is nothing short of amazing, so much agave present in all areas and a nice high ABV to match. Absolutely love it!! Wish there was more available!! Xo

1330.Review: Dark chocolate, cherries, sweetness tempered by the alcohol and a long, long finish. What an extraordinary spirit this is.

1331.Review: probably my new favorite blanco. never ending sweet agave earth herbs vegetal grass spice pepper some citrus. extremely long finish. a little expensive but you have to pay for the best. only for special occasions

1332.Review: Just wow!, I tried Calle 23 Criollo at home on a flight with a very tough competition, drank side by side with Fortaleza Blanco Still Strength, Gran Dovejo High Proof and G4 Blanco, in my opinion best of the best line up for blancos. Criollo aroma is the best I have ever had in any tequila. On Flavor, it is also pretty amazing but comparing it against Fortaleza SS and G4 is up to your preference and palate, very close, all 4 are really outstanding. On Finish and overall rating my preference is 1) Criollo, 2) Fortaleza SS, 3) G4, 4) GD HP.

1333.Review: Easily the best blanco on the market. Hard to find but pick up if you can. One of the best tequilas I’ve ever had.

1334.Review: Brilliant blanco with a lovely cooked floral sweet agave aromas alongside lime, freshwater combined with minerals, and a little spice.

1335.Review: Wow. Believe the hype on this stuff. On a different level than any blanco I've had before and the finish... Wow! If you are going to drop 80 to 100 on a bottle this one just may be worth that much$

1336.Review: Believe the hype.This Blanco while mild in aroma boasts an incredibly complex and layered group of flavors with the most extended and exciting finish I have personally experienced in a tequila.

1338.Review: I have heard all about this tequila before I did this sampling.  it did not let me down. .lots of cooked agave goodness in this.  It will make.your tastebuds sing!!

1339.Review: Wow this tequila is special one of the best Blanco available. If you have the chance grab a bottle a d try not to drink it too fast.

1340.Review: My first time tasting this was at a bar in Copenhagen Denmark, the Barking Dog. I was tasting some Siembra Valles earlier with Carl Wrangel at his “Shop” Shoppen. We then went to the bar where I was drinking a tequila grapefruit cocktail. Carl then comes by the table and leaves my wife and I a generous pour of a blanco tequila. I approached it not knowing what it is. We sat there and smelled it for a while before even tasting. We got lots of cooked agave with a very herbal and floral aromas. A lot was going on. I also smelled notes of petrichor which made me think of only a couple of old school blancos I love. Then tasting it blind I was blown away. Definitely tons of cooked agave that didn’t go away. Other vegetal notes of mint. The finish on this tequila was very looong. I had to know what I was tasting so I asked Carl. He knew I couldn’t visit Copenhagen without him sharing this most wonderful tequila. I look forward to next week sharing this with my good friend here at home who appreciates the finer things. Other than him I will be hoarding this for myself. 7/14/18

1341.Review: Truly amazing a√±ejo! Warm agave, nutty, fruit, citrus, berries, lots going on here.  Hard to find now.

1342.Review: Definitely worth the USD32 I paid for it in January 2022.Nose is great and a bit better than the palate. Nice oak characteristics that are a bit rare lately. Not a large, or any, grass note presence like in the blanco I had in 2019, but a very unique tequila anyway.

1343.Review: Aroma: mix of agave and caramel , sugar, spices, earth and anise with bourbon. Palate: cooked agave with spices and bourbon flavor. Finish: licores and bourbon that last long. It is complex and a must try if you can still find it.

1344.Review: Not Corrido but what a value. Agave, oak, barrel spice of cinnamon, caramel and some light vanilla. Thanks Mike Bucca.

1345.Review: Edited 2/4/2019Nose:   Bold and crisp agave with mineral notes peeking through. Orange and lime citrus, with some pineapple. Vanilla and caramel to add another dimension. Flavors:   This blossoms with the second and third sips. Barrel spices of clove, cinnamon and cardamom. Butterscotch, hazelnut and pepper playing well with light oak. Agave remains front and center. Finish:   There is some candle wax like notes on the back end.

1346.Review: Nose is pleasant mint like aromaTaste is delicious mint with slight refreshing sweet cucumber and warm pepper spice finish

1347.Review: nice balance of spice sweet agave and citrus. nice light oak flavor

1348.Review: First one I have ever rated. Hard to find specifics yet.

1349.Review: Great Reposado, keeps its pedigree of great Tequila by maintaining an agave presence from start to finish. This profiles like an Ocho product, that is high praise for any brand.

1350.Review: For me, the curbside appeal is better than the bones. Aroma is oak, sweet, cooked agave, a little cheese, baking spices. I absolutely love the smell.After that, it's a really good tequila. Taste is heavily influenced by the French oak. I'm really curious how this would change if the agave were cooked low and slow. I believe the HP autoclave was an unfortunate shortcut. I'll definitely drink more, but believe it fell short of its potential.It loses points on value, as I feel it's a bit overpriced.

1351.Review: ABV 42%. Unique Double Barreling: 2 years in American oak barrels, then 4 more months in French Oak. Nary a Sassenach Scotch barrel, nor any Scotch barrel in the mix!But innovative idea producing an unique profile -  Personal tastes will prevail…Nose:   Fruity. Fresh cherries, dried cherries. Light vanilla and citrus. Aromatic scents of oak. Flinty limestone. A little spritzy pizzazz to the nose. Flavors:   Sweet fruitiness. Bold heat element: course ground black pepper with hints of cinnamon. Rich wood tones with some underlying caramel notes.  Finish:   Lots of wood and lingering heat on the fade, and some harsher wood tones. A big shout out to Doug Price for muling this down to me!

1352.Review: Minerality, cinnamon pitted fruit, like a cherry.  Some melon Caremark and whiskey peatiness

1353.Review: Unique flavors of cooked agave, light caramel, slight heat. Interesting the double barrel aging

1354.Review: Nose: Autoclave agave, earthy oak barrels, floral sweetness. It’s dryTaste: Dry oak and obvious French oak sweetness with an agave backbone. Tangy sweet peppery finish with more oakIt’s slightly overpriced like many celebrity offerings.

1355.Review: Purchased online for USD99. A bit high for a reposado. Maybe a bit high for a specialty reposado, but this aged for 2 years in American oak and then 4 months more in French oak. The collaboration with Sassenach is in name only, to my knowledge, as no Sassenach barrels were used in aging this tequila. Perhaps, one day such a product will exist.Will revisit to add further tasting notes.

1356.Review: Light floral aromas, much bolder flavor. Tasting oak, barrel spice, hay, dandelion… this one is like nothing else.

1357.Review: Not much on the nose unless you take a huge whiff, then you get a bit of tequila. One of the smoothest tequila's I've ever tasted. Little funk of scotch, but not much. Really clean finish

1358.Review: Very different.. lot of scotch coming through… smooth and finished with cooked agave

1359.Review: Nice light aroma, scotch & herbs, some vanilla/oak in there - Scotch flavor right off the bat, into a smooth light agave flavor - smooth finish, holds scotch flavor for a bit

1360.Review: •Very Smooth•Nice sweet Taste Nodes (Caramel, Vanilla)•Peppery Taste

1361.Review: Sweet smokey noseSweet pepper tasteWhiskey finish

1362.Review: Oaky, lots of caramel but not overwhelming, very smooth, good for old fasioned

1363.Review: Lighter. Tastes less like tequila. Kinda whisky

1364.Review: Very drinkable but heavier on the wood than I would expect in a reposado.

1365.Review: Smooth, herb flavour, light on the palate. No spice, but not sweet. “It tastes like a campfire” - Fionna.

1366.Review: the price brought my rating down a tad.

1367.Review: Recommended for Whiskey drinkersaged in French oak and American white oak barrelsAgave and earthy smell but still fairly smooth. a little rougher though if you like sweeter style tequila IMO taste: Whiskey, honey

1368.Review: 4 months in whiskey barrels. collab with scottish guy 16 months american barrels 4 months french

1369.Review: Not a balanced expression compared to other tequileño products. Oak presence overpowers the agave essence. I can see whiskey people loving this

1371.Review: Scotch similarity, sweet aromaBite at finish

1372.Review: Nice smell. Whiskey and scotch strong taste. Quite strong and heavy on the pallet. Harsh after taste.

1373.Review: If tequila was whisky would taste like that Vanilla and aged barrel notes.Strong finish Would go perfect on the rocks

1377.Review: Amazing aroma! Great oaky taste, peaty but not overpowering. Price is just a killer for me tho. At $110 msrp there’s a lot of other options in my opinion.

1378.Review: It has a whiskey-like taste, but it also leads to a feeling of alcohol and is not easy to drink.  But the impression that some people will like it.  I don't feel the need to be tequila.

1379.Review: beautiful nose, very fragrant. scents of oak, spice, peaty scotch, tad smokey, celery notes agave ginger, rosemary, dry sage and ethanol.  on the palate the agave is present... front and center.. alot of black pepper and dry chiles also cinnamon amd alot of dry spices....like sage,laurel, oregano, clove and cumin.getting a ginger type of sensation. dry fruits like cherries and cantaloupe. nice mouth cover with long lasting chest heat.finish was short and sassy.. interesting profile.. totally difrent than other tequilas.. i love when distilleries think outside the box and introduce something different.  paid a Ben at Old Town. not bad for a limited run bottle.

1380.Review: This was suuuuper tasty! Got some nice Scotch barrel flavor from this one, and it smoothed it out so nicely. The only negative is that it was 100 dollars, but for a special limited release it's understandable.

1381.Review: Gibbles Mcgorbbles! This is one sumptuous lump! Delicious. El chocolat. La toca de pistachiano.  El agave.  A feast for the suck.  I wish I could down a bottle right now and get in a folding chair fight.

1382.Review: Super creamy mouth feel. Heavy on the oak but not obnoxiously. A little overpriced but a good bottle for the collection.

1383.Review: El Tequileno Sassenach Reposado is a great take for someone who prefers a rich and woody nuanced reposado. I love what El Tequileno has done here, but it's a tad pricey ($119  @ Sip Tequila).

1384.Review: Nose- agave, cherry, fruit(cantaloupe), minerality, pepperTaste- agave, slight Carmel, little oak, biterness (dark chocolate),cherry,black pepper, little whiskey / pettinesses Mouthfeel doesn’t last long *nose is complex but nose leaves more to be desired

1385.Review: The oak is extremely present in the finish. A sweetness from the agave is the dominant flavor up front. What more could you look for in an unadulterated tequila?

1386.Review: Perfect amount of scotch flavor. Which is light as I’m not a scotch lover. Still has the classic El Tequileno repo flavor

1387.Review: Aromas of light scotch, melted sugar followed by agave, wood and dandelion. Flavor is pure scotch. In first 3 seconds, you would swear it was scotch. Once that dissipates, there's wood, agave, more scotch notes with sweet butterscotch and light caramel. A very interesting and different take without being overwoody or as woody as the process would lead you to believe. A keeper!

1388.Review: sweet nose, lots of agave, oak. Definitely smells lighter than it tastes.  First pour so it’s a bit hot, very spicy throughout, lots of oak, hints of vanilla. The longer it sits, the more the agave starts to come through. Very enjoyable special blend from El Tequileño

1389.Review: The nose is very nice on this one. Agave with a decent amount of barrel presence. This would be a great tequila for a scotch lover. I tried this at the distillery, but didn’t have much time with it. I will have to revisit it at some point.

1390.Review: Some melon in the aroma, which is a nice throwback to how tequila tasted many years ago. Flavor is light caramel, agave, and vanilla. Super easy to drink, and not all that complex.

1391.Review: Tasted at the Latin Food Festival, Santa Monica.

1392.Review: Nice vanilla and light minerals in nose, medium body, sweet agave, butterscotch and pepper in palate, finish with lingering sweetness and spice. Was great value in clearance bin for $20. Not a standout for me to buy at regular price of $45

1393.Review: Clear and smooth. Warm all the way down.

1394.Review: Great Aroma vanilla smooth start and finish very little rasp.

1395.Review: smooth and nutty flavor. not a bad after taste.

1397.Review: This tequila is really hard to sip because it goes down so easily. It's almost too smooth so it leaves me wanting more.

1398.Review: Aromas are subtle - mint, citrus, floral, earth. Heat/spice flavor is upfront the minute this hits your tongue then settles back into a smooth, almost buttery flavor. I also taste something slightly bitter at the end. Not necessarily unpleasant but not necessarily something I seek out either. Finish is all in the mouth and moderately long.Updated 8/15/2015

1399.Review: had in NYC. chilled and sipped. smooth finish. very very good

1400.Review: I get a great valley style agave presence on the nose but has a hint of a medicinal note in the background.  Flavor is excellent with none of medicinal notes in the flavor what so ever.very smooth with an excellent mouth feel.

1402.Review: Full agave upfront balanced floral spice luscious

1403.Review: Nose:   Cinnamons and cloves, musty wood, vanilla cream, ripe dark pitted fruit and some earth. Just a hint of a peach blossom. Flavor:   Spicy: cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, mild allspice and peppercorns. Trace citrus. Followed up with comforting vanilla, almond and trace butterscotch. Rich and viscous.

1404.Review: Surprised as bought it very cheap (23 bucks) but nose and taste aer very solid! Highly recomended.

1405.Review: A true Reposado tequila, all the natural flavors of the traditional cooked agave with the nuances of wild turkey barrels.Awesome body, a sip by sip tequila, perfect with an apple tart with vanilla ice cream.

1406.Review: GREAT AND FULL SILKY BODIED WITH LONG AND PRONOUNCED LEGS. BRILLIANT AMBER AND GOLDEN SUNSHINE SHADES. WHITE OAK WITH TOASTED ALMONDS AND LIGHT TOUCH OF CACAO AND VANILLA HINTS. SILKY, VERY SMOOTH AND BALANCED. SMOOTH SWEET AND LONG COOCKED AGAVEENDLESS AND A SOFT TOUCH OF SPICED AND HERBAL NOTES.

1407.Review: Rated during a Tequila Club presentation. Very gracious and attentive owners in attendance. Lots of spice, some pepper, and for 5 years of barrel aging, significant agave still in the mix.  A touch on the sweet side for my tastes, but by no means cloyingly so. Check out their Añejo expression - it is the pick of the litter, IMO.

1408.Review: An interesting tequila, I did not dig the oak flavor so much, it is very bourbonish. I preferred the añejo from this line.

1409.Review: Unbelievable smooth finish - if you like Extra Anejos, you’ll love this one!!  Hard to find but worth the search!!

1410.Review: Cooked agave on the nose and some dried fruitiness, nail polish aroma comes through somewhere…. Some barrel spice and oak.  Nice little sipper, not to complex.

1411.Review: Nose: caramel, vanilla, cinnamon, butterscotch, oak, and some agave Flavor: oak, cinnamon, orange zest, agave sweetness, and still a watery mouth feel Finish: medium with hint of agave and pepper

1412.Review: Roasted agave, French oak barrel flavor, nuts, pepper, spices, cinnamon, caramel, hay.

1413.Review: love the finish of this tequila no burn and natural sweet. agave, vanilla, pepper in the taste well done

1414.Review: Aroma is sweet fruit with a bit of fresh cut wood. The flavor begins with a nice sweetness followed by a black pepper spice. The sweetness lasts through the spice and becomes a bit much. Almost like a stick of Juicy Fruit gum. The spice lingers for a medium finish.The price point for the repo is more in line and I really want to like this one but that over the top sweetness is just too much.8/30/2015

1415.Review: Heavy handed on the aging but otherwise a nice, balanced oak flavor.

1416.Review: Wow. Really impressed. At first glance i was turned away but after a little air was introduced it came around like a tiger.

1417.Review: I rated this tequila blind, during the 2013 Spirits of Mexico competition.

1418.Review: Light oak on the nose but not much of anything really.  Kinda hot but not overly.  Light oak, light agave, light vanilla.  Basically underwhelming.

1419.Review: Number Juan Reposado! A double oak reposado tequila that I would put up against most Anejo tequilas. This is their Blanco that has been matured in French and American Oak barrel then blended harmoniously together to create this beautiful Tequila! The aroma of fresh agave is definitely present then you get some toast from the barrels. This tequila sings! Great by itself or even better in a cocktail. We did a riff on the Espresso Mexicano! The Number Juan Reposado shined through! Coffee and Repo Tequila are now a thing in our cocktail repertoire! Probably one of the top 5 cocktails I have ever made. It is no secret that the Number Juan Reposado was the right call! A Reposado that stands apart from the crowd! Highly recommend by A Couple of Drinks with The Clarks show!

1420.Review: Number JuanTried this flight in Dec 2019 when I met Alex in Vegas.UPDATE:I'm not sure which lotes I tried 3 yrs ago, but sounds like those batches were better than what some others tasted more recently.______________________The entire line is decent. I liked the repo best. blanco a little hot, anejo a little more

1422.Review: Very good.  Aged in multiple barrels and at first I thought that it wouldn’t be very good.  I was wrong.  It is definitely in my top 5. Reposados.

1423.Review: A vanilla nose with a little agave and even less alcohol.  I enjoyed the watery mouthfeel which had some oaky ageing and cinnamon.  It finished smooth with increased agave and pepper.  Oddly, the finish was a bit more oily and had a medium linger.

1424.Review: First smell was really nice...vanilla etc, then the Real Agave, smoke, pepper for sure.  Was expecting a smoother tequila, but reminds me of really good Mexican Reposados.  Staying true to the cooked agave 1st with smoke, pepper, then the sweet notes of vanilla, oak and baking spices to finish.  Definitely get this again.  The Extra Anejo is damn awesome IMO!

1425.Review: Got this for a steal $35. This is actually very enjoyable. Nice viscous mouth feel. Loads of caramel, oak, agave, little vanilla, little fruit and some grassiness which is interesting mixed with pitted fruit. With a medium to long finish with caramel or butterscotch that stays on the tongue.  Little pepper Definitely enjoyable but a good light everyday sipper. Nothing super complex. But good

1426.Review: This was really enjoyable . A great, authentic reposado . All the right stuff … the cooked agave, some smoke, honey sweetness, faint barrel notes , nice after burn . A  great sipper , as it’s to good to mix . The reason I love reposado, a true essence of a Mexican tequila reposado . Definitely will be trying more of this brand and distillery.

1427.Review: Harsh pepper start followed by a smooth smoky burn as it goes down.Can be rough to sip on the rocks..Probably would be better for me to shoot it next time.. a little pricey for a mixer.

1428.Review: very sweet aroma,  a little burn when drinking , but decent finish .

1429.Review: Lots of barrel influence on the nose and palate. Caramel, vanilla, and stone fruit somewhat overpower the agave. A bit over priced IMO. That said…. It’s a nice little sipper.

1430.Review: Barrel spice/cinnamon on the nose. Lots of oak and baking spices on the palate. Medium heat and finish. Not gonna rush out for another bottle but not bad either. I recall price was just south of 60...

1431.Review: Aroma grassy, herbal, light wood, faint caramel and maple. Agave is in there somewhere. Flavors of creme brule, wood, agave. Actually a good bouquet and balance but wood seems to overpower the agave. Finish is neutral.

1432.Review: Good solid tequila. We used have this as a staple at our bar before price jumped to over $50. Think it’s  about $15 too high

1433.Review: Agave floral aroma with a very light flavor but then the finish is a little spicy but clean. Higher price point so not as much value but worth buying occasionally.

1434.Review: Actually got this bottle for $1 as part of an order I placed at Old Towne Tequila. As you might guess it sat on my shelf a long time before I gave it a try. What a pleasant surprise. I do wish it was available locally. I would drink it more often if it was.

1435.Review: This Reposado had an agave and slight oak smell. The flavor was smooth enough but unremarkable. The finish was thin and short.

1436.Review: I was very apprehensive about buying this tequila, because the track record of celebrity tequilas have not been very good. This one is no different, but the reviews were a mixed bag. I’m not picking up on the sweetness people claimed ruin the tequila. I enjoy a sweet tequila but all I noticed was the peppery heat and alcohol sting. Don’t get me wrong it wasn’t horrible, but it’s not worth the 50$ price tag. If it was priced around 25-30$ I would consider buying it again, doubtful either will happen.

1437.Review: Aroma is heavy scented with sweetness bordering on fake smell. Taste is thin and burns. Finish is ok. Would not recommend.

1438.Review: Great barrel flavor. Wonderful aroma, not much finish. About $15 too expensive for me.

1439.Review: Tried and fingerprinted the Number Juan Reposado on my 1st taste:Glass: very clean Reidel 3 oz tequila stem glassLegs: almost none; rather a very uniform film dropInitial nose: light and fruityInitial taste: crisp, yet light agave. A bit peppery, but nice pleasant fruit... Mostly orange notes to me. Finish: about a 30 second pleasant" back of the mouth" burn. Really enjoyed it!Finis

1440.Review: Aromas of cinnamon spice, oak, vanilla, caramel, and some alcohol. The flavor is mild and lightly sweet, with notes of oak, vanilla, and butterscotch. Vanilla and oak on the finish, with some agave, as well as a lingering heat.A decent reposado overall.

1441.Review: A solid repo, priced right, light barrel notes with light vanilla and cooked agave

1442.Review: Wow this one has a nose on it. Very strong. Palate is nice,Don't love it but a nice sipper.  Lot going on

1443.Review: Agave barrel spice, earthy black pepper, some oak max woodiness rounded out with smell of dried fruit…. Agavae, caramel and black pepper up front mellows after the 2nd sip.

1444.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave, oak, black pepper, and a sweet (but not tart) fruitiness akin to apple or pineapple.Taste : Sweet cooked agave with oak, black pepper, red grapes, vanilla, and butter. Light oils and fair bodied texture.Finish : Medium in length with stronger pepper and vanilla.

1445.Review: This is a quintessential highlands tequila. It has the notes of unripe everything (apple, pear, pineapple, agave and fruit). I think its the nature of the terrior, more than the cooking method or process. But that is only one man’s opinion.I am getting a lot of oakiness from the barrel on the nose, as well as vanilla, honeysuckle and orange blossoms.For the palate, i am tasting cherries, mild cognac, wood, asparagus, pleasant heat, pepper and agave.

1446.Review: berries on the nose belies a charred, woodsy palette and smooth quick finish

1447.Review: Pleasant melon, caramel and vanilla aromas. Cinnamon flavor and finish  and medium viscosity.

1448.Review: Glass: Straw color. After coating the glass, small tears take a while to form before quickly rolling down the glass, leaving a few pearls hanging.Aroma: Let this open up for a couple of minutes to let an initial alcohol aroma to dissipate. Green pineapple, green agave, green apple. I presume these “green” notes are from cooking the agaves in an autoclave. Light oak and pepper.Entry: Buttery and slightly sweet, pepper presents quickly.Flavor: Buttery, sweet and peppery, soft agave notes. The sweetness is like that of a white fruit such as apple or pear, but does not really come with its own flavor. The butter notes are from the virgin American oak rather than baked agave. The pepper quickly consumes the experience.Finish: Big pepper with a little sweetness and agave for moderate length. Moist with some dry tannins.Conclusion: The agave flavors are fairly basic and “green” due to baking the agaves in the autoclave. The barrel notes are pleasant and what you might expect from virgin American oak. This is a worthy profile and welcome addition to the Don Pilar lineup. If you want to try a repo that doesn’t have whiskey/bourbon notes, or the chocolate/coffee notes you would get from virgin French oak, check this out. Priced at $37-40, it’s an excellent value.

1449.Review: Baked agave, oak and caramel. Rich, smooth and well balanced with a finish that lingers.

1452.Review: very soft nose. everything from entry to finish is too soft, which is unfortunate because what's there is quite good.

1453.Review: Nose - Agave and oak spiceTaste - Sweet agave with barrel spice and light tannins. Little bitterness and some great bourbon notes from the barrelFinish - Fades to creamy custard notes from the caramelized agave with the added oak.

1455.Review: Aroma- oak, caramel Taste- oak, agave, butterscotch Finish- Smooth, butterscotch and agave and then an aftertaste of what seems like additives.

1456.Review: Good nose. On my pallet I get candied agave, wood, pepper, earthy with a nice creamy finish. pepper lingers ..for the price, I’m impressed .

1457.Review: Nose is very pungent of agave,baking spices, dried apricots,pepperTaste is similar. Banking spices from the agave, caramel, fruit, earthiness, black pepperLet this one breathe for a little and it really starts to open up.  The caramel/ light vanilla flavor last all the way throughout.

1458.Review: Don Pilar's reposado is a excellent value at $42.  A fruit forward reposado with plenty of cooked agave and a smooth    mouthfeel.Aroma:  A punch of fruit (apple, pear, red grape skins, pineapple) up front.  Cooked agave, vanilla, oak, and black pepper. Inviting, yet mellow. I love the nose.Taste: Light sweetness, mild oilyness, and a black peppery warmth.  A defined oakeyiness, cooked agave, and balck pepper up front.  On the back end i get some faint fruits (black cherries and orange citrus), vanilla, and cinnamon.  Finish: Medium to long. Mildly sweet and warm with a bit of nutmeg spice.

1459.Review: Coconut fresh agave taste. Combined with the reposado aging, carmel, butter, and some spice make for a well rounded tasty sipper.

1460.Review: Aroma - agave, oak, cinnamon, vanillaFlavor - sweet agave, vanilla, oak, cinnamonFinish - smooth with heat on the throat

1461.Review: Fresh and crisp aromas on this 6 month reposado with a hint of light creamy-ness in the palate but yet a good amount of cooked agave.

1462.Review: Nice nose of baked agave, caramel and raisin. Easy going in, soft flavour profile of agave and light barrel notes. A softly spicy, long and warm finish. A very solid repo but a bit too light for my tastes.

1463.Review: NOM 1588|Good citrus notes, light sweetness, slight heat.  Nice mouth feel. Fairly priced. Well made Reposado.

1464.Review: NOM 1588|Nose:   Ripe red fruit notes. Cinnamon and faint vanilla - a warm  roundness to the aroma. Orange zest and a bourbon note. Flavor:  Buttery vanilla and lots of fruit. Some pepper kick. Complementary baking/barrel spices. Some oak.

1465.Review: NOM 1588|Spirited reposado. Very nice sipper with vanilla, butterscotch, cherry and oak aroma. Taste is baking spices, vanilla, butterscotch, caramel and oak. Finish has a great little kick of heat that’s very enjoyable! I will always keep ordering this one in!

1466.Review: NOM 1588|Very good Repo, tried at the L.A Tequila Fest. I was about 10 shots in when I tried it so maybe I need another try. It was very good at the time.

1467.Review: NOM 1577|A cheap one to get drunk as skunk

1469.Review: NOM 1414|Aroma: Much better than the Blanco. It's definitely not as harsh. I get butter, pepper, oak and a slight bit of chocolate. Flavor: Not as complex as the Blanco but still solid. I get some butterscotch on the front and it finishes with a bit of cooked agave and pepper. Finish: Very smooth. This is a great Reposado. The finish hangs around for a while and leaves a lot of flavor.

1470.Review: NOM 1414|NOM 1414Subtle oak aromas of vanilla and pine with the grassy/vegetal aroma of the blanco continuing to predominate. The spice in the flavor is significantly toned down from the blanco. A really nice, smooth sweet and spice interplay in the flavor that is very nice. The finish is pretty short.A really nice repo.06/27/2017 (vertical tasting)

1471.Review: NOM 1414|NOM 1414. NOM 1414. Wood, smoke, agave, caramel and black pepper. Strong pepper finish.

1472.Review: Sweet pipe tobacco aroma with Allmond extract and marzipan flavor really nice finish.

1473.Review: NOM 1414|Not much aroma here.  Am I congested?  Come on Repo - where u at?Citrus?  Not really sure.  Hmmm- buttery and smooth.Playful finish.

1474.Review: NOM 1414|Aroma and taste are good. Typical aromas with light barrel aging: light cinnamon, vanilla maybe a hint of grilled pineapple (like the Blanco) with good agave. Taste is good but very light. Finish is still underwhelming.

1475.Review: Aroma and taste are good. Typical aromas with light barrel aging: light cinnamon, vanilla maybe a hint of grilled pineapple (like the Blanco) with good agave. Taste is good but very light. Finish is still underwhelming.

1476.Review: NOM 1414|Wet cardboard aromaHints of vanillaâ€¦not warming.  Fresh grass cutting finishMild overall

1477.Review: Some cooked agave with pepper and light caramel.  The finish was sweet, almost honey like with some more pepper.  A mild drinker.

1478.Review: Tasty. Cooked agave, carmel and almonds in the aroma. More cooked agave, grassy cinnamon in the taste. Finishes with honey, earthy pepper and a bit of smoke.

1480.Review: randys banana like the Blanco but I like the Blanco better

1482.Review: Ticks all the appropriate boxes but no fireworks for me, doesn’t dive deep into the flavours that I’m liking for. Pretty easy going on the back end, this won’t drive people away from the category.

1483.Review: Fuerte! (Or maybe it was the spicy chicken I was eating with it.)

1485.Review: Aroma like mowed grass or hayTaste different than aroma taste buds opened. Finish like a mouthful of pop rocks. Not harsh but spicy.

1486.Review: Aromas of cooked agave, butter, pepper and vegetal. Taste is sweet, can perceive the nose, oily. Pretty good

1487.Review: Tons of lemon on the nose. High levels of citrus with agave. Faint hints of pepper. Nice body on the palate. A little hot. Nice acidity. Citrus is more pronounced than agave. Nice quality.

1488.Review: Aroma: Baked agave, barrel spices and caramelFlavor: An interesting mix of baked agave, barrel spices, black pepper and caramel.This reposado has a creamy consistency and a lingering finish.

1489.Review: Smooth, balanced and delicious. Lots of agave still present and working well with the caramel and spice from the barrel.

1490.Review: Rated blind after aeration.Color: dark strawGlass: coats the glass, legs hang a long timeAroma: alcohol, baked agave, orange, spice, caramelMouth: thick, slippery, strong alcoholFlavor: agave, caramel, spice, hint of orange zestFinish: mellow spice of med lengthPrice: $50 @ Old Town Liquor/Zee Tequila

1491.Review: Sweetness and fruit (banana?) in the aroma. Sweetness and banana show up in the flavor as well with a spicy finish. Much, much improvement over the blanco.

1493.Review: FYIThis rating is for the 2010 Skinny Neck Repo not the current release

1494.Review: Cinnamon aroma Dry and quenching Smoky

1496.Review: Cooked agave nose Sweet spice Caramel (additive)Syrupy sweet Not round on palate

1497.Review: light mouthfeel, but full flavour. leather, light caramel. mineral finish

1498.Review: Minerals, leathery, richer for a respasado

1499.Review: Instant aroma of caramel Caramel undertone in finish, but harsher finish than I prefer

1500.Review: Bananas foster on the nose with fruit, caramelized sugar and a touch of spice. Light oak finish.

1501.Review: Grittier than many good tequilas. Hazelnut notes.

1502.Review: Good aroma, nice taste and a smooth with a little bite. Only a bit less than the anejo. May be one of the better distilleries- the 357 blend is the only one I'm not so sure about. Cost $49.99 + $5.05 shipping

1503.Review: Flavor is extended if taken with food.

1504.Review: No burn, smoothest tequila I have tasted.

1507.Review: NOM 1431|This drinks like Don Julio Blanco. the nose is clean and mineraly but lacks depth. There is something funky mid tongue - has an orange flavor... not entirely unpleasant but not quite right for a high quality tequila. my guess is that it is due to the autoclave and adding flavoring to make up for fast cooking.update: after finishing the entire glass...i think it drinks like a lower quality Blanco. I would drink Don Julio over Suavecito nearly any day. the funky flavor really detracted from my wanting to keep drinking it

1508.Review: Immediately after pouring, the aroma is vegetal with noticeable agave note. Quickly this evolves to a sweet, fruit (cherry, pear) aroma that is then settled down with a briny overlay. Flavor begins sweet (fruit) then brings in a soft heat. Not as bad as it sound but somewhat reminds me of cherry cola. Bitter almond at the exit leads to a relatively short finish.March tequila tasting - blancos, 03-24-2022

1509.Review: Fruity with a vinegar twang on the nose that really makes this one stand apart. I’m tasting plums with balsamic vinegar. Oily in the glass. This isn’t your typical tequila, and I’m warming up to it as I go. This one’s a trip!

1510.Review: Wow! This is a totally different animal from the  NueveUno which I just rated. Citrus, pepper, a nose spike from the ethanol...looks at label hmm 40%. Still using the stemless Riedel this settled down quickly in the glass and gives a great bouquet of orange flower and roast caramelized agave. Some sourness and a citric acid tang on the tongue like too many sour patch kids is not a bad thing at all as this fades and finishes on some great sweet agave vinegar notes. Sounds contradictory but it all works together. This receives an 8 for value from me. My usual score is 7 which is average as far as the app is concerned.

1511.Review: Aroma of dried cranberries and flowers initially in the glass that developed notes of balsamic vinegar as it sat. This has a "aged" character to me that is a departure from the standard blanco profile.The taste is similarly unique, with an inexplicably balsamic background behind a core of cooked agave and orange peel flavor. Like other reviewers, I think this vinegar note actually works quite well and augments the classic agave flavors in a thought provoking way. Lingering and pleasant peppery bitterness on the finish.NOM 1414 again producing quite a unique-tasting tequila. I've tried their ArteNOM reposado expression and was similarly impressed by the atypical flavors they have coaxed out of agave. While it's flavors are probably not in the comfort zone for most tequila drinkers, this bottle goes to show how different even a blanco can taste. Highly reccomended for anyone looking to taste a unique tequila.

1512.Review: Unique flavor profile and a fun tasting adventure. I would definitely drink this again, yet this isn't something I plan to buy again. Affordable.  Ferment and Still $37.Nose: Fruity and tart plumbs, sour grape skins, faint hints of cinnamon spice.  Wow. Very unexpected and delightful. Taste:  Mild oily mouthfeel, tart acidity and a mild sweetness.  Very easy to drink.  Again, the plumb and citrus fruitiness with cinnamon take center stage.  Reminiscence of the sweet, tart, and pleasant bite of balsamic vinegar. Unique, but its works well.Finish: Medium tart and sweet.

1513.Review: TCBCO2101   15269004/02/21        14:27Initial nasal impact is warming and drying. Aroma is upfront citrus and cooked agave, backed up by floral notes - jasmine and orange blossom. Some limestone and olive follows.Mouthfeel is coating and drying. The citrus, cooked agave and olive come through immediately on the flavor with a nice pepper hit. Maybe a touch of spearmint. There are some mineral and plain Greek yogurt components on the retro nasal. A medium finishA solid blanco from NOM 1414 and at $35, it's a definite buy

1514.Review: Blind tasted well with Terralta, Pasote & Cimmaron blancos.  Mild agave & something very slight sweet aromas.  Very unique flavor profile with carmelized agave, citrus & something else that turns a little peppery on long smooth finish.  Bumped up score a couple points for value.  Definitely a sipper that I would buy again.

1515.Review: Flat flavor not as complex, but the cooked agave was present all around with a really enjoyable layer of natural sweetness that reminds me of dulces típicos of Mexico (jamóncillo & almonds/nuts)For the price, this is a great mixer tequila and versatile to sip on.

1516.Review: This has a Zing to it! Light, and refreshing… easy drinking citrus and pepper and there is something else not cinnamon but maybe like a clove in oranges type flavor.

1517.Review: Good. Loads of citrus. Very mellow, easy to drink

1518.Review: Nose:   Big baked agave entrance. Spicy with citrus zest. A dusty note and minerals. Flavor:   Cinnamon, cloves and a bit of vanilla. Nice peppery zing. Plenty of sweet agave front and center. Pleasing mouth feel. Finish:   Late blooming ripe tree fruit nuances, backed up with pepper and anise. A guest  presenter at our Ajijic Tequila Club October 2019.

1520.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1520.Review: This is ALL about the barrel, if you’re a Bourbon or Scotch fan then you are gonna be a fan! Spicy and punchy, this kicks your ass from start to finish.

1521.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1521.Review: This is quite wood influenced from the 5 years spent in the barrel and the higher bottling proof.
