Very heavy rye whiskey presence in the taste which reminds me of the aged Celestial Tequila products  aged in Wild Turkey Rye barrels. I know there are fairly pristine WT Rye barrels in the NOM 1480 barrel warehouse along with another rye and some other not often seen whiskey distillery barrels as well. It has a very rich flavor of rye whiskey from the extended aging and the 50% ABV. If rye whiskey barrel aged tequila is what you seek, go for this at La Cata in Tequila, Jalisco MX. Edit to add that I have tasted this XA to the tune of a half bottle over the last month, both from a Glencairn glass and Romeo's jarrito to form this opinion.

1522.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1522.Review: This single barrel, high proof XA comes from Eladio Montes and does not disappoint. Viscosity coats the mouth with notes of oak, sawdust, dried fruit, vanilla and butterscotch. Let this open up for several minutes and the profile will change as the alcohol burns off. Take your time and enjoy this at La Cata.

1523.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1523.Review: Complex aromas of butterscotch, comote, dried  fruit ( apricot), and a touch of baking spices. Natural sweetness in the mouth, balanced by a dry finish and medium mouthfeel. Layered and interesting. Although it’s 50% abv, it doesn’t feel “hot”, but it is pungent. A special occasion sipper for sure.

1524.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1524.Review: Because this is high proof (50% abv) I used a glass specifically designed for higher proof spirits (the Stölzle "Jarrito" Tasting Glass.) As such, alcohol fumes didn't get in the way of my tasting experience.There's definitely a lot going on here in the aroma. Just like any good natural spirit, don't rush this one. It will continue to open up in the glass and surprise you.At first, I detected white chocolate in the aroma. Then came the cinnamon, barrel spice, and fruit. A little while longer some jalapeño and citrus.The flavor follows the aroma, but this is where the oak and barrel spice become much more obvious.Has a thick and oily texture in the mouth, and the finish lasts for a long time. Thumbs up on this one.You can only get it at the La Cata tasting room in downtown Tequila, though. And it's a single barrel, so it won't last long. I recommend picking one up soon!

1525.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1525.Review: Nose:   Elegant, complex aroma. Dried fruit: apricots, plums and raisins. Lush ripe fruit: dark berries and dark cherry. Barrel spices of cinnamon and allspice. Vanilla, cedar, and piquant mineral notes. Creamy.Flavors:   Bright citrus notes of mandarinas and orange, vibrant baking spices, silky vanilla custard, and warming pepper - all in perfect balance. Roasted nuts on the retrohale. Finish:   There is some whiskey/oakiness going on in the finish. The higher alcohol ABV is in no way off putting, but it will definitely numb your lips!Tasting notes from the following night:  The nose and entry flavors seem to have more bourbon or rye oak and “hottish” barrel spice than previously noted.

1526.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1526.Review: very oak forward. butterscotch dried fruit spice pepper. a little heavy for me. tasted at la cata

1527.Tequila: Hacienda Los Alamos (La Cata) Single Barrel Extra Añejo
1527.Review: La Cata previously did a single barrel limited edition extra anejo collab with Rey Sol Tequila. This time around, the limited edition collab comes courtesy of Hacienda Los Alamos Tequila. I had the opportunity to taste this at La Cata last weekend, and needles to say was very impressed (immediatelly bought a bottle). Single barrel organic extra anejo aged for 5 years and limited to only 192 bottles. ABV is at 50%. Only negative is that you will have to make the trip to Tequila to get this as it is only available at La Cata.

1529.Review: Very floral, fruity, with a melon aroma.

1530.Review: Anise and black pepper with a great oiliness.

1531.Review: Cinnamon and anise aromas. Agave and olive flavor, super thick oily mouthfeel.

1532.Review: From NOM 1420 which is listed as a prior producer though not for this Blanco Fuerte expression. Clean agave nose with some alcohol from the 100 proof. Silky smooth in the mouth with agave and pepper, both green and black. Nice lasting finish from this very nice older blanco.

1534.Review: Strong raw agave flavor and aroma. A very simple blanco with a bit of heat and alcohol. Overall this was disappointing as I have enjoyed the other offerings from this brand.

1535.Review: Nose:   Tons of agave. Maybe a hint of smoke. Herbal. Detect mint, apples, pear and minerals. A floral note. Silky mouth feel. Nice pepper to help balance out the slightly sweet notes. Spicy. Finish of filberts and fruit.

1536.Review: Nice aroma, and great oily mouth feel. Flavor a bit too sweet, but overall pleasant.

1537.Review: tasted from the regular bottle version at 38% abv. There is a crystal bottle with box set that sells for 10 times the  cost of the plain bottle I bought in PV. This is a very spicy, tangy blanco with a bunch of agave and pepper on the tongue. Nice long finish with some alcohol numbing.

1538.Review: my favorite blanco sad it's not in the US

1539.Review: I really enjoyed this one as a green agave flavor hits you it fades to a citrus minerality that is very pleasant for the price do yourself a favor and grab one!

1540.Review: A light aroma of sweet cooked agave, there is more agave in the flavor. This has a nice peppery kick and a long finish. Good stuff!

1542.Review: This bottle looks a little different than the picture here.  It has a dark blue label.  Aroma: lots of agave and a hint of alcohol. Flavor: agave and herbs with a nice long, oily finish.

1544.Review: NOM 1426 So under the radar and so fucking good! Not easy to find, if you see the original funny looking bottle with the red clown nose topper, grab it. Clean, crisp, agave forward. Lime, citrus, mint, melon, a great sleeper for sure! Avoid the new NOM 1438 version.

1545.Review: NOM 1438- better than the reposado from the same nom, but again a big difference from the original NOM 1426. This is drinkable, but definitely not high-end

1546.Review: NOM 1426|100% blue weber agave from the lowlands, baked 48 hrs in brick ovens. Juices extracted using the traditional tahona method. Double distilled in stainless steel pot stills.What an incredible value! A great sipper that you won't feel guilty mixing. Legs and pearls, agave nose. Bright clean flavor. Moderate pepper/spice finish that lingers.Purchased at Old Town Liquor $22/750ml

1547.Review: NOM 1426|Aroma - Cooked Agave, lots of citrus, brine, and a grape note as well. Flavor - medium mouthfeel with notes of cooked agave, grape, citrus, with a black pepper note on the finish. Finish was short and uneventful. Fairly one dimensional but not offensive.

1548.Review: NOM 1438|I like this.  Good agave, pepper and fruitiness. The pear and agave gives a cinnamon pear like flavor. With a light bit of minty coolness on the end.

1549.Review: NOM 1426|No aroma. That's what i like.Kind of a wood flavor. Nice.Smoother than the most recent that i rated smooth.

1552.Review: NOM 1079|My rating is of a leather strap first generation Reserva especial

1554.Review: NOM 1079 version.Date: Originally reviewed 6/8/2012, update 8/24/2013.Source: My private collection.Setup: Riedel Overture glass, neat, room temperature.History: Although 1921 blanco, reposado and anejo continue to be produced, this Reserva Especial Reposado version is no longer in production. It’s a terrific treasure bottle if you can find it. The brand was named "1921" to commemorate the final year of the Mexican Revolution. This is a highland tequila that was originally produced at NOM 1079 (Agave Tequilana Prod. y Comercializadores, SA CV). 1921 is no longer produced in NOM 1079 and is now produced in NOM 1535 (Destileria Morales, S.A. de C.V.). Production: 1921 Reserva Especial Reposado is double distilled using copper pots. (The new juice produced at NOM 1535 is distilled in stainless steel pots with copper coils). Aged between 9 and 14 months in 200 liter medium charred American oak barrels. The barrels are only used 5 times. The first time it used the tequila is aged for only 9 months. For the second use of the barrel, the tequila is aged for 11 months, the third use for 12 months, the forth use for 13 months and final use for 14 months. Although all of bottles are designated as reposado some are aged over 12 months and could be considered an anejo.Tasting Notes: This bottle used for this review is marked LOTE No. 190. This is a single barrel tequila so you can expect variances from lot to lot. I tasted it in a Riedel glass at room temperature after breathing for 10 minutes. Color: Deep golden straw color. Looks more like an anejo than a reposado. Nose: Right from the nose I knew I would love this Tequila. Aromas of caramel, apricot and cherry with a hint of lemon, mild agave but not much wood coming through and very little alcohol. Entry: On entry you get hit with lots sweet buttery agave, fruit and mild oak. Body: Complex and smooth with a sweet tone. Flavors of cooked agave, pepper, caramel, a little oak with a nice oily mouth feel. There is no bitterness and it has a very well balanced alcohol tone throughout. Others have described it as smoky but I’m not picking that up. I’m getting loads of sweet fruity agave, and loving it. Finish: Medium in length with hints of vanilla, spice, fruit with mild heat and agave coming through. The 1921 Reserva Especial is one of my favorite reposados, but unfortunately as I mentioned, it is no longer produced.

1557.Review: Buy this any time I can still find it

1558.Review: Amazing nose, light in color yet rich in flavors of spice, cooked agave and light barrel notes. This tequila took over 13 yrs to get to market. It is costly but special.

1559.Review: What a treat to taste this brand new 6 year XA from Volans. Itâ€™s pricey but they started this project over 6 years ago when the brand first formed. If your budget allows for it, this should be in your collection. It takes the original XA to new layers of depth with a little higher ABV. Congrats Volans. Another masterpiece from El Pandillo and Volans.

1560.Review: This epic XA with a light caramel color holds a complex body and lavish layers of floral, dried fruit, citrus, baking spices, chocolate and salty caramel flavors balanced with mineral and cask notes.  Our first sip awoke our palate with juicy citrus flavors, the second sip revealed layers of complex notes, and our third sip left us with a long lasting elegant finish steeped in El Pandillo terroir.  Felipe is the ultimate maestro, and this 6yr XA is one of his greatest works of art.  Very highly recommended.

1561.Review: absolutely unreal. easy to drink, even at higher proof. amazing spice character with cooked agave still shining through. this is now my gold standard.

1562.Review: Cooked agave w/ oak- subtle sweetness-jasmine- butterscotch/caramel- mild smoke- green peppercorn- mild ripe grapes

1563.Review: Very complex tequila. Very special barrel, indeed.Aromas and flavors were identified (in that feature of the app). I only have a sample, so I won't have time, as I would with an entire bottle, to identify even more characteristics.Definitely worth obtaining.

1564.Review: Pleasant fruit (guayaba?) spice (nutmeg) honey and vanilla aromas. Sweet agave and light caramel flavor from the mature agave used. Light finish and mouthfeel. Perfect for aged tequila lovers who like an open, and naturally sweet tequila rather than a dry oak-forward XA. For me, it’s a great special occasion or end-of-the night with dessert sipper.

1565.Review: Cooked agave, butter, citrus, almond aromas. Vanilla, citrus, caramel and fruit flavors. Super well balanced product with lots of interesting things going on. It’s also super rare, 195 bottles from just one single barrel.

1567.Review: Loved the color , the juice and the presentation!

1568.Review: I’ll be honest, it’s a little hot for me and I love HP. Definitely a quality product. The nose is so bright and clean. Earth, Citrus? Not sure. The palate is bright but once that finish hits you’re in for a ride. Glad to finally have tried this one. Update: this opened up nicely, delicious and the heat calmed down. I’ve bumped a few points.

1569.Review: This one just does it for me. Heavy on the agave on nose and palate, delicious minerality. So damn good. It elevated a margarita to new heights and is also great for sipping if you can handle the 110. This is, for me, a near perfect expression of blanco tequila. Terralta 110 and G4 108 are fantastic, but Tapatio is the GOAT for me.

1570.Review: Nose- Cooked agave, black pepper, grapefruit, lightly floral and grassy. The alcohol is present but not dominating which blows my mind.Flavor- Cooked agave, black pepper, white pepper, a little de-seeded jalapeno, lime, mint, and just a touch of olive brine. Once again the alcohol is obviously there but dangerously easy on me. Finish- pleasant sweet heat that lasts! This liquid is insanely good.

1571.Review: First Tapatio product I’ve had and it’s a winner. Tons of roasted agave and pepper throughout. The alcohol is definitely there but wasn’t as a prominent on the nose or in flavor as I expected from a high proof. Helps add to the flavor without overpowering all the other amazing flavors of this tequila. Very complex flavor with bright agave and pepper, minerality and I get a little molasses, brown sugar, cinnamon flavor as well. Finish is long and absolutely delicious. Every sip I seemed to find more flavor. One of my favorites and a tequila I just keep coming back to.

1572.Review: Huge flavor. Great for sipping. Killer in margaritas. Big green pepper and citrus notes. Great all around and a good value for the proof and 1L size.

1573.Review: Aroma : Vegetal, grassy, citrus, and herbal notes accent light alcohol and raw agave.Taste : Sweet cooked agave and light alcohol. Peppery heat with cloves, pear/peach, and earth. As with other high proofs, the alcohol is not overpowering here, but serves to give more depth to the other notes.Finish : Long and slightly hot with black pepper, cloves, and some potato.Usually I review all of the base level tequilas (Blanco, Reposado, Añejo) in a brand before moving onto the things like extra añejos and high proofs, but like the Excelencia, I had heard so many great things about this bottle, I had to open this up first. And I'm glad I did.

1574.Review: The Camarenas know how to make tequila. This high proof tequila is a treat. The nose is strong and full of fresh agave, green apple and alcohol; in a good way. I taste white pepper and sweet agave. The flavor is intense and the finish is excellent. It’s truly a treat for blanco lovers. ¡Salud!

1575.Review: Legit one of the best tequilas ever made, it’s almost  unbelievable that something could have this high of an ABV and still achieve balance and subtlety! Agave for days from start to finish, it has some tropical fruit going on but really this is about agave. Makes a mean cocktail if you’re in the market...

1576.Review: This 110 is just as fun and playful as the 80, but with more complexity. It has the green apple, pear and olives as the 80, but with more herbal, minty punch. I love me some high proof blanco and this does not disappoint. Price is fair considering you are getting a liter instead if 750mls.  It’s light and mineraly with wet stone aroma. Sweet agave with black pepper, clove and cherry on the tongue. I love this juice from La Alteña.

1577.Review: A lot going on here.  Nose:   Vegetal cucumber, citrus, licorice nose. Minerals and a celery/thyme herbal note. Taste of mature agave with a nutty peach note. Coats your tongue with a rich buttery feel. Some peppery heat and a bit of salinity. Finishes with fading pepper heat and a banana, anise, and almond tease.  Good balance for all that is going on in this tequila.

1578.Review: Really enjoyed the strong agave presence. The finish is strong with a mineral lingering in the mouth. I'm sure it makes a great margarita that will knock anyone's socks off. Salud!

1579.Review: Fresh cut grass, peanut brittle, cooked agave

1581.Review: Sweet, floral nose, with a vanilla note. Very sweet entry, which turns a little acidic and bitter. The sweetness continues across the tongue all the way to the finish, but at the end the bitter notes become more grassy and green. The alcohol is never overpowering, but a few drops of water really improve the taste experience.

1582.Review: Blind rated. After pouring there is a bit of acetone in the nose, which could indicate some little defect in fermentation, but after resting a while in the glass it opens up and it's good. A lot of beautiful floral agave, with some alcohol and maybe still some trace of acetone as well.  Lots of agave and spice on the palate, some pepper. Some bitterness in the medium agave finish.  It's a bit unbalanced, but very good nonetheless.

1583.Review: Green agave on the nose. Pepper along with alcohol leading to a nice long finish with some tongue buzzing.

1584.Review: Nice nose, clean, sweet, and very floral. The flavor is full of sweetness the cooked agave comes through. The finish had nice spice and was long lasting.

1585.Review: Smells like Arandas! High proof doesn't bother the taste.

1586.Review: It will get you drunk.  I am changing my opinion on this tequila. Now that it has been opened for over a month it has really opened up. Love it

1587.Review: I know this is going to sound incredibly strange but the aroma is overwhelmingly buttery. To the point of smelling like buttered popcorn at the movies. There is a subtle note of agave but it's minimal. The flavor is hot but full of raw agave. You can definitely tell this is high proof. There's also some anise and butter on the finish. This one definitely hangs around.

1588.Review: Strong, rich vegetal aroma with prevalent agave. Fresh and clean (without the yeasty "funk" of sample 1). Heat and spice show upfront but followed by a fruity sweetness (much more complex in flavor than sample 1). The finish is long and lingering. Although high proof, this one tastes like something you could sip on a nice, summer evening.

1589.Review: This blanco is unlike any other I can think of. Intense agave flavors, scents and finish. The finish lingers for a few minutes. I'm partial to blancos with a peppery taste and this is the ultimate. The nose can be a little overwhelming but that's to be expected with a 110 proof.

1590.Review: Rated blind. Fantastic agave nose accented with what I presume to be some aromas from the cooking process—not smokey per se, but something. A bit thin in the mouth while the flavor sneaks up and hits you over the head with agave and smoke. The finish explodes with pepper and spice and lasts forever. Don't sip too fast, or the overproof will get ya! This is what it's all about right here folks! What a treat!

1591.Review: for being one of the top abv, this was the sweetest high proof tequila I’ve had so far. Has perfect amount of pepper though not as much agave as I like. With that said, this is a perfect sipper but can also hold its own in a cocktail. Will always keep this on hand.

1593.Review: Highest proof (110) tequila is allowed to be bottled at. Very good price for what it is.

1594.Review: Cinnamon, citrus, strong alcohol aroma on nose and palate. Very spicy and strong finish with long burn. This is a well made tequila with little finesse as the strong alcohol content is unimpeded.

1595.Review: Fruit, mint, pepper, butter. Delivered by a mule’s hind leg

1596.Review: not much of a blanco fan aside from calle 23 criollo, but this is pretty damn good. more earthy and vegetal than I'm used to, but I still enjoy it. this will make some killer mixed drinks.

1597.Review: not much of a blanco fan aside from calle 23 criollo, but this is pretty damn good. more earthy and vegetal than I'm used to, but I still enjoy it. this will make some killer mixed drinks.

1598.Review: Nose - Loads of agave and alcoholPalette - More complex than the smell to me. Still heavy agave notes, but also some white pepper and citrus. Sometimes a sweet rock-candy like note. Not as much alcohol harshness as I expected from a 110 proof. Nice viscous mouth-feel. A fantastic price for a great tequila.

1599.Review: Be patient after the pour.  Let this open for 10 minutes.  Since you won’t do this, pour 2 glasses.  The first smaller and the 2nd bigger.  Your curiosity will have you smell the aroma and you’ll get alcohol, pepper and a heat.  The taste will be heavy agave but still have the alcohol and black pepper.  The finish is hot and medium smooth.  With the rested glass you lose the alcohol and the agave and pepper come forward.  The finish becomes smooth without the burn.  This is a wonderful sipper if you are patient.  Be patient. I prefer Terralta and Gran Dovejo but this is pleasing.

1600.Review: Aroma, you kind of have to fight past the initial alcohol to get to agave, ligjt sugar, and mineral scents. It does open a bit more after sitting but flavor is slifht burn, agave, brown sugar, mint, Jalapeño, then a burn with the finish. Great mixer for the price but would probably sip just as much

1601.Review: Bottle: Lot TB110-032, 01/08/2022Appearance: ClearNose: Cooked agave, black and white pepper, citrus, minerality, wet earth, grapefruit, lemon, lime, orange, pineapple, lemongrass, olive, brine, …Palate: Cooked agave, black and white pepper, citrus, mint, lime, brine, jalapeño, alcohol, butter, olive, subtle smoke, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, mango, and anise…I feel like I’m repeating myself from the regular blanco, but a lot of the same flavors are there (albeit with a stronger punch!)Finish: Very long, with the flavors giving way to the alcohol warmth over time…very enjoyableOverall: As someone who really likes Tapatio blanco, this 110-proof version does not disappoint. The neck pour was a little more alcohol-predominant, but the following glasses (especially after letting it rest for about 10 minutes) really allows the strong flavors to shine through. In a margarita, the flavors come through equally as well and compliments the other ingredients perfectly. This is definitely going to be a regular purchase.

1602.Review: It's a burner. Not bad at all. But I Prefer Terralta 110. I would use this as a mixer.

1603.Review: Bring on the heat! First two sips I experienced some elevated temperatures with this one. Aroma was high alcohol and pepper for me. Taste was similar with alcohol, agave, pepper and some burn, the good kind. I let it sit for about ten minutes and went in again…. Amazing what a few minutes can do to a resting glass of tequila. The aroma lighted up a bit and the flavor,  although still a bit strong and hot revéales more of that agave, pepper and fruitiness. A true high proof Tequila. Great for a Paloma!

1604.Review: I've had the extra anejo, reposado and this... this is so good, I get agave and pepper some mineral but good god do I love this stuff.  I have to get this online because I've never seen it in a store near me.

1605.Review: Nose: Cooked Agave, Pepper, MintTongue: Agave, pepper, honey

1606.Review: This 110 functions as it should as a high proof!Gets you wasted quicker! One partygoer said “I don’t normally feel the first shot after 10 minutes, but this one…YES!” The alcohol smell is strong but no one has complained of it burning going down. Love this Tapatio 110!

1607.Review: Old school tequila made the right way. Tapatio doesn’t always get the recognition it deserves. I think this shines in a Paloma or Margarita.

1608.Review: One of my favorite high proofs. I feel like it’s a true representation of what a highland tequila taste like. It’s full of cooked agave but the finish is what does it for me. It has ripe mango, citrus, minty, some briny and mineral notes, and a soft creamy butter feel. Very thick mouthful.

1609.Review: Peppery, vegetal, slight earth like clay, and maybe lemon? Would be interested to try on a cocktail since the ABV  should hold up nicely. Excellent taste.

1610.Review: nose flowery citrus alcohol taste mineral briny mint flowery citrus with delicious warm peppery finish

1611.Review: I’m primarily a Margarita drinker, and currently I dabble with sipping. This is my favorite tequila! Such amazing agave flavor, and the extra alcohol punch, makes this my #1 tequila.

1612.Review: Strong scent but to be expected… definitely vanilla… smooth finish considering the strength. Bien!

1613.Review: Everything that I love about the 80 proof blanco is magnified in the 110-proof.  At $55 (Old Town) this is an incredible value and a magnificent offering by Felipe Camarena. I find the 110 too sweet to sip, but it works exceptionally well in mixed drinks.Nose:  Vegetal, raw agave, citrus and pepper. There is a mild briney quality with a green pear fruit, too.Taste: Chewy. Bright with sweet cooked agave and with nice enveloping minerality. Peppery heat rides above and reminds younthat this is 110 proof.  Finish: A nice long ride of sweet agave with a bite of pepper.

1614.Review: Way better than their standard blanco!

1615.Review: notes of citrus, a little heavy on the nose. surprisingly good finish

1617.Review: Lots of alcohol in this one. No hiding it. Nice light agave notes. Lots of floral forward tones and a peppery aftertaste.

1618.Review: Being 55% you truly taste the agave. Although it does have a small burn if you shoot it, it is easy to sip. I’d recommend especially to make strong cocktails.

1619.Review: Very green earthy amazing tequila! Not a crazy amount of bite for the proof. Just a ton more flavor.

1620.Review: Lots of Pepper on the taste, very solid expression

1621.Review: I’m finding this slightly tricky to characterize - herbaceous and slightly earthy.  And yet it’s got a smack of ham to it! Nice finish.

1622.Review: The high proof really shines through detracting from the aroma, taste, and finish. I love Tapatio blanco and was hoping to love this too. For me it’s not a sipper but I’m sure would be excellent in a cocktail.

1623.Review: Cannot believe how smooth and balance this 110 tequila is.      A lot of flower note

1624.Review: Surprised how smooth this is for 110 still strength. And the nose is amazing. Loads of agave, along with some river rocks and citrus. The alcohol comes forward in the flavor but quickly fades back into the abundant agave. Nice oily mouth feel. Finish is very nice with more agave complexity and very little burn.I’m really enjoying these still strength blancos. Gran Dovejo and Fortaleza are my favorites but this is very nice.

1625.Review: Opens up with grass and a little black pepper and soil. But it’s agave up from with the tasting, very fresh. Tastes green (can you taste a color?) on the best way. It’s floral as it opens. Very well done.

1626.Review: Natural sweet agave taste. Clean pure taste of well made tequila. Slight burn due to higher proof.

1627.Review: Nose: alcohol straight off the rip…. As it opens up pepper, raw agave, wet fresh cut grass, Minerality, and shocked by strong Lavender!Taste: Strong Fresh Cracked Black Pepper, raw and sweet cooked agave, spices, Hay, butter, very clean, earthy, wheaty, and mint on the finish!

1628.Review: 750mL bottle, paid $56. Nose: amazing cooked agave, white pepper, citrus, jalapeño, surprisingly little alcohol. Taste: deliciously smooth sweet caramel, light pepper, brine, citrus, jalapeño. The mouth feel is fantastic, nice and oily. Dangerously easy to drink with very low alcohol bite for a 110 proof. Absolutely fantastic. It’s currently my favorite high proof blanco.

1629.Review: finally bought a bottle and this is my first taste.strong sweet agave spice pepper floral. easy to tell this is a high proof because there is some alcohol burn. still fits right up there with the top tier high proofs. huge value for less than 30$ for a liter in Mexico

1630.Review: I find that the extra alcohol detracts from the amazing flavor that regular tapatio blanco has. Everything is amped up to 11 in this but the extra proof cloaks the brilliance of this stuff with booziness.

1631.Review: The sweet heat is on your tongue.Definitely not for rookies.If this is old school & All original I’m in love .

1632.Review: I am so happy I finally got my hands on this high proof.. im loving it.on the nose: a musky cooked agave, sour grapefruit, ethanol, jasmine and sweet truffles.on the palate: Agave stands tall, citrus, herbs,candied berries, roasted pineapple, the heat on the exhale is accompanied with cinnamon, peppers and dry oregano.the finish is a lingering peppery, saline.this i recommend to all who like tequila as it was meant to be.

1633.Review: tough to drink. more for cocktails.high proof. 55

1634.Review: Sweet agave and caramelWhite pepper spicy. Can taste the alcohol Light to med body

1635.Review: Spicy notes from the fibers in the agave.

1636.Review: This is a bargain!  Loads of agave, pepper, and some heat. This makes a great margarita!

1637.Review: This is a sneaky high proofer that is a great bottle to have on hand. I got strong agave and sweet grass notes on the nose but banana and agave in the palate for sure. Strikes me as more of a unique blanco but would definitely make a great sipper on its own or paired with smoky foods and such. Great pour!

1638.Review: Here's something every tequila lover needs to try. it definitely has some heat can't say no burn on this blanco 110 proof. Its a pleasant burn though not harsh at all. its more heat than burn. It"s silky texture and burn is actually perfect. some complexity though. I get that nice sweet roasted cooked agave any more I think would take that sweetness over the top. The long agave notes last throughout its profile. it has lots of pepper, some citrusy grassy and earthy notes. needs to be let out and open up a bit. oh and Value that gives it a really good score. I can get this for about $50 i can't think of another bottle with this quality at this price. maybe the artenom 1123 at $55 comes to mind.

1639.Review: A great balance for high proof! Inviting agave, lemon zest, mineral nose. Sweet almond, buttered popcorn entry... very mellow initial flavor for a 110, but quickly gives way to green peppercorn, spice, brine, lime and roasted agave lingering on and on and on for an incredible, deliciously long finish. Long legs. Packs a punch. Not for the novice or faint hearted.

1641.Review: At 55%, unsurprisingly, the nose is quite hot but there are some aromas underneath the ethonal.  Black pepper, cooked agave, celery, and some clay/earthy thing going on.The taste and finish are absolute showstoppers.  An abundance of green flavours: celery, green chartreuse, sage, green bell pepper, and lime zest.  That black pepper and cooked agave are also noticeable.The finish is loooooong, dry, and herbaceous.At $78 cnd, this is a bargin and the taste completes with any blanco on the market.  If the nose was a bit less hot it'd score in the high 90s.

1642.Review: Exceptional.  Beautiful balance for a high proof.  Brine, veggie, pepper, citrus, metallic nose.  Has a light peppery dry sweet finish. Doesn’t overpower you with a bang but evens out really nicely with an oily feel in the mouth.  Citrus, agave, salty, herby flavors.

1643.Review: Very strong tequila bite, pepper nose, no soft taste for the American pallete

1644.Review: The nose I get a strong alcohol smell and let it breathe before enjoying it.  This is when the magic happens I get black pepper, citrus and it has strong agave flavor.  The finish is long and lingers.  I got this on sale and will say it’s going to be added to my liquor cabinet.  Carlos Camarena is a true artist and craftsman.  I prefer this one over the regular blanco.  The flavor is more noticeable here.

1645.Review: Amazingess!! True nectar of the gods!! Open the bottle and sweet agave instantly fills the air. Palette is just as amazing! Will make sure this is something I always have on hand.

1646.Review: Notes: full cooked agave since the beginning, orange peel, with green apple & pear notes. Herbal and grassy aromas in the mix. Black pepper, anise and mint along with a buttery sensation that just melts in your mouth. Long adherence. Wow, sharp alcohol smell but so subtle afterwards… just amazing!

1647.Review: Very good high proof. Has a really sweet smell like agave and some vanilla, probably from the wood fermentation tanks.  Lots of pepper that stays on the tongue (medium to long finish). An easy highproof sipper. That’s really good.

1648.Review: First high proof Blanco I've tried, it's a unique and enjoyable sipping experience. Nose is pepper, agave, and fruity - I picked up some melon and grapes?The taste is sharp, in a good way, with lots of heat and vegetal/floral notes shining through.The finish is fast and hard, leaving a tingle and a briny yet sweet coating of the mouth. The extra ABV always lets you feel it's presence, yet alcohol is never really tasted.

1650.Review: Lots of agave flavor, lime, a little tart and somewhat harsh on the nose. Long pleasant finish and as expected a good burn.

1651.Review: Beautiful cooked agave on the palate. Can feel the higher proof on your tongue. Delicious earthy flavor. Nice "Tequila hug" from this one.

1652.Review: Bottle from 2013, solid traditional tequila, no fiddling around here, good agave presence, goes down pretty smooth for 55%, finish with just a tiny hint of bitterness but overall a very very good product like the entire tapatio line, this is tequila and nothing else

1653.Review: Nose is unassuming but right off the bat you can tell this is done right.  Yes the nose is sweet but it’s muted, allowing wonderful fresh and crisp agave to boast with a little pepper and banana-citrus coming through.  Right away the palate screams well-roundedness.  It checks all the boxes that the Ocho Plata does.  The oily legs linger in the mouth during the finish and leave a nice, classy pepper memory.  The finish also has an earth that I just can’t identify yet.  Nothing at all against the regular blanco but 110 is better.  WELL done.

1654.Review: Creamy, buttery, pepper and anise...light on alcohol smell and taste for high proof... delicious!

1655.Review: I affectionately refer to this as my tequila “jet fuel” , lol . Just like the name states, this is a high octane premium blanco tequila from one the best in the industry. Carlos and the crew never disappoints. For experienced tequila lovers only . Loads of sweet agave, mint, pepper . Amazing smell and taste , enjoy ! Oh, I personally toured this distillery in 2018 with Experience Tequila.

1656.Review: suuuuper firey at first, followed by a nice sweetness. smooth mouth feel and a very warm finish

1657.Review: Beau gave me an onza of this the night I first closed the bar.  Absolutely ace, I say.

1658.Review: Love the agave and pepper taste in this expression.  As you would expect from the over proof it has quite a bite from the alcohol but it mellows a bit as you go through the bottle. Very well done.

1659.Review: This is an excellent blanco.  I would put it behind Calle 23 and Cascahuin though.  Lots of cooked agave, honey, citrus, green apple, mint.  White pepper.Hot for sure.   I can’t help but wonder if the alc. is clouding some of the complexity.   Overall a treat.  Get it!

1660.Review: Definitely a sipping tequila to share with friends.

1661.Review: Aroma: Agave, pepper and citrusFlavor: Big agave forward, great mouth feel. Nice pepper and citrus followsFinish: Loooong with nice pepper heatBetter than their Blanco? Yes. Nudges out Criollo by a hair as my favorite high proof blanco

1663.Review: Very good with notes of cooked agave, mint, anise, pineapple, citrus, melon, a hint of pepper, and buttery floral notes. Interesting how buttery, cooked agave, and minty notes also exist in Tapatio Exelencia

1665.Review: Well that was boozy. A very in your face tequila.

1666.Review: Instant sweet with some late heat, not overpowering which surprised me with this overproof. Great notes of agave on the nose and initial taste

1667.Review: I really enjoy drinking this tequila frequently, strong and spicy balanced !  tequila for Machos !

1668.Review: This just made my top 5 blanco list. Great agave and flowery/citrus nose but this tequila is all about the taste! Rich/thick mouthfeel, agave forward with playful hints of lime and a long minty/pepper finish. I also get a hint of something savory mid-palate. Somewhat reminiscent of a good mezcal...

1669.Review: Best high proof blanco I’ve ever tasted. Smooth for proof and went down too fast. Need to have another to give time to open up. A whole lot of tequila for the price.

1670.Review: Nose is just as awesome as the regular blanco with even more cooked agave intensity brought through with the added kick. It does come across as boozy but for me I really enjoy the extra heat. Nice long peppery finish. Will be my fav for the next while.

1671.Review: Purchased & shipped from Zee @ Oldtown; Maybe it’s the bottle, maybe it’s the size, but Tapatio just screams authenticity to me; I really like this brand; light notes of pepper on the nose, slight agave w floral notes; slight burn (to be expected at 110), but not overpowering; peppery on the backend w more agave; at $53 USD, this is a great deal.

1672.Review: Always towards the top of my top tequilas list!

1673.Review: Raw jalapeños, cinnamon, floral, anise, spearmint, cayenne

1675.Review: Needed a liter bottle to take on a trip to Fiji and after checking reviews picked this one up. Very happy! $50 and is delicious on ice. Expect the alcohol to be dominant on a 110 proof bottle but the cooked agave notes very prominent - very happy that I chose this tequila as my traveling companion (and my wife as well).

1676.Review: Opens up a lot with a few drops of water. There’s a burn with the alcohol percentage, but much less than expected.

1677.Review: COLOR: PlatinumNOSE: Roasted agave, carmalized sugar, very floral, lime & orange zest, black pepperTASTE: Bright ripe agave, huge floral notes, creeps and then overwhelms palate with clean roasted agave and pepperFINISH: medium body, long finish, clean, light, pepper, slight alcohol burn

1680.Review: Tasty for an ovenproof.  Would recommend on that basis

1681.Review: The 110 proof quality is a bit harsh at first, but the lingering finish is fruity and flavorful.

1682.Review: A great blanco. Big agave notes from the nose through to the finish, With the higher proof evident as more pepper/spice hits the mid-palate and lingers for a long satisfying finish.

1683.Review: This is for real men who're looking for strong back flavor

1684.Review: More flowery than regular Tapatio blanco. Peppery, chile, clean agave.

1685.Review: 2020 version. 14294 POM. $69.99+tax in Michigan. Appearance- beautiful darker golden honey. Long legs on my glassNose- Cooked agave, loads of oak, clove, faint nuttiness, burnt sugarPalate- Carmelized agave, more oak and vanilla, baking spice, and peanut brittleFinish- Long lasting finish with some lingering alcohol heat that fades into honeyValue- Great value considering the age (2 years), the name (Patron), the quantity (limited production), and the quality (no additives, special barreling)

1686.Review: Might be the best XA I’ve ever had.....loads of agave still present and all the qualities you want from the oak. This is perfectly balanced, that’s all we mortals can ask for.

1687.Review: Sherry, oak, deep cooked agave notes and rich body. Simple but good if you're lucky looking for that profile.

1688.Review: Available only in Duty Free stores. Wonderful aroma. Really super nice, to the point where i can't stop smelling it. Baking spice, nuts, vanilla. At $89 this is a killer value.

1689.Review: Sweet flavors on the top with a warm finish

1690.Review: you can definitely taste the sherry. just wish the finish was smoother

1691.Review: The sherry flavor comes through strong, I didn’t mind it at all. Very bold with a small burn at the end. Not something I want all the time, good for showing off.

1692.Review: The Sherry cask comes through on the nose immediately, little to no agave and slightly sweet.Almost a hint of whiskey on the palette. Light pepper and vegetal agave flavors.Finishes with a low lingering pepper & fresh agave.

1693.Review: This has a sweet complex flavor profile. Oak honey whiskey in the flavor makes it stand out. The aroma is very pleasing. A significant improvement over regular offerings from patron.

1694.Review: This sherry cask aged anejo opens with an equal scent of cooked agave and barrel spice whisky.  There is also a hint of honey on the nose.  When tasted, the agave is present along with a nutty oak flavor followed by bourbon and honey undertones. I feel that tequila traditionalist will focus on the sherry/bourbon profile.  Personally, I prefer using the sherry barrel aging to influence the taste as opposed to additives.

1695.Review: Patron+WineNice finish... best of all the Patrons I have tasted

1696.Review: Aroma: oak, sherry and bourbon notes, caramel, licorice, cooked pineapple, plumbs. Taste: cooked agave, sherry, oak/woody, hint of salinity.A very similar taste profile to Angels Envy bourbon...

1697.Review: Finally a patron that is very well done. Just lovely.

1699.Review: I'm also a whisky drinker .. preferably sherry or port cask finished ... so this is right up my sleeve.I could get a bottle for just €49 .. a steal ! See it ..buy it !!!

1700.Review: Perfecto on the nose and the front palette, a bit too hot on the end to rate as elite with me. Bottom line here is an honest to goodness tequila with no manipulation or additives. Keep a bottle handy.

1701.Review: Very solid blanco from NOM 1146. It really reminds me of Pura Sangre from the same distillery.

1702.Review: This is all of the best parts of NOM 1146 blended into one. You can only get this at Cantina Mayahuel, and it’s the best house blanco I’ve ever tasted.

1704.Review: Kind of an agave scent, flavor is earthy but good. Finish is smooth

1705.Review: Not much aroma, but I like the thick oily taste, puro agave taste.  I think this may be a do- over.  I would taste this again.  You are welcome Don Lorenzo - I would taste you again

1706.Review: This is a really rich blanco with lots of aroma and flavor. Floral and citrus aroma and lots of agave taste. A bit peppery on the finish.

1707.Review: Nice house Tequila in San Diego...floral scent and strong flavor up front...finishes strong but overall an enjoyable find...

1708.Review: Landed in cute San Diego tequila bar and no wifi but totally decent tequila.  The bartender recommended this house tequila. This tequila is pleasant and floral up front with a strong but stereotypical ( maybe a bit strong) finish.

1709.Review: Fruity nose, sweet agave entry with white pepper/jalapeño finish. Nice!

1710.Review: The nose is very vegetal with a funky spice, mint and smoke aroma. Taste is fruity, sweet, spicy and  vegeative. Some heat on the way out, and not bad overall.

1711.Review: Nose:   A little hot and sharp on first pass. Then a floral note, minerals and agave evolve. Flavors:   Agave, pepper and an acrid pepper bite. An undercurrent of mint, and with a little time, the bitter note rounds out, giving way to creamy sweetness.

1712.Review: Light a Agave and tobacco nose. Cream soda flavor and finish.

1713.Review: The aroma makes me feel so Agave!

1714.Review: Sweet entry with cream soda and mint... jalape√±o at the back of throat. Slightly sour finish with light heat.

1715.Review: Oak, agave, cinnamon, honey, leather, fruit, vanilla. Approachable, but a tad sweet for me.

1716.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave, oak. Some vanilla and barrel/baking spice too.Taste : Cooked agave and barrel/baking spice predominate here. There is also some amount of oak and vanilla as well, and light citrus. This is medium bodied and somewhat oily.Finish : Medium/long with stronger spices and oak.

1718.Review: An interesting a単ejo, with aromas of cooked agave, leather and cinnamon. The flavor has bright citrus and peach. Tastes sophisticated and refreshing.

1719.Review: This is a good ankle.  Loads of agave up front with a nice cinnamon and baking spice notes, with some oak little vanilla, a good bit of pitted fruit like plum and nice peppery finish that stays on the tongue for a medium finish.

1720.Review: Light sweet honey oak aroma, subtle cooked agave.  Surprisingly very little burn for an a単ejo, smooth enjoyable finish.

1721.Review: Herbal, touch vegetal, savory, long savory & dry finish. I have to be in mood for this.

1722.Review: Found this pleasant on the nose and palate both.  Nice finish.  Strong spice notes, but not at all overwhelming.

1723.Review: Nice and crisp! Clean finish! Not too oaky/vanilla.

1724.Review: this is quickly becoming on of my most favorite anejos.  I found it for $39.99 and now.own 3 bottles.the nose features some.amazing aromas of cooked agave, cinnamon and oak.  really nice creamy mouth feel with cooked agave on the front followed by chocolate and vanilla.  such a well rounded flavor profile. on the finish it has a little of peppery burn and  an vanilla caramel-dish flavor that makes you want to have a other sip.  if you like anejos, you owe yourself the chance to try this gem.  I really do enjoy sipping this neat.. get it you won't be sorry.

1725.Review: Date: Originally reviewed 8/21/2013.Source: My private collection.Setup: Riedel Overture glass, neat, room temperature.I thoroughly enjoyed this tequila which is from from NOM 1412 (Destiladora de Los Altos, S.A. de C.V.) which also makes Hacienda Vieja tequila. The distillery is located in Arandas which is in the highlands (Los Altos). It is named after Don Felix Ba単uelos, the founder of the distillery and patriarch of a widely recognized tequila family from Arandas. The price is around $50 for a 750ml bottle. Don Felix is double distilled. This is definitely a tequila made for sipping neat. I prefer a Riedel which I used for this tasting. Don Felix has an initial aroma of light fruit, peach - maybe a little apricot, caramel, some cooked agave, a hint of honey and very little oak. It is very pleasing on the nose.It has an oily, rich, creamy mouth feel. The taste starts with hints of vanilla, fruit and cooked agave and spice. It has just the right amount of sweetness. This is an extremely smooth anejo, with very little burn, and a lot of flavor. The finish is long lasting with again, a lot of flavor including oak and more spice. I keep using the word flavor but don't worry it's not the kind overburdening flavor that makes you wonder if essence or sweeteners were added, but the type of flavor that reminds what good anejo should taste like. I highly recommend it.

1726.Review: I am more of a beginner when it comes to fine tequila and so far this one has been by far the absolute best!! Smooth going down and taste that is great in the beginning and the end.

1727.Review: Has a very herbal agave organic taste.

1728.Review: Really is a great bargain as far as most equivalent anejo's go. Light flavor and smooth with a decent amount of heat on the tongue.

1729.Review: $45 a bottle, a hidden jewel if you can find it. I've tasted some tequilas at twice the price and not near the value.

1730.Review: Very crisp, light. Semi sweet. Smooth but not syrupy.

1731.Review: Such a wonderful and smooth aroma of oak, cinnamon, nuts, sweet cocked agave and maybe honey, aroma very pleasant! Flavor very good not as good as the aroma but is very smooth. Tastes like honey and nuts then I was able to identify the sweet cocked agave and cinnamon and at the end the oak wood and a little spice all the flavors nicely balanced. I bought this tequila for 32 dollars I like the price too! Definitely will buy again!

1732.Review: Strong flavor and relatively smooth finish. Very fragrant aroma lots of spiciness with cinnamon and barrel flavor. At $43, not a great value.

1735.Review: Bought on a whim, at $39 it is the bargain of the year.This is a very smooth Anejo with excellent flavors. I would recommend this tequila for your collection

1736.Review: NOM 1456|Very nice tasting Reposado, a little on the lite side. Balanced and pleasing.

1737.Review: NOM 1456|Nose: cooked agave, fruity, spices, floral (carnations)Flavor: cloves, nuts, oak, cinnamon, and some sweetness Finish: long and peppery

1738.Review: NOM #1456Lovely full nose. Balanced nuances of fruit, carnations, creamy agave and spices. Flavors:  Pepper, graham crackers, cloves and nuts. Nice agave zing.  Finishes with the graham crackers and pepper.

1739.Review: From the 2014 Tequila Advent Calender Day 3. EU and MX issue at 38°. Big, bold and spicy with a fairly long sweet finish this reposado is seldom seen in the US.

1740.Review: Quite disappointed with this one.  It tasted quite artificial to me

1741.Review: Love aromatics to finish. The right amount of tannins n oak for me. Memorable.

1742.Review: NOM 1456|Very peppery at initial kiss and after. Pleasant.

1743.Review: Great on the nose, is like an XA, wood, sweetness. Taste is consistent with the nose, wood, dry fruits, no burn for my palate. Its an excellent sipper!

1744.Review: NOM 1456|This is one disappointed me, especially after reading so many good reviews by well-respectedTasters.  It seemed artificial to me from the nose straight through the palate... additives?  Decent caramel, spice & sweet notes, but a weird hint of artificial sweetener taste I couldn’t seem to shake.  Tasted next to the Blanco, and I preferred the Blanco.  Beautiful bottle... but I probably won’t open it very often.38% Mexican Duty Free.

1745.Review: Loved it. Can not wait to try the Anejo

1747.Review: pepper agave spice. long slightly sweet finish

1748.Review: Tastes of peppery agave , honey , herbsThis tequila has a nice long peppery finish with a hint of cinnamon

1749.Review: Cooked agave, caramel and cinnamon on the nose. A nice round, sweet vanilla. Definitely alot of agave on the palate, a nice spiciness, definitely the cinnamon and vanilla coming through. It’s very rounded and nicely sweet. Very good for an every day sipper.

1750.Review: Great bargain brand. Much better stuff than other brands twice the price!

1751.Review: Sweet floral aroma with some honeysuckle there for me. Taste is also somewhat sweet with cooked agave and barrel notes coming through. Fairly long finish with some heat. Overall not really complex but a fantastic value and will definitely drink again.

1752.Review: Great budget Anejo.  Not overly complex but a real nice bargain sipper. I enjoy it. Definitely recommend grabbing a bottle. First one I reach for when sipping on the patio.

1753.Review: Big punch of oak. I prefer an agave forward product even in the aged expressions. Good value, but not quite a fit for my taste

1755.Review: Nose:   Caramel, ripe agave, dried fruit (prune?), earthy notes, pungent fruit aroma and a hint of smokiness. Nice baking spice pop. Flavor:   Vibrant full fruity start. Light wood notes with butterscotch, vanilla, and pepper. Nice mouth feel to this one, although not terribly viscous. Finish:   Medium long pleasant finish of nuts, pepper and a non offensive bitterness. Footnote:   This is the Mexican 36% release costing $253 pesos. Unbelievable quality value añejo.  It gained a few rating’s points on value.

1756.Review: This is the Mexico version (38%).  The aroma and flavors of wood, agave, citrus and pepper are understated. A medium finish with a modest pepper bite.  Though the flavors are subtle they complement each other beautifully   It's smooth, pleasant and thoroughly enjoyable. At about $18 US, this  was well worth it.

1757.Review: LTHQL21A0340%Warming initial nasal impact.Aroma: caramel, cooked agave, honey, baking spice, cinnamonLight buttery mouthfeel with sufficient alcohol.Flavor: caramel, cooked agave, baking spice, pepper, light vanilla.Medium finish. Nothing too complex, but the price point is excellent (although I received mine as a gift). 7/10 points for value

1758.Review: Nothing amazing, nothing awful. Simple caramel, agave, whiskey nose and flavor. There is some butterscotch in the flavor as well. Pretty lackluster finish (although nothing offensive) perhaps due to the lower ABV 36%. But hey—for $300mx a great bargain if you just need a simple añejo.

1759.Review: I might need to visit this again, on the nose I get agave, Oak, cinnamon baked spices,caramel, vanilla ,I tasted a little bit more oak than agave. Over all it’s a good anejo and especially for the price.

1760.Review: Fantastic Añejo, especially for the price! Right out of the freshly opened bottle, it was a little hotter and more oaky than I was expecting. I let it rest for 2 weeks and it’s a completely different animal. Thick, viscous mouth feel, nice rich caramelized agave, and just a hint of oak to balance it out. Spectacular.

1761.Review: Spice, dried fruit, agave and oak flavors. Picked it up at El Buho for dirt cheap which added many points. Excellent añejo for the price.

1762.Review: Got the older bottle for $40 really good Anjeo. Agave, oak, little fruit, nice peppery finish. I will buy more as a go to anjeo

1763.Review: Nice nose and flavor, I have the 36% Alc. Vol. version. Really light and easy to drink. Price is a bargain for this quality.Gran aroma y sabor, Tengo la version de 36% Alc. Vol. Ligero y super facil de tomar. La relación precio calidad es insuperable.

1764.Review: Quite a delicious Anejo... Cinnamon & nutmeg on the nose which follows through the flavor.. nice barrel presence throughout..  Worth the pick up, and a bargain @ $35 for this treat if you can get your hands on it.

1765.Review: This one really took my by surprise. Cost less than $25,  great sipper and great for mixing.

1766.Review: Nose: sweet aroma, cooked agave, and VanillaFlavor: spicy, herbs, agave, earthFinish: Medium finish sweet with some spice.

1767.Review: Tasted blind in 2019. Nose is agave and herbs. Nice viscosity with solid legs. Agave sweetness with some white pepper, sweet caramelized agave and a very nice finish of great length.

1768.Review: Tropical fruit (banana) nose, nice mouthfeel and spicy finish. A little sweet for my palate.

1769.Review: Vanilla. Pepper. Good value blanco from Las Am√©ricas. Blind tasting 4/28/2019

1770.Review: Nose reaps of additives and flavor artificial and imitation vanilla lingering palate flavors

1771.Review: light banana aroma, sweeter, agave flavor

1773.Review: Nose:   Pungent minerals. Big ripe agave, citrus and butterscotch. Some floral notes. Lively palate:  black pepper, rounded fruit, butterscotch and prominent baking spices.

1774.Review: Overall I think this is a pretty good drink. More whiskey than tequila but if you’re into those flavors, it will probably be a winner for you.

1775.Review: I’m starting to think I might be an XA fan, this is entering lovely!! Tons of caramel, almond and baking spice, all those cognac flavours. I’m going to make a Manhattan out of this.....stay tuned.....

1778.Review: gran orendain9/6/22 NOM 1110 LOTE EEG14nose: whiskey citrus fruitpalate: subdued, caramel, a little vanilla, its dry and a little bitter, possibly because this bottle has been open for several years

1779.Review: Aroma Butterscotch, followed by caramel, vanilla, cooked agave and oak.TasteCaramel and vanilla followed by cooked agave, oak, butterscotch, and baking spices.

1780.Review: Agave present (roasted)Honeysuckle Lemon oil Great acid Clean finish Salinity

1781.Review: Expected something else on this one, a little to bitter, very whiskey like, overall ok but nothing memorable

1782.Review: Dry and barrel-forward with woody notes, light caramel, leather and earth. A breath of vanilla on the finish. This is a whiskey drinker’s tequila; refined and heady. Collect, age, decant by the glass and enjoy.

1783.Review: This EA strongly reminds me of Irish Whiskey. It greets the palate with an astringent molasses or peanut brittle assault. The bitterness is impressive in its staying power if you like that effect. I can smack my lips for minutes after each sip and still taste and feel the pucker in the back of the roof of my mouth. Then the effect finally softens into a faint vanilla vapor, which is my favorite part here.

1784.Review: Very bitter and astringent finish, would be great for someone looking for that style of tequila You can taste the bitterness from tahona method and agave fibres being left in for fermentation Not many fruity or spices esters Notes of Caramel come out once package gets warmed up

1785.Review: Astringent and cinnamon. Nice clean finish

1786.Review: A touch of agave on the nose, whiskey right through the finish. Nice dryness from the barrel.

1787.Review: The aroma is heavy on the barrel. Flavour is hot and barrel forward. Great tequila for a whiskey drinker.

1789.Review: I found this to be an excellent sipping drink and enjoyed the smoothness, a hint of sweet at first then impactful flavor. Not my number one choice but close.

1790.Review: A –A musty start (mushroom, yeast, olive, etc.) in the aroma phase. There’s cooked agave, licorice, and a small dose of vanilla. A moment of apple/pear on the nose, which was nice. In addition to the alcohol, I picked up another chemical scent, maybe rubber? It isn’t a bad smell, but not my favorite of the tasting session.  T – Baking spices and licorice/anise, a blend of raw and cooked agave. I’m tasting black tea and black pepper. The peppermint and vanilla combo is interesting.F – Following the theme of the taste, I’m almost getting a chai tea vibe, had all the elements of ginger, cinnamon, clove, black pepper, and tea.Overall – This is a solid blanco, but not my favorite.

1791.Review: Aroma: All cooked agave up front, like a freshly opened agave oven, coupled with cinnamon and a clean minerality throughout.Taste: Light and creamy sweetness, cooked agave and notes of sugar cane.Finish: A burst of cooked agave, citrus, and black pepper. The most notable part was a lingering aftertaste of the aforementioned flavors that seems to coat not only the tongue, but the roof of the mouth as well.

1792.Review: NOM 1588|Nice nose of cooked agave, lemon, and more of a tropical vibe like coconut or pineapple. If you blindfolded me I could be convinced it’s a mai tai. Mouthfeel is a little thicker than usual, and tastes of cooked agave, lemon, lime, but a little bit of acetate note that I don’t enjoy. Finish loses that flavor and is pleasantly long, and citrus forward.

1793.Review: Cooked agave, apple, pear, and floral notes. Very surprised to see this tequila at $19 a bottle..amazing value!

1794.Review: Agave, hay, and sawdust on the nose. Flavor bring agave and some light jalapeño with a medium finish that brings a slight tingle. Nothing too bold but not too light. Extreme value.

1795.Review: Aroma: clean and plain. Alcohol. Not even much agave Taste: very plain. I dont get much of anything. Almost like licking steel… which isnt bad? Raw agave maybe Finish: short. Watery. Not unpleasant but not anything to get excited about This almost tastes like a kirkland or espolon Tres agaves??

1796.Review: NOM 1588|NOM1588  - Tequilas El MexicanoHecho en Arandas JaliscoThe clean scent of cooked agave jumps out of my Stölzle Jarrito tasting glass. As I continue to nose this Blanco the clean agave scent turns buttery. There are faint hints of minerality, lime, pepper, anise, muted mint and fresh herbs. The peppery agave makes itself known right away. There’s a slight agave sweetness and some alcohol burn along with white pepper. There are some slight vegetal notes in the background. On the finish your have some lingering buttery agave and a peppery capsaicin mouthfeel. This affordable Blanco is a fun sipper and an excellent choice for craft cocktails. Salud!

1797.Review: NOM 1588 | Grass notes. nice agave aroma. pepper little heat, rough finish. not bad for the price. Repo is preferred

1798.Review: Nose- agave, grassy and vegetal, clay, minerals.Taste- cooked agave, minerals, melon, cinnamon, citrus, and a little bit of sweetness. Thin mouth feel.Finish- sweetness quickly fades leaving just a touch of cinnamon heat.Value- $40 in Michigan so it's a decent value! Updated review from a blind tasting - lolN- agave, nutmeg, green apple T- toasted agave, apple, bell pepper MF- medium body F- long peppery finish

1799.Review: Earth and mushroom on the nose. This has more viscosity than most and a quite sharp ethanol presence with some natural agave sweetness. Fades to a vegetal/savory taste that totally speaks to the nose.

1800.Review: NOM 1588|Served in a Nos’r stainless steel nosing glass. Nose is mint, agave, and light citrus. Light body, floral and citrus notes with a touch of cinnamon and pepper. A little thin and the finish isn’t incredibly complex but the mild and enjoyable heat lingers on the roof of the mouth. Super pleased with this at $299 pesos

1801.Review: NOM 1588|Aroma:  agave, fruitty, floral, minerals, slight mintFlavor:  apgave, spiceyFinish:  medium, tongue tingly

1802.Review: NOM 1588|38% ABV Mexican releaseInvigorating nose:   Fruity and floral with a toasted nutty feel to the agave that is prominent. There are earth and mineral notes and the aroma of sweet fennel resting in a musty root cellar. Also, baking spice and pepper make this an interesting nosing. Flavors:   Initial burst of bold cinnamon and jalapeño.  Followed up with with a balancing act of creamy almond paste, vanilla and white pepper zing. It coats the mouth in a rich fashion. This picks up a couple of points on value. A very nice bargain tequila.

1803.Review: NOM 1588|Pleasant minty aroma, oily body and great price! ($19). Only downside- can detect stainless steel process in sharpness, especially in the finish. A little copper would greatly improve this.

1804.Review: NOM 1588|Wow, a $19 Blanco that delivers significant bang for the buck. Has a bit of a funky almost lactic aroma. Feels super thick and oily in the mouth. The finish ends slightly rough but still pleasant.

1805.Review: NOM 1588|I found a dusty old bottle from 2015 at a local liquor store in Arizona! Needless to say I was very excited to try this one. Nose: at first this blanco was nothing but alcohol. I let this one sit for about ten minutes given the age. After about ten minutes it opened up and I got notes of mineralogy, agave and citrus but also still quite a bit of alcohol. Palate: the taste instantly reminded me of vacations in Mexico. Agave bomb for sure but also a ton of minerals, almost metallic. Citrus and pepper on the back end. Finish: this particular blanco actually left me with quite a bit of heat in my chest and throat. There was also a lingering bitterness. I’m glad I was able to experience this one. While it wasn’t my favorite it’s a great budget additive free option that has a finish much more stronger than a typical 80 proof. Would be a great mixer.

1806.Review: NOM 1588|Douce et très facile à boire.

1807.Review: NOM 1588|Lote: MEX38 14-12-21.Cooked agave, "hard" slightly metallic, herbal, pepper spiciness.

1808.Review: Blind taste testedAroma: Something hard to pinpoint, but delectable, almost pineapple. Also, light agave and citrus. Taste: Creamy, agave, pineapple, melonFinish: very minimal bite, melon, cooked agave, cinnamonI wrote down that, “I kinda love it.” I was very surprised to find out it was El Mexicano.

1810.Review: NOM 1588|Just a lot of cooked agaveMinimal pepperLess sweet more minerality Very little heat on the finish

1811.Review: NOM 1588|NOM 1588 This could be the best $20 tequila Blanco I have ever tasted. Don’t let the price fool you, this is a solid sipper. Excellent aroma and flavor with little to no burn, short finish. I can’t imagine anything better for this price point. Good stuff and additive free. Get it before it becomes popular because it will.

1812.Review: Nose has crisp clean agave with some mint, pepper and minerals. Taste hit with some nice peppery agave and minerals with that little minty notes. It leaves you with a lingering pepper agave finish with a creamy mouth feel. Good price, suggest to friends and would sip again.

1813.Review: finally another offering in my region that is additive free. the other being Tapatio. the nose is a bit underwhelming and perhaps a wee bit acetone. but agave is dominant just like I want for a Blanco. oily mouth feel agave ,pepper , bit of herbaceousness. finish is nice and warm but not as "full" as something higher end. all in all I will def keep this one beside my Tapatio for a nice Blanco sipper option.

1814.Review: This is an amazing tequila, is so easy to taste. Don’t have too much alcohol when you drink es it

1815.Review: NOM 1588|Crisp clean cooked agave, with some pepper, minerals.

1817.Review: NOM 1420|Really nice citrus and almond notes on front end but heavy ethanol burn finish

1818.Review: NOM 1588|2015 bottle from La Vinata in Chicago. Really good for the money. Amazing really for the bottle cost.

1819.Review: Nice legs on the glass so this one has a nice viscosity to it. On the nose it's has a robust aroma of baking spices with a hint if brine and citrus .Nice oily mouthfeel followed by an explosion of baking spices from the cooked agave.  getting citrus like orange peel and grapefruit followed by a hint if bitterness to even things out and on the finish it's a light sweetness. awesome everyday sipper at a bargain price!  I am stocking up!

1820.Review: really not a bad every day tequila. I have it at my office and will have it with ice at the end of the day

1821.Review: NOM 1588|Good nose with agave and fruit aroma. A prominent, up front agave flavor with cinnamon, pepper and a touch of jalape√±o. A decent finish. Very easy and enjoyable to sip. A bargain, but I would not feel cheap serving this one to friends.  I will buy this one again.

1822.Review: NOM 1588|Excellent flavor ,very well balanced,it does have the pure agave taste without chemicals or artificial aromas one of the best old fashioned Tequila Blanco

1823.Review: Made in Los Altos (highlands) of Jalisco, in the town of Arandas, by Leon Banuelos, the creator of Cazadores.

1824.Review: Reposados need to pay attention to this gem. One of faves today, although the older ones pre-2000 are my weapons of choice. Buttery soft with tons of warm cooked agave, macadamia, orange zest, melon, banana Gerber pudding, minerals, mint tea, damn this is fkn fantastic! Rating a 1998 bottle BTW, but even the newer ones are great, and under 45 bucks for a liter! Update: the 1 liter bottles are discontinued and replaced by the standard 750ml, which are still a steal!

1826.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave and vegetal, grassy notes. There is also some caramel, oak, and very light mint.Taste : Cooked agave, banana, and the same unique minerality you see in the Blanco. Some vanilla and caramel, and more grassy notes from the aroma. This is somewhat oily, and very light in flavor.Finish : Medium length with agave and caramel, and slightly bitter.This is another light bodied tequila. But the light flavor is not accompanied by any significant depth you might see in other brands. This is still fairly good though.

1827.Review: This tequila just makes me smile. Its fun. Distilled at La Altena, its not as refined as Ocho or aggressive as El Tesoro. Its the middle child. If the blanco is pears, this is a pear pie. Its really rounded out nice with agave forward taste with retaining the minerality of the blanco.  The baked agave is still dominating with a sweetness of butterscotch and vanilla.

1828.Review: No hidden agenda here, tastes like the Blanco with a touch of added sweetness and spice from the oak. Still loads of agave to be had, especially on the finish.

1829.Review: Nice nose:  Some mineral notes, melon, agave, a dried fruit of some sort?  Candied piña and honey. Butterscotch or caramel aroma. Very light oak. Flavor:  Banana bread spices, agave, anise, pepper, and oiliness on the tongue. Finishes with pepper, sweet agave and a bitter tang. There is also a musty note.

1830.Review: Strong agave nose with light vanilla notes. Medium to light viscosity. I've had much better bottles of Tapatio Repo- the agave in here smells a little green.

1832.Review: OyamelWashington DC$12a subtle and easy tequila.both the nose and tongue are soft, maybe too soft for the tequila purist.still you taste shadows of cooked agave and earthy herbs followed by sweet fruit.I'm shocked this is 40abv. a great tequila to introduce people to the agave world.

1833.Review: herbal nose with thyme, mint. zesty herbal entry, with menthol and black pepper. good balance, finish could be a bit stronger.

1834.Review: On the subtle side as far as aromas. Still pick up nice agave and spice/citrus...fairly thin mouth feel with a mellow finish/ very little alcohol" burn"

1835.Review: Slight Green Pepper nose Green ,sweet tart Agave , semi dry finish

1836.Review: Very unique and interesting. On the nose I get vegetal grass and raw agave. But, I also get a sweet note (possibly caramel) which makes me wonder if it's been very slightly aged. There also seems to be a hint of mint. The flavor is very mild but builds to a strong finish. If not for the finish I would wonder if it was watered down a bit. Much like the nose I get raw agave and mint on the taste. I just wish the flavors were stronger.

1838.Review: Aroma: agave, citrus, alcohol and spice. Flavors of black pepper, agave and vanilla. A short and somewhat sweet finish

1839.Review: Tasted blindNose - Agave and wood spiceTaste - Agave sweetness with oak char elements. Slight bitterness from caramelized oak and agave notes

1840.Review: The nose was like walking into a distillery, had sweet agave, light wood, flowers at the bottom of the glass. Pepper on the tongue, earthy and light agave and wood on the mouth. Anise on the finish.

1841.Review: Everyday tequila cant match this flavor for the price.

1842.Review: Rated blind. Sampled in Riedel Overture.Glass: Very pale straw color. Early tears dissipate into wide flat legs. Later tears are larger as the coating in the glass sheets away, leaving a number of pearls on the glass.Aroma: Initially sharp with agave, alcohol and mint, but becoming more complex as it quickly opens up, revealing baked agave, brown sugar, pepper and apple with a soft vanilla undertone. Excellent. Some nice caramel notes reveal themselves at the very bottom of the glass.Entry: Smooth and slightly sweet and buttery with a touch of pepper.Flavor: Big cooked agave notes, sweet butter, apple and black pepper with a hint of grapefruit. Excellent.Finish: Lots of wet pepper and sweet agave stay with you in the long finish.Conclusion: This is an excellent full-flavored light repo. Not a lot of barrel notes, but big on the agave.

1843.Review: Cooked Agave on the nose, with a little sweet vanilla and some alcohol. I get a hint of acetone and medicine on the back of the nose, which prevents it from being a great aroma. A lot of agave on the palate, with a very light barrel touch and and a bit of fun alcohol burn in the mid of the tongue, not too sweet. Medium to long finish with no bitterness. A good tequila, It lacks some complexity and balance to be an exceptional one but definitely fun and worth the price. One of my fav between the ones tasted

1844.Review: very peppery, tastes more peppery than I personally like for a Reposado

1845.Review: Serious agave on the nose. Wow! Pallet you get agave, cinnamon , balanced with a long finish. Sipper

1846.Review: This is a light tasting repo. I don’t get too much wood in it nor do I get the vanilla present in the Anejo. The price is fantastic and for a sub $45 bottle it’s the best additive free tequila you can buy, hands down

1848.Review: Has a little Scotchy taste to it, has a nice pepper aftertaste to it as well

1849.Review: Natural sweetness, pepper, barrel, lemon.Great value. Woody for a reposado.

1851.Review: Solid on the nose, not as great on the pallet but great nonetheless

1852.Review: Like most, strong agave and oak with vanilla. I honestly can’t tell if I really like this or not, seems to depend on the day. In the end I would recommend it, especially to agave purists and would buy another bottle if there weren’t so many more to try.

1856.Review: On the nose, cooked agave, oak and slight cherry sweetness. Taste: balanced oak and agave at entry, dried cranberry sweetness and anise in the background; not a note I like but it’s presence isn’t off-putting. On the Finish the oak continues with dried cranberry sweetness but once the oak dies the anise makes a faint appearance. Overall great additive free tequila for the price

1857.Review: Peppery. Burnt sugar. Little orange. Wood. Hits front palet hard then smooth.

1858.Review: Lot: R-0136. Big jug of 5 liters. Bottled 11/08/08.Color: very very pale yellow, almost transparent.Nose: sweet cooked agave! With very light herbal, menthol and mineral aromas that is just enough to maintain freshness of the sweet agave but doesn’t overpower. This sweetness of the cooked agave is very pure, again, like white rock sugar of sweet cooked agave essence, if it exists.Palate: mineral, sweet cooked agave, good sweet & sour balance, slightly citrus.Finish is medium, herbal & sweet cooked agave.

1859.Review: Vegetation, copper, agave, honey, mineral, vanilla

1860.Review: Sweet, additive free, smooth finish, easy drinking 6$ hh

1861.Review: Agave, oak, and pepper from start to finish.  Some touch of barreling.  Very nice and at a good price.

1863.Review: My good to mixer.  We’ll-made, smooth, oaky.  My #1 tequila, hands down.  Love it.  Thanks Carlos Camarena for carrying on the legacy.  Salud a todos!

1864.Review: Budget friendly repo, great notes of oak and cooked agave . This repo has a great balance of sweetness and oak on the nose and palate.

1865.Review: After trying Fortaleza mine and El Tesoro, tapatia reposado left much to be desired. I get mostly agave but with too much pepper and jalapeño forward with a long pepper finish. Not smooth like the other two mentioned. If you like a spicey tequila you would probably enjoy this. Not for me.

1866.Review: Aroma: sweet agave forward Taste: sweet, vanilla, pepper

1868.Review: Tapatio's Reposado is rested for 8 months in bourbon barrels. The character of this reposado is subdued, but is very well done. ($40 @ Old Town).  I want to echo Erica Boroom's evaluation, as she is spot on.Nose: Mellow oak bourbon barrel notes up front. Light cooked agave, and vanilla. Before this opens up, it can come across as Hay.  Faint  traces of banana, earth, and mint.Taste: Mild honey like sweetness, a macadamia nut butteriness, with some peppery warmth.  Mild cooked agave, carmel, slight vanilla, bell pepper, along with bourbon barrel notes are so well proportioned. The longer I sip this, the greater I appreciate what Tapatio has done with this one.Finish:  Simple. A little light cinnamon warth that sticks around for just a little while.

1870.Review: Tasting agave, a little leather, alcohol, black pepper. I’ve drank too much, can’t tell anything now.

1871.Review: This is a good, very traditional reposado. The aroma is the stand out here. All the regular aromas of cooked agave, some light sweetness with caramel, and definitely some fruit.  Taste and finish are both very good. There’s some good spice and pepper in it and some good warmth as it goes down.

1872.Review: One of my favorite Reposados. Personally prefer it over their Añejo expression. Very vegetal and herbaceous.

1873.Review: This repo smells and taste like the distillery! Agave, fermentation, wood. Everything you’re looking for in tequila.

1874.Review: I was expecting a harsh bite and never got it. Very easy to sip, silky, oily on the tongue with the glass resting makes me want more. Pepper and Agave present an aged flavors are present, but I can't describe them other to say they are complimentary,  not distracting.

1876.Review: First experience with Tapatio. This is a smooth, mellow, silky Reposado. Clean Agave forward taste with hints of vanilla and spice. Extremely smooth finish with no bad aftertaste. Solid solid. This should be treated as a sipper. Amazing quality for the price. Should be in every Tequila home bar as a common staple - como agua!! Lol.

1878.Review: Mostly agave aroma with the slightest hint of oak and vanilla.  Bursting cooked agave flavor with very slight cooking spice, vanilla & cooked pear.  Oily in the mouth and super smooth finish.  A very nice, understated reposado sipper.  Well done Tapatio!

1879.Review: Aroma notes: Menthol like icy hot, Spearmint, jalapeños, cooked sweet agave, lemon zest, floral, hint of vanilla, maybe brown sugar, citrus, and rosemary.Tasting notes: Very Hot, minerals, raw and cooked agave, mint, very clean tasting, little oak, white pepper

1880.Review: Very clean agave aroma with a slight sweet flavor but finish has a little bite.

1881.Review: A favorite Repo I enjoy often. This enhances the 80 proof  Blanco many notches in complexity to stand on its own as unique and most excellent. For Tapatio Blanco, the 110 expression is “the one”.

1882.Review: getting notes of nixtamal or not buttered pop corn. with a very green and crisp kiote fragrance and a burst of citrus (grapefruit)taste like roasted agave and cinnamon.  vanilla, oak and spices.. getting cucumber,  minerals, sweet honey tones and dehydrated fruit like pineapple papaya and apricot. finish is short but very flavorful..

1883.Review: Oh yeah , baby . From the moment you open it, you know this is a seriously great tequila . But of course it is, being from La Altena and one of the masters, Carlos Camarena and crew. Tons of sweet cooked agave on the nose and pallet . Smooth with a small good burn . No fake oak or vanilla here folks, and no heavy whisky/bourbon overtones … just the real deal . I fell in love with this long ago and it never disappoints. Could easily be my only tequila . Salud !

1884.Review: Very agave forward.  The true intention of the spirit. While it is not cheap by any means, at 1.45/ oz here in Buffalo,  it’s a better Price than many, many others not nearly as good

1885.Review: A version of their blanco with fruity/sweeter notes. This expression has subtle tasteful notes of oak & barrel spice. On the sweetness, I got dehydrated pineapple, caramel & vanilla (volteado de piña cake), along with earthy and mineral hints. Medium length finish with agave and butterscotch/honey sensations. Would love to see a higher ABV Reposado

1889.Review: The nose was light agave, heavy oak and vegetal. Almost like dirt. In the mouth it's as if I was sucking on a piece of wood or earth. All I could taste. Hard to believe this is the same juice as the blanco or anejo, as both are so much sweeter and bright. Finish was relatively nice, with more earth and some toasted agave.

1890.Review: peppery, agave forward, Bourbon barrel flavor comes through

1891.Review: Sweet, green agave on nose. Citrus and peppery with ripe agave taste. Slight burn but just at threshold. A very good Repo. After opening up and aerating burn is same but flavors balance more. Smell citrus candy and maybe I'm still too much of a novice but a very, very slight scent of bleach. Not enough to stop enjoyment but discernable (to me, anyway).

1892.Review: Very smooth, great aroma. No burn.

1893.Review: As expected, I love this expression from La Alteña.
