Aroma - sweet cooked agave Flavor - more sweet agave and slight vanilla, bell pepperFinish - smooth with lingering sweet agave and pepperThis has everything I like about El Tesoro with a smoother flavor and better value. Not quite as complex as Ocho but the agave flavor is great.

1894.Review: Fleshy agave on nose Alcohol present Vegetal on palate ++acid Slightly reductive on back of palate

1896.Review: excellent agave and honey sweetness with delicious aftertaste, not much on the nose but flavour more than makes up for it

1898.Review: aromas frutales, sobre todo a piñas frescas, sabor original y fuerte muy impregnado a frutas

1900.Review: stone fruit on the nose round tequila with agave and stone fruit sweetness finishes warm

1901.Review: This is what a repo is supposed to smell like, wow!  Sweet agave that balances well with barrel influence, joined by a caramel-ly buttery butterscotch.  They definitely just took the blanco and stuck it in a barrel...delicious.  The finish fades quick but at the same time lingers a couple minutes with faded caramel.  Very good!

1902.Review: Agave up front and light oak. Medium finish. It’s a decent Reposado, but it falls a little flat for me. Great value though!

1903.Review: Not much to add to this vs other comments... This is great. Simple. Oakey and caramel. Yummy. I did like the Blanco better. Huge butterscotch and oak vs vanilla. Am getting more cinnamon on the finish than most. Tasty. Definitely an evening sipper. Pricey at $74 CDN in Vancouver. Tapatio does NOT use additives to its Repo. So this is the real deal. A great basis for repos........

1905.Review: LOT TR-016US21/05/2019Warming and drying initial nasal impact.Cooked agave, oak, banana bread, baking spice on the aroma.Oily mouthfeel with sufficient alcohol.Caramelized agave is upfront followed by baking spice, honey, slight vanilla and slight oak on a very balanced flavor. A hint of the bourbon barrel shows some ankle in the background. Some orange marmalade on the retro nasal.A medium to long finish is where the pepper creeps in nicely.Another great aged expression from Carlos Camarena where the agave still is the star of the show (as it should be). This is a must have reposado. Extremely well balanced, easy to pick up flavors, but not an overly complex (a tribute to Carlos Camarena, because the agave shines through). Certainly a top reposado for me. Added plus - great price point, 1 ltr bottle and a screw cap for easy travel. Could sip it all night.

1906.Review: cooked agave, caramel, oak and a little mint on the nose, Bananas, cooked agave, vanilla little pepper on the palate.  great for cocktails.

1907.Review: Very oaky aroma but clean fresh taste. Will have it with tacos to cut off the fats

1908.Review: Tasted at Taco Guild in Phoenix

1909.Review: A great example of a reposado. All of the agave forward flavor of the blanco, with a touch of the oak and butterscotch that the añejo offers. The whole Tapatío line is great, can’t go wrong with their reposado.

1910.Review: Sweet agave with light oak opening to herbs and vanilla. Medium body with sweet mellow in palate, lots of white pepper and herbs. Medium finish. Fantastic value. Nice Reposado that keeps fruit in front while infusing with some oak.Tried a second bottle- very consistent.

1911.Review: Agave and oak on the nose, giving way to butterscotch and a peppery aroma. More wood influence follows with vanilla, caramel, and toffee notes. After opening up, herbal and fruity scents can also be detected. The flavors are similar with agave and oak taking on the starring role. Nice bite from the white pepper, then mellows out into rich, buttery caramel-covered cherry taste. Very pleasant.

1912.Review: A cool repo, sweet but peppery. Smooth finish, that leaves a tingle.

1913.Review: I may be somewhat biased towards Tequila Tapatio, my earliest childhood memories are from Arandas Jalisco and it’s tequila industry.  We lived very close to Destileria La Alteña.  The agave aroma from Tequila Tapatio brings me beautiful nostalgia.  Tequila Tapatio is my North Star from which I judge all my Tequilas.  Aroma is definitely cooked agave forward (lots of agave) did I mention agave?, subtle oak, citrus, with a matching flavor that coats all the senses.  A slow low heat finish that fades like a sunset.

1914.Review: So much cooked Agave flavor in this tequila, it's a surprise that it is so affordable!

1915.Review: I’m a huge tapatio fan but this is not as good as I remember it a few years ago. Still a good tequila but feels a little flat all round for me.

1916.Review: Nice green nose, with great cooked agave throughout.On the palette there is an earthy tone which is followed by heat that I find to be slightly unappealing. Finish is dry and slightly bitter.A bit disappointing after the blanco.

1917.Review: Agave forward aroma with a light oaky character. Very light in colour, but earthy and bitter on the palate and to finish.

1918.Review: So a lot of people talked about this one. I couldn't get it in AZ, so we came to Baja and found it. Tapatio is a great tequila. Nothing disappointing about it. Beautiful nose, taste and finish. If you can find one, it's worth your time. Complex straw, butterscotch and cooked agave on the nose. Vanilla, butter and carmel in the mouth. Citrus, dried cherries and banana in the finish. This pairs very well with passillas and aniheim pepper dishes and 72 percent dark chocolate desserts.

1919.Review: Me encanta, de mis favoritos del Valle.Notas frutales, roble, anis. Me encanta el aroma y la sensación del primer trago.Excelente Tequila y gran valor!

1921.Review: Light agave with heavy burn of alcohol on the nose; alcohol scent overwhelms any other notes; on the palette, again, heavy alcohol presence; slight buttery taste on the backend with more alcohol burn; trying to figure this one out...I love their XA & Blanco, but this one is a bit of a letdown; Tapatio is usually a good value due to their bottle size, 1 liter; probably will not purchase another Tapatio Reposado, though.

1922.Review: Beautiful fruity nose, taste is agave with some definite wood notes, a nice medium spice and a lovely finish, which just keeps hanging around. Every single thing about this tequila, from the packaging to the juice to the price is authentic old-school. An excellent Reposado.

1923.Review: nice fruity agave nose and taste light oak on the finish. good repo

1924.Review: Aroma a caramelo, mantequilla, agave cocido, moras, cacahuate, sabor muy limpio conserva sus aromas esenciales naturales, solo un poco de bsrrica, recomendado para quien no le gusten mucho los a√±ejos

1925.Review: As much as I like the Blanco and XA, i found the Repo to be just ok. The nose is similar to the blanco but with more alcohol and less agave. The miss in the Repo is mid tongue to finish for me. The finish is astringent and alcohol IMO.

1926.Review: I just love this stuff. I have not heard any chatter about it good or bad so I wasn't expecting much, but I was surprised. I will definetly try to keep it on hand for friends.

1927.Review: This is a very light tasting tequila, and very smooth.  Scent is somewhat floral and citrusy - maybe a bit of vanilla.  The taste is awesome - very light, clear agave influence and very little bite (just enough).  Very nice.  Purchased this in Playa del Carmen, Mexico and it is probably the best value I have encountered.

1931.Review: 5/12Wow, what a great tequila, even after aging it showcases the agave beautifully with pepper, eucalyptus, jasmine on a bed of maple and cinnamon. On the palate is where the barrel aging really showed with honeyed characteristics, white pepper and a hint of cardamom. Fantastic!The finish is just as it should be. Lingering just in the back of my mouth, a subtle reminder of a beautiful spirit. Overall one of the most pleasurable tasting experiences I have had!

1932.Review: Strong agave aroma with a flavour that lingers in the mouth. Tasted in a riedel tequila glass.

1933.Review: Butter, cooked agave and nuts on nose. Big spice, tobacco and choc on palate, touch of honey.

1935.Review: Aroma: earthy, smoke, spicy pepper, citrus, floral. Flavor: spicy, very earthy, smoke. Nice long lasting finish

1936.Review: Nice aroma and viscosity.  Obviously on the sweet side, but very enjoyable as an after dinner drink.

1937.Review: NOM 1466|Big notes of toffee and vanilla and brown sugar. Last of Carmel and brown sugar finishes sweet of brown sugar.

1938.Review: Aroma: Cooked agave, caramel, and vanilla.Taste: A nice blend of the cooked agave and vanilla.Finish: Easy-drinking, smooth finish that accentuates the taste, with a a slight alcohol bite.Overall: Hands down the best bang for your buck añejo out there, a real treat.

1939.Review: Very well made. Balance cooked agave & barrel aging

1940.Review: Don Pilar AnejoThis Anejo has a very pleasant nose of sweet cooked agave and buttery caramel. I get some light honey notes, fresh fruit and some light spices from the Virgin American White Oak barrels. I taste creamy cooked agave and peppery barrel spices then some warm honey. There is a nice mouthfeel and some pepper and alcohol tingle on the finish like a nice warm hug. This is a nice Anejo with some depth. I get more on the nose than the pallet but it’s a good sipping Anejo. I’m positive it’s additive free. Go get some! Salud!

1941.Review: Aroma : Wood/oak, caramel, vanilla butter, cooking spices, citrus, agave. It's like sniffing tequila and whiskey at the same time.Taste : Cooked agave, citrus, caramel. Some of bourbon notes here like the caramel, and also oak, vanilla and almond.Finish : Fairly long with vanilla, oak, spice and agave.Medium bodied and many flavors that bear resemblance to bourbon. If you also happen to be a bourbon fan like me, this tequila is a must.

1942.Review: Deep amber color. Loads and caramel and butterscotch on the nose, some vanilla and oak as well and agave too. Slight hit of pepper followed by and hints of fruit and agave... finishes with oak and leather tannins. Short to medium finish, with some lingering heat.

1944.Review: Love this juice !! A bit thin on the mouth feel but an awesome fruity , woody , caramel aroma . Not too sweet , not too dry with a bit of citrus , vanilla and nutty flavors . Goes down rather nicely !!

1945.Review: A wonderful aroma and flavor of caramel and oak. This tequila is silky smooth and easy to drink.

1947.Review: out of the full bottle I let it breathe for a few. I noticed the aroma got more bold with a few mins. light oak on the nose, followed by molasses. sweet, but easy.wonderful lazy summer night taste. oak and honey are strong, but not over powering with a sweet lingering finish.Azul Latin KitchenSouth Lake Tahoegreat menu of tequila$11bottle fullrequested champagne glassqueso fortido and carnitas

1948.Review: Blind rated. This one has a beautiful aroma, with loads of caramel, oak and dried fruits. Some sweetness and that little mint, which I perceived throughout the samples. On the palate is balanced with a medium mouthfeel. Again Caramel and oak, although less than expected from the aroma and the same goes for a mild sweetness, which for me is a plus in an añejo (I tend to dislike over-oaked and very sweet añejos). This is a well done añejo. It's definitely my favorite one in the line, although I would have liked a bit more of complexity and oiliness. I could drink this one all night.

1949.Review: Strong note of caramel and a slight hint of oak on the nose. The flavor is a lot less sweet than I was expecting. I definitely get a lot of oak but it's not too overpowering. The finish is nice and lingers for quite some time. I wish the flavor was a little more complex (maybe hitting that caramel note more) but overall a good Anejo.

1950.Review: Sweet, peppery with a dry finish

1951.Review: This really works for my palate. I get apples and dried cherries in the nose. More of the same on the body along with vanilla and caramel. I could a longer finish with some spice at the end. Great value at about $35.

1952.Review: -tasted blind-Balanced aromas of agave, oak, vanilla, yeast and light cinnamon with moderate-high alcohol presence. Moderately sweet taste of agave, vanilla. Somewhat hot finish - uniformly vanilla.

1953.Review: Tasted blind Nose - Caramel and spice Taste - Barrel spice and caramel sweetness with some alcohol numbingFinish - Medium length sweet finish

1954.Review: vanilla and gardenia nose, nice. entry is not as sweet as expected, but nice tannic tea. slightly green like chewing on grass, finishes a little bitter.

1955.Review: Rated blind after aeration. Aroma: kind of a green funk (mint, green agave?), agave, chocolate? Flavor: Bourbon and spice. Finish: Dry, tannins, spice. (.57)

1956.Review: Rich in flavors of cooked agave and tropical fruits layered with barrel notes of toasted oak, caramel, spices, with a pleasant finish.  With a flavor profile dominated by barrel notes, this Añejo is recommended, especially for Bourbon drinkers.

1957.Review: Rated high in value because this can be bought at Costco

1958.Review: nose honey cherry citrus taste lovely orange cherry nutty spicy warm peppery finish stainless distilled only and lacking copper distillation that may have improved thus Anejo

1959.Review: Caramel, oak, agave, cinnamon,vanilla finished off by some more sweetness and soft pepper. This sips dry like a whiskey and has the oak and vanilla, caramel properties to it. Great value at $37.99 in So. Cal when I purchased this last spring. Fantastic budget Anejo that would be very pleasant to sip or killer on some good cocktails.

1960.Review: Tequila finish, not as sweet or Carmel

1961.Review: Classic Anejo. Solid oak, vanilla, and caramel notes. Nice finish.

1962.Review: Aroma- agave, ok, caramel, butterscotch, more developed than the repoTaste- agave, oak, caramelFinish- baked agave, alcohol, light caramel

1963.Review: If I wanted bourbon I would have bought bourbon. Super disappointed in this.

1964.Review: Very whiskey-like. But also a pleasant drink. Light and balanced overall, despite the heavier barrel flavors. Good one to use for an agave old fashioned or any cocktail where you’re subbing tequila for bourbon or whiskey.

1965.Review: Starts out with a lot of cinnamon, agave, light vanilla and caramel notes with a subtle hint of salinity leading to a smooth long finish.

1966.Review: If you’re a whiskey fan (especially bourbon) then I highly recommend giving this one a chance. This is one I keep coming back to since it’s pretty accessible for me and at $30 a bottle I’d say it’s a nice deal. I get notes of vanilla, oak, caramel, ground black pepper with a slight fruity agave sweetness both in the nose and palate and no burn. Nose isn’t as strong as the palate but this is one to definitely enjoy on these colder nights.

1967.Review: Generous aromas of vanilla, orange peel and toffee. Rich full mid palate with a warm and round texture. Slightly subtle anise or Tarragon highlights. The finish is clean with a long and graceful ending. No hot burn.

1969.Review: It has a sweet aroma, caramel, vanilla.The taste is good a little spicy finish , but a good tequila.

1970.Review: i keep a bottle on hand so when i have friends that come over to vist and just want to have shots, this is what they get . 35 bucks .

1971.Review: Rich, thick, bourbony, caramelly. If you enjoy extra-anejos then this one is for you.

1973.Review: alcohol with some vanilla aroma. not peppery.

1974.Review: Charred oak, a little more on the sweeter note on the nose.The amount of cooked agave on the palate is delightful and rich. The oak does not overpower it.

1975.Review: wasn’t the worst i’ve had, as in not repulsive bad but bad from a category of almost decent but falling quite short. thin, alcohol taste, no presence blahhh

1976.Review: For the dinero a great quality tequila

1977.Review: This is the embodiment of a ‘bourbon style tequila’... If that even makes sense. Oak and sweetness on the nose, Demerara sugar on the palette. Whiskey barrel finish.

1979.Review: Rich amber color, nice nose. Smooth cooked agave flavor. One of my go-to tequilas...

1980.Review: Nice bottle but not worth the cost of admission. it has a distinct smell that says  I am younger than I seem. the taste is not bad at all, smooth to the lips but when it hits your throat you'd say...way to young to be anejo. Drinking a  few of these and your more than likely to start a fight.

1981.Review: Has a Canadian whiskey aroma to it. Little bit of a burn Not bad, but not sure I'd buy again.

1982.Review: Rich flavor and smooth finish. I wish I hadn't opened ( and finished ) my autographed bottle

1983.Review: Spicy with a bit of burn, but not much. I think a bit overpriced for what you get, unique because it's so spicy. I don't mind the spice but rarely looking for that in an anejo. I'd buy it on a really good sale, but there are just better alternatives for around the same price. I don't ever expect much agave in anejos, but it's pretty much completely gone here, which I don't love.

1984.Review: It had a light taste. Easy drink. Tastes of sweet caramel and vanilla extract. Very nice

1985.Review: Great pepper!! Love this type of Anejo!! It's pretty hot on the pallet.

1986.Review: Extremely smooth, no heat, but little in the way of flavor. Medium mouthfeel, slightly sweet. Light, but excellent.

1987.Review: A modest scent as it hits the nose. Definite smell of cooked agave along with walnut and pepper. The legs appear short and the initial taste lacks the familiar sweetness and fruitiness I enjoy. It's a bit harsh with a strong alcohol on the attack. The taste is nothing special but the finish, like the smaller of the two kids in a fist fight, packs a surprising punch. A nice finish.

1988.Review: Walks like crème brûlée, talks like crème brûlée, must be made of liquified crème brûlée!!! Really delicious, I haven’t had it in years and it’s amazing in every way!

1989.Review: For fans of VERY aged tequilas, this may be a great choice. However, it's gone too far for my preferences.

1992.Review: less sweet than imagined. cannot feel special. very smooth and noble but nit unique.

1993.Review: big sweet aroma, very mellow flavours, ultra smooth.

1994.Review: Excellent excellent flavour, smell and finishLots of caramel notes, smooth finish

1995.Review: Sweet caramel and vanilla aroma Bourbon like taste and good finish

1997.Review: Nose is bursting with sherry, nice fruit and tobacco.On the palette you get some initial dry/bitterness and then a long slightly sweet finish. Lovely fruitcake notes all the way through.

1998.Review: Just re rated this and was surprised by my initial low rating. Lots of agave on the nose despite the 5yr age, sweetness from the sherry cask but not overpowering. Little light on the palate but good flavour. Nice lingering finish.

1999.Review: Only had a taste so I cannot evaluate the taste fully.  It is clearly a bomb for the senses with fruit oak and agave coming through in a balanced way.  My rating may even go higher with a full pour at some later date.

2000.Review: I don't know how much better a Tequila can be. I have gone to El Agave in San Diego for the past 6 years and this is always the first and last Tequila I will drink there

2001.Review: To my pallet this Tequila hit a cord. I have the 10 year variety and a word I use to describe it is delicious. Heavy oak presence and not a lot of agave left to pull out. I love XA's and this spoke to me. If you are not an XA fan, you may not care for this Tequila.

2002.Review: Very interesting expression. Very floral on the nose with orange blossom, lime leaf and honeysuckle. The flavors are rich with agave, vanilla, raisins and unmelted butter.

2003.Review: Very unique start to the nose:  flowery, vanilla, citrus and agave. It has a light and airy sensation to it. Vanilla, pepper and spicy. Some apple nuance. Bitter/sweet. Finish doesn’t evolve much from the initial impressions. But interesting expression.

2004.Review: Cooked agave, light oak flavor, butter, pepper

2005.Review: Agave, oak, mineral, mineral, celery, jalapeños, spice, Carmel,

2006.Review: I just loved the fruity notes as apple, pear, ????????????

2007.Review: Another one of Espolon's unique expressions that it hard to find outside of Mexico.The Chardonnay barrel aging adds a little butter, vanilla smoothness without being overpowering.Worth trying if you can find it.I liked their Bourbon barrel aged reposado better,  but that's me.

2008.Review: Frosted glass bottle from around 10 years ago. Still vibrant even being open for some time. Aromas of agave and fennel present and this has a nice viscosity in the mouth. Slight  bitterness as the fennel loses focus on the finish hold this back a bit. Solid stuff.

2009.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2009.Review: Very good xa, on the lighter side for a 10 yr xa, sweet cooked agave shines in this bottle

2010.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2010.Review: Very light for a XA but full of agave and barrel flavors …. Soft profile

2011.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2011.Review: Lot 70 of 122. An amazing nose and taste. Nice fruit with some heat, caramel, vanilla, apricot/fruit, orange citrus. Sweet agave passing through, and not all oak with the 10 yr aging. Taste has a sweetness with alcohol (but not excessive for a 110 proof), caramel, vanilla, raisen/apricot. orange citrus. Amazing!!

2012.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2012.Review: Owned a couple of these over the past 20 years. This is a terrific bottle for XA enthusiasts. Nose has deep notes of almond, slight vanilla. Smooth across the front, slight caramel mixed with agave. More of the same notes on the back end. Too much aging for my taste, but XA drinkers will love. Unfortunately, unable to recall what I paid, but I know it wasn’t cheap!

2013.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2013.Review: this tequila us really good. we went thru several bottles a few yrs ago. overall sweet but not artificial with a bit of oak but not an oak bomb. well balanced

2014.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2014.Review: Way too much barrel aging for me, personally, overwhelms the tequila, but clearly an exceptional and well made example of being exactly what it is supposed to be. If Extra Anejo is your thing, but it.

2015.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2015.Review: It’s a whiskey lovers tequila. It is heavy on vanilla and caramel, with some earthy spice. Agave is there, but it blends into the sweetness. I’m a whiskey lover and adore this bottle. It’s not what I would call ‘traditionally’ perfect, but it’s an excellent bottle.

2016.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2016.Review: This is my all time favorite and only score it 97 because I have never given anything in life a perfect score.  This is genuinely a slow sipping slice of heaven.  Señor Orendain has crafted a barrel strength Tequila for the ages.  It is additive free and it's Carmel overtones occupy the majority of my taste buds with a heavy Agave character and a taste of honey.  I would choose an evening sipping this over anything that wasn't a night of wild passion with Heather Graham.  if you can get some, do not miss out.

2017.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2017.Review: This is smooth and citrus blast... kinda reminds me of the move starship pain. Smooth move but with a bright slam at the end...bottle 128 of 170, Barrel# CLXX

2018.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2018.Review: Nice sweet agave for an extra Anejo. When I did a tasting at el Murcielago Tequileria in Monterey, MX, Arette extra Anejo was a  stand out for the way it expressed the fruit. Good bit of jalapeño, bell pepper and oiliness of oak in the nose, light bodied entry, orange and citrus spice in finish along with vanilla, apricot, chocolate. At $100+, it is still a great value and lot of nuanced complexity.

2019.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2019.Review: Warm orange oil, oak silkiness long finish.   No overflash Of pepper/heat.

2020.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2020.Review: Smooth Tequila.Caramel/Vanilla Tastefinish is a bit on the spice side

2021.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year

2022.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year

2023.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2023.Review: This was recommended, excellent bargain for the quality and taste.. will always have a bottle in my collection

2024.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2024.Review: I love this one.  You can really tell it’s a lowland despite the heavy oaking; it’s got lots of vanilla, caramel, dark chocolate and orange, but also a very unique mushroom flavour which I have yet to find anywhere else.  Too bad it’s so expensive or I’d drink it all the time.

2025.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2025.Review: Just kinda there...nothing necessarily remarkable. Fairly smooth but odd aroma and harsh finish. Then again I am new to Tequila and my favorite so far is Dos Artes Especial...that said I have had a few others that I have liked more.

2026.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2026.Review: They make a 55% that cannot be purchased in the States,  it’s made in very limited batches and not every year.  I have a bottle #55 of 125, and yes this is validated by the family of the Distillery.   This is a very fine example a true sipping tequila, and not just with anyone, but for someone who appreciates the craft.  The final roll of the back of the tongue is what separates this from everything else.  Do not ruin this with a slice of pear, orange etc,  keep it as neat as possible and enjoy.

2027.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2027.Review: Great find.  Expensive but still at a better price point than competing brands, especially for the quality of this tequila.  Smooth, not too peppery, not too sweet....just right with a nice warm finish.  This will definitely be one of my top favorites.

2028.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2028.Review: This bottle is amazing a true Mexican tequila not some white washed thing for the USA raw and real delicious!!! And for the price you cannot beat it

2029.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year

2030.Tequila: Arette Gran Clase Extra Añejo 10 Year
2030.Review: Big vanilla & peach nose.  Warm sweet flavor with a sharp alcohol burn at the end.

2031.Review: On the nose, very potent caramel and nuts, pecan or walnuts, some pecan definitely. Very reminiscent of pecan pie for me. A little bit of whiskey, and some agave but very little. On the palate, I’m definitely getting that caramel, and honey, but a nice hint of red apple. The oak is surprisingly not overpowering for an 8yr XA. Very nutty and toffee sweet, delicious. For $109.99 on their website, this is a great value XA. The finish is long and nutty, so good. Almost right there with Tapatio Excelencia for me.

2032.Review: Nose:   Caramel apple, vanilla, cinnamon and cloves. Slow cooked agave with oak woodiness present on the nose. Some dark ripe fruit adds another layer of interest. Also picking up some mineral notes and grapefruit.  A touch of sweet leather. Flavors:   Silky almond, hazelnut nuttiness, feisty pepper zing with a nutmeg retrohale. Hints of pencil shavings. You know this has been aged in whiskey barrels, but with restraint. Finish:   Nice. Licorice, tummy warming pepper and toffee leave you with a memorable and mouth filling experience.

2033.Review: Has the original blanco’s green apple aroma/flavor, with caramel and oak. Not too sweet. Slightly dry finish balances the agave sweetness.

2034.Review: I was very lucky to receive a sample from a good friend (thank you, Remy). Before sampling this tequila, I was a bit nervous. Having tried the other Suerte expressions, I still didn't know what to expect. Aroma: Oak, caramel, toffee, green apple, honey, and slight alcohol. I really like the nose on this.Flavor: Oak, spice, slight pepper, caramel, and still some faint agave at the end. Finish is on the longer side, but the flavor starts mellowing out somewhat quickly.Overall, a good extra añejo that's easy to drink. I wish, however, that it offered a bit more personality and complexity.

2035.Review: Great aroma of Fruit,agave,honey,oak,caramel. Taste of agave,honey,fruit,cinnamon,oak,vanilla.Finish Starts with light sweetness and finishes dry.

2036.Review: I like all Suerte tequilas I have tried so I was excited about this one.In short: very good but not blown away. Once you factor in price, I’m not sure worth the experience. Lovely aroma.  Flavors of honey creme brûlée. Honey and caramel dominate. Vanilla. Roasted agave. Wet clay and a little white pepper. Silky mouthfeel.  On the sweet side but not cloying. There is oak and wood present but nice because not over-bearingly so.It does open up well. I just upped my rating a tad.

2037.Review: Very nice XA from the mind of Felipe this was provided by the brand as a 100ml sampler along with the Blanco and Reposado. I've nursed this in small tastes of 10 to 15ml for as long as I could. This has a good balance between the oak flavors from aging and the sweet fruitiness of the roast agave. Made at El Pandillo with only well water, this doesn't strike me of having the minerality of another product made with only well water, Tequila Terralta. Nor does it with other raters as it is mentioned by no one and isn't listed in the 12 notable aromas and tastes on the app product page. Aerated as are several other products from 1579 it has a pleasing easy to sip character. I think price equals value here with the state of current tequila pricing.

2038.Review: Brian and Don Vicente were kind enough to gift me a sample of the blanco, repo and XA, and I am so grateful for it.On the nose, very fruity, caramel, vanilla and agave. The fruitiness is gorgeous and really sticks out. Something almost like toffee and a little bit of oak. A touch of apricot.On the palate, the fruitiness definitely shines. A little spicy, amazing natural sweetness. Very delicious and I can’t wait for this to come to California. The whole lineup is fantastic and this XA is absolutely no exception.

2039.Review: It’s extremely rare to find an extra Añejo with agave all over it but here we are. This might rub XA drinkers the wrong way, it’s light on vanilla and baking spice, not very cognac(esk). Excellent stuff.

2040.Review: Blind sampleNose- soft and elegant, vanilla, agave, wet earth, oak Taste- cooked agave, over-ripe fruit, raisin, vanilla, caramel, baking spiceMouthfeel- thin and oilyFinish- medium, soft, and wonderful

2041.Review: If you can find this, grab it. It’s an excellent XA that still manages to retain agave aromas and flavors. Vanilla and caramel aromas and flavors with some dried fruit on the finish. Super pleasant crowd pleaser.

2042.Review: Fruity, floral, honey, and earthy on the nose, the juicy aroma is fantastic! On taste I also get some light vanilla, oak, and agave to balance out the flavors. Like all 1579 the oak complements and doesn’t overpower. Combined with the softness from oxygenation and this is really easy and pleasant to drink.

2043.Review: Delicious, a great product from El Pandillo. Hits all the right notes that Terralta XA hits for me with the minerality blending so good with the vanilla, oak and cooked agave. The oxygenation is clearer on the finish making it dangerously easy to drink like Volans. Nevertheless it still keeps you thinking and wanting to taste more.

2044.Review: Smells exactly like Terralta xa, light honey, earthy scent, more intense flavors than the repo.  Excellent xa with strong agave notes.

2045.Review: Don Vicente XARight away I’m met with that fruity highland agave scent. It’s stone fruits (cherry, peaches, mangos and plums) and then the buttery cooked agave. There are hints of oak, caramel and vanilla. The nose is so juicy that it’s hard to let it rest. The buttery cooked agave and baking spices (nutmeg, anise & vanilla) hit right up front. There’s some light pepper notes and oak notes that follow. A nice alcohol tingle is present and the agave sweetness carries from beginning to end. There’s nothing dry about this excellent XA.This XA is NOM1579 goodness. Its mature estate grown agave that’s cooked in Felipe’s unique stone ovens before it’s shredded by Igor and then crushed by Felipestein. It’s then fermented in jacketed stainless steel tanks with  before being double distilled in copper stills. After that the tequila is oxygenated to help unify the flavors and soften the mouthfeel.Currently this tequila is only in Texas but its worth seeking. Salud!

2046.Review: By production notes, this is similar to Terralta extra añejo, but with oxygenation. This is definitely a different product, though. The nose is different, and to me, has a very nice apple characteristic (may be perceived differently by others). I have found this apple like note common amongst aged products out of El Pandillo, which I really like, but it's much more vibrant in this one. The peppery notes present in the blanco and reposado are less pronounced as more oak characteristics take over from the long aging process; these oak characteristics are still quite subtle, likely due to the subsequent use of older barrels, which is common at El Pandillo. The finish is medium in length and the peppery notes come out for a bit.

2047.Review: It’s extremely rare to find an extra Añejo with agave all over it but here we are. This might run XA drinkers the wrong way, it’s light on vanilla and baking spice, not very cognac(esk). Excellent stuff.

2048.Review: NOM 1443|This tequila is a little disappointing considering how much I’ve enjoyed the rest of the lineup. All the obvious oak tasting notes are here in some degree but no discernible agave and the finish is not entirely pleasant.

2050.Review: Aroma: Incredibly sweet. Strong notes of caramel and vanilla with a hint of pepper, mint and agave. There also might be a slight note of almond.Flavor: It's very sweet upfront and slightly sweet on the finish. In between though it takes on a very medicinal and bitter flavor. I really wanted to love this based on the aroma but the flavor is lacking.*Blind Tasting*

2051.Review: This is a wonderfully aged tequila that smells fantastic, tastes rich and thick, and has a long and pleasing finish that you don't want to ever go away. At 100 proof, it packs a punch, but does so with style and class.

2052.Review: NOM 1443|Nose: Toast, vanilla, raw agave and baking spices. Palate: barrel char smoke, same toast, vanilla and baking spices but less raw agave and more cooked agave. Finish is long and smoky, almost reminiscent of a single malt from the highlands.

2053.Review: NOM 1443|Oak on the nose, there is some agave on the taste, not totally overshadowed by the oak thing…

2054.Review: NOM 1566|Ok to good Añejo. Nothing special going on but nothing offensive either. Even.

2055.Review: Good flavour but slightly masked by the ethanol burn. Better when water added. Oak, vinella and Carmel flavor

2056.Review: Aromas of oak & agave, flavors of caramel, cinnamon, agave & slight honey.  Smooth finish.  Very nice Añejo.

2057.Review: NOM 1443|Clean nose of citrus. Sweet cream, vanilla and lime flavors. Crisp with a medium finish of white pepper.

2058.Review: NOM 1443|100 proof is too strong to drink on its own. Try with and ice cube

2059.Review: Eye: light gold with slow fat legs.Nose: Meaty with oak up front. Vanilla and wet earth then some cooked agave. Fresh spearmint and green peppers follow after it's had a chance to breathe.Palate: Comes on hot. Full body. Sweet bourbon. Vanilla and caramel are most prominent. Some cooked agave and red grapes. Light ethanol.Finish: Warm with black pepper. The cooked agave is most apparent here with some minerality. Long.Conclusion: A loud añejo with some very pronounced flavors. A solid tequila and great introduction for those coming from Bourbon.

2061.Review: NOM 1443|Spice, light tropical fruit, cinnamon, cassia, orange, bitter orange, minerals

2062.Review: NOM 1443|Batch 08, NOM 1443, light gold color, slight oaky aroma, nice oily feel & for 100 proof not too hot on the spicy finish

2063.Review: NOM 1443|Too much burn for an añejo

2064.Review: Pretty good all around (aroma, taste and finish) and best of the three main expressions.

2065.Review: NOM 1443|Very strong, can definitely taste the 100 proof

2067.Review: Tequila Tuesdays at Hooters in Sacramento? Yes it’s real! 5$ shots of Dulce Vida Anejo.  I’ve had the blanco and was almost choked out by it. The Anejo however is quite good, and 5$ shots makes it all the better. I had written off Dulce Vida but now it’s back on my radar. It has almost no aroma but the severe burn of the blanco is also gone. Flavor is light, very light but hints of agave and oak are noticeable. Short finish but did I mention it was 5$!  Thanks Joey for talking me into it.

2068.Review: Nice oak flavor compliments the agave.. decent finish.. enjoyed but nothing special.. overall just decent

2069.Review: Aroma is very desert like with lots vanilla,Carmel sweetness with hints of oaks and mint. Med-thick body with oily feel, the oak notes come forward with some spicy notes. You can feel the 100 proof in the finish.

2071.Review: Ok in a pinch - not going out of my way to purchase.

2072.Review: Earthy in aroma and taste. Mildly sweet finish

2073.Review: appearance:golden honey; glacial slow tearssmell:mint, grass, wet claytaste: difficult to describe; very complex main taste is of grass and wet clay/cement definite earthy notesfinish:amazing very slow finish; aftettaste of mint

2074.Review: NOM 1443.  Tasted at home on a Riedel glass.  Medium gold champagne in color.  Almost no alcohol in the nose.  Aroma of slight oak and leather notes, but not strong or too complex.  This follows through with the taste as well, not overly complex.  Very smooth for 100 proof.  Like the other Deluce offerings, they are all good, but not exceptional.  At least from this NOM. B-

2076.Review: It was a little too alcohol-y for me. I enjoyed it but I prefer a smoother tequila. The burn lasted all the way through the finish.

2077.Review: This is an unusually strong tequila (100 proof) and hence traditional tasting methods don't work. The aroma is potent (not in a good way), but for those with a good nose, it'll be easy to sniff several types of spices (easiest being vanilla). The flavor is difficult to decipher, but the finish is quite pleasant.

2078.Review: Finally tasted it. Definitely warm agave from beginning to end. Banana pudding, apple pie, dried fruit, cinnamon, honey. Glad I finally experienced it. T1 was solid. Word has it that it might make a return.

2079.Review: Expected a little more taste after the great nose/taste of the ultra fino.  Not a game changer but decent. Nose is great, flavor dies to fast.

2080.Review: Smells like creme brûlée, tastes like old fashioned doughnuts, what’s not to like?!? A completely unique flavour profile.

2081.Review: Aroma has a vegetal scent. Flavor shows green agave. Finish is a bit harsh. Great for mixing cocktails!

2082.Review: OyamelWashington DC$15champagne glasshalf bottlesurprisingly softer nose than the blanco. almost too soft. sweet and candy like, the nose would be great for a first timer.the licorice is gone from the blanco. now it's very herbal on the tongue. sage, eucalyptus and black pepper. soft, subtle and sweet.Easy finish.

2083.Review: An oaky ultra fino. Flavors are very subtle.

2084.Review: I get more alcohol in the nose than I like and the finish lacks the pepper I like in agave harvested in the highlands. The body I like a lot. Citrus, floral notes, baked agave, pepper. A softer nose, maybe a wee bit more time in the barrel and I would be happier.

2085.Review: First sip is sharp. It mellows after the second shot.

2086.Review: This taste of t1 reposado, came from a friend,, and I really want to say that something went wrong at some point, with what we have.  And yes, I did taste this blind.  I've had the t1 repo several times, and I remember it being tastier than this particular bottle.  While the nose is nice, there are some burnt notes and raw wood tones, that are bothering me.  I need revisit this tequila from a different bottle.  German Gonzalez has always put out a stellar tequila, so this review is just as disappoint to me as it would be to him.

2088.Review: Nice legs. Strong medicinal scent and taste. Slight burn finish.  No real trace of agave.

2089.Review: NOM 1146T1 Reposado Excepcional Lote: 129t1R15 (? - It's hard to read on bottle)Tasting Date: 6/16/22My Rating: 82 Nose: baked agave, vanilla, citrus, pepper, some vegetal, Taste: agave, pepper, a little oak, some citrus Finish: sweet agave and oak not a long finish Other: based on lote, i believe this was from 2015, and it is an older bottle we've had for several yrs. great legs, thicker viscosity which I like. Let this one sit and open up for a bit

2090.Review: Scents of butterscotch, caramel, light melon, and pepper. Definitely pick up more subtlety like tobacco and mint the longer you nose it. Flavor is a little thin once you get past the initial burn but definite notes of agave and wood present with some date and the smallest hint of anise. Overall not unpleasant.

2091.Review: Love that the aging process does not overpower the agave flavor and you still get some fruity and spicy nuances. Loved the appearance of banana notes and the minimal barrel influence of nutmeg, clove and a variety of baking spices. Cool unique bottle too

2092.Review: While the aroma is not very inviting, I enjoyed hints of pepper and the grassy, earthy flavors.

2093.Review: Eyes: Very clear and bright. There is almost no color to this repo - very light straw color. Very little tears left behind by the long gentle legs that snake their way down the glass.Nose: agave, butter, and alcohol are the dominant aromas. Once it opens up I get scents of wet grass, some pineapple, banana, lemon, hay, rose, baby oil and cream soda.Taste: not very complex taste, but it is very good. The alcohol leaves some lip numbness (which I dont mind). I get agave, pepper, banana, and grapefruit.Finish: The finish stays with you. It is a nice blend of oregano and mint. It is a nice repo that I may buy again if I am lucky enough to find it again.

2095.Review: nose is a little hot and one dimensional with agave. not in a bad way. taste is soft with baked agave, mild oak, some herbaceous and citrus qualities, minimal cinnamon. finish is stronger in baked agave and fresh agave, with a nice mild linger and warmth.

2096.Review: Sweet. Creamy buttery nose, lots of agave with a bittersweet chocolate just before the finish.

2097.Review: Sampled this one last night and liked it, I need to buy a bottle to fully explore the flavor and develop a more thorough rating...

2098.Review: Initial aroma shows strong alcohol with a very subtle sweetness. Initial sip confused me because I was expecting some harshness but instead I was treated to a medium bite and a hint of sweetness that was like agave syrup. Decently priced at less than 40$ worth the try.

2102.Review: Not a bad teq but there are better ones out there and for less.

2103.Review: Very light flavorHint of nuts (almonds?) at the end

2106.Review: Bubble gum on the back end of the finish.

2107.Review: One of all time favorites at Agave!

2108.Review: Dunno if it was the bottle but found it underwhelming... expected more

2109.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2109.Review: Gotta say, I like this one. Rated blind. Aroma of black pepper, baking soda, minerals and agave. Taste follows, very balanced and natural.

2110.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2110.Review: Nose:  Pear, cedar, mint and green piquant notes. Mouth feel is oily. Pretty hot entry with minerals and cake batter sweetness. This one is kind of hard to peg - but interesting. A touch bitter on the finish, but within my o.k. range.

2111.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2111.Review: NOM 1456|Overall mellow and moderate. Just right as a supporting character.

2112.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2112.Review: A very very nice Tequila, lots of agave, this is what old school Tequila should taste like, a very distinctive nutty/almond flavour profile, at 24â‚¬ thousand times better than other brands twice or three times the the price! Grab it

2113.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2113.Review: NOM 1610|Aroma of cooked agave,minerals,floral,fruit and pepper.Taste of minerals,cooked agave,fruit,mint.A little sweet.

2114.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2114.Review: One of the best blanco tequilas I have had. Superior to many higher priced Reposadas

2115.Tequila: La Cava de Don Agustin Blanco
2115.Review: Sweet, agave forward, floral and fruity. Crushable tequila at 38% abv, minimal burn and lots of flavour. Leaves you salivating on the middle of your palate. Steal of a deal sat 28$ a bottle

2116.Review: Very easy to drink and many people will like this because it barely has a finish at all. It fades very fast. Overall this is quite simple. There is a lot of cinnamon in the aroma and a little bit of something that smells like artificial sweetener.

2117.Review: Mint and green agave aromas. Minty flavor, thin mouthfeel and short finish. Simple but easy to drink.

2118.Review: Tequila Don Benjo NOM 1583 Las 3 RRRTequilera de la zona sur de Jalisco, municipio de Tonaya, Zona Sierra de AmulaUn Tequila Reposado, 100% agave por $200 pesos, también existe presentación Añejo y el infaltable cristalino de esta marca, el blanco se les olvidóEn Nariz: Muuuucho Roble, cereza, chocolate, pimienta, clavo, vainilla.En boca: Muuuuuy ligero, sigue habiendo roble, chocolate, Carmelo, como defecto el retrogusto es muy corto, pero caray por $200 es una ganga.

2119.Review: Agave and oak presence up front … slight straw aroma … black pepper on the mouth and a taste of a pitted fruit….. complex and balanced

2120.Review: Oh yeah this is nice. Agave retained on the nose along with barrel notes.  Pallet is oak with slight pepper on the finish. Super easy to drink and delicious. This is pretty dang good

2121.Review: Aroma : Bourbon-like caramel, vanilla, and oak aromas. Light orange note.Taste : Mellow cooked agave sweetness pairs with vanilla, cinnamon, and oak.Finish : Cinnamon spice wraps up the sweetness of the initial impression nicely.

2122.Review: Smells/tastes like good Blanco with baking spice & Mexican vanilla infused!! Great use of oak, this is a winner with any crowd.

2123.Review: Vanilla stands out to me in the aroma.Flavor has hints of vanilla, wood, and earth notes.

2124.Review: Aromas of whisky, leather and cooked agave with a vanilla , cinnamon flavor that has a pleasant spicy finish. Really nice anejo!

2125.Review: Batch #12 love the aroma get lots of tropical fruit especially banana. Good well rounded taste and finish really loving this Anejo

2127.Review: like smokey/ oaky. not that bueno for mama

2129.Review: Very nice easy sipper Oak, agave, loads of pitted fruit, black peper. Short to medium finish.  Very nice easy sipper.  Nice on the pallet …. Caramel is a nice touch when opens up.

2133.Review: delicious. 1 extra point for being certified additive free

2134.Review: great aroma with earthy, oak, cinnamon, leather. flavor isn't as agave forward as I'd like but it keeps developing on the finish. anise, cinnamon, wood, leather, earth, sage. great price point.

2135.Review: Oak and smoke, warm mouth feel with a spicy finish Honey and oak are the primary tasting notes I pick upLong smooth finish for alcoholy forward tequila Light aromatics

2136.Review: Nice anejo with bourbon hints and nuances of spice and fig.

2137.Review: Lots of vanilla and caramel on the nose, heaps of oak but still agave present. Very bourbon like.

2138.Review: Very nice aroma. Nice subtle whiskey nose. Very smooth with nice sweetness and whiskey notes. Flavors hang for a really long time.

2139.Review: Rated blind on 8-18-16: Woody aroma with cinnamon. Subtle initial flavor that builds to an añejo-like finish. Initially thought it was an añejo but it's actually a repo.

2140.Review: Nice smoky taste and smooth finish. Tried at Mexican Sugar.

2141.Review: Rich agave and oak is the play on this one. Browned butter, toffee and vanilla on the palate.

2142.Review: Very flowery and flavorful. Kind of sweet. I like it!

2143.Review: Fabulous aroma!..incredible finish! Beautiful pearls/ tears with this treat. Extreme yummy, buttercream nose. Taste is complex full of oak & carmel. My Anejo was nom 1494 (older purchased in Tucson, AZ). I see my (many) newer bottles are nom 1146. Hands down my favorite of the 100+ Ts I have tasted.  My go to....with orange infused dark chocolate. oh yum!

2144.Review: Very refined with awesome aroma. Butterscotch nutty flavor with a finish that begs for more, but the cost may affect that decision. Worth the experience.

2145.Review: Tasted at Just Tacos restaurant and bar in Oahu, Hawaii.  Nice mellow nose with hints of Carmel and Honey.  First thing, this is some super smooth tequila.  No burn at all with this one, only a slight warming sensation. Love it!  One of my favorites.  A++

2146.Review: San Diego Tequila and Cuisine Event

2147.Review: Tasted at San Diego Tequila and Cuisine event

2148.Review: Fan of this añejo. Pricey if you get the horse head, but you save about 35 bucks if you buy the bar bottle, which I did. Warm agave, mocha, caramel, dried fruit, very nice añejo.

2149.Review: Nice sweet nose, wood notes, cooked agave, cherry notes, a lot of sugary flavors in the taste profile, chocolate notes. A whiskey drinkers kind of tequila if that’s what you prefer

2150.Review: It’s sweet dark chocolate covered cherries on top of cooked agave. It’s an empty whiskey barrel and baking spices.  There are hints of leather and soft pepper notes. There’s natural sweetness and a cohesiveness of aromas.There is a burst of flavors. The cooked agave runs from start to finish. I get the spices up front; nutmeg and cinnamon. Then the sweeter notes come in; natural vanilla and a sweet cream / creme brule. The finish is semi dry with some whiskey barrel notes but the sweetness carries through and there is a pleasantly light pepper on the tail end that lingers.Let this Anejo open up then enjoy!

2151.Review: tried a taste of each expression at the tequila people event in san diego 8/22. need to revisit for tasting notes10/20/22agave heat oak cherry nutmeg cinnamon a little green apple slight pepper and a mild lactic smell in the top nose when it sitsdefinitely let this open up. the experience is very different after 20 minutes. I accidentally let it sit over an hour and it was even better

2152.Review: Their barrel blending process is their forte. Cabal aged expressions are a representation of good sipping  tequila. Loved the transparency offered by the owners on their brand and process. Slightly overpriced (but also this brand is being affected by industry raw material factors). Alternative is to try their bar bottles if the horse head bottle is not as accessible for you as a consumer.

2154.Review: Beautiful bottle, and the nose on the Anejo is very nice. Aromas of Agave, cherry, and some oak.  The advice To let this Anejo open up is confirmed. Totally different experience by letting it open up for about 10 minutes. Good balance between agave and oak with a littlenatural vanilla and caramel flavor.

2155.Review: sampled at the Tequla Ranch in Paramount. and I just had to bring it home with me... nose gives you fresh roasted agave, nice barrel notes, cooking spices and citrus. on the palate you get a burst of cooked agave and roasted pineapple, pine nuts and dehydrated fruits.. nice mouth cover and chest heat. perfect for sipping on a cool night.  finish lingers with notes of cinnamon and vanilla... thumbs up....

2156.Review: From a mini bottle on sale from OldTown. Light in the mouth with clean agave, pepper, some caramelized sweetness. A short finish holds this back a bit but this very sippable.

2157.Review: Nose:   Citrus, earthy notes and agave. Flavors:   Pepper, spices, sweet agave with brown sugar nuances, and citrus zest. Fairly viscous.

2158.Review: Strong baked agave flavor with herbaceous flavor.  Grassy and crisps palate. Finish is smooth with a small bite of agave to end

2160.Review: This is a nice little Blanco.  Super easy to drink, with a really nice agave and grassy taste.  It is so cheap here in Mexico that I bought it for Maragaritas, but tried it and really like it.  A little light in complexity, and not a strong finish, but very nice as a sipper.

2163.Review: Roasted agave, agave forward, clean, touch of heat. Slight hint of sweetness that quickly dissipates into citrus. Medium long agave finish.

2165.Review: got a bottle today for less then 10$. sweet agave citrus earthy

2166.Review: Great taste, this is what highland blancos are all about, you can notice the high standards and premium agaves used , can’t fool nature, if you’re in the search of high end agave Tequila from the highlands... look no further

2168.Review: Mineral and earth on the nose. Chocolate bittersweet flavour. Easy finish, but not the agave flavours my palate loves. Would recommend and drink again - would pair nicely as a night cap or desert tequila

2169.Review: Perfectly clean distillation from an estate grown blue agaveThe very best I’ve ever tasted and a ridiculous value in Mexico

2170.Review: Aroma of cooked and raw agave. Cooked and raw agave taste. A good finish, not a lot of peppery kick you would find with other blancos. Not very complex. I am curious about what makes this one “extra premium.” To be fair, I haven’t tried Don Nacho Blanco, so I can’t compare. This tequila is easy to sip. If you or anyone you know is tempted to try any platinum or cristalino color filtered product, try this instead. A good value.

2171.Review: smooth and I can taste the agave, with a clean aftertaste, fair price

2172.Review: I smelled grapefruit vanilla and agaveThe flavor is smooth while hitting my mouth with strong alcohol. I the grassy agave flavor hits in the back of the throat. This is a good tequila that highlights the blue agave while still being smooth. It does not have the citrus flavors I prefer with a blanco

2173.Review: This is a new tequila at my local store so I thought Iâ€™d try.  It is so damn sweet.  Tried it straight, with ice and lime, and in a marg (2 lime/2 tequila/1 triple sec.  still sweet.  Not a bad tequila, wont buy again.

2174.Review: Luxurious caramel feel on the tongue. Nice agave with hints of butterscotch, mint, and wood. Longer finish than many but not a coating feel. This tastes far above its price point.

2175.Review: Nose: agave, cinnamon, lemongrass, nutmeg, and a hint of wet cement Flavor: white pepper, cinnamon, cloves and some agave , with a creamy and thick mouth feel Finish: is medium, peppery, with a fruity sweetness

2176.Review: Nose:  Robust ripe agave, caramel, cinnamon, oranges, lemon peel, pine needles and minerals. Flavor:   Spicy white pepper, cinnamon and cloves. Slightly viscous, round mouth feel of caramel and ripe cooked agave. It blooms in your mouth. Finish:   Caramel, pepper and grapefruit rind. Just a hint of cedar shavings.

2177.Review: Agave, cinnamon and slight raw agave aromas. Very thick and full mouth feel. Creamy and sweet flavor, but not artificial. Dry but pleasant finish.

2178.Review: Lot T120116BO, bottled on 11-04-2016.Nose: light sweet cooked agave, anise, light floral notes, light white pepper, feels fresh & slightly herbaceous.Palate: aromatic anise like sweet cooked agave, herbaceous, a hint of black pepper, fresh mouthfeel.Finish is medium to long, the anise like sweet cooked agave and a hint of black pepper persists.

2179.Review: Not overly complex but really well done. Nice hint of lemon on the nose

2180.Review: Nice complex blonco loads of cinnamon and nutmeg from the agave.  I get a big vegetal note in the middle and a light peppery finish.  I could definitely sip this more and bring more flavors out.

2181.Review: Very nice. Opened and tasted with John and Christine in celebration of his remission. A nice high proof Joven, this purposeful blend should be right in the wheelhouse of anyone that loves to smell and taste additive free products. Dsrk copper tones usually portend bad news for a Joven or Reposado but in this case it demonstrates the flexibility of the category.

2182.Review: Nose: Dried stone fruit (apricot and white peach), raisin sweetness, agave, clove, cardamom, oak, and melted butter Flavor: cooked agave, black pepper, stone fruit, light saltiness, barrel flavors, clove, and lots of big dark chocolate Finish: is long, the raisin sweetness starts it and more chocolate appears and it ends with the floral spice of white pepper This will be a good food tequila. I would use it with my Pork Medallions with Tequila Peach Sauce to cook with and pair to and served with my Grilled Apricots with a cinnamon ricotta sauce

2183.Review: Congrats Grover!  It opens up really nice, high proof keeps the agave showcasing through the barreling.  Great warm finish!

2184.Review: This is downright delicious. nose: raisin, holiday baking spices, brown sugar, oatmeal cookies, chocolate. great mouthfeel. the extra proof is welcomed and offers a bump in heat I enjoy. I think it needs the extra abv.  Not all is lost for the agave, tasting ripe agave (albeit a focused search), ripe fruit sweetness finish with a hint of cocoa bitterness. It’s rich yet a brightness still there. I don’t think I’d say complex but it’s not singular like overly artificial XA’s leave you with.   could be a fantastic after dinner drink or a celebration. what was this XA like before it was cut with blanco to make the joven. ????

2185.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo
2185.Review: A lot different than I was expecting. Not as overwhelming with chocolate notes as other Casa Noble products. Lots of oak, slight hint of berry, clay and at the end some brine. The flavor however is typical CN. The chocolate note is a lot more prominent but it's not over the top as sometimes the Repo and Anejo taste to me. There is also a slight hint of mint and vanilla.

2186.Review: Aromas: Bell pepper, orange peel, with a sour and yeasty (?) funkFlavors: Agave, pepper, bitter oak, slight metallic finishIt’s just ok.

2187.Review: Lightly sweet, cherry, dried fruit notes. Nice mouth feel and finish. Good price, great bottle

2188.Review: A little funk on the nose with minimal agave. Palate is soft, some vanilla and soft agave.  Finish is decent. Not amazing. A decent Añejo after opening

2189.Review: Solid anejo. Light hand on the oak, which I appreciate. Long finish. Not super memorable in any respect but a very well made spirit. And a very affordable price in todays aged tequila market.

2190.Review: I can smell the cooked agave, sweet oak and a floral note. I then taste agave, toasted oak, caramel, spicy vanilla and some smoke in the midpalate. The finish is nice. There is pepper and a viscous mouthfeel which helps the finish to slightly linger. Overall the Anejo is the most complex of the 3 expressions. It’s complex but nowhere close to overwhelming. Well done Insólito! 2nd tasting - Half bottleThe bottle opened up some and I increased the rating by a 2 points. Salud!

2192.Review: Light sweet oak, dried cherry, minimal agave in nose, but there is some more cooked agave and spices in palate, medium body, pepper and spices in finish. Not a lot of complexity in this Anejo but the price is good.

2193.Review: For me, not enough agave. Nose is cherry, barrel notes, pepper & light funk, same on the palate with slight bitter wood finish. Good value but not gonna rush out & buy another.

2194.Review: A nice golden color with nice legs.  The aroma is mild vanilla and agave.  The flavor and finish add light caramel and pepper.  The pepper brings this home.  This is an easy sipper.  I prefer a bit less sweetness but in this case the sweetness is not oft putting.  This gets value points.  The anejo is the best from this distillery in my opinion.

2195.Review: This Anejo is really well balanced. Easy sipper. My new go to. Bumped it up another notch.

2196.Review: An anejo that allows the agave to still shine. Perfect balance of earth and age.

2197.Review: Caramel. Sweet. Subdued agave but it’s there. Very nice sipper.

2198.Review: Taste- Cooked  agave, oak, pitted fruit, licorice (bitterness), little vanilla, smoke (almost similar to a scotch) And light pepper on the backend.

2199.Review: Not overly complex, yet a solid añejo with strong whiskey notes with a generous amount of cooked agave. For $45, this is a steal.

2200.Review: agave and caramel right off the bat. slow lasting slightpepper finish. @anejo_bros

2201.Review: Tasting Date: 7/22722Lots of oak and usual bourbon notes on the nose, nothing out of the ordinary. Not getting much agave here but it is present. Flavor and finish are much of the same. Nothing blowing my socks off but better than most new craft bourbons.

2202.Review: Has a slightly sweet vanilla aroma and light caramel taste with a nice finish. Not at sweet as some anejo brands which I find is a plus.
2202.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo
2202.Review: Strong aroma of oak with underlying notes of cherry and pear. (Surprisingly, the typical CN chocolate and vanilla notes are absent.) And, a noticeable briny aroma at the end. Flavors are classic Casa Noble - chocolate and vanilla with spicy peppermint on the finish. The finish is long, warm and lingering.

2187.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo
2187.Review: dark oaky flavors spicy with a long finish.

2188.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo

2189.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo
2189.Review: I have the high times barrel select extra anejo and I am very happy with it nice agave flavor with sweetness and a long smooth finish

2190.Tequila: Casa Noble Santana Reserve Extra Añejo
2190.Review: This is my first Anejo and Wow

2191.Review: Cinnamon and baking spices nuances, reminds me of a lighter version of Fuenteseca

2192.Review: Cinnamon Bitter herbal note on finish

2193.Review: Agave on the noseLittle green, little bit of earth.Agave forward.Good mouth feel.Smooth finish.

2194.Review: Tastes like a winter blanco, nice toasted almonds and cinnamon throughout.

2195.Review: This has a crazy amount of cinnamon flavour to it, good tequila, a little thin but overall a decent product.

2196.Review: A friend shared a glass with me, and wow—first Cuervo I’ve enjoyed! This one was 38% ABV purchased in 2004. Personally didn’t detect additives, it just tasted like a delicious aged tequila. Ah, the good ole days for JC.

2197.Review: This is for the bottle shown, 1989 bottle of añejo, sealed and rested 15 minutes. Very buttery, with a rich natural sweetness to the oak, dark cherry.

2198.Review: Another ATM bottle provided by a guest. Nice richly aged Añejo that shows JC could make very good tequila before money became king.

2199.Review: This was an outstanding Anejo for its time, well made, beautifully balanced, cooked agave and wood. Not your kids Jose Cuervo

2200.Review: NOM 1104|NOM 1104. Aroma: Strong oak notes that really overpowers everything else. There is a hint of vanilla but it's very subtle.Flavor: Again, strong oak notes but now the vanilla starts to show through more. Reminds me of Familia but a little sweeter. There is also a slight hint of chocolate.

2201.Review: NOM 1104|NOM 1104. Relatively subtle aroma is dominated by oak with some caramel and something almost like turpentine (not in a bad way). Caramel, vanilla and spice flavor that clearly shows barrel age but is not overly oaky. Definite similarities to the Reserva de la Familia but significantly tamed down on the oak (I prefer this milder oak flavor). Nice finish but relatively short.

2203.Review: Have not seen this in many years but back in the day it was my go to sipper. wish I had kept a few bottles before they disappeared.

2204.Review: Pass the pancakes!I can feel a hangover coming on

2205.Review: NOM 1104|NOM 1104. A real GemFlavor: intense oak yet earthy, caramel, smoky, & some spice. Long finish

2206.Review: Nice organic reposado that has some interesting spice of cinnamon, allspice, oak and sweet agave. Some slight numbing on the finish rounds out a pleasant experience.

2207.Review: Very light agave and oak smell. Initial tastes of agave, pepper, and oak. I taste some very faint baking spice on the finish.

2208.Review: NOM 1479|Very unique juice hidden in a wine bottle.  Aroma: vanilla, spices and fresh agave.Palate: nutmeg, cloves, peppers, oak wood, cooked agave, baking spice, orange peal, chamomile.Finish is sweet, cinnamon, spices, oak, come together very nice and stays long after the last sip.

2209.Review: On the nose, caramel, barrel spice. Vanilla, cooked agave. Very soft. Sweet tobacco in the empty glass, I’m a sucker for that specific aroma, so extra points in the nose for me. On the palate, Agave stronger than the nose implies. Light vanilla, caramel. Not too complex. A bit thin, not as oily as I like. Definitely a very competent Repo, but loses some points in value for me as I haven’t been able to find it under $42, and I would struggle to pay that when El Tesoro is an option, and cheaper in my market. Still, they’re very different and it’s worth trying, you may like it more.

2210.Review: Nose: cooked agave, some oak, ripe tree fruit, vanilla, clove, and sweet cinnamon Flavor: cooked agave, cinnamon, clove, oak, sweet fruitiness, and a nice creamy mouth feel. Finish: medium and starts sweet and ends spicy

2211.Review: Distinctly caramel aromas, slightly smoky on the palate, smooth but somewhat unremarkable finish.

2212.Review: I find this tequila a little Ligh both in flavor and aromas.

2213.Review: It has a strong vanilla flavor right off the bat. I can taste some agave but it is not very agave forward. It’s got a funny finish. Kinda additive tasting. It’s not horrible but not great

2214.Review: Nice flavor. Definitely some vanilla flavor from the barrel. Not really sweet though. The guy pouring samples at The Outsider said no additives.

2215.Review: Bouquet is pleasant but sweet.  Flavor also shared a sweet palate almost like an ice pop or a creamsicle.  As a gift for someone that likes Tequila and likes sweet drinks, this would be a nice option to get them.

2216.Review: Tasted a small sample (need to come back to do a proper tasting)Initial thoughts:Vanilla/sweet notes… flat profile Oak and sweetness overpower the agave flavor. Minimal agave detected

2218.Review: Better aroma than the Blanco, super vanilla. An interesting Burst of flavor upon entry in the mouth most likely from the French oak barrel. The barrel really dominates the taste. A little spicy, minty and oaky. Finish is good but not very interesting.

2219.Review: Sweet, but tasty in most ways. Just a little overly sweet, I guess.

2220.Review: Would drink again, but would not pay full price for another bottle.

2221.Review: This is the sweetest non additive Repo I have tasted. Very tasty, floral and lots vanilla. Good stuff.

2222.Review: vanilla, caramel on nose.  taste butterscotch.  sweet.  too sweet.  finish is spicy.  altogether smooth, but tastes artificial.  kind of disappointed after seeing ratings in the mid 80s.

2223.Review: Definitely vanilla and honey upfront for me. as I read the profile I got the butterscotch and cinnamon as well.

2224.Review: My bias upfront.  I’m not a sweet person.  The aroma has vanilla and some agave. It also has some ethanol mixed in.  The mouthfeel is watery but carries the vanilla forward into the finish which adds some cinnamon to go with the vanilla sweetness.  Something seems out of place here.  It’s fairly smooth and an easy drinker but gosh, that vanilla is sweet.  Barreling doesn’t really do this.  Maybe they were trying to imitate other fake shit like Clase Azul at a more affordable price point. Certainly a reasonable business venture.

2229.Review: Vanilla, cake batter, saccharin, ethanol on the nose. Mouthfeel is a little thin and watery. Cooked agave, vanilla and white pepper on the palette. Reasonably inoffensive. Finish is a little bitter, with a vanilla artificial sweetener flavor.

2230.Review: Too much vanilla and caramel for me and a little sweet

2231.Review: A perfect reposado. Richness like that of an anejo without being too sweet. The ideal amount of spice (both pepper and baking) to bring it all together. An earthy side and enough agave to it that are both so welcomed. To have this flavor profile for a reposado, I can’t even begin to imagine what their anejo would taste like.

2232.Review: sweet smell, vanilla. Peppery, can taste the agave. Light sweetness but not overpowering. Overall a very light tequila, pleasant. Outstanding for the price.

2233.Review: Very marshmallow-y. Warm sweet aroma, like a toasty marshmallow vanilla sugar cookie. Sweet and robust with light finish

2234.Review: Nice level of Caramel and Spices yet the flavor is lacking as it is light

2235.Review: Lots of cola and root beer on the nose, along with agave, caramel, and an earthiness. Other baking spices also make an appearance, along with noticeable aromas of vanilla and honey. Palate is very similar, lots of root beer and baking spice. It's a bit more muted than the smell, but still pleasing. Finish is short and subtle, with hints of cola and molasses.

2237.Review: Way too oaked for a repo but not bad. Unremarkable. Tobacco aroma,  sweet finish, but everything else is covered by wood.

2238.Review: For a reposado, this is super aged. It’s more like an añejo. Nose is butter, oak, and caramel. Flavor is sweet with some barrel spice on the finish.

2239.Review: Fortunate at a friend's tasting, dusted off bottle, had enough for two last samplings.  Oak, vanilla, butterscotch, spices, a long finish..

2240.Review: One of my all time favorites. Wish I could get my hands on another bottle.

2241.Review: The first hit on the aroma is caramelized plum, with secondary notes of brown sugar and vanilla. The flavor follows through with the same notes of brown sugar combined with baking spices, which come through strong and identifiable at the end. The finish is a burst of anise blended with cinnamon sticks, and a port wine sweetness.

2242.Review: Story:Añejo expression of the ArteNOM line, made in the same distillery as Tears of Llorona, Cimarron, Fuenteseca and Don Fulano.Aroma:Lots of pepper, touch of mint, fruity. Caramel and agave, definitely very prominent whiskey notes. Banana, very light ethanol. Vanilla when I tip my glass just right. A little water brings out butterscotch near the end. Wow, this aroma is very complex. Palate:Instantly hit with sweet caramel and pepper. Cooked agave, and that whiskey note coming through. I’m getting only a faint hint of vanilla, but it’s there. Definitely fruity, though I can’t pinpoint a specific fruit. Verdict:Interesting, a tasty tequila, and one I would recommend trying. It won’t be a staple in my bar, but when I’m looking for something fruity and peppery, I’ll reach for this.

2243.Review: Nose: oak, some agave in the background, caramel, butterscotch, whiskey, clove, and nutmeg Flavor: oak, sweetness, white pepper, clove, toffee and roasted nutsFinish: starts with white pepper, some sweetness, oak, and some heat

2244.Review: This is gold standard for Anejo.  Perfectly balanced and a real treat.  Aroma is amazing and the flavor follows through to the end

2245.Review: This is an absolutely fantastic anejo. In my top 2 or 3. It has it all.

2246.Review: Nose:   Initially I was hit with French oak and some lumberyard oak aromas. Given a  little breathing time, rich sweet notes emerged:  butterscotch, dark chocolate, vanilla, cafe con leche, and the slightest hint of maple. Herbal/earthy root cellar aromas, thyme and green pepper mingle with spicier notes of finely ground white pepper, orange rind, nutmeg, cloves and powdered ginger. A pleasing marriage of scents. Flavor:   Spicy zing enveloped in sweet, buttery, agave richness. Caramel, toffee and almond paste. Grapefruit zest and oranges. Lots of facets...Finish lingers.

2247.Review: lovely flavor very different for me. sweet without burn. I call this one the wine of tequilas like a Porto to me.

2248.Review: Balanced, not overly sweet. Agave and oak showing well together. Big mouth feel, strong barrel notes, Carmel, cooking spice. Well balanced

2249.Review: Aroma : Vanilla, caramel, and light cinnamon. There is also some oak, orange, and butter.Taste : Lots of oak, along with some chocolate, toffee and berry fruitiness. Light butter and orange here as well. This is a good balance between sweet and spicy, while still letting you get the full complexity of each side.Finish : Long with stronger notes of vanilla, berry, and oak.There is a lot going on here. It's obvious there is a ton of complexity with this one to the extent that if someone told me this was an extra añejo, I'd probably believe them. Some may find the oak overpowering, but that's why you have to give tequilas like these time to open up, otherwise you'll miss out.

2250.Review: Another 1146 gem. I Always keep one in my stash. ArteNom came out strong out of the gate w/ their 1079 release. This is Agave forward with notes of candied walnuts, nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla, yams, mocha, leather, with a hint of smoke. Kinda goes down like an XA. Damn solid stuff.

2251.Review: This is a barrel heavy influenced tequila that does it the right way.  Caramel and baking spice notes are very present, but without losing the agave essence. It's a touch pricey, but also unique.

2252.Review: You can really appreciate the wood on the nose. Smells like a good humidor; makes me want to grab a cigar. Unique flavor from the triple barrel aging. Detect something like Sherry. Very smooth.

2254.Review: Hints of vanilla, sweet but not cloying. Nice, clean finish but not weak

2255.Review: Lovely and rich. Complex and smooth. Great finish. Rivals 42.

2256.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band
2256.Review: Smoky whisky barrel flavours, good smooth blend...like it best in Winter!

2257.Review: This low score maybe the result of my high expectations.  I found nothing extraordinary about this tequila .  Disappointing .

2258.Review: Aroma: I get a strong note of coffee and berry. There is also a hint of caramel and oak. It's super complex. Every time I go back I get a different note. Flavor: For me this is pretty barrel heavy. I get a lot of oak with a subtle hint of chocolate. I was hoping for something more complex an in line with the aroma. Finish: The finish is pretty complex. It goes up and down and lingers for a while.

2259.Review: Light vanilla aroma and less barrel than the reposado. Sweet, fruity flavor and pleasant lingering finish. Great cold weather tequila (noted on 12-23-2012).

2260.Review: Nice agave and wood notes on nose, good agave flavor and crisp agave spice finish

2261.Review: A super unique Tequila. Tons of flavors that develop the more you sip. Deep rich cherry , oak , agave sweetness ties it all in.

2262.Review: Great Tequila! Smell taste and finish all excellent. Quality tequila!

2263.Review: 3rd pour of the night after Don Fulano Reposado and Cascahuin 48°. Just as rich as the higher proof pour but with the big fruit of the Don Fulano in the background behind lush sweet spice from the barrel. Best añejo I've tried so far.

2264.Review: Trying this next to Tears of Llorona. I know that's not fair, but many say it's a poor man's tears. I think it stands true to that comment. To me it tastes like Fuenteseca 2018 Huertas if it was aged in a barrel. Flavor is there, but wish the nose was too. Not complex enough for me. Will have to revisit this one.

2265.Review: Buttery mouth feel.  Prefer a little sweeter

2266.Review: Très douce. Légèrement fumée et boisée.

2267.Review: aroma - oaky turns into a very nice vanilla. then has hints of peppertaste - very smooth. you can really taste the wood in the barrels. then smooth, sweet agave finish. again, hints of pepper.  doesn't linger too long, but isn't quick either

2268.Review: color:amazing natural dark aroma:bold_ dark chocolate, taste:finish:personal:

2269.Review: A very well made añejo with marked wood notes well balanced with other barrel notes of vanilla, caramel, and spices.  Well worth discovering.

2270.Review: Really enjoyed this one. Great for a whiskey enthusiast that’s exploring tequila. Really nice dry fruit notes - dates and raisins. This would be great to bring and enjoy around a fire pit!

2271.Review: Such a great balance on the nose and taste.So many flavors to pick up, had this with friends and everyone picked up a different note but all loved the juice.A must for tequila fans and guest you want to take on a flavor excursion

2272.Review: Bottle: Lote 051AA21Appearance: Dark AmberNose: Caramel, maple syrup, oak, whisky, black pepper, sweet cooked agave, butterscotch, toffee, butter, vanilla, minerality, honey, molasses, charcoal, dried fruits, almond, baking spice, cake batter, apple cider, anise, barrel spice, and smoke…everything common to the best whiskeys with an agave complexity underneathPalate: Caramel, butterscotch, maple syrup, whisky, oak, sweet cooked agave, honey, vanilla, toffee, black pepper, whisky, cinnamon, citrus, baking spice, butter, smoke, barrel spice, anise, chocolate, clove, allspice, apple, molasses, olive, cake batter, coffee, and almond…matches the nose quite well, but in different proportions and includes some tasty additions with an amazing mouthfeel on topFinish: Oak, vanilla, hazelnut, cinnamon, roasted nuts, and honey with pleasantly warming alcohol throughout…long and marvelous finishOverall:

2273.Review: Can smell the caramel and whisky.. flavor at first to me was more whisky then agave.

2274.Review: I might not be able to identify this as tequila at first if someone didn't tell me, but then… Well balanced nose, cooked agave right alongside some port wine, whiskey, almond, hint of parmasean and, really, I get a whiff of pencil shavings. Nose intensifies as the glass sits. Beautiful color, like a bourbon. On the palate it is buttery, has a port wine type of richness, stewed fruit and I definitely taste some cooked agave, crème bruleé, and a whiskey zing on the finish. Gets more interesting with each sip. Different, but really nice.

2275.Review: Great complexity Aroma: Oak, cloves and baking spice.Taste: Cooked agave, toffee, orange zest.Finish: Nutty dryness, cinnamon, and cocoa.

2279.Review: tasting at chris porters 10/22artenom 1146 anejo this was at the end of tasting 10-12 other tequilas. I liked this but think it might be better on its own after opening up so will revisit at another time

2280.Review: Flavor much more complex than the nose. Dried fruits(date, raisin) up front, caramel, butterscotch, chocolate and vanilla comes mid palate and on. Plenty of agave at 80 proof! such a master piece at this price point!

2281.Review: Citrus on the nose, heavy oak and currant tastes. Prefer the repo

2282.Review: The end was a bit more bitter.   Did not like how my head/emotions felt the next day.

2283.Review: Dangerously smooth to drink and a great anejo that is not overwhelming.  Beautiful nose with hints of agave and baking spice.
