Definitely pick some up if you can still find it. Bravo.

2832.Review: Lot 91|On the nose, some licorice and agave mainly. On the palate, mainly the agave, some baking spices. Surprisingly no licorice (thankfully I’m not a licorice fan in the slightest). Overall the way I’d describe this is clean and surprisingly smooth and it makes a lot of sense. They say you rate a distillery by how well it does its blanco, since the blanco is the basis for everything else. Simply put, Fortaleza made me a blanco fan. Coming from scotch, I wasn’t sure if I’d ever move past Anejos and Extra Anejos. Fortaleza truly opened my eyes to all that tequila has to offer.

2833.Review: Lot 96|Nice oily legs in the glass.  Aroma of cooked agave, earth and grass. Flavor of cooked agave and vegetal.  Long, pleasant finish.

2834.Review: a lo que debe saber y sentir un tequila, muy mineral y citrico.

2835.Review: Lot 92|Lot 92-B.  This is such a solid tequila.  So versatile and delicious. Not as thick as the still strength but a very easy sipper.

2836.Review: Lot 100|It has that Arandas Funk on the nose which is not what I expect of Fortaleza. I understand it’s Arandas agave and I get it, but it’s not what I expected. The flavor matches the nose. It’s both excellent and I’m still stuck on not what I expected. Very clean finish. Doesn’t have much of the oiliness that I’ve come to enjoy in exceptional tequila. It’s excellent. Don’t get me wrong. For me, I prefer the standard Still Strength as a pure expression of what I expect Fortaleza to taste like. But it’s outstanding tequila and a very cool Lot that people should experience if they’re hard core tequila nerds.

2892.Review: Lot 77|Lot 77-B is my very first Fortaleza!  I let it open up for 45 minutes.  The aroma is complex, deep, thick, and wonderful. Not harsh, very smooth, but not lacking the alcohol taste either.  It finishes by hanging around a long while with some citrus, light pepper, and a very mild grass.  Most of all this juice has character and you can tell.  Very balanced, very unique.    I’m glad it’s in my collection.

2911.Review: Lot 80|While almost perfect for sipping straight alongside a homemade slightly spicy sangrita...save the still strength for that...I find this is best mixed with 1 whole muddled lime, a quarter of a navel orange on the rocks.. a splash of seltzer is optional... would never waste it in a margarita sweetened with triple sec, agave syrup etc.... also great if you just want to throw back a shot or two

2912.Review: Hair Salon smell on nose, not like a perm but chemical based with a little citrus rind. Surprisingly deep and complex on palette compared to nose. Grassy with raw agave and citrus.

2913.Review: Lot 78|I love the nose!  Fresh, clean, grassy. It’s really good. It’s got a bite to it, that is different than the highlands tequilas. I like the finish, I love the mouth feel, it’s got a bite to it. It’s high priced, but a fantastic, artisan process and worth a high price. Might be the best lowland tequila. I like Fulano better, but think they use highland agave.

2914.Review: Tequila Fortaleza (Los Abuelos in Mexico) is widely considered to be one of the great brands available out there. Distilled by a 5th generation Sauza, this tequila is still made the old style way with a Tahona and old school methods. The bottles are hand blown and the real cork piña stopper symbolizes this brand.Aroma: Cooked agave, touch of earthyness, black pepper, olive and butter. Really pleasant.Initial Taste: Superb creamy agave entry.Body: Wonderful amounts of agave and the pepper spice that goes along with it. The sweetness from the agave and the fruit is still there as well. Complex...while still being light and pleasant with no burn or bitterness.Finish: Ultra smooth. A hint of pepper and fruit remain while a nice agave flavor lingers. nicely for a medium duration.This is just a superb tequila from top to bottom. From the bottle, to how it was crafted to every aspect of the flavor in your mouth this is a winner. The fact that it can pretty easily be found for under $50 makes this probably my favorite blanco. Go out and get bottle. I'm pretty darn sure that you won't regret

2915.Review: This is one of my favorite blancos, it has so much flavor! Roasted agave is very apparent on the nose, followed by a butteriness laden with olives and citrus. Underneath the bright citrus lies a deeper, earthier vegetal aroma that carries a whiff of spice from white pepper, then fades to raw agave and a dash of mint. The taste is wonderfully spicy and sweet, with blasts of roasted agave intertwined with hits of black and white pepper. There is also a rich, creamy vanilla flavor that lies atop a foundation of the earthy vegetables from the nose. This finished up with a splash of citrus and brine, a very crisp and refreshing tequila.

2916.Review: Not my favorite. Very heavy oily olive flavor. Slight burn.

2919.Review: Lot 45|The gold standard, or if there are several, one of those select few. This is mystical stuff, a presentation of agave so bewitching, so mesmerizing that it has you constantly going back for another sniff, another sip, caught between trying to make sense of it and yet soak freely in its glory all at the same time. Extreme praise, I know, but there really are few times when a drink catches you so off guard as this. The nose is soft and rich, petrichor, lush garden flowers, jasmine, a light undercurrent of pepper. The palate is buttery, rich, almost moist agave, some tropical fruit like lychee perhaps, a light sweetness that never gets untoward, something even like olive oil too. A very pleasant tingling, almost cooling, emerges in the finish, rich agave and light pepper carrying throughout. This is, clearly, gorgeous stuff, not unlike the decanter it comes in. An all-time great and one of the surest fire ways to make an agave convert of anyone.

2920.Review: Lot 69|Normally reposado drinker. Now I know why I quit blancos. Very green!

Nose: there's a distinct, and very noticeable mushroom aroma that dominates...supported by cooked agave, and acetone...I noticed a little bit of sea air, and pickling spice...other notes are fleeting, some tropical fruits; starfruit, pineapple...baked goods perhaps? Palate: A very mushroom-forward entry gives way to sweet, cooked agave, followed by drying cinnamon, balanced with some citral, herbal, and vegetal notes in the middle. Mushrooms return on the satisfying, medium finish, along with black peppercorns, agave, and minerals. Not too dry, not too sweet. IMHO, you'd have to really like mushrooms to enjoy this batch! Furthermore, this brand may be in danger of being crushed by the weight of it's outstanding reputation...Not overrated, but also not for noobs with Americanized tastes.

3104.Review: LOVE this!!! So much cooked agave goodness!!!

3105.Review: Oven roasted agave feels the air when you open the bottle.  Aromas of cooked agave, lime, herbal, cardamom, walnut, coffee, honey, vegetal, pepper, anise, mineral, smoke.  Palate is full of heat in a good way with sweet agave, alcohol, mint, minerals, and green banana. Finish is subdue and sweet that makes you want more.  This is addictive !

3106.Review: Aroma : Vegetal, herbal, and grassy aroma packed with cooked agave. There is also some underlying pepper and licorice.Taste : Agave, black pepper, vanilla, mint, and citrus notes. Lightly sweet and oily in the mouth.Finish : Warm and peppery with plenty of residual cooked agave, and light spice.I'll need to keep my eye out for more Cascahuín. This is only the 2nd bottle I've tried and both are (in my opinion) better than a fair amount of the NOM 1579 tequilas.

3107.Review: Re-evaluated - A lot of sweet cooked agave on the nose with some slight vanilla cream, light pepper, spice, a pinch of smoke, definite alcohol, and anise. Vegetable and slight citrus. Taste is some heat, anise, sweet agave, vegative, minerally, with a pinch of ftuit. Heat onth the  backend to the finish.

3108.Review: Cascahuín Plata 48%This 96 proof lowlands tequila has a great nose of strong fresh agave, herbs, light citrus, muted white pepper and alcohol. I taste mint, cooked agave, pepper and alcohol. The finish is full of bright agave and a pleasant warm tequila hug. This blanco is worth your money. I’m glad to see higher proof tequilas become more common. !Salud!AustinTequilaConnoisseurs

3109.Review: Served in a Stölzle mezcal nosing glass. Nose is massive, fresh agave and subtle notes of licorice, the 48% comes through with presence. Quick hit of pepper, transitions into cooked agave. The high abv is nuanced, not overwhelming as the nose would suggest it might be and the heat rides through the mouth, over the tongue and sits on the back of your throat for what feels like ages. It’s a top 3 blanco, hands down.

3110.Review: As a fan of high-proof blancos, this one is amazing. Terrific nose. Vegetal, baked agave, grass. It has a wonderful lactic aroma. Crisp and clean. It really coats the palate. Agave, pepper and a hint of citrus. The high alcohol makes it linger, which is fine by me. Stunning.

3111.Review: Right up my alley, tons of agave off the nose and a vanilla-wasabi thing going on that makes me want to smash the whole bottle in one sitting. Stay tuned for a follow up rating when I make some cocktails.

3112.Review: Lot 6, sampled at Distillery Visit September 2018

3113.Review: Vista:  A glint of silver. Very slow thick tears. Nose:  Big bold aroma. Baked agave, hints of herbs, olives, licorice, cinnamon and fresh cut grass. Ripe vibrant fruit note and a touch of pungency, minerals. Some Cascahuín signature barn funk. There is alcohol here, but it is merely the vehicle delivering the goods. Palate:  Great! Banana/vanilla, agave, pepper, mint and grapefruit peel.  Viscous and natural agave sweetness. Finishes in a lingering fashion with warming heat, significant pepper, some alcohol and spices.

3114.Review: The aroma had loads of agave with significant notes of citrus along with some grass. Flavor is packed with agave and some grapefruit along with a hint of pepper. There is also some sweetness from cooked agave at the front of the palate Flavor is long lasting with lingering sweetness from the agave and citrus. It does not taste like a high proof blanco. I really enjoyed this blanco, it’s one of the best I’ve had.

3115.Review: A very aromatic tequila, this higher proof blanco really shines in the aroma and taste department. Rich roast agave notes on the nose lead to a nice naturally sweet taste in the mouth along with a big alcohol punch that fades to slight bitterness. Not available in the US.

3116.Review: It smells really interesting. Maybe even hints of something mustardy?

3117.Review: Amazing Blanco, so good. Long finish with a peppery burn I love.

3118.Review: Smell of raw and cooked agave. Mouthfeel - coats but not overly slippery. Taste - hot alcohol lingers, sweet water, white pepper, plantain leaves

3119.Review: What a great nose!Raw and cooked agave, floral, citrus, earthy, fantastic On the palate, much of the nose comes through, adding pepper and minerals, balancing with a sweetness Finish initially has a touch of heat, the great cinnamon tingle, ends with an odd sweetness Great high proof

3120.Review: extra proof pays off, packed with flavor, rich texture. nose is hot, but palate is lots of sweet/nutty agave then anise/almond in the finish. drinks like a perfect pan dulce. Great!$65 out the door for high proof tequila is a steal

3122.Review: Nice and strong agave scent on the nose, considering 48% still great flavor, nice agave followed by peppers and minerals.

3123.Review: Agave on the nose. I’m getting a mineral forward with agave & pepper on the back end. I like this bottle still strength amplifies the flavor, but a little too much mineral for my taste.

3124.Review: Nose: herbs, olive, citrus, agaveTongue: spice/pepper, mineral, agave, green, dry

3125.Review: Great sipper with some extra sting on the end. Nose:MineralVegetalAgaveAlcohol Touch of citrus and aniseTasting sweet agave with cinnamon and a touch of smokiness. Excellent high proof blanco.

3126.Review: A solid higher proof blanco from one of our favorite distilleries.   Balanced and complex with the expected agave and citrus flavors and hints of pepper and spice.  Delicious.

3127.Review: 75th official rating. Great aroma of raw and cooked agaves, citrus, white pepper. Raw agave and citrus hit the palate with a smooth transition to cooked agave, earth, celery, and a touch of cinnamon. Great balance between “bright” and “dark” flavors and aromas.

3128.Review: Definitely hotter on first try. Lots of agave. Peppery. Excellent.

3129.Review: Solid raw & ripe agave aromas with some minerality, lime, wet stone, green pepper. On the palate it’s pretty matched with the aromas. Starting at the front of the tongue there’s some mild agave sweetness, with the minerals and spice showing mid palate and some long lingering green pepper and wet stone like flavors. Not too hot for a high proof tequila.

3130.Review: Very clean and bright all around, much more so than the regular Blanco. The nose is really nice with sweet melon, a touch of smoke, minerals and a subtle hint of rose. Palate entry is butter, then crisp lime, spice, earth… finish brings hot pepper, fruit, vanilla and minerals. This is a great one!

3131.Review: A little hot, but expected for the high proof. Citrus, minerality, Poignant white pepper. Pleasant to drink once the palate adjusts.

3132.Review: i just can’t get enough of the bold cooked agave nose that continues on the palate. Subtle citrus and pepper. Funny story about this bottle. I purchased it at Agave Spirits in PV while visiting for my 40th. Our house chef chose this bottle off our counter to make a pitcher of margaritas. Hurt me to my core, but I’ll never have a better margarita.

3133.Review: Not much on the nose, a little agave. Taste is cooked agave, slight hints of citrus and a very clean, smooth finish.

3134.Review: Not much on the nose.  Some minerality with a touch of citrus.  The flavor and finish are agave and pepper with some high proof style alcohol.  If you enjoy high proof you will definitely like this.

3135.Review: Huge undiluted agave flavour. Pleasantly aggressive yet accessible.

3136.Review: One of the best Blanco Platas ever! Such a nice aroma to it, lot of agave, pepper, bit of alcohol, mint, tropical fruits.Flavor: tons of sweet agave that lasts long, fruity, citrusy, alcohol, mineral, butter and maybe some pepper at the end. Overall - This is a great Tequila to sip on anytime.

3138.Review: Overall nice balance of flavor. A lot of mint, citrus and a touch of brine, and fresh herbs.

3139.Review: Very good neat -Not a ton on the nose. Wife actually liked thesmell.A lot of agave and big citrus on edges oftongue. Smooth especially for a high proof Phenomenal with a cube! 100% buy again

3140.Review: The high abv makes this a very harsh drink. Tastes like the regular blanco is a watered down version of this one. 48 percent vs 38

3141.Review: Heavy of green earthy grassy notes…Amazing finish for heavier proof as I prefer the heavies.

3142.Review: Just a beautiful expression of a high proof blanco - Minerals , mints , agave , overcooked agave , alcohol slight citrus and sweetness

3143.Review: Nose: agave, citrus, faint alcohol Palate: salinity balanced with agave sweetness, pepper, spiceFinish: lasted a long, long time; some pepper lingers until the endLote 64

3144.Review: Cascahuin Plata 48Lot 125A top notch high proof blanco.  Allow this one to open up in your glass to get the best it has to offer. Purchased at Sip Tequila for $69.Aroma: Bold earth, agave and mint up front. Notes of cilantro, walnuts, and grapefruit.  Faint traces of vanilla. Wonderful. This is about as good as it gets.Palate: Full mouth salinity and agave sweetness on the approach with a nice build up of warmth.  Cooked agave, baked bread, thyme, peppercorns and grapefruit rind.Finish: Long dry. A slight sweetness with a lip smacking herbalness.

3145.Review: Very vaginal Sarah thinks it taste like licorice I like it it is higher proof so it the little Bernie

3146.Review: Man, I could just smell this one all day. Citrus-agave-floral just opens up wonderfully. With a more herbal opening on the tasting that kind of fades into a drier, earthy yet still sweet finish. Just great stuff.

3147.Review: nose is intensely citrus "lemon,grapefruit tangerine" agave front and center. extreme vegetal, crisp minerals and very light alcohol smell.has a violet/jasmine scent.on the palate I get a delightful blend of agave, roasted pineapple, the citrus.. mmm. and the minerals from the water.. a burst of black pepper including the spices. and fresh sage taste  very spicy . like dry roasted anchor chiles. the finish is long and fresh the spice lingers. (note) I was taught to kiss the juice. basically simulate the drink with a closed mouth. wet your lips with the tequila before sipping.  and then go back to the nose. then sip... works for me... just  saying... I recommend this all day.

3149.Review: Huge smack of cooked agave right away! The smell of alcohol is there from the higher proof but there’s also crisp green vegetal notes, black pepper, olives, minerality, and a mesquite/smoke thing going on. The nose on this is amazing. Oily (almost chewy) mouthfeel with a natural, caramelized sweetness from the agave. The finish goes on and on.As someone who was wary of high-proofs for a while this is a must-try. The flavors here are unbelievable and they’re stronger and more full-bodied than your typical 40% abv blanco. One of the best I’ve had!

3150.Review: Cascahuin Plata 48NOM 1123updated:2nd reviewdid a blind tasting July 3, 2022more agave forward, heat pepper vanilla floral sweet, a little caramel. good long finish. complex still like it very much!________________________1st reviewJune 13, 2022my rating 89lote: 45 (071220)nose: earth, vegetal, citrus agave pepper a little minttaste: agave pepper mintfinish: long pepper warmth

3151.Review: 5.27.22 Update - man this is good stuff here! Aroma: sweet yet butteryFlavor: dynamic flavors changing throughout the finish; just the right amount of pepper and heat. More raw or green agave than cooked. Sweet on the swallow at the beginning of the finish almost honey like.Finish: long and tasty - some burn but not bad for high proofLove it!

3152.Review: Brine and green bean on the nose. Sweet cooked agave on the tongue. A finish that lingers forever. Tasted blind.

3153.Review: This is so good! Just in incredible and tasty blanco! Beautiful sweet flavor all around

3155.Review: Cascahuin  Plata 48, Lot 103.   Purchased this past wknd, during a trip to San Diego along with several other bottles of sweet nectar. I've really grown to like the higher-proof tequilas. Gives the flavor profile a nice bump.NOSE:  The agave aroma is sweet, but seems slightly subdued compared to some blancos, it's still very nicely balanced with the extra alcohol hit... peppery, minty, grassy, scents of grapefruit flesh, vegetal, and a fresh moist dirt aroma that reminds me of helping my father dig holes to plant roses in our backyard when I was a child.MOUTH:  Agave flavor is almost a touch creamy! As is typical, the notes on the nose are expressed in the flavor profile. There's a nice intensity of flavors... along with that citrusy peppery alcohol, and a buttery smooth mouth feel which finishes light and smooth. Mmm Mmm good!

3156.Review: Pretty vegetal and earty. Tasted alongside with Siembra Valles HP, both are quite similar but unique.

3157.Review: A tequila drinkers tequila. Aaron Ward - my AGM- bought me this bottle of tequila for me my first bottle of tequila. It is an acquired taste for sure. Tough at first, but you learn to love it. spicy

3158.Review: crisp flavor...you can definitely taste the higher alcohol content

3159.Review: The sweetness of agave is delicious, but it also has a slightly lascivious impression.

3160.Review: As soon as I removed the cork I smelled the cooked agave.  This high proof Blanco is the equivalent of the rebel of the Cascahuin family.  I love Cascahuin’s more tame Tahona Blanco, but Plata 48 is anything but tame.  It’s pure, spicy, cooked agave with some heat, and a good finish.

3162.Review: Blast of agave up front. Lime and citrus mid palate, with minimal burn from the higher proof. Vegetal/grassy notes come through in the finish. Tons of bold flavors here, and coats the mouth very well. Excellent blanco.

3163.Review: Nose is subtle Thick oily mouthfeel, with lots of mellow agave and a distinct fruity creaminess (a flavour I have found in other valley tequilas, but toned down and more enjoyable here)Finish has a pleasant burst of heat followed by baking spices, pepper, and a lingering coating of the mouth

3164.Review: Aroma is nice. Full cooked agave, pepper, mine (like an old peppermint) little fruitiness like banana peel. Taste- completely different than expected; agave, vegetal, licorice (slight bitterness) loads of pepper on the back end that has a long finish

3165.Review: aroma: floral, fruity, agavetaste: spicy, strong

3166.Review: Light citrusy smell -love the aroma!Strong Woody and peppery taste- bitter tasteWorst finish of cascahuin -lingers on tongue

3168.Review: Aroma: alcohol, citrusTaste: spicy finish, sweet start (agave)

3169.Review: Lote 64, Strong agave aroma, 30W oil on the tongue, nice peppery taste,  long warm mellow finish. 96 proof this is fantastic stuff. The Mrs picked me up  2 btls from La Playa in GDL 600 pesos each. What a steal. If you can find some in the USA, get some. #CASCAHUINEANDO still kickin Patron & Don Julio ass.

3170.Review: Nose: strong agave, vegetal, and spicyTaste: strong mouthfeel, notes of pepper, and an earthy, lasting finishA very strong blanco that I’ll be sure to buy again!

3171.Review: Really nice aroma. The agave is there but it’s soft and not over powering..  The initial flavor is more subtle than I expected but I loved the finish and the peppery heat that lingered. Excellent blanco...will enjoy the rest of this bottle.

3172.Review: very boozy, but in a good way.  Tasty clean finish.  Would definitely get the job done effectively

3173.Review: The Cascahuín 48 Plata is very rich and full of terroir. Beautifully balanced and elegant in style, much like the 80 proof, but bearing more depth, concentrated agave character, and viscosity. This is the epitome of Los Altos Tequila, uncompromised and without excess manipulation. If you see this in on the shelf, considering stocking up unless you want to leave some for us. High proof Tequila is certainly becoming harder to acquire.

3174.Review: Cascahuin plata 48:  Alexis (a wonderful guide at the distillery) explained how the cement tanks and the added agave fibers to the fermentation tanks completely changed the profile.  This is way different than the regular blanco.  It is MUCH sweeter and so full of agave it’s just beautiful.

3175.Review: Licorice is definitely the aroma and pronounced flavor upon opening before breathing. Agave and mineral is present. For a 48%, burn is undiscernable from a 40%.

3176.Review: peppery, high proof that stick around for a hot minute!

3177.Review: Lactic nose.  Lots of agave and pepper on the palate.  More earthy and vegetal on the finish.  Nice sipper.

3179.Review: Great example of a high proof Blanco. Good solid agave flavour. Nice mineral nose and warm peppery finish.

3180.Review: Smooth noseGrassyFreshCitrus Definitely some alcohol on the nose. Has a biteVery rich.Has an alcohol burn but mellows to a sweetness on the finish

3181.Review: For a high proof tequila the alcohol is not so noticeable in the taste. Agave, pepper and mineral flavors make this a must have sipper.

3182.Review: Alcohol nose. Sting on the tongue. Mostly enjoyable. Peppery

3183.Review: Noticeable agave flavor with a bit more more burn than other Cascahuin products due to the 48% alcohol content. The cheesy lactic flavor is still present. This is a wonderful sipping tequila if you are ok with a little quality burn.

3184.Review: Lote 1018. Another excellent tequila from Cascahuin. The higher proof lends itself to an explosion of agave flavor that is tough to beat. Absolutely amazing!

3185.Review: The Cascahuín.48% abv 96 proof. It is hot, surprising and remarkable finish. I am hooked on this high proof. Chava at NOM 1123 is a master. The Casachuín line rocks!

3187.Review: On the smell you hit of cooked agave and alcohol, taste is strong and burns on the first sip, aftertaste anf the further sips is were you feel the wonderfull flavors if the agave.This is on my top 3 list of blancos and for the price I get it in Mexico this is a no brainer. Well done Cascahuin.For sipping or mixing, Cascahuin Plata 48 brings a unique flavor and characterEn el olfato obtienes un golpe de agave cocido y alcohol, el sabor es fuerte y el primer trago arde debido a sus 48 grados. La recompensa viene en el retrogusto y en los tragos siguientes, gran sabor a agave cocido.Esta en mi lista de los 3 mejores blancos. Exclelente creacion de Cascahuin y el precio en Mexico creo que es bastante justo, 650 pesosYa sea solo o para mezclar, el sabor de Cascahuin plata 48 es único

3188.Review: Very nice, smoother than I expected being higher proof than normal 80. Decent finish with a slight creamy feel but not oily. I don’t have a sophisticated nose but got an agave citrus sent . Definitely looking to explore this brand more.

3190.Review: Big cooked agave up front. Pepper, vegetal, and I get a small amount of tobacco smoke. The mouth feel is creamy and awesome- I love this one. I go back and fourth with this Plate 48 and the Tahona as my favorite from Cascahuin. A truly beautiful blanco.

3191.Review: Intense.   Great.Aroma: slightly hot but nice citrusFlavor: cooked agave, honey, pepper, mint and basil.  Citric.  Gently sweet.  Hot but the sweetness works well to balance things.  An exciting  one!

3192.Review: Oh my! One of the best, if not THE best blanco I have tasted.Incredible cooked agave notes on the nose and even better flavor. The aftertaste is pleasant and lingering, making you crave the next sip even more. The 48% ABV (94 proof) spices things up without giving you the burn of other high-proof Tequilas.Hats off to the Rosales Fam. & Co on this one.Cheers!

3193.Review: It has a mineral, citric, peppery, fruit tasty. It’s definitely one that, you may not want to put the bottle away just yet.

3194.Review: Very complex citric, fruity Spring water

3195.Review: Pure distilled tequila!! The tones are very natural and mineral.  The finish is special thanks to that 48%.  great overall

3196.Review: En esta etiqueta, cascahuin logra expresar lo que en mi opinión debe tener un excelente tequila.

3197.Review: Great example of a well made Valle tequila. I would recommend anyone to try this tequila if looking for some of the regional characters of the Valley of Tequila. Full of agave from beginning to the end. There is an initial burst of flavors with some minty and peppery notes that hit the tongue but then recedes giving space to a lighter mineral tone with a long finish with herbal characters.

3198.Review: excellent! love the revealing finish and hint of tabacco on the nose

3199.Review: Blind tested vs G4 Blanco; Sweet, slight agave nose; very fruit forward with warm honey across the palette; slight caramel on the backend, delicious; at $50 USD, this is one of my favorite blancos; 4/17/21, tasted blind vs Siembra Valles High Proof, definite taste of sweet, fruit; delicious but 1 point less than Siembra;

3200.Review: Ripe agave aroma. 5 year agaveRoller mill and fermented with agave fibers on top in a cement tanks for 4 days This is hands down one of the best tequilas

3203.Review: WOW this stuff is amazing start to finish.

3204.Review: You can really smell the cooked agave and the anise, full body and really sweet but a mineral contrast that make it balanced.A must try Tequila.

3205.Review: Wow, another amazing overproof tequila, beautiful agave notes and a nice vegetal bouquet and flavour.Just a gem.

3207.Review: huge cooked agave nose pepper anise. natural agave sweetness grass vegetal some citrus. long finish. a great high proof blanco. one of the best

3208.Review: Damn, before I tried this again just now, courtesy of veteran tequilamollier and Cardamaro-based mixologist Connor TheImpaler, I had burdened this delightful spirit with the snivelly and mealymouthed score of 79%.  What was I thinking? Why was I not immediately beaten to death with a coa?  This nectar projects up the length of my nostrils the finest agave sniffings I have yet encountered.  Despite being 48% you can barely taste the alcohol.  Delicious.

3209.Review: Agave cocido, dulce, fuerte, esta a 48 grados, se sienten los grados al estar en boca, despues del primer trago, empiezas a sentir mas los sabores.

3210.Review: Barn yard, anise, bubble gum, cloves, black cherry,

3212.Review: The aroma of this one is pretty awesome, full of "green" aromas, you will perceive a very refresh in nose.The taste is very smooth, very softly, is full of agave sweetness.

3213.Review: Crystal clear in the glass with thick legs that took a long time to develop.  Aroma of agave, herbs, grass and alcohol (48%).  Flavor of cooked agave, citrus and pepper.  The finish is long and the alcohol doesn't overpower.

3215.Review: Very vegetal, peppery with loads of fresh cooked agave, The taste on this blanco is a pleasure to enjoy, the entrance is robust, strong but welcoming at the same time with very little  to medium alcohol burn and instead it fades quickly to layers and layers of fresh cooked Agave, with hints of ground almonds and nutmeg, some sweetness is present that quickly reminds me of baked sweet potato, caramel notes, that clearly comes from the miles of the agave and a long long ending, the finish is long and very pleasant aftertaste that leaves the palate coated with Agave!

3216.Review: The cooked agave and earthy aromas and flavors dominate over the high proofing. Very balanced and sweet. A great proposal from Cascahuin!

3217.Review: Humid roasted agave off the nose, very unique and inviting, makes me think of Mexico.Some elevated sweetness that is a bit much for my taste but this is an excellent Tequila (agave spirit, whatever).

3218.Review: Starts with herbal, citrus and vegetal aromas coupled with a sweet green olive brine. Across the palate, a nice mouthfeel that has even more of that sweet and mild green olive, with a finish that hits with a punch of spice, agave, mint, and black pepper that lingers with a pleasant heat from the 46% abv.An excellent agave distillate that is not easy to find, but well worth enjoying.

3219.Review: Unusual, vegetal, green olive nose. Flavor bursts on the palette like a firecracker of black pepper, sweet agave, cinnamon. Definitely taste the 46%, and numbs the lips but balanced all the way through. One of the longest and tastiest finishes ever. Thick and slick mouthfeel, as with all Caballito Cerreros. A somewhat challenging, but extremely memorable spirit.

3220.Review: Color label. It was amazing. Probably the best blanco I’ve had.

3221.Review: Cooked agave, smoke, grass, well water, cinnamon, minerals, citrus, lime, tropical fruits, celery, mint and rosemary.  Palate includes all the aromas plus tangerine, melon or mango. Finish is warm medium , sweet, lite bitterness, barrel spices, cinnamon and little pepper. IMHO one of the three best blanco I like as of 4/2021.

3222.Review: Cooked agave for days although different to blue agave. However, it is also very mineral and earthy so it balances. The higher ABV version is my favourite as I find the flavours to be intensified.

3223.Review: A real treat.  Agave forward with nice heat.  high proof really comes through to make this a fantastic sipper. The aroma on this is just phenomenal.

3224.Review: Aroma:   Spicy cooked agave - almost like chewing  on a piece of agave, it is so vivid. Slight mushroom straw funkiness. Aroma of jackfruit. Mineral effervescence. Floral and herbal notes, cut grass.  Green olive. Flavor:   A potent pepper and ethanol blast of heat - but carrying fruit, spice, and sweetness as well. Light vanilla and cinnamon fade in and out. This leaves some fire on the back palate and esophagus. Not real viscous. Finish:  A little hot and kicks like a burro. But what a ride.

3225.Review: Inside rear label says Batch 01. The Agave  Angustifolia, colloquially called Chato provides a different nose than the Agave Azul that is also produced and bottled at Fabrica Santa Rita. Nose has some earth and mineral elements carried by the 46% ABV. On the palate it is easy to sip with earth, grass, roast chato and surprisingly a mild alcohol experience for the higher ABV. Some nice sweetness that lingers as the finish fades.

3226.Review: Acquired on may’19, for the German market Ringsherum.Nose: initially very herbal, grass, floral notes, spicy, 8 star anise, very aromatic. Palate: for a second the ethanol stand out, but balances and floral notes appear, raw agave, anise, slight agave sweetness, a hint of black pepper. Finish is medium to long, raw agave and floral notes persist.

3227.Review: Little smoke on the nose with mint. Cooked agave for sure. Honey on the palette, soft notes of vanilla, pepper a little lavender as well.

3228.Review: A little different flavor profile than your standard Tequila but very appealing. A little smoke, fruity, cinnamon. Nice combination of flavors that work well together.

3229.Review: We’ve been struggling to find this anywhere and came across it in a tasting bar in Puerto Vallarta. The label doesn’t exactly match as what we had was black on the seal but said agave not chato. I was really impressed with the 40 and this fell a little short for me in comparison. Just not quite as complex or smooth. Still a great tequila though!

3230.Review: Magnificent! Any CC expression will be of great quality. If you can do a side by side with Azul Blanco, both really enjoyable

3231.Review: Wow. The taste is more mezcal-ish. But really good  cinnamon agave taste with some smoke and tangerine.  Very different. But so good.

3233.Review: Aroma- lovely aroma of agave (that is more vegetal and smoky smelling), light citrus perhaps grapefruit Taste- the first couple seconds is sweet and then vegetal smoky agave hitFinish- very smooth for a 46%, pure chato agave

3234.Review: sweet spicy cooked agave earth minerals cinnamon green olive grass. mildly hot slightly sweet finish. purchased from sip tequila.

3235.Review: Not for newbies, lots going on here. Thick mouthfeel. Minerals, smoke, and jalapeño on the nose & palate. Cinnamon hits mid palate and carries through to a long hot finish. Very complex, many more layers not mentioned.  Hard to find, grab it if you see it!

3236.Review: vegetal olive nose. dare i say bandaid scent. not in a sweet way but..honey nuts, apricot, butterscotch, popcorn, cinnamon to me. earth. Excellent explosion. fantastic.

3237.Review: My 1st taste I wasn't too sure about this but the more I drank the more I really started to like it. Very distinct flavor. I recommend!

3239.Review: This is a unique Agave spirit… The nose and mouth are so good. For me I get a sweet mineral flavor and enjoyable spice finish.It’s like a night in the ring with a good worker and your finish hits perfect for the 1, 2, 3…

3240.Review: Tasted at the distillery December 2019. This is really good and different than the azul. I like the azul better than the “chato”. But this has lots of great flavor.

3242.Review: Clear crystal tequila in a heart shape bottle. Aroma of raw agave, herbs, vegetal, orange peel, jasmine and alcohol. Flavor includes caramel candy, cooked agave, herbs, vegetal, cinnamon, and white pepper. Finish is silky with long legs, agave and oranges.

3243.Review: Nose: cooked agave, fresh ground clove, banana, fresh wood, day old cut grass, it’s muskyFlavor: agave, baking spices, vanilla, and black pepper Finish: medium musky up front and moves to spice of mixed peppers

3244.Review: I’m tasting agave, fruit, vanilla, almond, and a pop of pepper. It’s coats nicely and shows off its legs. Yummy!

3245.Review: Mexican release, 38% ABVNose:   Fruity agave with cloves and a green banana tease. A pop of jackfruit and a dank cellar note. Flavors:   Buttery brown sugar richness. Medium black pepper that builds intensity throughout the tasting. Vanilla and almond cream mid palate. Baked pineapple and spices. A very respectable reposado that doesn’t develop a whole lot more on the finish. I’d like to retaste this brand at 40% ABV.

3246.Review: Nose:Rain/damp ground HayAgaveCaramelFlavor:Sweet cooked agavePepperVanilla Delicious Reposado

3247.Review: one of the better reposado out there nom 1414 really hit it out the ball park with this one

3248.Review: Nose is super sexy!Rich caramel and dark chocolate, almost smells creamy. More of those aromas are even more present on the palette, some toasted marshmallow and a great mouth feel.

3250.Review: Great añejo will definitely drink it again. Love the smell and taste combinations. Sweet in the taste I get some caramel and vanilla. Finish goes down without burning very pleasant

3251.Review: A fine Anejo, balanced but lacking some finer points. Love the repo much more

3252.Review: Nose:   Aged oak barrel chips. Ripe, slightly bruised dark tree fruit and berries. Cinnamon, maple, vanilla bean and citrus zest. A whisper of white pepper. Pungent alkaline minerals. Flavor:   Rich silky texture, with pepper and barrel spices heating up the entrada. Creamy vanilla & maple present as in the nose - but the fruit is taking a back seat on the palate. Citrus notes bloom halfway through.

3253.Review: Super well rounded. Caveat emptor/ its aged long enough it does REALLY take on the barrel notes. I’m starting to gravitate more towards lightly aged expressions and this one doesn’t quite fit into that category

3254.Review: Fantastic tequila from 123. Cooked agave gives way to oak, vanilla, butterscotch and chocolate-covered toffee. Nice treat.

3255.Review: Follows the lineage of the reposado but that balance between agave & oak is starting to disappear. This lineup has made me grow a whole new appreciation for American oak and how even a contract brand can have elite results with the right recipe. Well done.

3256.Review: Light agave nose. Smooth mid palate. Hot, dirty finish.

3258.Review: A lighter anejo not unlike the Ocho product. More bitter notes on the finish though, and to me this anejo doesn't have the balance of oak and agave that the Ocho does.

3259.Review: Very light nose, sweet vanilla dominates, but alcohol also prominent. Sweet entry, quickly turns slightly bitter. Can't recommend this one.

3260.Review: Impressive. A very light touch añejo that has a familiar chocolate French oak aroma. Very nice, and works well as a crowd pleaser.

3261.Review: Big fan of this one. Lots of oak/whiskey/barrel notes but it tastes natural and there’s a nice sweetness on the finish. I paid $65 for this and have no regrets.

3262.Review: This, to me, is what a nice quality Anejo should be for this price. First, it is organic and there are not many who can say that about their agave production. The tequila has been aged just the right time in oak as it has taken up that woodsy fragrance and flavor but not overwhelmingly. Some gentle floral notes. Well balanced and one I will keep in stock as a daily drinker.

3263.Review: Pretty good, finished could be better.Picking up what may be additives on the sweetness and finish but it is far from additive heavyI’d drink again

3264.Review: A light, delicious anejo. Maybe too light. A light nose with oak and some chocolate. Super-easy sipper. Chocolate and vanilla flavors. Additives?Almost reminds me of drinking a flat soda. Good anejo but definitely missing something. Expected a bit more after having the reposado. The $90 price tag doesn’t help.

3265.Review: Very light, grassy nose.  Vanilla, oak and agave are notable on the palate.  Has a longish but non-descript finish.  A very tasty and easy-to-drink Anejo.

3266.Review: Very warm finish. More complex than the 2 / Reposado. The finish is very nice. There is a depth to this anejo that I have a hard time describing. It has a caramel sweetness and a thick mouthfeel

3267.Review: Alcohol, vanilla, and sweet notes on the nose. Unexpected pepper up front, but pleasant. Then slight citrus, vanilla, burnt brown sugar, and slight berry on the end. Recommend!

3268.Review: Well done Anejo aged around 18 months I believe , I use this in a Manhattan , the agave shines well against the oak  and baking spice. Tons of dark fruit no additives well done

3269.Review: Maybe I just don’t like anejo?  Woody, warming, somewhat acetone taste? Not as smooth as I’d hope.

3270.Review: Great oaky smell but that taste dominates too much in taste.

3271.Review: I had this in a margarita and it was DELICIOUS!!! Tasted like apple juice lol!!! So yummy

3272.Review: Tried during a tasting . Overpriced additive vanilla oak tequila. I did pick up some brown sugar/spice in the flavor. But very faint, mostly vanilla bomb to mask the oak barrel of the anejo. Which I’ve come to find out is very common amongst anejo additive tequilas. They try to cover the barrel taste with additives. Probably why the cristalino segment is a thing now… highly disappointed.

3273.Review: For you visual people,  This has a nice transparent amber color with good legs in your glass.  The aroma has oak, agave and some alcohol.  The flavor adds some vanilla sweetness.  The finish is not as long as the legs would have indicated which is fine because a sweetness emerges with a small bit of alcohol, not pepper, burn.  Overall a low80s product unless you enjoy the sweetness which would move your score up a couple of points.

3274.Review: A bit sweet for my liking, but for someone that likes strong flavors this is for them. Not bad, small burn at the finish. Would be higher if slightly lower price.

3275.Review: SmoothLittle tequila biteNot too sweet for anejo

3276.Review: Earthy, petroleum notes, minerality, barrel sweetness on nose, softest of the 3 in mouthfeel, persistent oaky & soft finish. Nice barrel influence.

3277.Review: A great tequila. There’s a bitter tannin kick midpallet which is probably because the tequila is Finished in smaller barrels to speed the aging process. The finish is also very drying. Otherwise it’s very good.

3278.Review: Earthy and herbal aroma. Lemon lime flavors, with hints of yellow cake, vanilla and oak. Sweet finish of vanilla and agave with a touch of lingering pepper.

3279.Review: Aroma is mild and inviting with a hint of caramel notes. Smooth and sippable with a toasty flavor (very very mild spice). Balanced flavor profile overall with a smooth finish. Nothing harsh or bothersome. Very well done, but not memorable.

3280.Review: Very sweet. Definite oak and pepper

3281.Review: This is more oily than the repo and I like that.

3282.Review: Good aroma very similar to the repo with cinnamon and sweetness. Taste is good too. Again similar to the repo with some additional depth. Finish is the best part. Long lasting and flavorful. Best of the three expressions.

3283.Review: This reminds me a lot like Fortaleza Anejo tequila.

3284.Review: Vanilla/caramel/oak up front. Subtle chocolate toffee with just the right amount of white pepper on the finish. I really like this.

3285.Review: Balanced and clean tastingHint of sweet but just as a teaseOak, vanilla, agave, very light pepper/smokeGreat hop from a bourbonDelicious

3286.Review: Oak on the nose. Light alcohol,  butterscotch, vanilla, very light agave, and black pepper.Very soft on the palate. Viscous mouth feel. Cinnamon,  butter, oak, cooked agave. and light alcohol. Medium to long finish.  Very nice!

3289.Review: Slight vanilla aroma and flavor. Not overly strong finish for a anejo. Prefer their reposado.

3290.Review: very smooth but was expecting little more flavors from the Anejo due to the robustness of the Reposado.

3292.Review: Hint of spice and oak on the nose. Taste is great with oak and toast hints. Very smooth. Great anejo.

3293.Review: A cheaper Clase Azul! The taste is quite similar, I actually prefer this anejo to that reposado. Tastes like a tequila that's twice as expensive, if you see it... Grab it.

3296.Review: Nice rich oaky flavor, mid spice, not too sweet, smooth finish, nicely balanced.

3297.Review: Bottle #35756; Light agave on the nose; hints of caramel & semi-sweet chocolate across the palette; butterscotch & stronger peppery agave on the backend; I feel that $60.00, is a decent price but $50.00, would make it a great deal.

3298.Review: Very heavy alcohol scent with a mild sweetness. Warm on the tongue all the way to the belly. Taste is average. Decent tequila but there are better bargains to be had.

3299.Review: Love this tequila. I have had 4 bottles in like 4 months. Butterscotch and cream soda.

3300.Review: Awesome smooth goodness...loving Portland, it's trees, beer, and little Tequila scene!

3301.Review: good breakfast tequila and great value. hints of caramel. sweet.

3302.Review: Fairly neutral aroma, heavy on the alcohol smell. Nothing really stands out in flavor or finish to be. Pretty disappointing really.

3303.Review: Great nose, subtle sweet complex flavor, a bit of a harsh finish. Overall very nice!

3305.Review: Not as good as the blanco or repo. Seems to go too far for smoothness

3306.Review: very tasty flavor, with a bit of roughness to the finish (but not too rough)

3307.Review: Seems thin with a strange finish. I've heard good things so maybe my taste buds are off. Definitely taste the peppery American oak.

3308.Review: Nice agave nose with light hint of oak. Very complex on the pallet with great finish.

3309.Review: This was an ok XA but what made me buy it the most was that it had the wrong price posted and they sold it to me at that price. The smell came in with a little bit of heat but pleasant after a minute. In the taste a lot of oak from the barrel In the finish it went down without burn

3310.Review: Apparently all we needed was TONS of oak to coax a decent score out of me. This is a butterscotch bomb, absolutely zero agave left but nice in its own way. I’m really not a fan of this lineup, it’s just not exceptional in any way.

3311.Review: Quite bourbon forward but it isn't covering the essential agave element. Very aromatic nose with agave, barrel spice of cinnamon and  mace along with alcohol. In the mouth natural sweetness and the barrel spice and agave make for a delicious experience. Lote 008. 02042018

3312.Review: Value priced! Also a good starter for newbies to taste.

3313.Review: Agave and oak on the nose. Some nice oak notes and some vegetal and mineral notes that don't come through much in the blanco. Neutral finish.

3314.Review: This is one of the tequilas that you get from old town tequila when you buy too much. So, I wasn’t expecting much. But I think I found something really good!  Or at least a good value.Not much going on with the aroma. But nothing bad. Maybe a little herbal and fruity.  The taste is where this one shines! It is strong in flavor… And a bit hot with alcohol. Definitely not smooth— it lets you know it is there and says hola.  There are some notes of pitted fruit, maybe plum. Also there’s a light hint of some dark sweetness, like brown sugar. But it is not overly sweet.  Definitely some pepper and maybe even some light chile. The finish is good with some good tingles on your tongue.  Thanks again for the free bottle OTT!

3315.Review: Pretty good for the price. Seems more like a shooter. Much better than most of the mainstream tequilas.  Old Town gave for free with big purchase.

3316.Review: Best for shots with lime and salt and chaser.. Nice aroma of sweet agave vanilla.  Has decent complexity with good mouthfeel and taste, sweet enjoyable.  Finish is a little medium with oak and a hint of smoke.  Got it for $1 at Old Town Liquor as a special purchase with order.

3317.Review: I got this for $5 on a promotion. Now considering the price I would rate this higher, but there isn’t much going on with it. The aroma is nice, the taste is good and there is minimal burn. In its full price, there are tequilas that are much better for the same price.

3318.Tequila: Amigo Tequilero Extra Añejo Gran Reserva
3318.Review: Really good effort here, warm and rich on flavour and nose. I get a touch too much sweetness on the finish but it disappears quite fast and goes bone dry.

3319.Tequila: Amigo Tequilero Extra Añejo Gran Reserva
3319.Review: Iâ€™m more of a tequila blanco person. But damn this is good.

3320.Review: Agave, caramel, and oak on the nose. Barrel spice and some cinnamon. Then there’s a sweetness that reminds me of French oak but their “premium” uses American, so I’m not sure. There’s a sweet fruity note that is almost like dates. If I was nosing this blind, I’d think it was an añejo. Excellent nose. There’s a bit of Ethanol but it opens up and that disappears entirely.Cooked agave, some vanilla. Not really a lot going on. Definitely a little oak and pepper, possibly the caramel but it’s faint and it could be the nose tricking me. Short finish.Overall Pretty decent. For $25, it’s decent enough as a sipper but I felt the blanco was tastier, the oak is overpowering for me, and I’m not loving it. Still good, but I think Arette reposado is a better budget buy.

3321.Review: Aroma: honey, agave, tropical fruits, spices.  Palate: fruits, banana, lime, sweet orange, mango, guava, chamomile, pomegranate.  Palate: fruits, spices, agave, nutmeg, ginger, marjoram, sweet flan custard. Finish is short to medium without heat, spicy, and agave.  This is a nice tequila for enthusiast and connoisseurs alike. You will enjoy!

3322.Review: 38% Mx. version @ $212 pesos...Dynamic nose. Caramel, vanilla, fruit, agave and light spices. Flavor:  Nuts, maple syrup,  light pepper and peach.  Coats the tongue nicely. Impressive at this price point for sure!

3323.Review: Great value, nice caramel nose with vanilla and baked agave, and light pepper. Light bodied flavor corresponding to the aroma. A fairly long finish leaving the palate wet and peppery.In terms of value for quality, I put this in the same class as Muchote or even Tapatio Repo.

3324.Review: Green oliveCooked agave Carmel honey and vanilla Slow soft marshmallow toasted finish

3325.Review: Was visiting Playa Del Carmen and bought this at this Europeana place on 5th for 380 pesos which is 18 usd. Amazing at that price.

3327.Review: Agave, caramel, oak, vanilla, solid tequila repo, better than most popular brands like Cuervos, but don't get me wrong, it's a personal preference

3328.Review: Aromas: agave, caramel, citrus, vanilla. Taste: perfect mix of the above as well, smooth. Nice clean finish. One of my favorite reposados.

3330.Review: Very nice aroma of agave, caramel and a hint of cinnamon & nutmeg.  Mild flavor of agave, spice, light pepper.  Oily finish on tongue and long, smooth finish.  Bargain at $30 from Old Town.  Blind rated on 12/31/21 higher than Fortaleza, El Tesoro (single barrel) & Santo Fino so I bumped it up a few points.

3331.Review: Roasted agave, vanilla and floral on the nose. Agave forward on the pallet, white flowers, hints of oak and vanilla. Very slight tannins on the finish. Tannins are short on the finish with agave medium long. Reminds of don julio repo. Great price for this quality of reposado. Producer told me it’s aged 6 months in American oak. The higher rating was due to the value. Very good juice for a really great price.

3334.Review: Man I can just imagine how the ultra premium taste that’s one of my next buys when I find it

3335.Review: 38% Mexico version.  Light straw color with long legs on the glass.   Aroma of vanilla and agave.  Flavor of light pepper, oak and agave.  Medium finish.

3336.Review: spicy! feel herb flavour with cooked agave. smooth, less alcohol taste.

3337.Review: some agave vanilla spice. not a favorite sipper.  will probably use it in margs

3338.Review: Cálido medio, muy frutal, dulce y de lágrimas  medias. Gran valor por precio

3340.Review: Agave forward and very little else. Clean autoclave taste, light citrus and herbal. A tequila purist will love this.

3341.Review: Enjoyed this tequila at the LA Tequila Fest. Very tasty, smooth and reasonably priced for a 1 L bottle.

3342.Review: Agave, peppery. long finish due to ABV.

3343.Review: Carlos’ home in DC. Can’t pronounce it but it’s good.

3344.Review: Delicious, but barely aged as an XA. This is simply all about the barrel, and in all honesty, it's completely overpriced. if this was priced normally.. let's say $230 to even $250, I would be putting it at a 92-93, but because of the ridiculous price, I really should be putting it at 86... but I'll be generous and put it at 90, because it is delicious.

3345.Review: Very whiskey forward from the aging in Booker’s barrels, this has more in common with the bourbon itself than with any of the 3 previous Aniversario releases. Disappointment with this for me mainly stems from the cost that is over 3 times the shelf price of any of the prior releases. It also is aged for less than half the time of any of the others at just over 3 years. I realize I’m bucking the idiot influencers and Insta posters but this gets a middle finger from me and earned a can’t recommend and a 3 for value. I’m being kind. Thanks Paul Kizer for providing the sample which was shared with several others.

3346.Review: Agave forward, barrel notes of rich, silky, baking spice, creamy, light sweetness. Absolutely delicious  … high price but it is exceptional

3347.Review: Nose and flavor of used barrel are there but did t last enough for me.  I wish for this to be aged a little longer, like 2 more years longer.

3348.Review: feb 18 2023ET 85th Nose: strong presense of Kentucky bourbon whiskey caramel Palate: vanilla caramel bourbon agave Finish medium and long flavor finishthis is a very good tequila and one that bourbon whiskey drinkers would enjoy. I feel honored to have been given a sample to try. I would gladly sip this when in the mood for an XA IF it was gifted to me, but at $500+ it is not an option for me. giving a 3 for value because of the price tag.

3349.Review: It was good but for the price way over hyped. There are better affordable options I would rather drink. Still very good but didn’t meet the hype for me.

3350.Review: Slightest Vanilla taste, Caramel, Oak, Cooked Cherries, Tobacco, very Ripe Banana, Dark Chocolate, dark fruit. Strong agave presence.Price hurts this one, I had 4 2 oz pours and it just gets better with each glass

3351.Review: Well this definitely has been sweetened It’s not over the top, nor is it cloying. It drinks more like an after dinner liqueur that would be great with any chocolate dessert. But if you’re not a fan of any amount of sweetness, you’ll probably want to skip this one. For me, I am enjoying it.

3352.Review: On the lighter side, not too sweet. Fair value. Not overpowering.

3353.Review: Sweet and smooth, sweet and smooth, sweet and smooth. I have a hard time wrapping my head around all the cinnamon and vanilla in this product. I can see why some like it as it tastes little like the tequila that I prefer and rate highly. This is a great dessert product.

3354.Review: This tastes like Christmas! The cinnamon spice is unique and so delicious

3356.Review: Incredibly smooth, the heavy vanilla/tobacco aroma belays the actual viscosity.

3357.Review: Way too sweet. Vanilla, cinnamon and cherry flavors. Tastes fake. I think this thing is FULL of additives—until they show otherwise.

3358.Review: Smells amazing. one of the best aromas out there for tequilas. Taste of vanilla sweetness with a butterscotch finish.

3359.Review: Licorice/anise on the nose. Pepper appears first on the palette, but soon balances out with more of that licorice taste and a bit of oak as well. Cinnamon really pops out on the finish. It’s more of a dessert tequila, but still pretty tasty.

3360.Review: Where is the agave?  A mix of vanilla and caramel on the nose followed by some cinnamon and vanilla sweetness.  This finishes with more sweetness and some citrus.  More pepper at the end would have been nice. None of these flavors are because of barreling.  Additives had to be part of the processing.  Can’t really hate this but I can’t love it either.  On a second tasting day, I’m increasing my rating.  Still not great but I don’t think I was quite as fair as I should have been.  I think this may be something that fits a profile and I will not denigrate if this is what you like.  I save my scorn for the Jose and Clase Azul people. Haha.

3362.Review: On the nose - vanilla and butterscotchOn the palette - tons and tons of vanilla, butterscotch, cinnamon.  I don't get much agaveIt's very sweet... no question that there are additives.. I'm not a hater of additives sometimes it makes for an inferior product tasting pretty good.I'd say this is very similar to a clase azul... it tastes slightly sweeter in a more artificial way, but it's not a bad "dessert tequila".   Is it Fortaleza?  not even close, but it's ok and if you like the sweeter side of things this would be worth trying or as a good entry for someone new to the spirit

3363.Review: Carmel, lemon and sweetened pineapple in the aroma. Sweet heat, toffee and anise in the taste. Finish is long, semi oily with slight cooked agave, licorice, clove and all spice. I paid $52 for 750ml. I would drink this again if I find it at a lower price.

3365.Review: Interesting product with very strong vanilla flavors and odor IMO

3366.Review: aroma and flavor predominantly caramel, vanilla and cinnamon. a touch of cognac oak on flavor. light, mild finish. not cloying, not off-putting, just not very complex. really lacks agave, doesn't fit my flavor profile. price point is decent. I would take San Matias XA, Gran Mayan Anejo over this for similar price. better than Clase Azul, adictivo, cava de Oro, compoveda, cincoro

3367.Review: As for me...nope. Taste like an additive bomb.

3368.Review: Butterscotch bomb on the nose and palette. Unique sipper. Enough of a cinnamon/vanilla blast that those flavors actually comes through on mixed drinks.

3369.Review: Can really pick up on the additives here.  Lots of cherry and sweet long lasting finish.

3371.Review: Tasted like it was infused with vanilla which overwhelmed all other flavors

3372.Review: Great sipping tequila especially at the $50 price point.

3373.Review: Sweet smell, Very different but good flavors, you can taste the mild clove and Vanilla, Great combo ! Little pepper on the back end but not much. Good Stuff

3374.Review: It seems this is “most reviewed Tequilla “ on this site and the ratings are all over the place. I do like this tequila but there is nothing extra about it that jumps out. Any flavors are short lived and subside quickly. I think this is why the ratings bounce between 70-to-90+. The tequila drinkers who like that quick “hit” of flavor rate this high and the ones expecting a bit more are on the lower side.

3375.Review: Surprising first taste. Familiar, but I just couldn’t place it. It was the sweet caramel flavors I enjoy, but a distinct finish. Then it hit me, and I did some research. This Anejo is aged two years a XO French cognac oak barrels ... and it’s heavenly!  So if you like a nice sipping Anejo, and you’re game for something quite different, this is a must try!  Can’t see my liquor cabinet being without this one ever again. Two snifters up!!

3376.Review: It make for some very good margaritas, but as a sipper, it’s way too cinnamon forward for my palate.  Interesting and different, but I could not get used to that flavor profile.

3378.Review: One of the tequila’s we are able to buy locally. Excellent with nice caramel notes

3379.Review: one of the best values in the tequila world based on its originality and flavor.  The fact that its around $50 makes it a near perfect addition to one's bar.

3380.Review: smooth with spice and cinnamon flavors. Unlike any tequilas I have drank so far

3381.Review: Tried this one at the El Conquistador while in Tucson. Mid shelf priced with a top shelf delivery.  Love the value here and will have a bottle at home soon. Has a nice butterscotch note and a smooth finish.

3382.Review: seems like a sweet sugary mess . almost medicinal to a fault.

3383.Review: Comparative to Corzo with more vanilla and Caramel notes

3385.Review: Wow. Had this before. I guess my taste changed but what a great Tequila. Smooth great aroma of butterscotch vanilla toffee. Starts smooth with great taste and finished smooth.

3387.Review: Unknown value. Purchased at bar. Suuuuper sweet but not artificially. Caramel, vanilla, and cherry are all dominate flavors. Honestly, Dr Pepper would be proud at all of the sweet flavors danced about.

3388.Review: Aroma: vanilla Taste: lots of caramel, brown sugar, honey. Not a lot of agave and certainly on the sweet side but still very enjoyable and drinkable.

3389.Review: A very nice dessert dram with notes of agave, vanilla, dulce de leche, White chocolate, banana, coconut, and a little pepper.

3390.Review: At Copita in Sausalito, CAAroma is sweet, caramel Tastes of vanilla, caramel, cinnamon and a hint of cherryThis tequila has a very smooth finishDelicious

3391.Review: Smooth and has notes of cherry. Extremely clean and pleasant.

3392.Review: Aroma sweet vanilla with a bit of clove and baked agave there but a bit overshadowed.   Licorice on the finish.

3393.Review: Aroma is very elegant and pleasing. Aroma is agave forward leading with caramel, vanilla, and small hint of brown sugar, cinnamon and clove. Very well balanced as all of the traits are distinguishable but not overpowering one another. Upon entry there is lots of caramel and vanilla with a backdrop of baked agave and finishes with the baked agave becoming more dominant. Length of finish is medium. Overall amazing tequila and great value

3395.Review: First time I tried it, loved it. Very sweet and extremely smooth. You won’t make “that face” with this tequila, no way.If you like sweet tequila you will love this one.Sort of has a faint black licorice taste which I usually don’t like but not terrible here.Long slow after burn but not in a bad way. Warm all the way down to your belly."

3396.Review: Has a lot of spice to it and on the sweeter side

3397.Review: The next best (affordable) thing compared to Don Julio 1942

3398.Review: Sweet aroma, vanilla undertones, smooth on the palette and a clean finish. One my all time favorite sippers. Can be hard to find.

3399.Review: Coconut and smooth vanilla. No dominant alcohol hit. Great introductory anejo tequila!

3400.Review: Very nice aroma , slightly sweet drinker with a smooth finish , hints of a nice fruit similar to cherry or a plum , overall a very nice tequila .

3401.Review: Vanilla cinnamon sweet finish. My favorite overall. Sends me!!

3404.Review: Seriously nice Anejo. Hints of vanilla finish

3405.Review: The flavor is rich and sweet, and the finish is fairly clean, but the aroma varies between merely unpleasant on some days and completely gross on others. At $59 a bottle, I think this is a bit of a rip-off. I won't be buying this again.

3407.Review: I only use this for cocktail drinks.Super smooth using a 6:3oz mix ratio.(6oz mixer with 3oz tequila)

3408.Review: Tried it again and I think I hate it even more now. I can't stand the weird overly caramel and lemony finish

3409.Review: Smooth, with very little heat. Sweet with loads of vanilla and a velvety finish.

3410.Review: I don't know what it was but there was a flavor in this tequila that was extremely offensive. To me, it came off as a plasticky/rubbery note.  People I shared it with did not get the same flavor I did.

3411.Review: Aroma is great, more vanilla in taste and smell - this is one of Desiree's favs

3412.Review: Very smooth finish. No burn. Has a cinnamon taste that stands out. Sweet but not overbearing.

3413.Review: Bursts of vanilla, soft tequila not too viscous - would like a bit more mouthfeel.

3414.Review: such a nutty sweet flavor that it is less appealing in the beginning but the finish is nice and smooth.  I think that it would be a great tequila to help convert people to tequila

3415.Review: Love the aroma, remind me of a sherry or port.Smooth with a nice finish.  It's now my wife's favourite sipping tequila.

3416.Review: One of the best finishes in a tequila. After reading many reviews I was expecting something super sweet like Clase repo. Instead it's only slightly sweet. Some might think that's a good thing, however I did not I was hoping for a cheaper replacement for Clase. For this price range id rather have Casa Noble its on the same flavor profile.

3417.Review: Vanilla bouquet. Smooth with tiny bite.

3418.Review: My favorite in every way. Tasty holiday flavor but will be great anytime.

3420.Review: A favorite, but very different than many other tequilas. Vanilla and caramel predominate - this is an after dinner tequila with little if any smoke, and a long finish.

3421.Review: I have a better selection than most venues I've been to and this is one of my top "tequila flavors".

3422.Review: Vanilla flavor. Liked it for about $45 4/20 $50

3423.Review: Honey and vanilla on the nose, with a rather pleasant flavor pallete (caramel, hazelnut and slight cinammon). Finish is superb, with a lasting effect that is very Brandy like.

3424.Review: Currently my favorite price and taste are perfect

3425.Review: One of my favorite tequilas! That brandy barrels do miracles in this particularly agave juice.

3426.Review: Sweet smell and hint of caramel

3427.Review: aged in oak casts - hints of vanilla, cinnamon, yummy

3428.Review: This is a great after dinner drink, and good for a date who is not so informed about tequila. One sip of this and your date will be impress of your tequila knowledge. Is this worth buying, yes! I would spend a little money on this one. One more thing, this goes great on a nice summer night with a cigar too.   VIve Con Ganas, Salud!

3429.Review: This is a well-made tequila, but it’s not complex. That’s not a bad thing, it’s just an observation. I usually look for some type of unique personality in a tequila, but this one is pretty straightforward and safe. Good for a group of drinkers at various experience levels.

3430.Review: Nose:   Jackfruit, minerals and trace barrel notes. You need to give this gently rested Repo a little time to coax out the aromas.  Fruity agave, herbs, white pepper, and a tropical fruit/vanilla note emerge with time. A touch of dandelion?Flavor:   This delivers clean sweet agave with a pepper backbone. A pleasing mouthfeel. As it opens up, some playful baking spices and subtle vanilla round out the tasting.  Finishes with a tiny amargo note. A respectable repo that won’t break the bank.

3431.Review: N: Agave, Vegetal then floralT: Sweet peppery agaveF: Sweet floral finishThe sweetness is natural and balanced. It’s pleasant and not overwhelming.

3432.Review: Aged 3 months in bourbon oak. Clean agave notes. Mild, silky taste. Great juice under $50. Love it in Palomas.

3433.Review: 3 months aged, sweet but not much barrel on the taste

3434.Review: Need to revisit, had a small sample

3435.Review: A long story goes with this but the short version is this is pre Suerte offering from NOM 1530. This may be the source of the original a√±ejo offering.

3436.Review: A masterpiece. Simply excellent.  1579 Gem. Buy one

3437.Review: very nice and agave forward, but a little sweet, and a bit of alcohol buzzing

3438.Review: Purchased in June 2022 for USD140.Aroma: plenty of cooked agave well balanced with oak, minerality, light fruitiness and citrus, orange.Palate: see aroma. Reminiscent of a creamy soda? Very unusual, but very enjoyable.Finish: orange, creaminess, alcohol and minerals.

3439.Review: This XA is an instant classic.  So much going on here.  Transitions from a fantastic blanco through all the Pasote expressions to get to this killer XA. Retains all of the warmth from the agave from the blanco and then some! Oily upon entry with yams, berries, candied walnuts, dried fruit> pineapple, blood orange, nutmeg, cinnamon, citrus, toffee, so much goodness here! One of the best XAs made in recent years!

3440.Review: Light in color.  Heat, whiskey, cooked agave. I wanted to really like this since I am a huge Pasote Blanco fan. Will need to retaste at another time.  Didn’t feel it lived up to its reviews.  / retasted again and found it opened up and was outstanding

3441.Review: Aroma : Full of cooked agave, vanilla, oak. This also carries some fruity undertones in the form of apple/pineapple/pear notes.Taste : The fruity undertones from the aroma carry through strongly here, accompanied by agave, citrus, and some minerality. There is also a hint of spice here that contrasts the sweeter fruit flavors, and the texture is oily and full bodied.Finish : Decently long and carries stronger notes of oak and vanilla that invite you back for another sip, and another, and another...This is like Cascahuín Extra Añejo's long lost cousin when it comes to the cooked agave/fruity flavor dynamic with some barrel notes; one of the possible routes a distiller may take in making a great Extra Añejo. In other words, buy this.

3442.Review: Another classic Pandillo/Felipe Camarena XA with its pale color and complex aroma of cooked agave, citrus, sweet fruit (apple, plum) and underpinning minerality (wet stone, clay). Spicy heat sits right on top of sweet fruit flavor at the open. (This is a contrast to many tequilas that open with sweetness then shift to spice. A really nice blend here.) These two continue to blend and dissipate at a similar pace in a mid to long finish. Again, the higher ABV is hardly noticeable in terms of heat but does push the agave and other flavors forward.Quite a bit of similarity between the Pasote and the Volans but to my taste the Pasote comes out slightly ahead.12-24-20197th Annual Xmas XA tasting

3443.Review: Nose is wonderfully bright cooked agave, nutmeg, cinnamon and citrus and it just deliversTaste is just a fantastic as the bright agave turns into cinnamon for a moment and then solid black pepper.  Just as you appreciate the pepper, the ride starts again as caramelly/vanilla finish lasts for the perfect amount of time.  What a journey

3444.Review: This 4 year XA from Felipe is special. The nose is complex. I detect cooked agave, sweet juicy plum , vanilla and some slight oak. I taste a sweet mineral brine, cooked agave and toasted brûlée. The finish is as wonderful as the first taste. This is truly a sipping tequila. ¡Salud!

3445.Review: Aged 4 years in used barrels, this XA from the mind of Felipe Camarena has a golden color with some copper highlights. Presented in a polished, heavy glass bottle and a basic clamshell case this resembles the well known Avion 44 package. At a similar price point  to the A 44 this XA has a very different flavor profile with a full and robust flavor imparted by Bib & Tucker barrels in El Pandillo's cellar. At 45% ABV this has a ton of spice on the palate from agave and barrel spice of caramel, oak, clove as well as a nice bite from the higher ABV. The taste is full with natural sweetness and some nice oiliness and really blooms with a small amount held in the mouth and worked around the tongue and gums for 20-30 seconds before swallowing. This finishes with a hint of bitter from the barrel but with everything else going on it isn't worth taking score away.

3446.Review: Aroma of agave and oak right up front followed by a floral and chocolate note. Flavor is a real nice oak and agave balance where one doesn't overpower the other. Some cooked brown sugar sweetness and cinnamon and peppery finish. Didn't get the overpowering heat that some have mentioned but enough to keep a nice presence in carrying the flavors well into the finish

3447.Review: Light Oak woody taste and on the nose, cook agave, notes of vanilla, hint of

3448.Review: Cooked Agave Carmel/vanilla cinnamon barrel spices, cool and great pepper mouth feeling. A touch of citrus, pineapple and tasty mineral clean water taste. Fortunate to try this. Gettin a apricot pear taste

3449.Review: Although it has a little alcohol, it is a very elegant tequila considering the characteristics of the barrel.

3450.Review: Full of flavor, agave, aroma, nose, finish, viscosity, taste, mouth feel. 90 proof.  Beautiful bottle, incredible detail… down to the Felipenstein tahona around the neck.

3451.Review: Great nose, long legs, good color. Fruit with mild alcohol nose. Good Agave. Taste, smooth, some wood notes, and medium burn for the high proof. Smooth finish that lasts. Easy rebuy

3452.Review: A very well balanced XA, cooked agave forward. Light mineral, citrus and oak.  Another excellent masterpiece from El Pandillo.

3453.Review: Still finding my way around extra anejos. This has a lot of depth in flavor. Maybe in part for to the slight over proof. Very fruity on the nose and in taste. In the pastor liner I like the agreed expressions more than the Blanco. Overall very well done.

3454.Review: Nose: roasted agave, toasted sugarFlavor: orange rind, pepperFinish: peppery in the mouth, but smooth down the throat.

3455.Review: Aroma: Agave, Caramel, Vanilla, Hint of Pineapple, OakFlavor: Agave, Vanilla, Pineapple, Citrus, OakFinish: There is an initial explosion of flavor on the palate and then it tapers off into a nice smooth finish. Overall: One of my favorite tequilas for special occasions. Just a fantastic Extra Anejo put out by Felipe Camarena. I got married last October and this bottle of Pasote Extra Anejo was one of my wedding gifts. I will always cherish this bottle.

3457.Review: I might have a completely different expectations for XA, but this one is nowhere near XA’s I like. My reference XAs are: Codigo XA, Grand Mayan, even Patron XA. To begin: the color is faint, would not expect this from XAs as I’m used to more rich and darker colors. Second, Pasote has unique earthy smell and flavor. This one is no different: earthy cooked agave on the nose. Smooth but tingly flavor with no depth at all, no layers like in other XAs I mentioned. Overall, this one should’ve been Pasote’s Anejo (as the current completely is undrinkable, imho) but the real XA needs a lot of work. For the price it’s a complete rip-off and I wouldn’t pay it again.

3458.Review: WOW!! this XA is awesome.  on the nose great barrel notes and roasted agave. citrus, and funky mango, jasmine and dry fruits. on the palate I continue to get all that agave. super creamy and so much minerals.. limestone and wet clay. butter scotch, cream soda, black pepper, sage,cinnamon, roasted nuts. soo much barrel.  very oaky.. getting a sweet potato candy vibe. made my taste buds explode.. so much flavor.. plus a little extra heat from this 90 proof.  aged prunes,raisins and dates.. super complex.  so many layers.. getting a mixed sensation of sun dried tomatoes and caramelized apples. finish was superb, just lingering and persuading myself to more.. kudos Mr Camarena..

3459.Review: Perfect. It’s not free… but worth the money. I actually went and bought two more bottles to squirrel away.It’s just about the most balanced extra Anjeo I’ve ever tasted. I appreciate that it’s NOT just cooked agave. When something is aged to this level, the barrel flavors in my opinion SHOULD slightly dominate a little over the cooked agave. So many highly rated ones fail either with no agave flavor left.. or so much you can’t tell it’s not just a Reposado. Very smooth.

3460.Review: A harsh finish for an anejo.

3461.Review: light sweetness on the nose but the taste is all pepper, a little oak but really light for an Extra Añejo. A little heat but the agave comes through on the finish. I don’t remember loving this the first time I had it but I feel like this has opened up incredibly. Definitely a fan, very enjoyable to drink.

3462.Review: I let this open up for about 10 minutes.  There’s an initial oaky bitterness that balances out midway and through a very pleasant finish.  However, the initial taste wasn’t as pleasant as the finish for me.

3463.Review: Soft butterscotch, fruity, apple, agave, raisin and a little oak on the nose. Still a hint of agave on the nose as well. Soft on the palate. A little alcohol burn on the back end. Nice baking spices, light cooked agave and vegetal on the palate. Long finish with a perfect amount of heat. Beautiful XA!

3464.Review: Initial aromas of sweet lemon  black pepper, rosemary, and cedar. Coming back to the nose after a few minutes I get buttered toast and some barrel influences  (oak, vanilla, baking spice).Despite being an extra anejo, the cooked agave flavour is still very noticeable. Lots of minerallity and herbaceous flavours. There is also some faint tropical fruit in the background.The finish is medium in length with noticeable citrus zest, oak, and vanilla. Retails for $275 Cnd here in Alberta, and I wouldn't think twice about spending that much on this incredible extra anejo!

3465.Review: Outstanding.   Have been waiting for 6 months for this bottle & I think I like it better than G4 & Volans

3466.Review: lot 1....minerality and agave right up front. slight caramel and pepper with a slight alcohol on the end. top notch and one of the best I've had. @anejo_bros

3467.Review: Light in color and great bottle too. Aroma is very good with fruit and some mild sweetness. Also getting undertones of vanilla and leather. Taste is an explosion of roasted agave with some spice. It is not overly sweet (gracias adios). It feels great in the mouth. It is not crazy complex-just really good. Finish is fantastic with some good heat and just the right amount of sweetness. Long lasting. This is what a great XA can be!  No superficial dark color or syrupy sweet nonsense.

3468.Review: Way too much resin flavor, and not enough sweetness.  Seems and looks much more like a young reposado in untoasted barrels than an extra anejo.  Might be interesting if it were $100 cheaper.  At this price point it's completely outclassed by every other tequila I've tried

3469.Review: Pasote does an excellent job with this extra Añejo. It brings buttery smooth aroma and flavor throughout with subtle hints of vanilla and caramel. Very smooth on the tongue without being overly sweet.

3470.Review: Nice smooth Carmel feel back of the tongue

3471.Review: Light amber color for an extra anejo. of course all Felipe's tequilas are typically lighter in color to most other tequilas but they do not lack in complexity. Peppery nose, cooked agave taste with hint of caramel and vanilla. Nice, rich mouthfeel. Rich consistent finish that I come to expect Pasote tequilas.

3473.Review: This Extra Anejo from El Pandillo and Felipe Camerena is a treat!On the nose you get the crisp water smell from the use of rain water and natural spring water in the making of this amazing tequila. It has a nice oily mouthfeel. The taste of citrus comes through with the wonderful explosion of cooked agave.  It also has a nice influence from the Dickel barrel used but weirdly and surprising enough not what you expect. While it does have a nice vanilla flavor some other flavors surprise you like grilled pineapple!  I don't get any chocolate or caramel from the barrel and I seriously don't mind it at all!  It's a must have for anyone serious about tequila.  Wonderful experience!
