3474.Review: needs to breath for about 10 minutes before drinking

3475.Review: Agave, white pepper, lime, brine. Long finish vibrating through lips, mouth, and chest. Nicely done.

3476.Review: On the nose, agave, grassy funk. Definitely some citrus, lime, orange rind.On the palate, full bodied cooked agave, that sweet potato-esque note, and some interesting salinity. Definitely some noticeable heat, I love high proofs but this is definitely a punchy one. Definitely a little vegetal and bitter on the finish.I’m going to be honest, this is a disappointment after the joven. The batch 1 joven was absolutely astonishing and this one is definitely a let down for me. As much as it surprises me to say this, I want to try the 80 proof because I don’t think the higher proof is doing this any favors. Don’t get me wrong, it’s good, but not $99 good.

3477.Review: One of the best high proof tequilas I’ve ever had, if not the best! Only reason the

3478.Review: Nose: cooked agave, mineral, herbal, I get celery and cilantro, there’s citrus, lime zest, white pepper, and nice floral aroma at the top of the glass Flavor: spicy on entry, that of fresh picked jalapeños and white pepper, sweetness of cooked agave, lime juice, and a nice buttery mouth feel. Finish: is long with white pepper spice, a nice sweetness shows up, just a touch of bitterness. This is a well balanced tequila

3479.Review: Tasted in Monterey at MBTC in Oct. 2021.

3480.Review: Sampled at MBTC 2021. Aroma and flavor are both a great example of what a blanco tequila should be. The lack of dilution allows for the product to have a potent flavor. Although the proof is higher than what I prefer, it wasn't overpowering.

3481.Review: gonna revisit this one for many reasons. First, I love the funky nature of it. Flavors are so good and checks all the boxes. I honestly think one of the biggest issues with this is my expectation due to the price. I’ll have a full pour at some point and review it. Not going to say a single negative thing about flavor cause I liked it and I feel like it needs more time open.

3482.Review: more of a burn and less of the agave and brine than the regular Blanco.

3483.Review: First time tasting this high of ABV so the heat isn’t what I’m accustomed to, but that’s okay.  I get lots of city’s notes after the heat.

3484.Review: On the nose I smell a lot of pepper and mineral not. Once I sip and get it on the taste buds it’s alot of agave flavor, but not as peppery as I would expect. I really like this one for sure

3485.Review: Nose:Some lactic funk or cheeseAgaveAniseMintCitrusFlavor:The funkAgaveCitrusAniseReminds me of the newer version of Pasote blanco. Not a big fan of the funky cheese thing. Otherwise a solid blanco.

3486.Review: I’ve previously struggled with high proof blancos, but this is really good.  Of agave, vegetal & slight lime aromas.  Oily mouth feel.  Flavors of green agave, white pepper, cilantro & lime.  Smoother finish than expected.

3487.Review: tried at chris porters 10/22Cazcanes 10 h.p. blancoSo strong alcohol Really hot but not as funky on the nose as the no 9 jovenBut I'm not loving this. Will need to revisit when I haven't had 10 other tastings

3488.Review: Tasting Review for Cazcanes Blanco No. 10Aroma:Enjoyed the entrance of this expression, roasted agave, buttery and caramelized sweetness, lime zest/citrus potency, and white pepper/aniseed nuances. The aroma personality on this one is very complex and inviting. Taste:Heavy cooked agave that just coats your mouth instantly with a buttery texture while showcasing a crisp framework. The heat you will receive from this blanco is with a punch of flavor and alcohol intensity is minimal. Another thing  you will be able to perceive its some minerality, that comes from their water source. The finish will have some astringency, not bad as is something I enjoy from time to time. Aftertaste is very rich and leaves a harmonious lingering agave flavor. Price: $100

3489.Review: Cazcanes Still Strength (NOM 1599)Nose:  Alcohol, buttery-sweet agave, smoke, grassy vegetal notes, crushed/powdered stones. Light citrus, white-pepper, licorice.Tastes:  I like high-proof blancos, and this one is up there (54%). It pushes the flavor intensity up a few notches.  Tastes of creamy sweet agave, white peppery spice, anise, light citrus & mint... goes down quite nicely, noticeable heat, but no burn... very clean, tapering agave finish.

3490.Review: A very good high proof.  The nose has agave and pepper.  The flavor adds some lime to the agave and pepper.  I enjoyed the peppery finish That had a medium length.  If you enjoy a nice HP then you will enjoy this.  I got this on sale(Happy Place in Saticoy). so the price was less of a factor.  A very nice, complex tequila.

3491.Review: Booming flavors - roasted agave, citrus sweetness, green olive salinity. Exceptionally long finish. Amazing!

3493.Review: I was expecting a more powerful explosion of flavors like the Tapatio or Terralta HPs, but I was pleasantly surprised by a smooth, complex flavor with strong notes of lime.Nose is great. Floral with minerals, lime. Finish is long and lingering with a peppery afterburner. Finish is also quite sour, which did not appeal to me.Not worth $99 but an interesting tequila.

3494.Review: Finally found at Ferment & Still; expensive at $99, but was excited to finally try it; packaging is very nice, giving impression of high end bottle; high intensity alcohol on the nose, slight agave notes along with pine, maybe? Even notes of lime? Unique; warm, as expected across the tongue, heavy lime & vanilla; different taste due to heavy lime accent; I do like it, it is very different than the normal, high proofs that I love like Fortaleza, Siembra Valles, Cascahuin; unfortunately, I believe the price is WAY too high; looking forward to trying their blanco. Just an afterthought, I am going to blind taste this vs Siembra Valles Ancestral as I didn’t rank that bottle very high; I almost feel like they are very similar, but Ancestral is north of $120 USD.

3495.Review: Amazingly complex high proof with intense flavors and nice oily feel on the mouth. Very well made.

3496.Review: Enjoyable, high 108 proof Blanco that could rate even higher had it not been for the value. I paid $94.99.

3497.Review: Wow… got this still proof through the tequila barrel collective. 108 proof is absolutely beautiful. Loads of agave, vegetalness, and pepper. Nice long finish and great taste.  WOW

3498.Review: Agave, Citrus, Caramel, vanilla on the nose …..aromas come out when it has had a chance to sit and open up a bit ….. slight heat some bite … agave and citrus on the mouth …. Some Vinny and barrel.  Not a bad sipper

3499.Review: can't recommend a side store meat after taste.

3500.Review: Good daily sipper. Aromas of citrus and cooked agave. Flavors are vegetal, oak and raw agave. Finishes with pepper, grapefruit and tamarind.

3501.Review: Aroma is slight amounts of agave, caramel, vegetal, citrus . Taste is same plus some added heat  that is definitely more than most and lasts long after swallow . A bit bitter . Nice thick mouthfeel . Nice packaging . Not bad, interesting.

3502.Review: nose citrus alcohol slight vanilla taste citrus vegetal slight vanilla with very warm finish very light on flavors, was expecting more

3503.Review: From a nom which can produce a nice tequila (Excellia) yet also produces absolute crap.  I always wonder about these types of distilleries.  Just check your reviews.  I found the aroma to be a pleasant mix of cooked agave and caramel with a slight hint of alcohol on a deeper inhalation.  The flavor was more of the same without the alcohol.  I appreciate nice legs and this had some.  (Just my quirk when I’m sipping and relaxing.). The mouthfeel is a light oily. The finish is mostly agave but does have some warmth.  Not a burn but some warmth that coats your back cheeks and maybe a little chest.  Not as complex as Excellia but enjoyable. The price is better than Excellia.  I found this at Total Wine which carried other variations.  I may take a chance in the future.

3504.Review: Had at golf tournament. Need to try again.

3505.Review: better than the Blanco. check out my review here: https://youtu.be/cUJVboj7rjI

3506.Review: Better than the blonco. Mellows our the vegetal/earthy funk.  Nice easy sipper.

3507.Review: Caramel and vanilla aroma and taste with slight orange citrus finish. Overpriced slightly.

3508.Review: NOM 1479|well. I couldnâ€™t gather much of any scent. which was fine by me. not much weight on the tongue but not thin either. flavor agave and subtle sweet. i think it would be great for a simple mix ( none of those fake sugar mixers tho!)

3509.Review: Aroma: raw agave, oak wood, citrus.  Palate; sharp agave taste, oak and pepper, spices but still has a good flavor. Finish: medium with oak and citrus flavor.

3510.Review: Lot 7 2004: Sweet bouquet of cinnamon, vanilla and honey on the nose. Really surprising and pleasant. Thereâ€™s oak, leather, cooked agave and pepper notes. Not excessively complex, I hesitate to say flat but pretty straightforward. A nice heat sitting on the roof of my mouth, the finish is nice.

3511.Review: Great aroma of grass, pepper and citrus. Maybe a hint of caramel but nothing too sweet. The flavor immediately brings forward the caramel along with hot pepper and spice. Long, smooth finish. Definitely a nice, sipping reposado.

3512.Review: A little bit of a harsh finish.

3513.Review: Inadvertantly deleted the first review. Raisins, spice cake, tannic elements from the grapes blah blah blah. The 750ml bottle cost is in the mid 4 figures. The brand website however sells 50ml bottles for much less than 1/15 of the 750ml. If you can taste it you should.

3514.Review: So smooth and delicious as a dessert drink. Heavy vanilla smell and flavor. Too sweet for regular drinking, but just right for an amazing treat. Really like this unique aging. Expensive, so find a sample or a deal to try it out.

3515.Review: Very interesting tequila and haven’t had one quite like it before. I thought it was fantastic but I can see those seeking traditional tequila not liking. All the traits of EA but was really floral and raisin really stood out for me. It seemed to be an acquired taste as the more I drank the more I enjoyed the complexities. It reminded me more along the lines of a brandy or cognac which is a first for me with tequila. It’s super pricy but would be a great special occasion celebratory treasure to keep around.

3516.Review: still have barrel 1. making it stretch. too pricey, but if money is not an issue, buy it! if you can find it. going to try barrel 2 and compare.overall, this is amazing! just as the name implies.

3517.Review: Based on the three-quarters of an electron worth of this tequila that I just tried, it’s got a great nose.  It’s got hints of that ‘shrill’ flavour I hate. Very chocolatey.  Rich and thicc.  Wouldn’t pay regular price, or a steep discount, or probably even a much steeper discount for it, but it’s good.

3518.Review: Surprisingly balanced on the nose, loads of vanilla and hints of spice. Palate is fairly light for something aged this long.Nice cocoa and dried red fruit on the finish.Insanely priced.

3519.Review: Classic asombroso aroma, leathery rich on the palate, bitter finish. Great juice

3520.Review: Amazing aroma and sweet flavor. Pricey.

3521.Review: amazing nose with indescribable flavor and a finish to die for

3522.Review: very interesting finish. The sherry is just enough to present itself while still retaining hints of agave in the finish. of course any bottle in this price range looses points for value, but definitely one to try just for the uniqueness of it.

3523.Review: Very lovely tequila. All aspects of how this should be crafted is present. No overpowering alcohol. Nice balance of a variety of aromas of such as wood Carmel thinking spice vanilla cinnamon citrus.

3524.Review: Sweet as candy with citrus notes

3525.Review: Deep amber color.  Beautiful in the glass.  Rich caramel and agave aromas. Light flavored at first.  Lightly sweet with more agave flavor.  Almost no alcohol present at first then building to a slight burn mid-palette. Long finish with pronounced vanilla flavor.  No bitterness.  More aromas than flavors in this one but still a nice one to sip. Absolutely incredible value for the money.

3526.Review: A beautiful tequila. The aroma of creamy goodness is exceptional followed by the taste of sweet agave. Excellent.

3528.Review: NOM 1580…. Agave sweetness …. Like a fig and chocolate bitterness

3529.Review: Definition of a solid old school añejo. Nose and palate are a perfect match and well balanced. Agave forward, dried fig, raisins, yams, mocha, cinnamon spice all come together nicely to make this older NOM 1079 version a must in any home bar. Harder to find now. So grab any you can find.

3530.Review: Buttery on the nose with some alcohol. Taste butter, honey, oak, apple, pepper, and whiskey, with some bite and a slight aftertaste.

3534.Review: NOM 1079|NOM 1079 Lot 23. A very nice añejo from a distillery that turned out more than a few. If you see the old NOM buy, buy, buy.

3536.Review: NOM 1068, millennial bottle from 2000. Juice had evaporated.

3537.Review: NOM 1580Very good… taste of rich agave , caramel, fig, chocolate and toffee ending. Very flavorful

3538.Review: Aroma: sweet agave, oak, caramel, spices, and a surprising hint of mint in the background. Taste: Very tasty, matching the aromas, plus vanilla and a buttery sweetness, along with a touch of smooth heat from the alcohol (40%abv). Finish is very smooth and lingers nicely.

3539.Review: NOM 1580.   Traditional tequila with a nice mineral taste.  Very smooth.  It really shines with ice and lime.  A great bargain if you can find it!

3540.Review: NOM 1586|Awesome. Super creamy, delicate while complex. Soft finish..Only gives option to rate as three different bins but the one I’m enjoying is 1580.. not 1586.

3541.Review: Nom 1580Really wish I got the blanco

3542.Review: This is an amazing Old School Tequila with everything you look for in a well made product.Great Sipper

3543.Review: NOM 1580Lote 001El Olor: Vegitial and cooked agave. Typical “cheap tequila” pungency. Not a lot of depth.El Sabor: Starts creamy and buttery but finds a bit of pepper near the end. Strong alcohol bite accompanying the trailing end. El Final: Nice lingering burn. Warm. Nutty after taste. Possibly the best part of this Tequila.

3545.Review: NOM 1580, lote 01For an añejo, not too sweet, but bit sharp/bitter on the finish.

3548.Review: very nice aroma , very pleasing nose , smooth sipper with a nice finish.

3549.Tequila: Volcan de Mi Tierra Reposado (Tall Bottle)
3549.Review: Served in a Glencairn glass. Nose is bright and punchy - wet grass, citrus, agave. Medium body, great legs on the glass. Hits with pepper and some leather, then a clean finish with some complexity, lingers on the tongue.

3550.Tequila: Volcan de Mi Tierra Reposado (Tall Bottle)
3550.Review: Harder to find these days, the brand has changed since being taken over by Moët Hennessy with only a Blanco and Cristalino products in the market.Review #50004282018

3551.Tequila: Volcan de Mi Tierra Reposado (Tall Bottle)
3551.Review: This is the repo that preceded the  Moët Hennessy Diageo buy out. The old stuff...Loved the nose. Butterscotch, slow baked agave, vanilla and fresh cut grass. Oily and not cloyingly sweet. Balanced pepper. A bargain at $125 pesos!

3552.Tequila: Volcan de Mi Tierra Reposado (Tall Bottle)
3552.Review: This is an amazing tequila for the price!

3553.Tequila: Volcan de Mi Tierra Reposado (Tall Bottle)
3553.Review: Found a bottle of this in Mazatlan for $120 MX pesos. It's 35% Abv.(don't even notice it). Damn this is good stuff for the price.This could be one of the best bargain reposados... kind of pissed I didn't buy the other bottle on the shelf

3554.Review: This is the smoothest tequila I’ve ever had, almost a dessert with chocolate and caramel butter. It’s also incredibly hard to find a bottle of it.

3555.Review: Pretty sweet caramel finish. Kinda a desert Tequila

3556.Review: This extra anejo is extremely smooth from start to finish making this my new number one fav! Super smooth, rich and complex with lots of caramel, vanilla, toffee and oak. Truly an excellent agave experience.

3557.Review: Similar to Don Julio 1942 in flavor, but slightly sweeter. Less alcohol bite on the finish than 1942. Almost too easy to drink.

3558.Review: Initial taste and going down are both excellent with a slight fruity taste

3559.Review: Very nice , sweet drinker but not over the top , taste an American bourbon note which is pleasant , nice aroma and finish .

3560.Review: Crazy strong aroma of agave, bold and complex sweet flavors, no bitter aftertaste but not a long finish

3563.Review: Mexican release. Bottled at the curious ABV of 36.4%.  Nose:   Agave, pear, mineral note, black pepper and some spiciness with a trace of vanilla cream.  Flavor:   There is more spice and pepper punch than the somewhat timid aromas had promised. Hot cinnamon, tingly pepper, some salinity and a suggestion of vanilla wafer cookies. Agave does not get lost in the shuffle. Finishes with a tiny bitter aftertaste, but rests nicely in your mouth for the finish.

3565.Review: There’s some cooked agave and olive in the flavor. Some minerals in the aroma and flavor. I like the finish, medium length and leaves agave on my palate.

3566.Review: Mineral , herbal aromas and flavor with rustic finish. Not my personal preference, but good for others who enjoy a masculine, earthy blanco.

3567.Review: The blanco has more mineral and citrus presence than the lunar rested blanco. This is how I normally like my blanco, more rustic and not as smooth. It had aromas of spice, herbs, pepper, vanilla, light smoke and nice anise and citrus. This had a really good nose. The Taste was spicy and herbal with a mild burn and some olive brine and citrus. I liked it.

3569.Review: 2/26/23SUAVE BLANCO $80 oldtown1522 los valles confirmed additive freeorganicHigh-pressure autoclave nose: agave, pepper, funk, brine, fruitPalate: agave, pepper with a fiz at end, mellowFinish: short I rated 82 but value = overpriced so TMM 79

3570.Review: Nose: agave, minerals, buttery Flavor: agave, pepper, grass, brineMed long finish with a kiss of sweet

3571.Review: Really pleasing cooked agave aromas. A worthy expression of the valley and characteristic of the distillery where it is produced.

3572.Review: Crystaline clear, long, clear legs that persist.  Vegetal, herbal, soft grassy with a touch of (white) pepper with some (black) bite, sharpness or zing to back of throat and going down.  Decent aftertaste of reasonable duration.

3573.Review: Traditional Tequila Valley lives in this one Lingering finish in the palate. Exactly what I expect in a Tequila Valley Blanco. Honest tequila. The presentation in this bottle allows me to pay a bit more for this juice than I would normally. It is stunning and allows me to share a Blanco with intrigues non tequila drinkers, that are interested in Premium experiences.

3574.Review: Earthy agave flavor, strong alcohol in the nose. Surprisingly smooth with hints of vanilla in the finish. I might have to start listening to Motley Crew, Vince has a good tequila.

3575.Review: Had this at a bar in Las Vegas. I am unable to find it at any liquor shop or online. Anybody know where I can get some bottles?

3576.Review: a solid value blanco, perfect for mixing and can be sipped in a pinch. I personally think I can sip this a little easier than Olmeca Altos or Legado.

3577.Review: Great value & price, liter bottle, great for making cocktails. Will not disappoint

3578.Review: This was surprising. Citrus, minerality, pepper heat. This would make an excellent well tequila or cocktail mixer.

3579.Review: Last of a bottle at Tommy's courtesy of Señor Bermejo. Gracias.

3580.Review: Aroma of white pepper and minerals. Pepper, alcohol and lemon for taste.Takes the lead in its category over Olmeca Altos. Scored  high points for price $23 in Michigan. Over all, very good aside for it's heavy alcohol taste  Certainly sipable. NOM 1610

3581.Review: Nom 1610 Heavy on the alcohol taste and aroma $22 for 750ml. Mixer at best.

3582.Review: NOM 1610|Great for mixing. Good flavor. Got it at ABC store on clearance. 5/22

3583.Review: light smoke & sweet nose, soft mouthfeel, semi dry finish.

3584.Review: NOM 1424|Vanilla aroma.  Pepper citrus taste.  Long peppery finish. Really great value.

3585.Review: NOM 1610|Agave, mineral & slight alcohol aroma.  Citrus, agave & pear (first time I’ve identified this) flavor.  Smooth finish and excellent value at $24 in OR.  With the fruitiness, it made a fantastic Paloma.

3586.Review: This is a well tequila at my neighborhood bar. Very good taste! Smell is agave and alcohol with too much alcohol. The flavor - starts like water, which is definitely undesirable, but then you get it. For the price and compared to what else is offered as a well tequila? Could drink this any day.

3587.Review: On the nose, fresh agave and pepper. Small ethanol smell to it. Tiny bit of citrus at the end. On the taste, sweet agave at the front end. Less pepper than the nose. Small citrus note at the end but the finish is mellow, not much punch to it. Short finish, it doesn’t linger.  Overall tasty and enjoyable.

3588.Review: Tequila General Gorostieta NOM 1414Aroma:Initial notes of crisp and raw agave, white pepper, herbal and fruity notes. Definitely let it open up to enjoy its majestic organoleptic profile. You’ll be delighted!Taste:Cooked agave is prominent but also complimented by some herbal touches of sage/lemongrass and Los Altos petrichor. In addition you will taste sweet remarks of green apple and pear that evolves into a slight  bell pepper/spearmint bite to it. Overall the profile offers a Mineral & Tannic sensation. Slightly briny notes at the end. Medium finish This is a blanco tequila that must sit in your bar! Highly recommended

3589.Review: Tasted at Los Angeles Tequila Festival.  A well balanced Blanco!

3590.Review: Light scents of cooked agave, with notes of dried figs and garden herbs. A pleasant sweetness across the palate, with a light flavor similar to those present on the nose. The finish is a burst of fresh herbs, primarily basil, mixed with white pepper. Easily the most “herbal” of any tequila I’ve tasted, which makes it interesting.

3591.Review: Story:The reposado expression of the ArteNOM series. Aroma:Honey, clear as day. Agave comes after, intermingled with vanilla, slightly floral. Pineapple. Definitely some ethanol, and a hint of butter cookie. Palate:Cooked agave, very prominent but soft vanilla. A gorgeous sweetness, and definitely a bit oily. It’s got a little heat on it, but It’s so soft, and I get a caramel note that comes in and out. Very long finish.Verdict:Buy. Absolutely love it. I have been lucking out with reposados lately, but I use the app a lot to find what I might like, so I can’t say I’m surprised. Still, this is a stunning reposado, I am very happy to have it in my collection and i have a strong feeling it won’t last long.

3592.Review: Vastly superior to General Gorostieta. Packs way more flavour and has a funky element that I really liked. A light reposado in the wood notes but heavy on the floral and funk. Very nice.

3593.Review: agave definitely comes through on this one. Revisited this one and really enjoying it on the second go around. Beautiful agave on the nose. Barrel influence is fairly minimal on this one as the agave is front and center

3595.Review: Love everything about this repo. Great balance. Light in style but cooked agave shows through with oak notes

3596.Review: In the glass it’s a nice clean pour with tight tears and coating. Perfectly clear with a light yellow tint.On the nose it’s got cooked agave up front, straw, yeast/sourdough, citrus, floral.The palate is fairly light but pretty complex and not overly viscous. Clean tasting agave, pepper, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla with a nice ethanol heat. Interestingly I detected little to no oak notes. The finish is a nice medium to long.Overall outstanding tequila and would highly recommend!

3597.Review: Straight up Agave, sweet the natural way. Well balance I like it a lot.

3598.Review: Aroma : Light agave, butter, caramel and pepper. Hints of banana and grass as well.Taste : The cooked agave is ever so light here, and there are notes of butterscotch, oak, and pepper that present a spicy and oily mouthfeel.Finish : Medium/long with a tasty sweet and spicy dynamic from light fruit and pepper.The flavor profile is slightly less refined than I would like, but even then this reposado can easily compete with more well known bottles you'll see on this app like expressions from El Pandillo and La Alteña.

3599.Review: 40% lote ANREP 1831Nose:   A very unique grilled pineapple, butterscotch, tart lemon/orange entrance. Followed up with the scents reminding me of Grandma’s dank root cellar - very earthy and holding flinty mineral elements. A touch of barnyard funk (not a bad thing). Balanced barrel spices complement the up front agave aromas. The faintest hint of oak.  Somewhat subdued aromas. Flavor:   Silky, oily, buttery. Agave forward natural sweetness, robust pepper & spice, fruit, a muted pencil shavings note and creamy butterscotch all blend in a very balanced fashion. This tequila has character that doesn’t get in its own way.

3600.Review: ArteNOM 1414I smell some cooked agave along with faint vanilla and caramel. The nose is light but there’s a lot going on in this glass. The flavors aren’t turned down. I taste sweet cooked agave along with creamy caramel, pepper and white oak. The finish is vey nice. The flavors linger on the back of my pallet. It’s a pleasant sipper.

3601.Review: Very herbaceous and bright on first sip with a pleasant, mild, slightly sweet finish. Has a lot of depth, agave is present from start to finish.

3602.Review: Very good repo. It’s crisp, which i suppose means “thin,” but in a good way. The aroma and flavor profiles stand out, equally. I get baked agave, lettuce and asparagus on the nose. Palate has agave, vanilla and butter. Its quite floral which is representative of the terrior.

3603.Review: Smooth to the nose. No overwhelming “bite” of alcohol. Little sniffs of vanilla, hint of sweetness too. Taste is smoke forward, then sweet, then very smooth. A little bite at the end, but just enough. Overall well balanced and lingers in your mouth.  Oak, chocolate, and smoke. Nice legs, full bodied. Excellent taste Finish has a bit of sweetness, but not overpowering. Little linger of smoke.  Very satisfying finish.

3604.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band

3605.Review: -tasted blind-Bright fruit aromas (melon, peach), mild mint and plenty of alcohol presence. Intriguing caramelized fruit flavors. Finish takes quite a journey - from sweet fruit to intense alcohol back to a mellowing sweet fruitiness.

3606.Review: Aroma: Agave and citrus.Flavor: Mellow but very good. Hints of caramel and agave.Finish: Nice long smooth finish.Value: Great product. Great concept. A little spendy but worth the price point.

3607.Review: This is a sexy tequila – warm, smooth, and a balanced combination of sweet and frisky. Aroma of agave and something else... vanilla, caramel, butterscotch? Something is starting and it entices you to continue. You bring it to your lips to find it sweet and tender, with a little bite. Is this but a tease? You draw it in and hold – the wet viscous warmth washes over you from the point of entry, down the spine. Your mouth begins to tingle with spice at the center and back as you taste a light touch of butterscotch. You are seduced. The experience lingers until you're unsure if you are still caught in it or merely enraptured in its memory. You return for more...Incredible, luscious, well balanced. A perfect marriage of agave and American oak, a light balance of sweet and spice.

3608.Review: Nice smooth aroma - sweet, butterscotch. Woody flavor with much more barrel flavor than a typical reposado. Very long finish...still tasting the flavor of this one after 3/4/5 minutes.

3609.Review: This tequila has a viscous mouth feel with rich flavors of mint, white pepper, and butter.

3611.Review: It just gets better. Initially hard to pick up any barrel like the oak and vanilla. I started to get the agave and earthiness no citrus or pepper though. That did come later. It was on the finish that the complexity starts to develop. Nothing in your face. Not the agave or the oak and vanilla. Finally I get some sweet cooked agave, pepper, with just enough smoky bourbon oak, burned sugar and vanilla.  Here’s the thing for me while this won’t be on my favs list there’s few like it unless it’s nom 1474.

3612.Review: Good clean taste just not quite for me too much vanilla upfront

3614.Review: This has a small hint of pepper on the nose, as well as vanilla. On the palate it’s real soft with the vanilla notes, and just taste great agave flavor. This definitely a great starter for someone looking to start like reposado

3615.Review: Agave and with a subtle hint of vanilla/caramel on the nose. Palette opens up with more agave and pepper. A nice burn on the finish that doesn’t overstay it’s welcome. I’m getting vanilla notes on the end there as well. Not too shabby.

3616.Review: Buttery, agave smell. Both come across on the palate as well with a little more vanilla, brown sugar and an complex oak and earthy aftertaste.

3617.Review: ArteNOM 1414: 41.2%, 27Bx, Lot ANREP 2201. (Repo).A- tiny bit of gold, almost clearN-  agave surrounded by an accompaniment of floral, mineral, fruity, hint of spice. Just so earthy. The core is earth and agaveT-  bittersweet cantaloupe, brown sugar, candied yams, slightly bitter pears F-  crème brûlée, flan, pepper, ripe pear Reaction- really opens up to something special when allowed to rest. The finish was stellar.

3618.Review: Nice oak , agave another dryer finish from artenom , a very complex tequila with layers of flavors and terroir.

3619.Review: A little light on the nose but don’t let that stop you from moving on. Big agave up front, some vanilla to trail that and a slow warm makes this an excellent reposado. Slight burn to finish up but nothing to worry about, I really like this.

3620.Review: Unreal. Unlike any other Reposado I’ve ever had. Toffee finish.  A true masterpiece

3623.Review: Unique, Sake almost in the finish.  Really great sipper, if unorthodox.

3624.Review: Aroma is sweet and fresh like water (simplified).To me; this taste very vegetal and outdoors.An agave bomb that taste cooked yet fresh. Very sweet, caramel, brown sugar honey,oak, some kind of fruit that hangs from a tree, and balsamic .  A peppery finish that just dies down pleasantly opening up to citrus notes on tongue and throat, last for less than ten minutes . A effervescent taste all in all.Update: 3 months later same bottle. EOBTaste more nutty,earthy,chocolate and beyond easy to drink. When I first opened the bottle the taste reminded me of fresh earth after rain or spring, now taste like sweet earth. More delicious now than before.

3625.Review: Banana aroma. Banana nut bread. Something green. Good mouthfeel. Nice tequila with unique flavors. Complex

3626.Review: Bottle laser dated from 2015. Everything is well balanced and nuanced. The flavors are layered, and open up as it sits in the glass. Cooked agave mixes with honey, and a tint of sweetness. Has faint earthy notes, but everything works harmoniously. Finishes cleanly, while the flavors linger for a bit on the palate. Could be my daily Repo!

3627.Review: Butterscotch, wild honey and tropical flowers on the nose. Smooth, soft, and floral initially on the tongue with basil and other herbs emerging afterwards. Finish is light and mineral, receding quietly which compliments the unique floral notes well.

3628.Review: Lemon, green olive. As it warms and opens the palate is full of rich, hot honey. The finish is rich and sweet and deep. It’s not as developed as some of its añejo counterparts but this is worth sipping neat all night.

3629.Review: Beautiful agave on the nose. Vegetal, clean, with a little oak on the nose.  Agave forward on the palate. Nice cooked agave flavor, clean, nice mineral feel on the palate. Nice medium finish.  Delicious!

3631.Review: Great mouth feel. Lots of alcohol on the nose. Tastes better than it smells.

3633.Review: Comes across harsh and boozy, some flavor associations are toasty grass, unrefined process

3634.Review: Over priced. Paid $60. It’s not worth more than $35 at best.  Far better options for that price.  Its missing flavor.  All I am getting is a bite at the end.

3635.Review: Black pepper and honey on the nose, thick mouthfeel, natural sweetness. Wonderful

3636.Review: Definitely more agave forward than the Anejos. I like the flavor better than the fragrance. Nice and smooth finish.

3637.Review: balanced reposado.  slight orange.  finish lingers. earthy/vanilla bean. light.

3638.Review: Really like this one. Cooked agave, we’ll balanced with vanilla and oak. Creamy finish of caramel.This now my favorite available in my area Repo.  This is different and similar to Fortaleza. I think with food the Fortaleza is more open and laid back. For just sipping the 1414 is a tad more bold and a bit more flavorful.

3639.Review: Nose is soft and filled with cooked agave, vanilla and butterscotch. Mouthfeel is soft and supple with an oily texture. Flavors are agave and vanilla with wordiness in the background with a peppery finish.

3640.Review: This is a very unique tasting reposado. I’m getting vanilla, oak, and caramel. But those flavors are unique examples of those common flavors you’ll get in any reposado. Such a good drink.

3641.Review: Cooked agave, minerals, and lemon in the aromas. Oily in the mouth with butter, earth, and roasted nuts. The finish has cinnamon, fruit, and citrus. Very nice balanced tequila.

3642.Review: I purchased this on the strength of the tequila specialist at total wine’s recommendation. The gentleman offered this, saying, “tropical juice.”  A seemingly adolescent characterization of a spirit, but one that sold me immediately. The guy is 100% accurate. Tropical juice. A bouquet of fruity flavors, and a nose that hits at those flavors. The finish wasn’t as delightful, but the bar was set high. Really delightful.

3643.Review: light and herbal on the nose, notes of nutmeg, basil and sage with a light funky (yeast like).on the palate I get cooked agave, roasted nuts, figs,raisins and spices and herbs. oregano,rosemary and anise. getting beautiful wood notes. I'm getting a hard to describe fruity taste, like over ripen jackfruit/papaya/plum.. hard to say. toasted bread flavor.the finish is crisp and wet. keeps my mouth covered. great mouth feel. truly recommend this.

3644.Review: Hoping for a little more out of this one. I appreciate that it is unique - nice cinnamon and graham cracker notes. The aroma is minimal. Finish is nice. I like the slightly oily mouth.

3645.Review: The aroma was a bit flat but the flavor was pretty good! It reminded me of a Apple covered in caramel and significantly oaky.

3646.Review: These guys at 1414 really know how to make good clean tequilas.This fellow it’s enthusiastic, it’s charming and doesn’t backdown.I drink it and I feel good. I am drinking the flavours of what I like in tequila, it’s masculine and brave.It has a great finish, it doesn’t bites you in any shape or form. It’s just there with a lot of presence and great heat that is not burning, or overpowering the flavours, it’s well balanced.I will drink it and buy the bottle all the time. This one is going to be always in my house.

3647.Review: light oak sweet cooked agave vanilla floral. satisfying buttery spicy finish

3648.Review: nose lovely citrus flowery herbal alcohol taste delicious mineral flowery herbal citrus with pleasantly warm pepper

3649.Review: Nose starts off stronger than I expected.  Maple actually jumped first then kind of faded.  Otherwise the rest of the barrel’s cinnamon and caramel and vanilla are represented in a classy, balanced way.  The palate is not what I was expecting and that’s a compliment.  A bit of a floral I can’t identify combined with an agave buttery swirl.  There’s something unique about the nose after you’ve sipped a bit, I think I’m smelling the barrel rooms at the various distilleries!  Particularly nosing the used, empty barrels!  Finish is good, just not great, it’s lacking but just a little.

3650.Review: Well crafted Reposado. A few coin higher than some other great buys, but I would buy again. Solid solid solid!

3651.Review: A reposado that maintains so many qualities of a blanco. Great balance of baking spice, caramel, vanilla, and a really nice nutty profile.

3652.Review: The reason you see reviews with a wide range of description is because this is a complex tequila.  You will discover flavors and aromas with each taste. (Try letting it breathe if you can be patient.). I liked the smooth mouth feel and finish.  While I didn't describe aromas/flavors/finish on this review, that is on purpose.  You should experience the complexity with friends and enjoy everyone's insight.  (As at aside... The price is not outlandish.  You deserve a good tequila.). One of my favorites.

3654.Review: Beautiful, light, clean, and crisp.Nose: Cooked agave, straw, and an earthy minerality up front. Subtle presence of light oak, cinnamon, and pear or pineapple.  Very clean.Palate: Silky, buttery, mouthfeel with a slight warmth.  Up front there is roasted agave, a little oak, butter, and white pepper.  A pleasant balance of minerality and earthiness. Suble fruit notes appear, then fade quickly.  Finish: The buttery, mineral, and pepper finish reside for a medium to long finish.  I tend to avoid Reposados, but this is one I want to drink every day.  A bit pricey, but the experience is worth the price of admission.

3655.Review: Yum!  Aroma is very inviting and is that a hint of bubblegum?  Taste is good.  Finish is also great with some sweetness and agave.

3656.Review: Nice baking spices & agave on the nose. Subtle barrel influence with cooked agave, vanilla, jalapeño.

3657.Review: Very light agave aroma with light caramel and vanilla flavor. Finish is warm but not harsh.

3658.Review: OK, I don’t know if this is a 96, but it’s the best Reposado I’ve had.  Great taste and finish - impossible to just have one.

3659.Review: Aroma - butter, cooked agaveFlavor - cinnamon, butter, sweet agaveFinish - oily, lingering, white pepper at the very end

3660.Review: Buttery soft, fruity nose. Cinnamon up front. Slight pepper,

3661.Review: Sweet smell with strong cinnamon flavor. Slight burn but dissipates pretty quickly.

3662.Review: Took a few sips to really enjoy. Apple pie spices on the nose, slight peach and citrus note on the tongue. Pepper and warm finish

3663.Review: WoW ! This is like the best reposado I have ever tasted, regardless of the price . Seriously. So alive with agave and slight barrel notes. Plus some tropical fruit and heat . The folks at nom 1414 really did wonders with this one . Superb ! Salud !

3664.Review: Great aroma with notes of agave and vanilla. This is a really enjoyable sipper.

3665.Review: Original post- Loads of pepper... pretty good after a couple of sips.  Can taste some oak, slight cinnamon and a lil vanilla.  Different but niceAfter trying again I let it air out and it was fantastic.The third time was even better. Has moved into my top 10 easily. Make sure you let it air out for about 10-15min to let it express itself. Trust me, you’ll be glad you did.

3666.Review: Very light and smooth. Color is very light too. My favorite Repo is Siete Leguas or Siembre Valle but this is a fine addition

3668.Review: Sweet agave aroma, with a bit of pineapple and butter.  Taste follows to nose... grilled pineapple agave, sweet with a bit of spicy pepper.  Long but very subtle heat finish.  Easy sipper.Excellent Reposado; very unique and one of my favorites.  This is my go-to Repo when I want something different.I really love NOM1414, and this is a nice offering with a different taste profile.

3669.Review: Cooked sweet agave with notes of cinnamon, vanilla, Pineapple, and a hint of artificialness.  Very tasty and Unique tequila for sure.  It’s really good, really good for shots because of its flavors with a good finish.  Great as an aperitif shot!  Bottled at 41.2%

3670.Review: Agave from beginning to end on the Repo. Not saying this is a bad thing, just very forward. Herbal notes and an almost sweet finish. Pepper is present but not over powering.

3671.Review: delicious, smooth, I could drink this on its own all night!

3672.Review: Excellent sipper. Very smooth and no rasp.

3673.Review: Hint of vanilla, berry, and smoky flavor. Crisp taste with just the right amount of bite. Excellent finish.

3674.Review: Maybe a little overrated and definitely overpriced. Just a typical tequila taste and not as easy to drink.

3675.Review: Nose is agave, light wood, vanilla, and soft smoky citrus. Mouthfeel is smooth and full. Buttery. Taste is sweet roasted agave giving way to a wonderful smoky oaky lenghthy finish. There's a very subtle sugary roundness underneath the spice that makes this a deliciously balanced drinking experience. Absolutely fantastic, like the rest of the Artenom line.

3676.Review: Masterful balance of different aromas for a very nice Repo! Only an expierenced master distiller could pull these flavors for a repo together, sweet agave, earthy minerals with a nice little spicy kick of habanero. Great sipper.

3677.Review: Smooth and top stuff with notes of caramel, vanilla, Agave, spice, marzipan, grapefruit, and pear. The Haas Brothers know their stuff from arte Nom and the exclusive high end Fuentesecas

3678.Review: Aroma is very light. Clean, earthy agave taste. Pleasantly spicy, not too sweet. Finish is crisp and doesn't linger very long.

3680.Review: Fairly neutral aroma. Getting notes of licorice and anise on initial tasting, finishes crisp and almost flowery. Subtle grassy notes on subsequent sips. I typically lean more towards oak and caramel flavors but this is a nice change.

3681.Review: Initially I thought the flavor and finish was a little harsh but I had also just eaten some very spicy food that probably affected the flavor. Subsequent tastings have been much better. Overall a very enjoyable reposado and the price tag is extremely reasonable. I can see it going up as it popularity increases.

3683.Review: nice smooth sipper , fruity on the nose with a slightly dry finish , very nice.

3684.Review: Oh am I glad for all the other reviews here that called this tequila out for its floral taste and its light finish. I really loved this tequila all in all and really hope to find it again. Nice concept of developing a terroir and matching it to an age. Though in this case I'd love to taste this same thing in a vertical flight.

3685.Review: One of my favourite distilleries and it doesn't disappoint. Maybe a little thin but smooth as they come.

3686.Review: Sampling in a Riedel at Tacolicious North Beach. Cinnamon note on the nose. My buddy, Tony detects a hint of honeysuckle. A bit earthy. Vanilla. Fresh. Light nose, not overwhelming. Nose turns  sweet the longer it breathes.  Spicy on the tongue. A good tingle. Lightly sweet.

3687.Review: Light aroma. Very smooth finish. Not a ton of flavor but still tasty.

3688.Review: Amazing presentation - the hand blown glass and artwork is fantastic. Big barrel aged notes of vanilla and spices on both the nose and pallet. Definitely pick up some dried fruit notes as well. Cooked agave is present but far from an agave bomb.

3689.Review: A beautifully blended masterpiece from Vivanco at NOM 1414. Made from 8 year and 10 year reserves and coming in at 47%. Warm cooked agave right off the bat with butterscotch, dried fruit such as fig, pineapple, apricot, some citrus, mocha, cherry, vanilla, leather, with a nice cinnamon kick at the end. XAs don't come much better than this. Only 1300 bottles made. A true treasure delight...

3690.Review: Finding this is like finding a unicorn Something special about this bottle, great value, over delivers. Cooked sweet agave, light spices. Beautiful.

3691.Review: Chocolate, cherry, mint, maple and sweet agave

3692.Review: I forgot how delicious this is. Cracked the bottle again last night and I’m still thinking about it this morning. It’s chocolate in a glass.

3693.Review: Tried in a Reidel, about 2 oz.  let sit for about 7 min.  Aroma- dark cherry, chocolate syrup, oak chars, light agave, mint, mapleTaste - earthiness, some smokiness, oak tannins, not much sweetness. Finish - nice heat on the back end.  Not overpowering.  Long lingering warmth with some wood tones.

3694.Review: Aroma: caramel, cooked agave, light oak, sweetFlavor: cooked agave, pepper, whiskey, hint of chocolate, oak, vanillaFinish: dry, heat, oak and light caramel

3695.Review: Brilliant stuff. Notes of caramelized agave, toffee, chocolate, vanilla, dried fruit, raisins, tropical fruit, pepper, oak, mint, and freshwater with a creamy mouthfeel and long finish. Bargain at $130-$150 a bottle compared to more expensive el Tesoro 80, Fuenteseca 8 and above, similarly priced Don Julio 1942, Reserva de la Familia, Avion 44.

3696.Review: not for sale on any market- this gem was a thank you gift from our friends at the 86co, thus making it invaluable.

3697.Review: NOM 1541|Aroma:   Pineapple, citrus, anise and a hint of caramel. Dark appearance but very light on oak influence. Flavor:   Vanilla, ripe agave, mellow black pepper and light baking spices. In their bio it says XA is added. I am not aware however, that they ever had an XA.

3698.Review: melts in your mouth. excellant finish.

3699.Review: Wonderful tequila and a steal. Tasted then Bought this in GDL for about $25 USD.

3700.Review: I like this. Reminds me of Karma from the same distillery. Citrus and agave with some sweetness on entry resolving to some white pepper and alcohol. Moderate length finish.

3701.Review: Aroma lemon grass alcohol Taste citrus vegetal grass with hot pepper finish

3702.Review: Libre Blanco is a nice surpise for $25 (Total Wine).  Use this as affordable sipper or mixer, it's quite versatile.  Nose: Mild raw agave sweetness is met immediately with black pepper and alcohol. However, letting this open up you get lime, tangerine, and lemon notes with a slight minerality. Faint hints of lemongrass, earth and limestone.  A bit out of balance, but there us a lot going on in the nose.Taste: Not particularly complex.  Thin mouthfeel with a bitter punch that is quickly overtaken by black pepper.  A slight brinneyness and minerality. Not bad, enjoyable enough to one can sip.Finish: Short to medium length with pepper that sticks to the tip of your tongue.

3703.Review: Mild agave aroma with a very smooth flavor of pepper and citrus.  The finish is smooth, almost to easy.  The packaging is not great with it's canteen bottle but don't be dissuaded.  Value is good.  This is why we try tequila in the upper 70s low 80s.  I've found many poorly marketed brands that I enjoy.  It will be a juice you can serve to anyone.

3704.Review: Was pleasantly surprised with this tequila. It had a good body, with a nice finish. There were plenty of citrus and pepper notes to it which I seek out and was happy to have tried them. Was a little skeptical by the canteen bottle but was glad I tried it... I do have to make a sidenote. The flavors of mint chocolate red pepper and mango are also phenomenal if you're into that sort of thing for a variety of drinks or for someone who is new to tequila. I was really digging the mango as it was not overly sweet but had enough character to stand up to the flavors. One could even just send it over rice if they have the dire need to have some additional flavorings.

3705.Review: Again another beautiful bottle and box. Wins points for Tahona and artesanal process. Great, smooth, enjoyable sipper but very pricey.

3706.Review: Might be the best finish of any XA I’ve tried, just keeps going! Rich and full, really leaves nothing to be desired other than dessert and a cigar.

3707.Review: A bit pricey, but delivers more than other expensive tequilas.

3708.Review: Deep gold color with elegant slow legs. Nose goes on forever, offering up new layers at every turn. My first aromas were of new oak notes mingling with ripe agave.  Then a vanilla cinnamon custard sensation crept in. Following were meaty, earthy notes.   All this wrapped up in spicy cinnamon, anise, fruity package. Flavor:  Considerably more oak presents on the palate than did on the nosing. More whiskey flavor. The agave and fruit notes take a step back from the nose.  Given a little more time, I got more vanilla, nuts, pepper, minerals and a hint of cherry. Finish: A long, complex and elegant finish. The price knocked the rating down a few points, and a little too much oak presence for my preference. A revisit and tweak on my original rating.  June 16, 2018

3709.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band
3709.Review: Smooth tasty excellent and expensive ! Bottle number 250.

3710.Review: Blind tasted. A nice oak presence in the nose and palate, without being overpowering. A nice complexity, mouthfeel and spice. This is definitely an excellent elegant tequila, I wish it had a bit more agave presence and a little less alcohol burn. Also the fact is quite expensive doesn't help. But in the end in terms of taste it's definitely my favorite between the sampled ones.

3711.Review: There is a really nice big aroma, dessert like- think bananas foster or other caramel type desserts. Fairly thick mouth feel. Sweet but not overly with minerals and barrel. Then all this comes through on the nicely balanced finish which stays with you for awhile.

3712.Review: Wow. Crazy smooth. This would go great with dessert. Amazing flavor, but I wonder if maybe the smoothness is TOO extreme? It almost rolls down your throat before you've tasted it.

3713.Review: A somewhat subtle aroma of wood, floral and caramel. A spicy cinnamon and wood flavor with hints of vanilla.  A good tequila at an extraordinary price.

3714.Review: Rated blind. Beautiful rich color. Alcohol and wood on the nose. Mellow on the palate. Nice finish. Some agave on the nose after it opens up, but not much agave left for the palate. Goes down smooth and finishes a bit dry. There's no way I would pay $300 for this, or encourage a friend to pay that price, but then again, I'm a big fan of agave flavors found in the lesser-aged expressions.

3715.Review: Amber colorBig nose woodyBaked AgaveOak spiceLong finish

3716.Review: From a blind tasting. Much darker, richer and more like a cognac in terms of legs in the glass than #1, the Alquimia Extra Añejo which I am comparing it to for the Tasting Panel. Deeper, more refined wood notes suggesting longer aging as well. A big burst of oak and nutmeg in the mouth and a long lingering finish. Edited to add brand names.

3717.Review: Complex aroma with fruit (cherry and orange in particular) up front then vanilla and oak underlying nicely. Flavor is initially dominated by oak but followed by fruit and a very nice spice. After such a big, complex flavor the finish is only moderate. Overall, a very nice sipping tequila. However, the at $340 the price relegates this tequila to special occasions.

3718.Review: The aroma is very heavy. I get a mix of some very bold notes: cherry, oak, chocolate and tobacco. And it shouldn't come as a surprise that the flavor is very bold as well. It's very strong with notes of chocolate, tobacco and leather. The finish is extremely good. It really hangs around. The biggest issue with this XA is the price point. Otherwise it would be a home run.

3719.Review: A nice, fruity nose. I like the mouth feel on the finish,  it's almost creamy and the berry flavor present in the aroma also comes through on the finish.  I had to go down on the value though.  The aroma, flavor and finish all appealed to me, but I just have a hard time with the price point.

3720.Review: Tons of citrus on the nose. Wonderful thick oily mouth feel. Nice caramelized agave still comes though. Aging is done to perfection here. The finish is spicy but not "scratchy" or rough like many other extra añejos. Very delicate and balanced. This is a job well done. A bottle of this will set you back $400, so it's a sipper best saved for special occasions.

3721.Review: Nice citrus notes and rounded French Oak barrel flavors- vanilla and baking spices. It has a great oily mouthfeel and pleasant, medium-length finish. But, at nearly $400 a bottle, it does lose some points on value.

3722.Review: LOTE EANE 0060815, marbete 2014.Color: medium brown.Nose: bourbon! It has mild bourbon notes at first, fortunately can smell cooked agave, toffee, butterscotch and wood spiciness.Palate: woody menthol, bourbon sweetness, caramel.Finish is medium to long, at the very end an earthy feeling from agave emerges just enough to know it is a tequila!

3723.Review: color: caramel, a bit added coloraroma: caramel, canilla, oak. coffee?taste: predominant oak, caramel, vanilla. a bit of a pasty texture (additives?)finish: ~60sec. lingers, fades suddenly.personal: gran clásico extra añejo, elegante, lo único que lamento son los aditivos. Lo compraba, sin urgencia.

3724.Review: Hands down the best Patron product I’ve had to date.Pallet was a nice cross of a bourbon and tequila.Outstanding finish with cooked agave, strong barrel influence and very low pepper heat.

3725.Review: Great on the nose with notes of wood

3726.Review: I’m not a Patron fan, but this is a great tequila. Excellent aroma and a beautiful finish. Very smooth all the way around. The only down side is the cost, it’s about triple it’s true worth.

3727.Review: Aroma has nice floral notes, caramel and vanilla. Flavor, the agave and oak is subdued by a very creamy and supple palate. Finish is smooth, oak and caramel. A good tequila. But expected much more at this price.

3728.Review: Wonderful aroma, if this one only would be less expensive…

3729.Review: Aroma - honey, lemon, bourbon, oakFlavor - roast/sweet agave, oakFinish - smooth, heat, vanilla and oakIt's a special juice. Pricey tho

3730.Review: Caramel on the nose, oak on the palette.  Bourbon-like finish...nice residual flavor.

3732.Review: Whiskey ishCaramel and sweet butterscotch vanilla Pepper Bitter numb cinnamon on tip of tongue Top of bottle is part of wheel in creation process Ribs on side are recreations side  of the wheel as well

3733.Review: nose; jalapeño,  vanilla,  spices, mint, lemon oil, chamomile,  hay, dry apricot,  red apple.palate; jalapeño,  apricot,  apple, citrus peel, candied/ripe mango, clove, mint, all spice, pepper.

3734.Review: Great presentation, did not like the finish but it maybe personal preference at this price point should be flawless

3735.Review: Lots of orange, and vanilla notes on the nose, smoke and oakinessLots of honey!Mint, and grass, finished with caramel and oakinessMuy muy muy delish!

3736.Review: Very swetMild taste, easy to drink. Stronger aftertaste

3737.Review: Smells sweet, orange, vanillaFirst sip very strong Finish smooth

3738.Review: Orange, vanilla, smoky aroma Smooth and sweet taste Excellent finish, leaves you wanting to drink more and more. Would add an ice cube to cool it down a bit New barrels - hybrid barrels, Hungarian oak

3739.Review: Great stuff with notes of vanilla, Agave, caramel, white chocolate, cherry, peach, hints of jalapeño and smoke, a nice creaminess and smoothness. Prefer Burdeos.

3740.Review: Had this at a tasting. I thought it would be better.

3741.Review: Very rich.  Finish is sumptuous; chocolate, stone fruit and vanilla.  The bottle is a work of art in and of itself.  Luxuriant juice; just expensive enough to alienate even many of the heavy spenders.

3742.Review: Very nice tequila.  the only down side is the price but it's a solid tequila in my book.

3743.Review: Vanilla, caramel both on nose & palate. Sweet baking spices. Sweet agave.

3744.Review: Has a bit of a burn on the nose , however it is a smooth sipper with very little burn , notes of fruit and vanilla , picking up honey and mild barrel , only problem is the price .

3745.Review: This is my absolute favorite tequila decanter. The scallop side etchings amplify the visual beauty of this extra anejo.

3746.Review: Definitely Smokey, ala Scotch. The overall viscosity is just right that you enjoy the flavor!

3747.Review: fantastic nose terrific flavor good finish on par with the herradura Supreme

3749.Review: I wanted to live it, but was disappointed, didn't finish well overly earthy and peppery for an extra anejo.

3750.Review: Great mouth feel, aromas of caramel and spiced vanilla, perfect lingering finish with just the right amount of agave, this tequila is well worth the price for people that appreciate the spirit.

3751.Review: The best tequila I have ever tasted. Oak taste, which some may not care for but smooth as can be. Pricey. But the quality is there and better tasting than some other tequilas costing 3x the price. There are a handful of tequilas that I would say are great tests to see if you can trust a reviewer. This is one of them. Anyone giving this a low score is not to be trusted. Even if the specific taste isn't preferred, the quality of this tequila is shockingly delightful and obvious to those who have developed their palates. Dangerously good given how easy it is to drink and the price.

3752.Review: Smooth but has a slight taste of alcohol. Remind me of a good cognac. Very Very pricey. Would like to share with friends but keeping it for myself unless I find "real" tequila enthusiasts or for a significant moment.

3753.Review: great flavor. amazing finish and lively aroma.

3756.Review: Nose: waxy, banana, green papaya, caramel, cracked black pepper. Taste: pineapple, vanilla, spicy finish but not hot, smooth

3757.Review: Tasted this at a USBG & Patr칩n sponsored event along with the other Patr칩n offerings, including all three from the "Gran" Patr칩n line. A very nice extra a침ejo, well balanced, and easy to drink. No roughness at all the finish. Really nice, but loses points due to cost. Obvious care was taken here, but still doesn't justify the price. I liked the more complex and interesting flavor profile of the (even more expensive) Burdeos...

3758.Review: Simply put, amazing blanco.  Tons of agave front, center, and exit.  Bazooka Joe, mint, pear, lemon zest, just delicious.

3759.Review: Aroma: Alcohol, coconut, agave, cherry, chamomile.  Palate: cherry, peppery, licorice, smoke, minerals. Finish medium with a hint of medicinal flavor

3760.Review: Older bottle, 2011 MarbeteBright nose:  agave, coconut, cinnamon and tangerine. Palate:  oily, agave, butter, hazelnut and light pepper.  Some herbal notes towards the end. Nice finish, a bit sweet, but I’ll finish my glass tonight.

3761.Review: I wouldn't call this smooth by any stretch but it has a respectably complex bite for those who prefer their tequila a bit acid-forward.

3762.Review: Very quick rating, after aeration, in a good mood. I'll need to put it in a blind lineup another night. Really enjoying it now though.

3763.Review: Alcohol and Mint nose. Nice mouthfeel.  Medicinal agave flavor. Soft feeling and agave flavor finish.

3764.Review: I usually love everything from this NOM, but ... it’s good, just not great or unique enough. The reposado and anejo were much better and memorable. Nothing bad here, just ... meh .

3766.Review: Single Barrel Anejo, party store special. Aged in Buffalo Trace barrels. normally wouldn't buy this brand but because of their previous barrel-aged Expressions was curious how this might turn out. Not sure if there are additives and they're very well maybe but if so very light and cannot taste them at all. Not sure if they do that for a party store barrels but the nose on this is just spectacular. Agave, wood, spice, butterscotch. definite hint of bourbon . Taste does start out a little thin and not very viscous but soon in comes creeping agave and wood and pepper and Bourbon and Carmel. finish is just barely a touch hot but very enjoyable. I like this more than I thought I would, will definitely buy again.

3767.Review: We like it and would go visit the distillery to see it. Oh, wait, we are here!  So much fun. The tequila has a great finish, that moves through the four embodiments of tequila:  sadness, happiness, unconsciousness, and nakedness. Bring it on, mayahuel.

3768.Review: Love the smoothness. Has a nice vanilla flavor. A nice smoke taste at the end. Fairly sweet. Must be a valley agave. Highly recommend.

3769.Review: Absolutely amazing. Complex, sweet and smooth.

3770.Review: Josh: badMe: doesnâ€™t taste like tequila

3771.Review: Sweet, delicate aromas, harsh taste that doesn't match the smell, very astringent alcohol taste, bitter aftertaste

3773.Review: Lot 02|Sampled at Tommy's Mexican Restaurant in San Francisco. Aroma is muted due to age. Flavor is somewhat muted, but still agave forward.

3774.Review: Lot 11|Aroma- liquorish, minerals, wet grass, vegetal, agave, earth, citrus. Flavor - Black pepper, vanilla, liquor, earth, fruit, citric, alcohol, vegetal, minerals. Finish- lingers with no burn, cream soda with vanilla, vegetal and minerals, white pepper and earth tone. Long legs, and long after taste of agave and earth.

3775.Review: Definitely a great tequila. Tried this at the los abuelos/Fortaleza distillery in tequila. Not sure why los abuelos has a higher rating than Fortaleza as it is the exact same product just different labeling... a great tequila non the less!

3776.Review: I feel I make make the same review over and over for this distilleries products......smells and tastes like someone shoved your head into a copper still. Tequila people taking the time to do things right, you never lose sight of the roasted agave.

3777.Review: Los Abuelos Blanco: Lot 60-B. (Fortaleza)I bought this bottle while visiting the distillery in Tequila, Mexico. It’s a beautiful property but this is a tequila review so here I go. On the nose I detect a lot of fresh agave and citrus. I smell lemon and a faint sweet agave finish. The taste is a mouthful of cooked agave, just the way a blanco should be. There is a pleasant white pepper finish. This tequila is well worth the price. FYI: This tequila is branded as Fortaleza in the US.

3778.Review: Many pours of this Lote 64 Blanco on Lobster Bus 12.

3779.Review: Lot 12|Lote 43-BAroma: Sweet baked agave, bread dough, lemon/lime, baking spice.Taste:  Strong agave, hints of bitters and jalapeño and pickling brine, appealing light sweetness, oily in the mouth.  Umami elements. Finish:  Warms the belly on a cool Jalisco evening. Lingers on and on.

3780.Review: It's a tequila that I revisit often. The lots change a bit but the buttery/ agave aromas stand out in this product. It is a complex tequila that shines in its flavor profile.

3781.Review: Lote 124-B Herbal, slightly sweet cooked agave, clean & crisp. After 30 minutes, it is briny on the palate with black olives, white pepper and the agave sweetness persists. Finish is slightly sour that turns into pure agave sweetness, which is medium to long in length.

3782.Review: Lot 12|First time Los Abuelos blanco. Good aroma and very good taste. For me the anis was quite dominant in aroma and flavor and abviously the cooked agave as well. Smooth and no burning at all, very long finish. Absolutely worth it‘s price.

3783.Review: Lot:120picked this up in Rosarito BC. on the nose i get a burst of cooked agave, grapefruit, light lactic notes, wild flower scent,minerals and im also getting slight wood notes.on the mouth you get what your nose defined. a whole lotta agave, lemon zest, peppery on the tounge, light alcohol very bold and warm on the chest (no burn).great mouth cover.finish is solid. light pepper and a rose water linger.

3784.Review: Lot 06|Slight difference compared to Fortaleza. Must be the blended batches? Baked agave, citrus, minerals and earth in the aromas and flavors. Salty buttery finish. Great complexity

3785.Review: Aroma, anís, cascara de limón, apio, yerba,

3786.Review: Unique aroma and flavor, agave aand fruit. Smooth and easy to drink, my favorite siping blanco so far.Atoma y sabir único, agave y fruta. Suave y facil de tomar, mi blanco favorito hasta ahora.

3787.Review: One of the finer Blanco tequilas for the money

3788.Review: NOM 1493|As of this review, I'm in San Jose del Cabo. So the price I paid for this particular bottle of tequila at Los Barriles de Don Malaquias was a bargain. Nonetheless, for blanco snobs, Los Abuelos is muy bueno IMHO. Heavy on the Cooked Agave, some pepper, and fruity acidity to roll over the tongue and finish.

3789.Review: I love the tequilas made using the old school methods. Tahona extraction, stone ovens, open air fermentation & copper stills have the best effect on the agave. A little expensive but well worth it.

3790.Review: Smells lactic, almost  Oniony, garlic, Taste papery metallicFinish : clean with some burn

3792.Review: Aroma is very wild, smells of a Raicilla. Sulfur big time. Acid drives the palate. Interesting but not what I like in Tequilas.

3793.Review: This is the version available in Mexico.  In USA it is the Fortaleza label.  Nice aroma of agave and yeast.  Flavor of agave and black pepper.  Long, pleasant finish.  Value was based on comparison to other artisanal, tahona offerings.

3794.Review: NOM 1493|peppery aromas and flavor but with a clean finish.

3795.Review: Suave en boca, a mi punto de vista un tequila bien hecho, aroma a agave cocido y tierra

3796.Review: Lot 04|I'm a blanco guy at the end of the day and like more floral and fruity vs peppery, though earthiness is a must.   Brought back some bottles of this from Mexico over the years, and it completely fits the bill.   Mouthfeel is outstanding, oily yet clean.    This is a tequila with real soul that simply explodes in your mouth with flavors.

3797.Review: Lot #18. Rich toasted Agave, with a sweet honey and Agave finish. This is my 1st bottle.

3798.Review: This is my very favorite tequila for sipping or enjoying neat with grilled foods

3799.Review: Sweater nose, good taste and finish.

3800.Review: Upgraded- TMM= 95  .The more I drink it. the more I fall in love with it. This was a special very limited edition amazing high-proof XA

3801.Review: This tequila really blew me away, actually. I got sawdust and oak on the nose with a damp cellar and wet rocks. But the star of the show was the flavor profile. I got musty oak barrels with a pungent gorgonzola cheese rind. It was really unique. Apparently there only literally a handful (10) of these bottles left.

3802.Review: Great aroma with lots of butterscotch, some vanilla, and caramel. The flavor had cooked agave, caramel, oak, and spice. Finish was medium to long but I did have some taste of mold that might be from the barrel but it was still not enough to take away from the overall finish.

3803.Review: Aroma = Roasted nuts, anise, chocolate, nutmeg,  cooked agave Flavor  = First sip strong and peppery then smooth light oakynes, nutty

3804.Review: Old Colored Label Caballito Loving the nose!  Ripe baked agave, pitted fruit and barrel spices marrying harmoniously. A complex and complete nose. Flavor:   Bold fruit, vanilla, crazy barrel spices, and warming pepper.  A very dynamic and vibrant palate. The over proof alcohol doesnâ€™t overwhelm in any way, but adds to the experience.

3805.Review: Only available at one place in GDL MX this bottle helped fuel a ride from Atotonilco where we were visiting 7 Leguas to the town of Tequila. If you have to ask...Agave roasted and caramelized along with oak spice and some alcohol from the 53% ABV. This is the equal of any similar product in the market, Terralta 110, Gran Dovejo Single Barrel, Felipe Camarenas private bottlings at El Pandillo and others. copied from prior unofficial app entry12/06/2018

3806.Review: Not as aromatic and complex as the 44% version, but clearly similar in profile. Still lots of cream soda and peach aromas. Agave, dried fruit in the flavor and finish.

3808.Review: seriously,  the nose on this is amazing!  I get the caramel cooked agave along with a hint of vanilla and a nice fruitiness to this.the flavor starts with the peppery kick Iloved on the Blanco and repo and has some vanilla and fruitiness mixes in.  I love how the agave flavor isn'r over whelmed by the barrel influence in here.  the barrel influence compliments the blanco flavors nicely.

3809.Review: Malolactic and agave on the nose, more agave and barrel and less Parmesan on the flavor. Mild peppery on the back end but good finish.

3810.Review: Gorgeous nose. Chocolate covered cherries all day. Juicy mouthfeel and a delicious, complex flavor of berries, chocolate, almond, caramel. Sweet but not overly. Oak is restrained too. Looong finish that turns a bit raisin at the tail end. Minus a couple points for price point, but a terrific anejo.

3811.Review: Nose: some agave, oak, orange peel, vanilla, caramel and nutmeg Flavor: barrel spices, oak, citrus, cooked agave in the background, sweetness of brown sugar and cinnamon spiceFinish: medium and starts peppery and ends a little dry with some bitterness.

3812.Review: Well made Anejo, sweet cooked agave, along with caramel, vanilla and light heat

3813.Review: Nice rustic presentation, sisal twine around the neck, hand written lote number/bottle? Tasted and nosed from a jarrito this has a very neutral aroma with oak spice dominant and some roast agave. In the mouth this is roast agave, caramelized sugar, barrel spice of of oak, burnt sugar from char and some agave spice of roasted pepper. Subsequent sips reveal a nice bold character that maintains throughout to a nice prolonged finish.

3814.Review: Though cazcanes is delicious the extra anejo price isn't worth it over the anejo price

3815.Review: Nose: cooked agave with wonderful aroma of American oak. Surprisingly this añejo is a chocolatey berry nose bomb though not too overpowering (clearly not an additive aroma). Subtle hits of caramel with great aroma of cinnamon and a tad bit of pepper. Palate: the taste of oak is stronger than the nose yet it’s pleasant and doesn’t outshine the agave. Slight initial burn with an amazing slightly oily mouthfeel.This is a great añejo from Cazcanes. I am curious to blind taste compared to more affordable options like Tapatio añejo to see how it compares, considering the high price point.

3816.Review: Very very tasty anejo. Nice long finish. Wish the nose had more to offer and wasn’t so expensive but I enjoy sipping neat. Notes: Carmel, honey dew, Vegetal funk, white pepper.

3817.Review: Agave forward flavors with pepper notes, along with balanced barrel notes of vanilla, chocolate and baking spices. A descent sipper with a pleasant finish.

3818.Review: Tons of agave and flavor on this one. A Little peppery as well

3820.Review: One word, Cheese! The first thing you get with the aroma is cheese. Never smelled any tequila like it. Taste was good. This is obviously a different Añejo than their regular run.

3821.Review: Unbelievably clean, all flavors are very subtle

3822.Review: Nose- Apricot, honey, hints of red wine, dried fruitsTaste- Agave, spices, fruit/orange/apricot Finish- velvety smooth, heavy body great lingering agave and pepper. The pepper is mild with long legs.Outstanding Anejo!!

3823.Review: The nose is super interesting from the extended fermentation. Pick up the wine staves on the nose and the barrel aromas. Unique and delicious - the wine comes through on the palette along with the cooked agave and oak flavors. Unique, delicious and additive free. At a fair price for the quality.

3824.Review: Very good. Agave, strong caramel and candy apple taste up front, pans pepper on the back end. The caramel and barrel does not over power the agave at all.  Can definitely see myself listing to jazz music and sipping this by the fire place.   Review Had to come by a month later and re-review it cause this is absolutely amazing.  Lost points for value, but this has become my absolute favorite regular proof anjeo.  Very good

3825.Review: Amazing. Oak, baking spice, agave on the nose. Great mouthfeel, heavy without being syrupy. Notes of butterscotch, caramel, maple, cinnamon roll/cassia (sweeter cinnamon), and sweet dark cherry on the palate. Enough agave shines through to remind you it’s still tequila. Flavor lingers on for quite some time. Will have to try the reposado and extra anejo sometime!

3826.Review: Cooked agave, vanilla confetti cake, great round mouth feels a little heavy.  Not a ton of depth but great straight forward drinker.

3827.Review: Unique aroma. Can’t tell if it has a slight nail polish remover aroma to it. Once I get passed it, I get the agave and slight caramel. Flavor is good with notes of agave and caramel. Finish is smooth

3828.Review: May need to re-rate this one.Initial thought is Aroma is a little alcohol heavy, not my favorite profile, but good enough to re-rate to determine if I just had an off day tasting.

3829.Review: Light Agave,oak on the nose.Baked Agave,vanilla,oak,caramel,baking spice.Nicely balanced flavors.long , lingering finish.

3831.Review: Floral FruitEarth AgaveLong FinishSpice WoodGreat pairing with a  PARTAG√ÅS  Serie D No. 4Mucho Flavor Fun

3832.Review: NOM 1483|This was a very old bottle that I just had to crack open before it evaporated.  All I could smell and taste was the Earthy Agave, some Wood and slight spices.  No burn and the finish was buttery and long.  Need to find more of it.

3833.Review: Something special. Delicious notes of sweet cooked agave layered with vanilla, caramel, light spice, and great barrel notes

3834.Review: Sampled at Distillery visit Sept 2018 with Sergio G.

3835.Review: Aroma on this one seems much different from earlier years. Sweet fruit is much more subtle and buried beneath barrel oak and a pine/cedar note. Flavor opens with a peppery spice that is softened with fruit sweetness. The finish has a slight bitterness and is medium length.This one is hard for me to rate. The aroma is outstanding but the flavor is pretty middle of the road. I really want to love it but keep winding up at average.12/24/2018 - 6th Annual Xmas XA tasting

3836.Review: smooth and fruity. like dried preserved fruits from the barrel aging nice sipping tequila. expensive so try and sell during happy hour

3838.Review: Smooth, vanilla, woody. Still retains freshness of tequila.$100/oz

3840.Review: It’s not a particularly bold XA but it is fascinating creation. viscous yet light. not overpowered by oak  personally I don’t trend on preference. This was quite enjoyable

3841.Review: Very enjoyable Tequila. Barrel notes are prevalent, agave , spices.

3842.Review: Great stuff with notes of cooked agave, pepper, caramel, dried fruit, citrus, and a little chocolate on the very smooth finish. Have this in between 8 and 12 year olds, 12 year old wins with its bright and bold flavors.

3843.Review: Full on agave, roasted and caramelized along with some green pepper notes. Serious lip buzz from the alcohol on the finish. Wish I had more of this older bottling.

3844.Review: Complex nose. Fresh cut grass, dill, nutmeg and baked agave. Flowery and vegetal. Taste starts with with spicy sweetness and vanilla/agave follows. Nice mouth feel. Some nutty notes too.

3845.Review: Old bottle, dated June 2007. Light nose, slightly savory and sweet. A tinge of sweetness on the entry, quickly turns up a nice heat. Green olive and bell pepper finish, with lingering black pepper. Recommended if you come across one of these older expressions.

3846.Review: This is the old style version of Centinela blanco (round bottle, white label) and it is a stellar tequila choice. If you spot one of these bottles, grab it.

3847.Review: Centinela blanco (old round 1L bootle from MX) has a nose that is a little sharp but with notes of lemon, cut grass, and a touch of brown sugar. I found notes of lemon, cream, the juice inside a chocolate covered cherry, and even a touch of chocolate in the finish.

3848.Review: Agave forward with a long peppery finish.

3849.Review: The bottle has changed from what's shown. I noted a smell and the taste that was different than anything that I have observed before. This was tasted at a restaurant in Guadalajara. So not sure how long it's been sitting. I noted something that tasted more to me like an industrial cleaning products somewhere in the flavor profile but still sweet. It overpowered everything else that I could sense. Might need a re taste

3851.Review: Has a certain almost shrillness to the flavor.  Almost a minty-ness- is this bad boy diffused? Not my favorite - kind reminds me of Olitas - but still decent.  It may be a little high on the additives.

3852.Review: Falls a little flat for me. Flabby.

3853.Review: Floral and fruity, fresh coconut and cucumber notes, lavender and some peppermint hints

3855.Review: Nice crystal clarity & legs in the glass.  Nose starts with a fresh agave fruitiness backed up by some green olive & seagrass.  Not overly sweet or fruity on entry...vegetal flavors dominate with a sharp hit of black pepper. Finish slow fades but turns a tad bitter.  Overall a decent blanco at a bargain price of $20.00.

3856.Review: Old school authentic Tequila! Muy bueno

3857.Review: Muy bueno. Great yard stick to measure all blancos IMHO

3859.Review: Another great Arette product. Reminds me so much of the old ETWLs...

3860.Review: Sweetness from aging is a bit too sweet for my liking. Aroma is very pleasant.

3861.Review: Had this on the big rock at a bar, after having a pour of Fortaleza Still Strength. I think the fact that I had it after a high proof blanco made it taste way smoother but I’m typically a Blanco guy, so well made Añejos are much more subtle and easier to drink if you drink mainly blancos, at least for me. With that being said, this was delicious. Aroma was great, very flavorful with a nice hint of agave. You can taste the quality on this artisanal tequila. It’s one that I would probably purchase for my home bar. I’m all about agave forward tequilas, which is why I usually stray away from oak-heavy or sweet Añejos and XA’s, but there’s definitely some agave to this one which I really enjoyed.

3862.Review: Simple and smooth. Oak and caramel with a bit of spice. Nothing to write home about and nothing to object to.

3863.Review: This really surprised me, after being disappointed in the reposado I thought that further barrel treatment would be a bad thing.....clearly I know nothing! Tons of earth & peppery notes balance nicely with the caramel from the oak, reminds me of a sweeter Fortaleza. An excellent tequila, I’m going to share this one with anyone who will listen.

3864.Review: Nose:   Fruity, spicy: vanilla, cinnamon, licorice. A cellar note/ minerals. Flavor:   Aforementioned spice, warming pepper, and butterscotch. This is revised from my original rating. It is far better than remembered.

3865.Review: Sweet maybe honey. Balanced smooth supper

3867.Review: Not my favourite anejo. Preferred the repo. Fruity aroma and a more rich flavour.
