3869.Review: My first non-additive tequila and I’m glad I decided on this.  This bottle alone just opened up new avenues for my taste buds.  The most obvious taste was the caramel with an all around smooth silky finish. Can’t wait to drink another from this line.

3870.Review: Immediately after pouring, strong cooked agave and slight acetone smell. After resting in the glass for a bit, acetone dissapates to a sweet vanilla and oak with agave and fruit taking a back seat.Initial taste is tannic with a black pepper bite. Some reviewers note cherry which I can understand if I keep it in mind. Oaked vanilla characteristics form a strong background while cooked agave dominates.Finish is tannic and fades quickly to a pleasant level.

3871.Review: oaky cus it’s añejo says maty mendoza barreled for so long

3872.Review: caramel sweet okay sweet at first and then it becomes more strongsipping tequila

3874.Review: Aroma oak honey Flavour caramel pepp

3875.Review: Finish has too much bite!  I like the flavor, kinda coco nutty, maybe?…I’m at a bit of a loss for the decription of the notes. Lol, sorry, but I’m getting sweet and a bit nutty, like me!  Haha

3877.Review: Had many and still drink again

3878.Review: Wonderful barrel forward nose. More than just but mostly boyrbon. Heavy barrel flavor but with something special in middle. A great anñejo!!!!

3879.Review: Aroma: cooked agave, vanilla, oak, caramel, cinnamon, alcohol.Flavor: smooth agave opening, followed by vanilla, oak, caramel with a hint of cinnamon.Finish: smooth non-burning aftertaste that stays with youOpinion: Beautiful aroma, amber color, medium legs, clean, smooth, non burning tequila after taste, balanced. Bottom line, I will drink it again.

3880.Review: Nose: butterscotch, ++toast, slightly vegetal Palate: sweet spice, slightly bitter

3881.Review: Nose is very light. Very smooth on the pallet, little to no bite.Short finish.

3883.Review: Aroma - light floral, cherry liquorice, candy Orange, oakFlavor - buttery, pepperyFinish - mild heat, light agave A solid yet fairly simple anejo. Easy to drink. Aftertaste leaves no impression on me.

3885.Review: warmer feel when drinking this tequila. would not drink in the summertime but would greatly enjoy it on a cold night.

3886.Review: coats the glass nicely and has beautiful legs. looks like the Rockettes on a nice evening in New York.  aroma I get beautiful.cooked agave, oak, hints of fruit (cherry) followed by a nice oakiness and a hint of vanilla. once it enters my mouth it does it with a silky buttery smoothness normally found in a well made chocolate. A taste of cooked agave dances across my tongue and and says hello!!  followed by a nice fruitiness of cherry and pear.. Then on to a little bitter oakiness to balance things out and then leaves you with a hint of vanilla and caramel to keep you wanting more.  A super nice Anejo that is well worth the money.  what are you waiting for?  get you some!!

3887.Review: Sweet agave and oaks on the nose, candied orange.Lots of cask, woodyness, agave is still present, notes of pepper and spice, cinnamon. YummyLong lasting finish

3889.Review: Very balanced flavors here, oak, caramel, agave. A short finish, I would drink this again

3890.Review: Muy suave , buen tequila , buen precio

3891.Review: Excellent Anejo!  Light tasting with a nice finish.  Good agave flavor for an Anejo, with a tiny bit of oak.  Little bit a anise as well, and just the right touch of sweetness.  Purchased in Mexico for around $25 - excellent value!

3893.Review: Seems to have lost a lot of flavorNot much to this oneOk. But not great

3895.Review: Incredible legs that won't quit. The color is light for an Anejo. The viscosity is thin making this clearer and lighter on the tongue. The nose is spicy more than floral or fruity. The alcohol is modest on the attack as is the agave. The taste is VERY, VERY smooth. Again there is a vanilla and carmel taste. There is little heat and the finish is among the most amazing I've ever experienced. There is no long finish but it is an understated and consistent finish. There is not a lot of explosion. I LOVE this anejo. Smooth as a baby' behind.

3896.Review: This is a pretty good repo. Lots of citrus and oak. Almost too much oak for me but it really didn't ruin it.

3897.Review: Top notch repo. So much going on. Beautiful nose, agave, honey, citrus,  cherry, figs, and even better once the palate activates! Wished it wasn't discontinued.

3898.Review: Agave forward on the nose with. Apples and dried pitted fruit almost like a wine smell…. Thin with very little body, but what flavors…. Very complex … changes form sweet cooked  agave to a barrel spice profile then to a oaky profile bitter dark coffee profile.  Love the complexity

3899.Review: Old school tequila right here, no flavours that don’t belong in this process......this is exactly the kind of tequila that got my hooked in the first place! Agave, grass, mango on the nose. Flavour is overwhelmingly roasted agave with a nice aftertaste of vanilla and spice from the oak, this stuff in punching way above its weight considering how cheap it is.

3900.Review: An earthy aroma of agave and wood, with hints of vanilla and citrus. An interesting flavor profile of agave, caramel, oak and spice. The flavors complement each other well in a manner more restrained than I had expected. Medium body and finish. Thoroughly enjoyable.

3901.Review: Production:Estate grown agaves from the Vivanco estates in Los Altos (highlands). Open-air fermentation with champagne yeast and the “Mozart Method.” Aged in american whiskey barrels for 7 months.Color: Straw/light straw, coats the glass, long legs, med speedAroma: white pepper, citrus, baked agave, apple, caramel, butter, dried cherries, orange blossomMouth: viscous, warmFlavor: pepper, baked agave, butter, caramel, apple, honey, roasted nutsFinish: tingling and wet, long durationConclusion: great juice, excellent value, a must-have for every aficionado

3902.Review: Best Bang for any $Solid !Go to Repo!

3903.Review: Wow, found an old bottle and all I can say is wow.  Love the caramel richness upfront. Right into an earthy,citrus (Apricot ) barrel spice and slight anise with the caramel following throughout and staying on the young’s for a medium finish.  Wow this is a sleeper. Very good.

3904.Review: light Amber color. straw nose. rich almost chocolate taste with consistent, predictable finish

3905.Review: The heat overpowered this Reposado just after I opened it, so I let it sit for about an hour and cake back to it. Upon my return I noticed nice citrus and vanilla nose and a really pronounced wet oak flavor all the way back, with a nice heat to the finish. After about 3 days... it’s gotten even better!

3906.Review: Great value - a shame no longer in production.

3907.Review: One of my favorite Reposados! On the nose I get light notes of agave and oak. Tastes of light sweet honey, red apple, as well as some light spice. Finish is nice but not very long. This is a reposado that is very easy to drink half the bottle. IMHO this is the most underrated and undervalued tequila. Unfortunately no longer made!

3908.Review: Incredible. I have now tried 12 tequilas replicate times. This is my favorite, but now (Feb 2015) I can't find it online!!!

3909.Review: Great bang for your buck reposado! It's almost like you can't go wrong when picking a product from NOM 1414.

3910.Review: One of the best tequilas for under $30.

3911.Review: A unique reposado that has aromas of banana, vanilla, caramel, and agave in that order. On the palate, light flavors of sweet banana and cooked agave. This leads into a finish than can only be described as a banana crème brûlée.

3912.Review: Very sweet for a repo, lingering sweet finish. Still good, just not my preference

3913.Review: Aroma: Cooked agave, fruit, and vanilla.Taste : Predominated by agave, oak, and pepper. There are some understones of vanilla here as well. The texture and mouthfeel are well balanced.Finish : Spicy black pepper and cinnamon finish that's decent in length.

3914.Review: Showed some heat, light wood, some citrus. This repo shows well

3915.Review: This is a well made tequila Earthy with great complexity. Agave and citrus in taste and very nice finish no burn at all. love it

3916.Review: 2021 - A bit fruity on the nose. Kinda unique aroma and inviting. Flavors are ok but I pick up a metallic twang I don’t love.  802023 - Better experience.  More caramel and oak than my first try. A little rich for me, but pretty good. 87

3917.Review: Rated blind: Really nice aroma on this. Peach, fruit and sweet agave aromas. Has a rich flavor and feels full and oily in the mouth, with a dry finish. A nice natural product.

3918.Review: Super soft and approachable, has very little sweetness to drive off veteran tequila drinkers. Lovely grassy notes.

3919.Review: Light in color with long thick lágrimas. First wave nose:  Rich vanilla, caramel, and butterscotch. Next comes agave, citrus and dark fruit. Nice spices. Flavor:  Cinnamon, cloves, sweet thick agave notes, vanilla and pepper.  A touch of earthiness and mint.  Good mouth feel. Light French oak note. Finishes with heat and anise and generally good balance.

3920.Review: Light green tree fruit aroma. Flavor is smooth and slightly fruity but not sweet. Very pleasant gentle finish with just a hint of cinnamon warmth.

3921.Review: I'll second some other comments and say this reposado is very soft in the mouth initially but I disagree with the not much aroma statements. The bottle I opened was full of agave right after pouring. Pepper and oak prevail in the mouth and end sweetly with some tip of the tongue buzz from the 40% ABV. Overall a nice reposado but not what I was expecting based on the blanco, añejo and XA I have had from the Don Fulano line.

3922.Review: Aroma: Very subtle and hard to really pick up on anything specific. Maybe some small hints of agave and pepper.Flavor: Much like the aroma, the flavor is pretty subtle. It has a definite pepper flavor but not much else.Finish: It's a little lackluster... It's just such a mellow tequila that it goes down and doesn't really leave anything behind.

3923.Review: Relatively bland aroma with moderate scents of black pepper, agave and wood. Flavor is a big surprise after the aroma - big and fruity with very little spice at the end. Taste is soft, wet and refreshing. Spice appears and lingers for moderate finish that stays completely in the mouth.

3924.Review: This was a delicious reposado for me. Nose was a little weak, but flavor of cooked agave, caramel, oak, making a kind of nuttiness I really enjoyed. I got it for just a little more than a good blanco so probably my favorite value for a repo so far.

3925.Review: Aromas of coconut, vanilla and chocolate. Smooth agave with complex fruity palate.  A pure delight, I liked it better than the Don Fulano agave.

3926.Review: It wasn’t bad, but I tasted a very salty note that made it feel like ocean water. For the price, I think there are way better reposados to try.

3927.Review: Let it rest 10-15 minutes in the glass, and came back to a wonderful aroma of mango, drinks like a really fruity Blanco with a little coconut and spice in the back. Great!

3928.Review: Aroma:fresh agavegrassgreen appleslight earthy funkherbaceousFlavor:silkycreamy roasted agavecinnamonbanana

3929.Review: Black pepper and more smoke than I normally like

3930.Review: The noise does not represent the taste. It has a dry finish and is not nearly as bad as I thought it would be from the smell.

3931.Review: Flavor is pepper forward. Burn is subtle.

3932.Review: surpsingly smooth on the way down considering how strong it tastes

3934.Review: Don Fulano Reposado,$65 USD (Sip Tequila),Lote 07DFR22Overview: Wow.  The soft nose reveals an initial and secondary profile are both fantastic.  The taste and finish approach perfection. Reposados are so hard to master, but I could drink this every day.Aroma:  Soft.  I'm with Nick Salcedo on aromas of 'banana, vanilla, carmel, and agave - in that order'.  I'd add that the nose is very well balancedand rich.  A second wave of aromas follow with cooked agave, cedar and oak,orange citrus, raisin, backing spices, and caramelized brown sugar. Quite unique and enjoyable. I think the soft nose does hold back the ratings justa little.Taste: Medium fullness with black pepper and cinnamon spice.  Cooked agave, oak, cinnamon, fruity up front.  Traces of smoke and orange peel citrus. The taste excels.Finish: Long finish of sweet-dry cinnamon spice with rich cooked agave.Exceptional.

3935.Review: Lote No.03DFR20Bottle No.12370Aroma: Agave,Cacao,Pepper,Caramel, EarthyTaste: Caramel,Chocolate,Agave,Nutty,Pepper,Olives.I pleasantly easy to drink sipper. The burst of cacao and nuts is unique to me, combined with earthy flavor mixed in tandem with the taste of caramel reminds me of a caramel fudge brownie. It's a gourmand taste done well.

3936.Review: Light vanilla and sweetness initially.  Turns to a nice peppery heat about a third of the way through.  Then back to some sweetness with a hint of mint.

3937.Review: Toasted agave on the nose.  Not boozy or chemical smelling.  Best mouthfeel out there.  Great viscosity.  Very mellow flavors. Light mint, agave, toasty flavors.

3938.Review: tasting at chris porters 10/8/22Don fulano repolote 04DFR21 Bottle 147chris purch from ferment&stillReally liking this! Agave smokiness on end High 80sLegs for daysGood Finish

3939.Review: color* darker than average reposado: 6/10smell* mild but noticeable alcohol* agave ?* pepper* sweet ? vanilla ?* citrus. lime? bubblegum-y (mildly artificial)taste* pepper* earth* sweet* oak* orangefinish* pleasant lingering * short: ~60secpersonal:me gusta como para mezclar. maybe bebidas, maybe 2.5/3oz per drink. me agrada el sabor cítrico.i know it's over 80, buy WOULD BUY $$$

3940.Review: One of my favorite Repos to sip neat! So well rounded with a slight lactic nose. Love it and the entire distillery!

3942.Review: A light, sweet, easy-drinking reposado but it’s not the most complex. I get lots of citrus-y notes from this but the restaurant I ordered it from served it with a lime so it may be due to that. Light agave, pepper, and cinnamon are also coming through. This is a decent tequila, but in my opinion the añejo/XA are definitely the stars of the Don Fulano lineup.

3943.Review: Aroma of agave, alcohol and citrus. Flavor of cooked agave, cinnamon and black pepper.  Pleasant lingering finish.

3945.Review: Was pleasantly surprised by this given the overall rank is not that high. Very fruity on the nose which carries through to the taste. There is a lot going on with flavors, fruit and barrel notes. Could have a thicker mouth feel but overall I really enjoyed this.

3946.Review: I get the scent of alcohol on the nose. Sort of a dark licorice finish after a agave forward first sip. No alcohol present in the taste. Must have mistaken some heavy citrus scents. This one just doesn’t do it for me.

3947.Review: Not my fav, nothing super special

3948.Review: Earthy, dry, leather, short finish! It’s a nice Reposado.

3950.Review: Neat: nice aroma- reminds me of vanilla, honey, and a dry sauna Taste: smooth on palette, good alcohol balance, woodFinish: smooth

3951.Review: was very good. smokey after taste, but not overbearing.

3953.Review: AROMA - Very nice unobtrusive notes on the nose, just like a proper repo should have. Agave, light notes of caramel, vanilla, and butterscotch. Light grassyness, black pepper.PALATE - Nice mouth feel, very nice warmth from the alcohol let's you know it's some good juice without being overwhelming. All the aromas also shine thru on the tongue as well, with the subtle addition of fruity dried apricots, nutmeg, anise, and cinnamon. All of which linger on the palate along with a clean agave finish.

3954.Review: This repo has banana hints, really weird at first, but I like how different it is. I would definitely get it again for a unique repo.

3955.Review: Very clean the blanco comes through in this expression just as it does in the anejo. Very good well worth the money.

3956.Review: Aroma:Agave not that strong, oak and pepper, after a few minutes leaving the bottle open a lot of citrus and I liked it.Flavor:Agave, oak, cinnamon

3957.Review: I completely don't get the high scores on this. It has many of my favorite notes present but they are muted by the presence of "wet dog" that is usually associated with cheap tequila. unfortunately it's not cheap as the bottle cost me almost $60. I will note that it got better on night 2 and 3 so if you purchase this stuff let it get some air.

3958.Review: Rating this with a “Tequila Fan” status, this is far and away thee most unique tequila I’ve had yet. It tastes and finishes like craftsmanship. I feel like I’m at home, because I am, and my mouth esophagus and belly are in Mexico. New favorite, and the cost makes me want to do more for Don Fulano.

3959.Review: Aromas of sweet agave & citrus. Nice, mild flavors of agave with slight pepper cinnamon & orange.  Smooth, longer finish.

3960.Review: It has a strong greenish taste characteristic of organic tequila.This pallor is not disagreeable, but feels fresh.However when I want these taste, I will choose don nacho.

3961.Review: 1st pour no rest period or time to open and breathe, it gave me a sour scent of moldy lemons.. and heavy lactic smell. I left the bottle open and glass down for 20 minutes and the whole thing changed on me.on the nose,Nice citrus, cooked agave, oak, cooked pine nuts, light lactic/cheesy fragrance, cinnamon hint of potpourri/gardenias.on the palate cooked agave is the star of this production.. subtle flavors of oak, cinnamon, vanilla, and light spices. alot of black pepper and smoke (reminds me of mezcal "firme").finish is nice with throat heat and delightful chest burn.

3962.Review: Taste is good over all but has a musty wood taste I don't like on the finish.

3963.Review: Good and different. Agave, fruit, caramel and a little smoke.  When it all comes together it reminds me of a muscadine grape

3964.Review: Herbal and mineral notes on the nose. Rich agave, vanilla custard and key lime flavors. Medium finish. Somewhat peppery.

3966.Review: Don Fulano Reposado, for me, has an unusual presentation. I get cooked agave, black pepper, olive, brine, and a mild citrus peel aroma. So far a beautiful if not typical bouquet. However there is a roasted protein in the background. Roasted chicken...got to say it has a marinade vibe. Iâ€™m digging it! The arrival is more cooked agave, a bit of vanilla and orange peel, pepper and brine, and bubble gum (Isoamyl acetate, a fermentation ester making the cut). A short to medium dry finish makes you want to head back to the glass to wet your whistle.

3967.Review: Nose vanilla citrus mint alcohol Taste minty citrus pepper spice with Warm delicious finish

3968.Review: Aroma: cooked agave, fruits: apples, citrus: orange Black pepper and light oak Flavor:Vanilla (reminds me of flan), cinnamon, light butter feel along with earthy and herbal notes (celery)Finish:Oily and medium finish, makes you crave more

3969.Review: Great oily mouth feel. Lots of earthy notes. Nose: Cooked agave, oak and more wood . Mouth : Cooked agave, fruity, almond, herbal. Finish: Carmel, lime, cloves and a bit of smoke.

3970.Review: A very solid tequila, goes down very easily, celery presence, ripe banana peel, grapes, agave forward, would buy this one again

3971.Review: nose is subtle agave, pepper, fruit, citrus, raisin. flavor certifies the aroma and adds some cinnamon and butter. good mouthfeel. the french oak plays in nicely without being overpowering

3972.Review: cooked agave vanilla citrus spice pepper. not too sweet. light in color

3973.Review: I use Don Fulano for many of my tequila tastings and I consider this reposado to be a great example to use French oak aging! The denser French oak seemed to allow to conserve more of the aroma of the original tequila, I get lots of cooked agave on the nose and the flavor. The nose also gives me raisin and honey aromas too. I love how this reposado's taste evolves from the initial cooked agave burst to be paired with "classic" Highland peppery notes and just tiny hints of flavors from the barrel. It feels almost like a blanco with a tiny little extra touch from the wood.

3974.Review: Decent aroma, no alcohol smell. Not enough agave

3975.Review: Tasted in a flight of Don Fulano at Coho restaurant at Friday Harbor.  Again, hard to get much on the nose (probably due to the glass type). Decent flavor and nice finish so good expression overall.  Agave is here as is a little oak.  Repo is less sweet than the Blanco.

3976.Review: If this was a blind tasting I would have said Blanco 100% - pepper BOMB

3977.Review: Good repo. Most of the fun from taste and finish from the blanco has disappeared which is too bad. Aroma is excellent.

3980.Review: Dry herbal smoked perfumed aromas bringing back flavors of baked floral wood , light and almond peel.Long beautiful nice elegant long finish

3981.Review: Very smooth to the palate with a spicy finish.

3982.Review: Agave flavor and scent present. Hints of vanilla from aging. Nice middle ground and all around.

3983.Review: Update to rating many years ago: allow this one to open up for 10 mins or so, the flavors bloom and expand. Notes of cinnamon, pepper and lite hints of melon/fruit. Very enjoyable! Medium finish with some pleasant heat.

3984.Review: Candied fruits and cooked agave on nose, apricot, grapefruit zest and pleasant bitterness on palate, Campari/bitter chic finish

3985.Review: A little musty on the nose, and a little sweet on flavor. But overall a pleasant sipper.

3986.Review: A light straw color. Nose of oak, vanilla, caramel, butterscotch, and cooked agave. Sweet across the palate, caramel comes through with some cinnamon spice. The finish is a combination of baking spices (nutmeg), vanilla, and a noticeable alcohol bite. The flavors linger for a good while afterwards.

3987.Review: I love this expression of Don Abraham. It retains the profile of the blanco with agave, herbs and orange blossoms, but gives way to a strong cooked agave, buttery, cinnamon and caramel flavor. I love the spiciness of the finish. Excellent repo.

3988.Review: Nose:   Sweet abundant baked agave. Floral notes and ripe fruit laced with cinnamon.  Subtle vanilla/sarsaparilla undertones. Flavor:   Creamy in the mouth. Big agave and butterscotch marry nicely. Finish:   This one keeps blooming a good long time. A pleasant sipper. Thanks G&S!

3990.Review: Pleasant chocolate aroma. Retains the cream soda flavor of the blanco. Great mouthfeel. It tastes very close to an anejo.

3991.Review: Spicy on the nose and in the mouth. Moderately long finish. Edited my rating to reflect rating the new bottling that is produced from organically raised agave. Much more agave present here than in the older short square bottle. This tastes exactly like a lightly aged blanco as a great reposado should. Too much crap in the market that is poorly made or been manipulated to hell and back to achieve a profile for flavor.  This is highly recommended.

3992.Review: Light amber color with nice, oily legs in the glass.  Aroma of cooked agave, caramel and oak.  Flavor of cooked agave and oak.  Medium finish.

3995.Review: Very pleasant to sip, could be well off confused by an añejo. well prepare you know this Tequila took effort by the Aromas and the complexity of flavors that are well put together. One of my highest rated Reposados

3997.Review: Aroma of some alcohol but oak and vanilla like a typical repo. Nothing crazy special but nothing bad. Has a refreshing finish like a spearmint style finish but not taste.

3998.Review: Cooked agave, Carmel, and spice on the nose.

3999.Review: sweet cooked agave caramel vanilla stone fruit cinnamon. long buttery spicy finish. great sipper

4000.Review: A touch of biting burn, turns sweet. I hate wasting  this in mixes.   This has been a perfect sipping Tequila.

4001.Review: Nice opening of vanilla and oak, finishes with just the right pepper bite.  One of my favorites!

4002.Review: Nice sipper with an unusual anise twist!

4003.Review: Nose: Fruity baked agave.  Palate: Creamy buttered cooked agave, finishing into a soft cinnamon with a hint of caramel.  Excellent Repo, at the top of the list. Buttery and soft all night long.

4004.Review: Excellent flavor with notes that are both pleasing to the palate and nose.

4005.Review: Exceptional! Cooked in a stone brick oven, which proves nice on quality. I was pleasantly suprised with the complexity of this tequila for a reposado. Succulent and sweet on the nose, reminds me of tropical fruits and apples. Very enjoyable taste! Smooth all the way through with a warm and sweet finish, bitter sweet chocolate. Plenty of cooked agave: Delicious. Lingering taste of sweetness is very nice. Highly recommend this tequila!

4006.Review: Caramel, brown sugar and some bitterness.

4007.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4007.Review: The nose doesn’t do this justice, I get some agave and oak of course but no indication of the magic to come. The port cask finish still has a strong backbone of French oak but gives way little by little to a warm, sweet crème brûlée mess inside a bottle. I’m going to be careful to make this bottle last, it’s a really great example of how the right barrel can make tequila shine.

4008.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4008.Review: A gift from a friend this Port wine cask finished reposado has a definite wine nose to it that is very evident when tasted. Tannic elements from the port come right out front and add an interesting taste element to the Herradura reposado.

4009.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4009.Review: (Port cask finish) Aroma is relatively floral with hints of caramel, earth and agave. There does seem to have a bit of sweet grape as well (from the port barrel or just marketing affecting perception?). Complex flavor that begins slightly sweet and evolves relatively quickly to baking spice (cinnamon and clove) with some good heat. Finish is warm and relatively long but rests in the throat rather than the mouth.I would say the port cask is having at least some impact on flavor but other than the sweetness and a bit of grape I'm not sure I can be any more specific.

4010.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4010.Review: 1 run deal, regular reposado then moved to a sherry barrel for 2 months, expected a better finish

4011.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4011.Review: Beautiful from start to finish. Sweet but full of balance.

4012.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4012.Review: As a brand fan of Casa Herradura, this is my 2nd round with the Port Cask repo; scents of light agave, slight grape and honey; on the front, more agave, slight alcohol burn, notes of caramel; on the backend, more burn with light honey and toffee notes; at a price point of approximately $80.00 USD, this is fair to good value;

4013.Tequila: Herradura Colección de la Casa Reserva 2012 Reposado – Port Cask Finish
4013.Review: I had this tequila in Austin at a bar and really enjoyed it so started searching for a bottle. I found it for sale finally in a small town in Illinois for $90. That may be cheap or expensive, but to me it was a deal. I have now been sipping at it for 10 months. It is one of those tequilas that I am generally happy to bring out for relaxing. But there is something off about it for being tequila. Specifically, the port influence adds a type of aftertaste that doesn't normally come with tequila. It is rosy and sweet and good but not tequila. Purists could pass. Those who like other unusual barrel takes could do a lot worse than this.

4014.Review: A little light and watery in the mouth, but this is a 38% abv product. Aroma has some celery, which reminds me of several old school tequilas. Also has vanilla and caramelized agave. Flavor is pleasant but not complex. Overall a solid tequila, if you can find it!

4015.Review: Smells like beach and fresh cut lawns. But maybe that's because I'm on the beach in Zihuatenejo? Numbs the back of the tongue (in a good way). Would definitely drink again!

4016.Review: Young flavors, but smooth. Aromas: grass, cherry, espelette, raw agave. Flavors: white pepper, honey, toast.

4017.Review: Green agave, orange zest, hay on the nose. Sweet cooked agave, citrus, lime, pepper on the tongue. Finish med-short with cream agave and citrus. Found bottle at Keg N Bottle in CA

4018.Review: I detect some orange zest (bright citrus) and agave on the nose. There’s also some lime notes. The nose is overall light and clean. I taste buttery sweet cooked agave and oily lime zest followed up with a lingering peppery note. The nose and taste go well together. This is a nice well made Blanco. It’s no longer in production so grab them when you see them!Salud!

4019.Review: Subdued and muted, green Agave, wet cement

4020.Review: Nice creamy agave and earth notes in the mouth which is preceded by some citrus notes on the nose. Note that this is no longer available.

4021.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band
4021.Review: Tastes a lot like IXA or Quinta de Gomez...... Checked the nom and yep they are from distillery 1549.

4022.Review: I get raw agave and strong menthol scent, very grassy and citrusy.  After the first sips I was done and this is my least favorite from this line. The ArteNom 1146, 1579, and 1414 are better than this.  I look forward in trying ArteNom 1123 in the future.

4023.Review: Fresh, vegetal, green apple, raw agave. Smooth . Long good pepper burn and fade out.

4024.Review: Not bad. Taste is Good. light agave, earthiness taste. Like a root vegetable. Retested on 5/14 Very nice. Taste of agave, minerality, lime zest/ orange peel pepper, light vegetalness

4025.Review: Citrus and booze-forward aroma. Slight taste of pepper combined with deep notes of herb.

4026.Review: Earth and pepper. Long finish. Not as much agave as I prefer, but excellent blanco. For this price, I would buy El Tesoro, Pasote, or ArteNom 1579.

4027.Review: This is an amazing Tequila for sipping Clean, great legs and finish. Not inexpensive but I believe worth it

4028.Review: This is pretty good, but Fortaleza Still Strength Blanco is noticeably more enjoyable.

4029.Review: Delicious sweet peppery aroma.  Bright, fresh, sweet black pepper.  Long finish with a touch a unpleasant bitterness after a min or two.

4030.Review: Aroma good. Earthy salty taste. Flowery taste

4031.Review: 40% ABVApprox 24* BxInitial nasal impact is warming. Aroma leads with citrus, mostly orange or mandarin. Cooked agave, earth and some Andes Candies (mint and chocolate).Slightly astringent mouth feel from a sufficient amount of alcohol. Drying with a buttery coating on the tongue. Initially sour impression on the taste. Cooked agave, pepper, mint and orange are the predominant flavors. Earth, some dark chocolate and vegetal dominate on the backend with a somewhat sambuca-like warmth to finish. A unique blanco at an very good value, but unfortunately no longer made

4032.Review: Tried this at El Palomar in Santa Cruz! Bartender even suggested I suck on some oranges after each sip! Yummy!

4033.Review: I expected a lot more from this 5 year XA. Good for sure, but doesn't come close to the 55 month XA. Great nose. Agave, nutmeg, cinnamon, figs, etc. but fades rather fast considering the time spent in the barrel.

4034.Review: Give a slight edge to the 55 month. Which had lighter wood notes. This is complex but the price point makes it difficult to pick over other xa

4035.Review: I find this version to be a tad better than the regular XA but the uncrease in price does not justify it. I really prefer the 55 Meses version than this ine, the 55 is more complex.

4036.Review: Rich agave flavor paired with mild fruitiness and various baking spices. Great stuff, but not the best value.

4037.Review: It’s smooth and light for an XA with balanced flavors of agave, flowers, raspberry, oak, vanilla, and leather—a real treat!

4038.Review: 45% ABVAroma:   Agave with light bourbon oak influence. Warm spice notes, citrus and citrus zest, vanilla, nutmeg and a spritz of minerals. Trace aroma of a cedar hope chest sachet. Flavor:   Less oily than Cousin XA 55. A touch thin in the mouth. A slight bitter bite.  But lots of fruity agave shines through. Pepper is a prominent player and has staying power. Spicier and more heat in the 5 Años profile. Finish:   Packs a lip numbing punch, with a touch of astringency.

4039.Review: Ok so this is a 5 years especial Barrel for the TBC group. Smell: I get alcohol first then some peppers and some agave at the end. To be a 5 year and still some agave is great.Flavor : I get the suprising sweetness of the agave again with some burn but great kick.Overall another master piece of Felipe

4040.Review: This was a Tequila Barrel Collective barrel selection. It’s a G4 5 year Extra Anejo. I compared it to regular G4 3 year Extra Anejo. Felipe Camarena doesn’t ever disappoint. On the nose the 5 year is more buttery and has more vanilla but less cooked agave. When tasting the 5 year I taste slightly more oak and the other flavors seem to be deeper than the 3 year. The finish also seems slightly smoother. I like that Felipe utilizes older used barrels to age his tequila in. This allows more of the tequila notes to punch through that aging affect that the barrels have. The 3 year is an excellent choice but the 5 year is a treat! ¡Salud!

4041.Review: Grass, olives and almond on the nose cooked agave on the palate with earthy mineral finish.

4042.Review: Nose honey water and cooked agave Taste. Buttery vanilla with cooked agave A bit spicy and nice tingle. Price is the killer

4043.Review: Really complex vs to regular XA. Price is a downfall. Bunch of dried fruit aromas and slight oak sensationLooking forward to do a side by side comparison to the upcoming 6 years.

4044.Review: The aroma of the barrels overloads the familiar smell of the barrel room at Pandillo on this expression but it does not overwhelm the aroma of amazing tequila. I don’t favor aged tequilas but in the universe of tequilas that you would compare to this one, it’s a Winner and a solid Value.

4045.Review: Love the nose on this with vanilla, oak, caramel, and the taste doesn’t disappoint.  However, I spent about $80 less on the standard G4 3-year XA, and I prefer the 3-year.  Just seems to have a better balance. Both are very good.

4046.Review: Compared with Tears of Llorna and Rey Sol 10yrG4 - 5 anos:Very light color - urine of someone well hydratedNose - light and delightful. Agave, vanilla, mild butterscotchTaste - butter and almonds. Mild tangerine. Agave still very bold and prevalent even after 5 years. Some distant hints of smoke even.  Butterscotch though is overriding flavor next to the agave. Yum.

4047.Review: Very light straw color. 90 proof. Comes in a little hot at first. Very agave forward.

4048.Review: Tequila Barrel Collective Limited run - Superb

4049.Review: This tequila is my first love, you never forget your first!! Oodles of roasted agave on the nose, banana nut muffin flavour(perfect for breakfast) and an amazing oily finish that coats your whole mouth. I still love this!

4050.Review: Bottle is dated 19/12/06 RLA-002. More oak and barrel spice than El Tesoro reposado from the same time frame. The base distillate would be similar so it's possible that newer barrels were used for aging this at the time. Blanco of this brand turns up much more often than the reposado and añejo so if you see this grab it for some 10+ year old agave goodness from La Alteña.

4053.Review: Subtle citrus nose. buttery, Carmel first impression on the taste. nice consistent finish.

4054.Review: Jay @ Añejo presented this gem for tasting. Apparently Jay can’t get this anymore!!

4055.Review: I’m not normally a fan of reposados, but this one I love.  It’s got a sort of overripe banana flavour that I’ve seen nowhere else.  It’s also a great deal for the quality.  It’s too bad that we won’t be able to get it anymore shortly.

4056.Review: Beautiful peppery green nose with bright agave.Palette reflects the nose well but finishes a bit hot.A little barrel on the finish but more of a long numbing tingle on the sides of the palette.

4057.Review: The aroma is on the sweeter side. Notes of banana and fruit. Taste is similar to the aroma. The finish is very smooth.

4058.Review: Agave forward on the nose, citrus too.. a little bit of white oak. Nice straw color. Smooth, light body. Short finish.

4059.Review: 7/13/21-Full nose of alcohol. Hmm. I wonder if I got a bad bottle. If I get to try again, I will update.

4060.Review: Aromas of vanilla are first here, mixed with roasted agave and a spiciness (black and white pepper) that is fairly pleasing. There is also a bit of a citrusy aroma, before going back to the wood with toffee, caramel, and oak. The flavor very much follows the aroma, but everything is a bit muted and fades very quickly. Overall, not bad for a bar-brand tequila. If they could tweak their formula to brighten up the aromas/flavors or make the finish a bit longer then I would rate it in the mid-80's.

4061.Review: My bottle has a crown but it is 2022 and it says it was aged for 7 years. This was very good and a great value when compared to other equally aged tequilas. Natural sweetness and deep char notes paired very nicely with some cooked agave. The agave is more of a secondary note while in the añejo it still shines, very likely due to the 7 years. Highly recommend.

4062.Review: Agave, caramel, cinnamon, oak… sweet and tasty. Great option for whisky lovers.

4063.Review: Aromas - vanilla, oak, caramel, dried fruit Flavors - cooked agave, nutmeg, cinnamon, caramel, 8 yr aging definitely leans more to whiskey profile

4064.Review: Aroma : Cooked agave, vanilla, and very light caramel against a backdrop of oak and barrel spices.Taste : Minor agave sweetness with more caramel, oak, and barrel spice, along with cinnamon and peppercorns.Finish : Long finish that expands with more oak and caramel. Slightly more spicy than the initial taste.

4065.Review: Nose:   Big vanilla roundness blanketing agave forward aroma. Balanced barrel spices and a pinch of leather complementing the above duo. Flavor:  More of the leather notes on entry. Light white pepper, nutmeg, caramel and mochachino.  Sophisticated oak barreling.

4066.Review: Agave still comes through with lots of vanilla notes Great long finish, I hate to use the word smooth but it fits. This is a special barrel at El Conejo in Sayulita that is at 140 proof! Wow!!

4067.Review: Rated at MBTC 2018. Multiple pours of this 8 year single barrel Extra Añejo were consumed. Agave, oak and barrel spice combine to make this XA an elegant sip despite the lips imagery on the bottle. Well done.

4068.Review: Matured with care, this XA retains forward cooked agave notes with oak and spice flavors.  Some sweetness from caramel and vanilla notes.  Really well made with an enjoyable finish.

4069.Review: North Texas Tequila Club tasting event in Dallas at Hohnholt home. First impression good with agave notes and nice soft taste with bit of alcohol finish.

4070.Review: Aroma - whiskey, pepper Flavor - raisins, whiskey, vanillaFinish - smooth, very smooth, lingering

4071.Review: This has tons of caramel and spices with a bit of pepper. It's easy drinking with very little bite.

4072.Review: Still agave forward with good balance of wood, vanilla, nutmeg, spice. Good dash of pepper on the long finish

4073.Review: Tasted this straight from barrel at El Canejo restaurant in Sayulita, MX. Bottled version will be slightly different as this one has continued to age beyond 8 yrs.An excellent XA with well balanced agave, vanilla and carmel notes without being sweet or straying too far from being a good agave expression.

4074.Review: Deep copper color with thick slow legs. Nose:   Deep rich nose comprised of many  subtleties.  There are peachy/dark cherry fruit notes, creamy vanilla laced with trace nuttiness, a suggestion of floral berries and a tease of barrel spices. Flavors:   Nice silky mouth feel. Almonds, hazelnuts, white pepper and vanilla. The barrel oak does not overpower, but there is some tannic bitterness. Heat builds on the finish.

4076.Review: Full body flavors and aromas taste of coffee, nuts, and chocolate. Full vanilla nose, butter, leather and honey. The Extra Dry has an extremely velvety mouthfeel bordering on the astringent. In summary an outstanding, remarkable and memorable spirit to taste, a must to have for lovers of ultra aged Tequila.

4077.Review: Nose- agave, white pepper, grass, citrus, and chalkTaste- Cooked agave, black pepper, cinnamon, and an amazing honey sweetness that is never cloying. A little bit if alcohol heat as well. The sweet blends with the spicy notes perfectly.Finish- the sweetness quickly fades leaving the spicy pepper for a medium length finish.Value- While my tasting pour was free this is only $29 in my home state of Michigan so this is an exceptional value!

4078.Review: Agave, pepper, mint, citrus, and butter with long legs and a nice finish. Wow!

4079.Review: Best silver in the price range by far. Smooth as silk.

4080.Review: We ain’t Cali or Texas but this is the best value in Michigan!

4081.Review: Straight up blanco. Makes an excellent drink but i can drink it strait up. Agave and pepper.

4082.Review: Nose is really clean and full of agave. Taste is a bit cloudy but the agave pushes through to a light peppery but medium burn. This one's a sipper for me, no mixing. For price range, very good Blanco.

4083.Review: Deep fresh agave notes , peppermint also

4084.Review: -  nose is very vanilla-e with herbal    notes-  the agave taste is peppery with        clean finish

4085.Review: Lote 2 Bottle #13Bright agave nose. Berries, butterscotch, brown sugar and pumpkin spices. Taste:  Agave, anise, intense fruit and spices. Rich mouth feel with nice pepper balance. Opulent brûlée and pepper finish.

4086.Review: Lots of butter in the aroma. Light in color, nice balance between cooked agave and oak.

4087.Review: Classic reposado profile. Too bad it's diffused crap now.

4088.Review: The differences between the original Cazadores (made at NOM 1128) and the current version are so drastically different it’s impossible to compare them. This reposado is super vegetal, loaded with a celery aroma that I love. The flavor is legit real old school agave, vegetal, creamy goodness. Finish is fantastic, long enough for a nice trip down memory lane—before the diffuser process changed this product forevermore.If you see a bottle with "NOM 1128" on the label, my advice to you is BUY IT without hesitation.

4089.Review: Ok , so this review is from my just opened 1998 bottle . We’ve all heard the stories of this legend, pre Bacardi take over diffuser fuck up . Sorry, truth ! OMG the aroma is so strong and unique, then the taste . Truly like no other. Old school sweet agave, mint, anise, mineral . So so good . I had to open this treasure and glad I did .

4090.Review: Weird nose and taste. A bad batch maybe?

4091.Review: If you find this bottle buy it!!!  If it has the lid that has 4 square holes in it.  These are the old school bottles of Cazadores.  I haven’t seen one of these bottles in years.

4092.Review: Must be nom 1128.This is one I think is getting mixed up in reviews with Nom 1487 which sucks.Cazadores nom 1128 reposado is nice old school tequila.Simple profile but very good.Aroma of cooked agave,Alcohol,Vanilla and oak.Taste of Agave,vanilla,alcohol and oak.Finish is short,warm and sweet.This Tequila is in style of many older reposado.I recommend.Avoid nom 1487.Check your label to make sure it is nom 1128 and enjoy.

4093.Review: El tequila de batalla, fácil de conseguir y muy bueno para el precio. Usado para cocteles, pero suficientemente bueno para tomar directo.

4094.Review: This was one of my go to tequilas for PALOMAS

4095.Review: Another good tequila in its price class.  Fairly smooth.  Nice aroma, ok to sip but good in a margarita.  No harsh finish.

4096.Review: Nice clean burn, thanks to this classic, I began my journey with tequila

4097.Review: Have loved this since the day I tried it. Great taste for the money.

4098.Review: The nose is phenomenal, banana and crème caramel, makes you wanna five right in the bottle. Super boozy, threw me off as I expected silky smooth but this has some serious fire in its guts. The barrel, unsurprisingly, is doing most of the talking here, I can actually still find some agave when I go digging for it but this has the pedigree of a great whisky.Don’t let me score fool you, it lost major points on value(is anything worth that much?!) but this is delightful and a well made tequila. I count myself lucky to even have the chance to taste.

4099.Review: Sherry barrel aging, leather flavors, and a bit drier than the Series 1 Lalique. These qualities make this a luxe all-night sipper.

4100.Review: Lighter in color than Serie 1. Aroma is much brighter citrus, cinnamon and fruit. Flavor has vanilla, dried fruit and butter. Long thick buttery finish.

4101.Review: Amazingly smooth packed with complex flavors.  A real treat to have knowing how rare it is.  Savored every drop.

4102.Review: wonderful floral aroma. all I smell is flowers and a hint of agave.  the most floral tequila I've reviewed with 54 fine beverages under my belt.  silky smooth on the tongue.  lots of flowers,  with pepper making a quick appearance just to keep you on your toes.  4 second finish,  then a slight linger on your throat. very nice and a great way to get the ladies to appreciate tequila.

4103.Review: Aroma; floralTaste; buttery, turns into floral, slight fruitiness.texture; smooth, medium thickness

4104.Review: NOM 1499:On the nose, loads of caramel, vanilla and oak. Sweet cinnamon and a bit of spice and fruit. On the palate, definitely a ton of oak. The caramel is very present. The oak is a little overpowering for me, I’m not loving that.  Nice natural sweetness and some agave hidden in there. The vanilla comes in and out and lingers on the finish.Overall solid. A little overoaked in my opinion, and at $90+, it’s a little pricy imo. I appreciate the use of Mexican wine barrels.

4105.Review: NOM1499-The nose is fragrant but not dark & dense.  It’s delicate but not thin or heavy. This Añejo is double barreled. They first barrel their blanco for 6 months in Mexican merlot wine barrels and then it’s rebarreled and aged for an additional 12 months in symphony barrels. A symphony barrel is a barrel made from multiple wood types. Corrido uses 3 wood types to make their unique barrels; French Limousin oak, Missouri white oak & Hungarian oak. There’s an earthy sweetness with hints of baking spices (mainly cinnamon), raw unfiltered honey, cooked agave, thin molasses and saturated oak staves. Some chocolate and tobacco sneak in too. This is a tequila that whiskey fans can also appreciate. -For a Añejo that’s interacted with so many wood types I can still taste the cooked agave. There’s notes of caramel and a dense combination of dark honey and Mexican vanilla. The barrel influence and some sweet pepper hit the mid palate while the baking spices and barrel tannins linger into the medium and sweet finish that has a hint of orange chocolate. Overall this is great additive free Añejo that I love sipping neat but I’d also like to try it in a Mexican Old Fashioned. -Their bottles look great and the back label has a picture of their stacked barrels on the backside that faces the front of the bottle.

4106.Review: Very complex from the moment it was popped open. Beautiful nose. Agave forward, mocha, cinnamon, touch of smoke, baseball mitt, molasses, chocolate, cherry, vanilla, spices, as good as it gets.

4107.Review: This is for the new NOM

4108.Review: Bottle from 2011. Oak, agave, barrel spice of caramel, cardamom, caramelized agave. Quickly becoming Unicorn tears. Someone must have a large stash.

4109.Review: Complex and rich. one of the best tequila values out there IMO. Agave, caramel, spice and just enough oak. Delicious.

4110.Review: Even more peppery than the extra-anejo, but I think I might like it more because the complexity isn't so hidden. Lots of licorice, and I don't like licorice. But I like this.

4111.Review: Nose:OakCaramelVanilla Hint of butterscotch Flavor:Strong oakToffee and cinnamon For me, the nose is better than the flavor. I wanted more agave and less oak in this one. Still a solid anejo.

4112.Review: NOM 1526, Corrido Anjeo ($101 @ Ferment and Still) is excellent sip, albeit on the sweeter side.  The nose and taste have multiple layers of complexity. It's quite the improvement from the reposado.  Carmel, oak, baking spices , raisin, cherry (dried) fruit, charcoal, and chocolate. Everytime I come back to the glass,  something new pops up.  The finish is a bit disappointing. A lingering sweetness, but otherwise not much going on.  A slight knock   on affordability.

4113.Review: I actually started my tasting with Nueve Uno blanco which imo is a solid blanco. Then I went with the Corrido anejo. It smells delicious, I don’t know why but I almost got a hint of butter popcorn. Tasted it and was very easy to drink , Cooked agave, caramel,vanilla, butterscotch,pepper, very little oak .I really enjoyed it.

4114.Review: I'm really glad they brought this line back. they are all first rate. the anajo has sweet agave vanilla caramel cinnamon dark cherry chocolate. very dark in color but no additives. everyone should have this in their rotation.

4115.Review: Lovely aged notes of caramel, cinnamon, toffee, vanilla and oak spice. The texture is round and plush across the palate. Very nice finish. Tasty and complex. Very nice sipping Tequila. Paid $95 per bottle.

4116.Review: Nom 1526. Very nice with tasting notes from aged tequilas, bourbons, and sherry cask whiskies.Has notes of Cooked Agave, Vanilla, Raisins, Cherries, Dark Chocolate, Butterscotch, Almonds, Maple Syrup, Plums, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Red Chili Peppers, Green Chili Peppers, Lavender, Violets, Oranges, Ginger

4117.Review: Quite nice! Agave, vanilla, caramel, cinnamon and butterscotch… light on the oak. Wonderful sipper with a long finish.

4118.Review: It’s a pomegranate liqueur made with tequila. It taste great for what it is which isn’t a tequila. Hence my rating. I rated it for what it is. If it was rated as a tequila it would be ridiculous low.

4119.Review: NOM 1595|I got this as an alternative to Pama Pomegranate Liqueur and because it has tequila in it. The flavor is comparable for use in making a pomegranate margarita.

4120.Review: NOM 1595|Wouldn’t consider this a tequila, its a pomegranate liqueur...Represents pomegranate really well acidic, tart and sweet/floral. Versatile to mix or sipWill see how it goes with some Holiday mixology recipes.

4121.Review: NOM 1595|Went to my local Mexican grocery store and look what i found ! I did Not expect this taste.Hooked.

4122.Review: NOM 1595|I’m not sure why I am rating this, it’s not a tequila. It’s got tequila in it, so I’ll rate it. I like pomegranate so that is really how I rated this like I did. You can make a decent mixed drink with this stuff. I added some ocho reposado with this over ice and it was tasty.

4123.Review: NOM 1595|Ripe fruit aroma, very slight agave aroma.  Super sweet fruity flavor similar to cranberry cocktail.  No noticeable agave flavor.  I don’t hate it, but probably wouldn’t buy or recommend.  $1.99 for 50ml worth a try.

4124.Review: NOM 1595|Really nice on the palate and a great way to introduce a sweet wine drinker into agave spirits. The infusion Clase Azul carries enough agave flavor the consumer to get agave on the palate. On the nose I noticed agave, tart, fruit. On the palate it was light in intensity and texture with agave, pomegranate, and cherry. Finish was short and simple

4125.Review: I like pomegranate and I love tequila but pomegranate tequila! Not so much. It made interesting margaritas.

4126.Review: This is an excellent liqueur! This isn't a replacement if you are feeling like tequila. In fact you shouldn't think of this as tequila primarily. Think of it as pomegranate juice that has been infused with tequila. That way you won't judge this as a tequila, which would be absurd!It is fantastic on ice if you are looking for a sweeter tasting with a tequila flavouring in there. They used excellent tequila in this liqueur : Clase Azul. Probably the best tequila-based liqueur I've ever had. Very smooth, not too sweet. And very easy to drink lots and lots very quickly. It's a bit pricy; but they are using premium tequila; and it shows!

4127.Review: Had this a few years ago out of a 50 ML bottle. From what I remember not too big on the tequila flavor but you got the tartness from the pomegranates.

4128.Review: Bright Agave on nose little bit of wood mid palate beautiful finish.  So easy to drink, rockstar throughout. Wow I love this stuff. Coats the glass beautifully

4129.Review: Nose:   Lightly charred, greenish oak aromas. Kind of an oak sawdust impression. A whiff of round, creamy vanilla and a suggestion of cider. Baking spices meld with passion fruit and green apple. Flavors:   Buttery. A rich merger of flavors:  vanilla, leather, maple and butterscotch. Pepper heat builds on the backend, with a bit of anise . Respectful barreling, highlighting the plentiful fruit and agave.  Finish fades slowly and gently. #1414 and Sergio Cruz are another up and comer to watch.

4130.Review: Bought this from Siptequila.com. Absolutely beautiful. NOM 1414 is definitely one to watch. So much going on with this Anejo and I love it all.

4132.Review: Well this is a pleasant surprise. Picks up quite a bit of oak from aging, in a good way. Very smooth.

4134.Review: Tasted blind Nose - Light barrel spice and agave with some alcoholTaste - Spicy agave and caramel from the barrelFinish - Short with some alcohol that fades to slight bitterness

4135.Review: bananas foster with vanilla nose. entry is pecans and cashews, with herbal top notes. turns to vanilla and peppery heat at the end.

4136.Review: Beautiful dark Amber color. Vanilla , dark fruit and citrus on the nose and same for the flavor along with some agave and oak and perhaps a bit of coffee. Not too vicious , but not too thin either. Nice long warm oaky finish .

4137.Review: The aroma is filled with fruit - apple, pineapple, pear - with butterscotch and oak alongside. Again, a very mild opening with a nice butterscotch sweetness. The flavor evolves to show some fruit and mild spice. On the finish, the sweet spice moves toward an almond-like flavor. This is a great aged tequila that could be sipped all night. However, it is a bit sweet for my taste.8/2/2015

4138.Review: Dried sweet fruit, hazlenut.  Dryness at the finish.  Lot 2

4140.Review: -tasted blind-Intriguing nose of fruit, wood and alcohol. Bittersweet oaky butterscotch palate entry, with a hint of acidic citrus. Nice. Leaves a tart, mildly acidic linger in the mouth. Caramel/butterscotch wood finish - long but ends on a bitter note.

4141.Review: If you are a fan of aged tequilas, this is one you should try. A toasty oak aroma mingles with agave and cinnamon. In the mouth, an oily coating lingers nicely, and when it fades you will want to go back for more so that it continues. This añejo pays tribute to its original agave roots and should be given high-fives for doing so. Well done.

4143.Review: The aroma is pleasant. I tried it after dinner, so it has all the perfect aromas for a digestive.Chocolate, coffee, vanilla caramel. It's an aroma dessert!As time passes, the cooked agave comes into play. It's fresh.The flavour is good. It is sweet, natural sweetness and warm. It's minty, fresh and light. Its palate is good. I like it.It is not “heavy” like other anejos and preserves the lightness of the Blancos.I will say that it is an everyday anejos sip.

4144.Review: LOT 113-18. This is a solid Anjeo. Tastes very good. will keep this one in stock in my house.

4145.Review: This is what I look for in an anejo. Creamy mouth feel, agave, vanilla, caramel, and a hint of oak. Great value, at under $55, for such a well made tequila. I like this as a sipper, but it makes for a great tequila  substitute on classic whiskey cocktails.

4146.Review: Cooked agave, cinnamon, spicy pepper. Smooth thick mouthfeel. Long peppery finish.

4148.Review: Lot 3-bottle 948—A smooth, light mix of agave and vanilla/caramel opening.  This is followed by a mild pepper addition.  There is a silky mouthfeel which has a medium finish time.  The finish has more pepper but still continues the agave and light sweetness.  An outstanding product.  This is anejo that everyone can enjoy.  The entire GD line is recommended.

4149.Review: on the nose I get barrel, oak,cream soda, sage, cinnamon tea, citrus, caramelized agave, dry hay, clove, wet red dirt.on the palate I get a very silky, peppery and creamy texture. laime stone minerals,mango pulp, citrus, oak chips, wet clay,dry fruits like pineapple, dates, cinnamon, mint. tasted sour dough bread, and a burst of dry spices. nice warmth on the throat and chest heat with barrel notes.finish takes its sweet time to decipate. follows with dry chile pepper sensation. another 1414 achievement on my books..

4150.Review: Wow! Nice Anejo! Great balance of oak, minerals, and agave sweetness. You might like if you like Siete Leguas.

4151.Review: Slight caramel agave smell with similar flavor but finish has a little bite. Not a fan of screw on cap! But price was good!!

4152.Review: Very nice product with light notes of agave and oak on the nose with some butter on the tongue

4153.Review: Imagine sipping this on a cold, wet night by the fireplace or with a cigar. Gran Dovejo's line up is so amazing.  Everyone should give them a try. At $60 (Sip Tequila), this is a bargain.Nose: Whiskey barrel influences right away. Dried cherries, leather, carmel, leather and a hint of smokiness. Roasted agave, butter, and cinnamon evolve. A rich and inviting nose.Palate:  Thick and oily with a mild peppery heat.  Unlike the nose, oak, cooked agave, and black pepper are present up front. Whiskey barrel char, caramel, vanilla, cinnamon and some floral notes follow in a subtlety blended spirit.Finish: Long and warm.

4155.Review: I can’t follow the nose and flavor of this. I’m getting strong cherry or roses?! floral almost to a point of turn off for me. I can’t pin point it. Update: near end of bottle revisit. Much more pleased with this as I near the bottle 1/4 maybe It reeeeally needed to open up for me on this one:) in any case it’s a solid tequila

4156.Review: Let this one breathe and open up. Vanilla & caramel nose, lots of agave, cinnamon and jalapeño on the palate. Nice long finish.

4157.Review: refreshing smell, not too sweet a little peppery, a little fruity. A very light anejo but the oak comes out as it lingers. Refreshing unique flavor.

4158.Review: Aroma - pepper, agave, oakFlavor - oak, leather, vanilla, butterscotch, very viscousFinish - long, lingering, warm but smooth

4159.Review: Wow!Sweet floral aroma followed by a wonderful agave forward flavor, just enough to carry over to a wonderful finish! Amazing value!

4160.Review: Earthy mineral taste, very unique flavor unlike any other tequila I ever tasted.

4161.Review: very oak forward caramel spice toasted nuts dried fruit. nice anajo. shipped from old town

4162.Review: The clerk at K&L Wines recommended this instead when my father in law asked for Sauza Tres Generaciones.Gran Dovejo makes a wonderful sipping tequila that should not be enjoyed any other way, in my opinion. Floral and aromatic, with a hint of sweetness and fruit.Better than some of the popular premium brands, like a certain supermarket staple that has a trademark circular cork stopper.

4164.Review: This is not a very great sipping tequila for me and will be donated to my stash for summer cocktail mixers.  I found the aroma to be warm, oak, agave, hints of butter, and vanilla.  The taste was immediately oak, followed by agave, then a peppery finish that left me wanting to find ways to smooth out with water.  Definitely reminiscent of those “punchy” tequilas I’ve had in my 20s when compared to other añejos (ie 1942, clase azul repo to name a few).

4165.Review: Butterscotch, vanilla, and pepper on the nose. Excellent! Pepper forward taste, which is good but not great. I like it as a sipper but not something I’d crave for.

4166.Review: Great nose!  Strong agave with charred oak on the palate.  Finish was good.  Overall couldn't find anything wrong with this one but had higher expectations so was mildly disappointed.

4167.Review: Long lasting flavor, that stood out against many other tequilas. Oak and toasted nuts with a light Carmel finish.

4168.Review: Very good Anejo with a nice presentation. No surprise as it's from one of my favourite NOMs.

4169.Review: Very tasty... Unique, flavorful, original and one-of-a-kind

4170.Review: Agave monster on the nose. Beautiful nose.  Pallet is interesting but tasty, not sure I know how to describe it.  Nice creamy mouth feel with some tongue numbing but it's sweet. Opens up after a few minutes to more deliciousness.  Expensive but I like it

4171.Review: This was incredibly delicious. I was fortunate enough to have grabbed the last bottle and it does not seem to be coming back. This had a high proof bite but I didn't mind. Awesome nose great flavor and finish. Super sweet and fruity. I would definitely buy it again if available. Lost some points for value. Probably would be in the mid 90s if value wasn't a factor.

4172.Review: Cooked agave, balanced between sweetness and mineral

4174.Review: Aroma: very aggressive alcohol attack (least favorite thing about this profile). Burns too much… I’m even surprised to say this. Other NOM 1139 brand are more friendly and delightful in their aroma bouquet. Aroma Notes added through the app (will add later on here) It improved in flavors and was able to enjoy it. Loved the overall complexity, it takes you through many flavors and still enjoyed some agave soul. Flavor notes added through the app (will add later on here).  Need to revisit since glassware at the bar was meh. Tasting at Madre Oaxaca @ LA - $20 1oz pour…

4175.Review: Doesn’t smell like much, but burns like a bitch, probably wouldn’t drink again to be honest.

4177.Review: Too much alcohol for my taste, light mouth feel and big burnWould stick with the añejo or repo

4178.Review: Very interesting: it’s hella peppery, but not in a way that so aggressive you have sip slowly.  And sip slowly we shan’t.  We shall guzzle.  But I digress! It’s like a low-level, fine-grained pepperiness present from start to finish in a background sort of way.  Earthy but still bright.  Almost a bit of smoke or something to it - although I hate people who describe everything as smokey.  Anyway, it’s time to get back to my life.  Highly recommend.

4180.Review: Peppery and herbal noseSpicy boy. Quite the zing.Very pepperyMinerally

4181.Review: Nose is Agave,fruit,fresh herbs and flowers.Taste of Agave,Green peppers,Fruit,fresh cut garden herbs,minerals,black pepper and clove.Finnish has some heat,long lasting with black pepper.

4182.Review: Second stab at a review first one went into the ether.  I don’t remember what I said but this second sample is feeling like a different tequila to me. Shows me how my tastes ebb and flow. Nose. Is heavy minerals. Wet cement. Hint of citrus and Herbaceousness Taste. Olive oil. With creamy herbs again. Sweet agave and cinnamon hearts. Finish. Nice and long with that Cinnamon heart spice. This taste totally hit me differently. Picked up on things I didn’t before and I missing some of the stuff I did. The bottle is half empty now so that might account for a bit.

4183.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4183.Review: Has a Malort wormwood thing going on. I’m a fan of Laphroaig and ET, but the marriage didn’t quite work out like I’d hoped. This is a pass for me

4184.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4184.Review: Agave, wood, barrel spice, and a light smoldering peaty twang. Moreno’s Liquors edition.

4185.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4185.Review: This is very unique Anejo, single barrel / scotch Interesting notes of agave and wood, light spice. Enjoyable

4186.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition

4187.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4187.Review: What a let down. Scotch barrels and tequila must not mix well. I love mezcal but the barrel influence on this one is a big let down. Super smokey, but in the wrong direction. Points also deducted for price. I was expecting so much more. The regular anejo is a much superior drink.

4188.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4188.Review: Very different than the regular añejo.  The Laphroaig barreling gives it a mezcal profile from start to finish, well done!

4189.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4189.Review: Nose- smoke, peat, anise, agave.Taste- peaty, agave with charcoal/smokiness. Hints of anise, cooked agave and Britney earthy tone.Finish- clean with outstanding cooked agave up front  anise on sides of the tongue and a light pepper finish.The Smokey is a bit much and resembles a mezcal.

4190.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4190.Review: Unique blend of agave and scotch flavors.

4191.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4191.Review: Best I think I've tasted so far. Rich agave with wood, pepper, and just the right amount of smoke and mahogany.

4192.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4192.Review: This is different but nice.  Agave and loads of peattines, and caramel.  Not bad.

4193.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4193.Review: Fantastic aroma and letting it rest for a minute after pouring makes a difference (IMHO). Great balanced flavor with a bit of spice as it goes down and a slight sweetness aftertaste.  I paired a second serving with a mild cigar and it was heavenly.

4194.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4194.Review: simalar to the regular anajo. sweet cooked agave vanilla caramel stone fruit oak baking spices. only difference is a light smokey peaty finish. points deducted for value. old town barrel

4195.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4195.Review: Lightly peated, Carmel, sherry, bright citrus aromas, light/young slightly sweet cooked agave?, Casky finish.  It’s certainly a tequila/scotch hybrid!  With an amazing light pale honey color!  Amazing how when u smell this sometimes I smell tequila, sometimes lightly peated scotch and often both together!  It’s distinct.  And maybe not for everyone?  I rather enjoy it for how well made and unique it is.

4196.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4196.Review: after letting it breathe for a min, I really started to notice a smoky brininess on the nose with just little hints of agave that start to come out more as it sits. I can almost feel the heat in my nose. Definitely spicy, peppery throughout that leaves a bit of tingle for the finish. Almost a little bit of a saltiness. But it still has a light agave sweetness throughout.  Very enjoyable, definitely a nice twist to the typically great El Tesoro.

4197.Tequila: El Tesoro Mundial Collection: Laphroaig Edition
4197.Review: Similar to the regular anejo with a lingering - and pleasant - peaty aftertaste. This is the perfect bottle to introduce a scotch lover to tequila.

4198.Review: Beautiful floral notes on the nose and a nice soft finish with light sweetness and oak.

4200.Review: Tastes over-aged to me. Far too much wood, the agave is gone.

4201.Review: NOM 1502|Da BOMB!! The aroma and finish were amazing for me! Definitely, one of my favorites right now.

4203.Review: NOM 1502|Lot: TPA-126-LA. Acquired at the beginning of 2019.Color: brown.Nose: wood spiciness, menthol, black fermented oolong tea, vanilla.Palate: wood spiciness, vanilla and oolong tea, the menthol keeps it fresh, otherwise wood have felt the wood too cloying. Very slight cooked agave.Finish is medium, the vanilla and wood spiciness persists.

4204.Review: partida elegantenom 1454caramel apple butterscotch oak. more oak on palate than nose

4206.Review: M&J. Classic warmth and mouth of an XA. Buttery, caramel. Nice balance between sweetness and heat.

4207.Review: Very good.  Slightly bitty at the end.  Great aroma.  Not quite worth the 350$ price tag though.

4208.Review: Love this one, I like it when you can taste the quality. How it should taste, old school, not too sweet.

4209.Review: Great stuff with notes of cooked agave, chocolate, salted caramel, tropical fruit, melon, minerals, pepper, and brine.

4210.Review: Have loved this bottle for a long time. Bummed pricing has risen so much and is so hard to find but still one of my all time favorite sipping tequilas to introduce people to.

4211.Review: Pardita Elegante was my first introduction to extra Anejo, so I am sentimentally biased. With each sip you are transformed into an old fashioned western gambling hall. Up front Agave with warm, carmel whisky flavors. This TequilaSnob loves the traditional flavors & warmth of this one.

4212.Review: very nice a bit peppery tiny bit of burn but overall very very good

4214.Review: Aroma a nueces jerez, fresco, agave, liviano, salado, para expertos

4215.Review: Amazing buttery , Carmel with a peppery finish

4216.Review: Quinton and Mike (Colorado Extraction Systems) at The Golden Nugget. With Joe Hickey, Chip

4218.Review: Let someone else buy it for you

4219.Review: Lightly sweet with a  slight  hot finish. cherry sherry cask flavor

4222.Review: Very good, but would struggle to buy

4223.Review: Aromas of dried figs and apricots, as well as notes of caramel, oak, and cooked agave. The flavor leads in with a balanced mix of baking spices, primarily allspice and cinnamon, with caramel and agave. The finish is a delicious blend of caramel candy, as well as baking spices and Mexican chocolate.

4224.Review: lots of oak.  agave on the nose.  pepper, some heat on the end.  not bad

4225.Review: Pitted fruit on the taste, sweet but not overly sweet still had to search for the agave.... easy to sip

4226.Review: Old metal label. This is one of the best XAs I've ever had. At the 1st "sniff" of this gem I knew it was going to be special. Warm cooked agave right off the bat, then some mocha,  cinnamon, cherry, toffee, butterscotch, slight vanilla. Beautiful viscosity. For a 5 year XA this beauty is not oaky at all! This is my 2nd metal label DF Imperial. almost impossible to find nowadays. I had to leave some behind a few times due to level issues but wouldn't hesitate otherwise. Perfection in a gorgeous bottle, unlike other cute bottles with piss inside! GEM!

4227.Review: Another excellent XA from NOM 1146, great balance of agave and barrel aging

4228.Review: Aroma : Fruits and earth predominate. There is the lightest touch of cinnamon and agave.Taste : Light fruits with caramel and vanilla make up the sweet side of this tequila. The less prominent, spicier notes can be attributed to light oak and black pepper. The texture is very well rounded.Finish : Medium in length with a little more spice than the initial taste.The higher price makes this lose some points in value considering there are other, even better extra añejos that cost less.

4229.Review: Can’t believe I haven’t tried this yet. I will definitely add this to my collection.

4230.Review: Oak, caramel, cinnamon, and bell pepper. Excellent.

4231.Review: Rich floral dried fruit full nose.  Big butterscotch and vanilla blast. Rounded balanced vibrant entry. I’m pleasantly surprised so far. I’m liking this! This is Don Fulano at its best.

4232.Review: Prior rating was deleted from the database due to an error a while ago. Tasted blind with other XA. Solid and flavorful this had been a favorite. I prefer the older, larger blue ceramic bottles to the new ones.

4233.Review: Aroma: Much like the Anejo it has strong hints of oak but then also has notes of vanilla, caramel, and cherry. Strangely, it also has an earthy quality that I would normally associate with a blanco.Flavor: It definitely has a strong oak flavor with hints of cinnamon and cherry.Finish: nice long smooth finish. It also leaves your mouth feeling a little dry which I think is a unique characteristic.

4234.Review: Aroma of caramel, dirt and citrus. Incredibly smooth, slightly sweet flavors of caramel, vanilla and cinnamon. Fairly tannic and mouth-drying but not overly so. Great finish that lingers for a good, long time.

4236.Review: This tequila has bright peat, cinnamon and earthy aromas, and a delightful almost fruity flavor. The finish seems to bring a few surprises as it delivers waves of delicious complexity. This is a real treat.

4237.Review: This tequila's aromas of earth and agave don't hint at the delicious, slightly sweet carmel, anise taste that hits your palate upon the first sip. A treat for sure, but a bit pricey.

4238.Review: Tasting the Don Fulano imperial blind, I had no idea as to how much I would dig this juice!  For a tequila that has been aged for 5 years (in I believe, heavy charred casks) there is a ton of agave in the nose and in the taste!  Notes of cooked agave, dry earth, orange peel, cinnamon, white pepper, dark caramel, toffee, coffee, leather and honey this tequila has a lot of heavy oak nots, but not overly sweet.  I'm totally diggin' it!

4239.Review: Un nez riche d’agave. C’est bon! C’est bon… Et la finale est interminablement délicieuse. Mium! Miam, etc…

4240.Review: Smooth and great smells. I get Oak and Carmel. To the taste it's cooked agave, caramel and a touch of vanilla. The smoothness on this tequila is like silk.

4241.Review: The price hurts this one, but it’s an phenomenal XA overall. There’s not much agave, but the medley of butterscotch, caramel, vanilla, oak, and nuttiness that’s achieved without the use of additives is really impressive. Some nice chocolate/cherry notes come through when you give it time to open up. It also has a certain dryness on the finish that I appreciate. I’ll savor the bottle, but if you have the chance to have a single pour this is a must try!

4242.Review: Bold and full bodied with luscious layers of stone fruit, agave, honey, chocolate, cooking spices, leather and earth notes.  A complex and lasting finish wrapped in barrel notes of 5yr+ maturation in French Limousin oak, makes this XA delicious.  Well recommended.

4244.Review: Oak shines through on the nose.Cherry & raisins with chocolate & vanilla present on the pallet.Finish is remarkable, lingering oak and fruit, light pepper that lingers.Another great product from 1146!

4245.Review: aroma is really caramel like sweetness with fermented beans.

4246.Review: Very bold aroma profile with oak, caramel and vanilla being the strongest. Alcohol also comes through a bit. I get little to no agave on the palate. Strong flavor of oak, caramel and pepper. Sherry is also prominent. Hints of chocolate and cherry. Finish is soft with lingering pepper. Nice tequila but not my preference.

4247.Review: Don fulano Imperial rating based on old bottle (2014?) we've gone thru several bottles of this. really liked it. fruit agave floral brown sugar a little cinnamon a little oak. well-balanced very good sipper.i like the juice in older bottles better but haven't tried any of the new bottles since about 2019?

4248.Review: A great XA that is certified additive free. Amazing flavors and smoothness. Delicious!!

4249.Review: I get some cherry, chocolate, maybe some raisin… very sweet. Not bad but not for me.

4250.Review: 1146 is an absolute unit. this is yet another slapper. Fonseca could literally slap me in the face with a tasting glass in his hand and I would thank him. super warm sherry oak, present but not overwheling sweetness, a hint of nuttiness, and a well maintained agave character. 87 is mostly due to the price, which was around a buck fiddy. there are still anejos/ XA's that I prefer over this that are cheaper, but it still slaps like a mf.

4251.Review: Smells like butterscotch candy my grandpa always had in his pocket I am just not a fan of the taste.  Vanilla. Too heavy.Really oak heavy

4252.Review: I have been looking for this one for a long time. Thanks to death by tequila (gracias Nastasia) I got a quick taste.  While this one loses some points for value, everything else is great. Aroma is what you would expect with vanilla, butterscotch and some agave.  Taste is the best part, with agave in some mild sweetness. I’m very happy it’s not overly sweet. The finish is wonderful!

4253.Review: Aroma- caramel, oak, slight cooked agaveTaste- caramel, cooked agave, all spice all perfectly blendedFinish- all spice, light anise, cooked agave, smooth

4254.Review: The one takes time to open up. Nice French oak notes bananas, Agave is still present.

4255.Review: A lot of oak and vanilla on this product - really a great flavor but losing a little of the agave flavor

4256.Review: Probably the best Tequila I’ve tried. Little to no burn, great aroma, tastes sweet. Overall very impressed.

4257.Review: Like honey. Great stuff. Much more like a desert wine than the El Tesoro Extra Anejo. Toffee, vanilla, dried fruit. Balanced, slightly sweet with plenty of flavor and little to no burn. Not the most complex but it beats the Don Abraham EA and I really enjoy that one. Gets a point taken off for the price which is a little high at $150.

4258.Review: Similar profile as the Anejo but amplified and with other barrel influences. Very complex & enjoyable sipper. Love the French Oak notes. DF is so underrated!

4260.Review: Loads and loads of oak. Definitely overpowers the natural agave. A decent bit of caramel and light pepper on the back end.  Very syrupy mouth feel.  Not the best XA but definitely not the worse

4261.Review: Profound taste, deep wood, agave is present, strong at the begining and great aftertaste.Savor profundo, gran sabor a madera presente, fuerte el primer trago y luego el retrogusto te incita al siguiente trago. Un retrogusto madera muy rico.

4262.Review: This is wonderful juice would buy again

4263.Review: A smoothe extra anejo that I would have rated higher but I just wasn’t in love with the taste profile

4264.Review: Get an element of dry roasted peanut with it.

4266.Review: Got to drink this at the distillery recently and had not tried it in 3 years. It was still as amazing as remembered, lots of agave still present event after a long maturation. I got peppery notes which balances well with the sweetness from the barrel. Delicious!!!

4267.Review: Increíble nariz, persistente.Golpe de agave retro nasal.

4268.Review: My 2nd bottle, 1st review; 1st bottle was older, nicer packaging; I’m neutral on the nose, just not very impressive for this price point; nice tones of caramel & agave on the front end; slight sweet honeysuckle on the back of the palate; this is a very smooth tequila but just a little shallow for the price point of $150USD;
