4583.Review: Buen tequila con aromas a Roble, mantequilla, vainilla y agave cocido.En boca madera, Roble y agave cocidoBuena opcion para probar

4584.Review: Great anejo/ whiskey, oak, vanilla, caramel flavour and aroma/ $16

4585.Review: Where the reposado lost me for aroma flavour and finish the anejo somehow brings it full circle back around. The grape notes are in full force more than the blanco the velvety mouth feel makes for an amazing finish. Easily one of my favourite Anejo’s.

4586.Review: Don't get much on the nose - just a little caramel and some dill (after resting it a bit in the glass).  Bitter flavor with a little butterscotch.  Very bitter finish.  Didn't really enjoy this one but super-low price (purchased in Mexico liquor store) made it a bargain to try out.  Will use this one for margaritas.

4587.Review: A full on whiskey bomb, kind of hits like a bottled old fashioned cocktail might be great with a touch of dilution. But not my fav AÃ±ejo.

4588.Review: This one really takes a right turn from the Blanco and Repo.   Pepper, light oak, cappuccino, and a bit of graham cracker.

4589.Review: Is this whiskey or tequila?? Delicious for sure but the agave is lost to me. Caramel, oak and vanilla is all i get.

4590.Review: Nice amber color in the glass.  Aroma starts with the charred oak and then some cooked agave.  Those characteristics carry into the flavor.  Smooth, long finish.  A nice sipping alternative to bourbon or brandy.  I should mention that I am a bourbon drinker.

4591.Review: Peppery and a little hot, but I like it.

4592.Review: Very good tequila at any price.  Less than $30 a steal.  (2015/12)

4593.Review: Excellent Tequila very aromatic at good price

4594.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band
4594.Review: Really good repo, would taste even better with natural cork not rubber!

4595.Review: A bit hot on the nose and tongue.  Nice agave flavor accompanied by a little alcohol burn.

4596.Review: So much better than any big brand product. The real deal...

4597.Review: NOM 1503|Aromas:   Lively nose. Ripe dark fruit with abundant agave. Caramel, vanilla, and plentiful barrel spices. There are some sharp mineral notes that provide counterbalance. Flavor:   Mixed peppercorn pop. Light treatment on the oak. Zingy spices bring tingle to the palate. Yet there is creaminess in the mouth sensation, provided by almond paste and butterscotch notes. Very affordable quality Reposado for $350 pesos.

4598.Review: NOM 1121|Wow. The old version (NOM 1121) is pretty damn impressive. If you spot this anywhere, grab it. You can taste it at Cantina Mayahuel in San Diego.

4599.Review: NOM 1121|Behind front label stamped: 22 DIC 98. Lote No. 33. Pipon No. 4.Color: light yellow.Nose: citrus, sweet cooked agave, mineral, Palate: sweet & sour balance but ends slightly sour & hot, cooked agave is medium not very intense.Finish: ends slightly soapy, might be floral aromas.

4601.Review: NOM 1503|Aroma of cooked agave,herbs and floral .Taste of earth,cooked agave,minerals.Finish of agave and Vanilla.Nice balanced tequila.Not very complex but nice sipper at low price.

4602.Review: Nose:   Initial hit of moderate oak.  Then pleasant earthy notes and a hint of lactic. Robust ripe red fruit, a suggestion of pears and agave roll in. Pulling up the rear are mellow vanilla and cinnamon.Flavor:  This drinks more like a repo than an a√±ejo. Spicy cinnamon, cloves and pepper. Sweet nuttiness, vanilla and toffee. Finishes with trace aniseed and pepper melding with the agave.

4603.Review: Nose:  Cinnamon and brown sugar on warm buttered toast, topped with almond & vanilla spiked whipped cream.  Delicate ripe agave notes with light pepper.  Flavor:   Semi oily with pronounced pepper upon first tasting; as well as a slight soapy cilantro nuance present. Fruitiness emerges as it opens up, with creamy anise and “hottish” cinnamon. Maybe even a hint of dill. It is an intriguing flavor profile. Finish:   Very balanced. It is thick and sweet, but in a natural inviting way. The finish continues to have that slightly soapy taste, but not as a flaw. Lingering pepper, vanilla and almond paste.

4605.Review: Drink on rocks with a seltzer back as it's not hot but you definitely get the alcohol presence on the mouth feel and nose. Hard to find at bars but Lucy's Pleasantville has it. Vanilla some spicy red pepper/fireball candy notes. great buttery mouth feel

4606.Review: a little lighter than hoped for, the notes of spice and oak are very subtle.  a good introductory brand.

4607.Review: View: wheat color no. 2 of 4, transparent and clean tequila, tones and reflections in gold color, this Tequila presents a medium body. In nose presents agave notes, caramel and vainilla aromas, with a promise of black pepper, citrus notes aroma and orange peel are present, wood and butter aroma notes also are present. In mouth, initially has an alcoholic impact but is not unpleasant, butter flavor and vanilla are in the mouth, in the back taste presents a sweet flavor to agave and confirms the black pepper, a smooth and silky flavor in mouth. Highly recommendable.

4608.Review: notes of carmel, vanilla one of my favorites. great sipping for a Respasado.

4609.Review: Exceptional value for this Anejo. Fancy bottle and all. Not the best made Anejo but flavors and aromas were all there.

4610.Review: Gorgeous color, great sipper. Wish finish was smoother

4611.Review: Strong perfume finish that I find too off putting.

4612.Review: Definitely disappointed with this one. A bottle can be good when flavors mesh together well, but this was just bland. Mellow, soft, no spice, no flavors shining through. However, this type of mellow could be good for someone trying to get in to anejoâ€™s.

4613.Review: Tasted in a small snifter at Santo Coyote in Little Rock.  Nice strong nose, thick in orange marmalade.  Smooth entry, no burn at all, just a slight tingle followed by a slight numbing in the back of the throat.  So smooth overall.  Would like a little more complexity in flavor, but overall, this is a standup Anejo.  B+

4614.Review: Thought it was really bland for an Anejo. Bad finish too.

4615.Review: This is my go to every time I am in California cannot find it in Utah

4616.Review: Lovely example of what is possible from Tequilas Finos. Surprisingly hot finish for this expression.

4617.Review: Oak and caramel …… dried fruit …. Barrel spices and some vanilla and agave on the back end some burn and slight minerality

4618.Review: An outstanding Anejo, incredibly made, outrageous bottle and packaging from Patron. Very pricey, needs to be enjoyed slowly and with friend who will appreciate its value

4619.Review: This is from Old Town Tequila.  “Gran Patrón Burdeos is made from 100% Weber Blue Agave, is distilled and then aged in American and French oak barrels at Hacienda Patrón distillery in Jalisco, Mexico. It’s then distilled again and racked in vintage Bordeaux barrels.”On the nose I smell cooked agave, oak, and wine. I also get some slight caramel. It’s pleasant. On the first taste I get a lot of smooth oak and agave.  On the second sip I get sweet agave and wine barrel. The finish is short and sweet. Overall this is a great sipper but the price hurts the rating. It’s priced anywhere between $449 and $349. If you have the money and love tequila you won’t be disappointed but at that price you can purchase a lot of other tequilas.  ¡Salud! AustinTequilaConnoisseurs

4620.Review: Entirely lovely, not many agave forward añejos on the market so add this to your collection. A little bitter on the finish to be “elite” but it’s really phenomenal.

4621.Review: Lovely copper color. Nose:   Rich, full aroma. Deep, dark ripe fruit overtones, vanilla, orange peel, dried apricot, walnuts, peach, cedar shavings, and an earthy slightly acidic note. Flavor:   Creamy vanilla, almond, round baking spices, bourbon oak, and warming pepper. Some herbal notes: maybe a hint of dill weed, anise and artichoke.  Finishes with some caramel.  Balanced medium long finish, a first class tequila. $$$$$

4622.Reviewer: Tommy Grules - Los Skeletone Blues Band
4622.Review: Wonderfully aged with unique smooth complex flavours... Just to damn pricey and this reduces its score..

4623.Review: this is a really nice sipping tequila. I love the strong oak tastes and the wine barrel notes. beautiful color. excellent presentation.

4624.Review: A little harsh on the lips

4625.Review: notes are from a tasting I did in 2016this is good but in my opinion, not worth the price. so the value brought my rating down a few points

4626.Review: Wooden notes with a subtle warmth. Velvety feel a characteristic of aging in French oak barrels. Almost wine like.

4627.Review: Savored a shot of this at a celebrity chef’s restaurant in Las Vegas. Worth the tasting experience. Not usually one to be enamored by pretty bottles, the heft and intricate feel of the design of this bottle stopper is truly a thing of beauty.

4632.Review: I tried this tequila while celebrating my son’s graduation from the university.  It’s an amazing tequila, very pricey but worth the celebration.  I absolutely love its copper color I think it’s rather unique.  On the nose I get cooked agave, minerals, oak and dried smokey fruits with very similar taste.  Finish was rather short but sweet (caramel) very minimal bite.

4633.Review: Comes from deep well water sources12 months in a French oakSmells oakyTastes oaky and smooth Cleared the sinuses

4634.Review: Fermented in Wood tanksFermented with fibres in french oak mills is not common

4635.Review: 2 years aged and the distilled a 3rd time $75/oz Vanilla, Prunes, oak,

4636.Review: Rich full body aroma. Carmel, vanilla, raisin. Very smooth a pleasure to the senses.

4637.Review: nose; honey,  walnuts,  dry peaches /apricots,  toffee,  pepper.palate;  ripe fruit,  nuts, honey.albeit a well made tequila,  underwhelming character.

4638.Review: I’m a Blanco guy so this is out of my comfort zone. Still learning to appreciate a good anejo.Had the privilege of tasting this @ a nieces birthday .Lots of oak. Very sweet. Caramel. Very little agave.Super smooth with no burn what so ever. Hard pressed to believe this is even tequila though. High price tag slightly downgrades the rating .

4639.Review: Love the floral and fruity taste. Nest sipping tequila I ever tried. Nice warmth a little spice at the finish.

4640.Review: Only it's price lowers it's rating. This is an amazing tequila.  Should you have the wherewithal and ability to purchase this with no dent to your overall finances, do it.

4641.Review: Dark fruits and oak come through heavy on the finish, viscous in texture with a long finish

4643.Review: My fave.  Good memories tied to this. Expensive ($432 inc tax) but worth it if you’re sharing with the folks that are important to you.

4644.Review: Such a great oaky tequila Sweet oak and caramel which an absolutely smooth finish and great aftertaste that just keeps giving.For the time being this would be one of my top choices for extra Añejo tequila.Would also be an amazing gift as it comes in such a large luxury box.Price might be a bit more expensive than it seems but if you can afford it, enjoy it!

4645.Review: Strong vanilla and Carmel aroma, downplayed caramel taste with a slightly medicinal finish

4646.Review: I’ve only had this a few times, but I could not believe how amazing it was! Full of flavor, agave and oak stand out in the front and a clean smooth finish leaving a wonderful flavor on the palate.

4647.Review: the nose is wonderful, can definitely pick up on the complexity of the ageing process - sweeter aromas, nuttyness, almost like that of a pecan pie!

4649.Review: By far the best tequila I’ve had.

4650.Review: Very excited about tasting this tequila.  Somewhat disappointed.  Good vanilla and caramel notes.  Cognac really comes out as you continue to drink it.  Very complex palate.  Unfortunately it is pricey-expensive,  there are better tequilas at a much lower price point.

4651.Review: This is the only tequila that I would drink from Patron. The first time I had this tequila I was so surprised because I’m no fan of Patron but this one tequila was great and totally something to talk about.    Too bad it’s so expensive for what it worth.

4652.Review: Rich, sweet notes. Dried fruit, vanilla, soft oak. Short finish. Smooth

4653.Review: sweet agave fresh tobacco grasstaste.warm smooth Carmel

4654.Review: Cooked agave sweetWarm buttery pepper caramel (taste)

4655.Review: This is a bottle that I’ve wanted to own since @1998 when I discovered it at a San Antonio establishment. On the nose, light honey & molasses; 1st taste was super smooth & buttery across the palette; light hints of brown sugar & caramel on the backend...almost vanilla banana like; definitely hints of caramel aftertaste; special bottle, EXPENSIVE bottle for special occasion or for sharing with tequila fans; this is a bucket list bottle & being a Patron fan, I am NOT disappointed; grateful for the opportunity to finally own a bottle.

4656.Review: Great stuff with notes of dark chocolate, raisins, vanilla, Port wine grapes, cooked agave, pepper, oak, citrus, and peach with a lovely creamy mouthfeel

4657.Review: It's a good spirit, nicely balanced, no dominant flavors, no defects. Subtle grape notes, quite pleasant ... But there are better Tequilas for half the price.

4658.Review: Only thing hold back this Tequila is price. Sure the Patron brand gets its share of hate but this Tequila is beautiful. Nose out of this world, palate doesn't disappoint and finish is wonderful. Truly a great expression of extra añejo

4659.Review: like silk on the tongue, fruit nodes of pear and apple with Carmel over tones ave a vanilla finish. the finest I have ever had the opportunity to experience.

4660.Review: weak nose and overly subtle flavor with mature finish. feels like it lacks agave and may be overaged.

4661.Review: Beautiful if you are looking for chocolate and coffee notes, very creamy on the palate.

4663.Review: I received my bottle as a gift. I would never buy it, too pricey for my pocketbook.  Love this tequila.

4664.Review: About as far away from what I would consider what tequila is, yet it is absolutely the finest expression of what tequila can be.

4665.Review: This Extra Añejo is simply excellenté. I'd buy it often if it was, I don't know, 1/10th the price that it is?Great all around. I was quite surprised by Patrón's "Gran" line, especially considering how little I think of the regular offerings. The final aging (2 months?) in the Bordeaux barrels gives this spirit a somewhat unique and rather pleasant favor from the nose, all the way through the medium finish. Excellent, but really only a special occasion choice due to its sky-high price point ($500-$600). Too bad, I really do like it.

4666.Review: Fantastic EA only drawback is the price tag. A true premium tequila.

4667.Review: Best tequila I have ever tried! So smooth it's like drinking oaky water.

4668.Review: Tasted at Just Tacos restaurant and bar in Oahu, Hawaii in a wine glass.  Nice medium dark golden color.  Very nice aroma of cognac, orange and a sweetness to it.  First sip was a little thinner than I expected, but mice and smooth.  i did detect some slight bitterness, but nothing too harsh.  It follows with a nice warming sensation and  long finish.  Way overpriced, very good!  A-

4669.Review: Very expensive and delicious a√±ejo .Use for special corporate occasions.

4670.Review: Aroma: Initial notes of agave and vanilla. After that, it settles into caramel and a subtle hint of rye.Flavor: Definite spice which I assume comes from the rye. There are other hints of caramel and cooked agave.Finish: the finish is dry and smooth. Hangs around in your mouth and slowly works it's way down the back of your throat.

4671.Review: I really enjoyed this. Lots of licorice, caramel and rosemary aromas. Feels fantastic in your mouth with a very nice finish.

4672.Review: Again, the aroma is subtle and smells of banana, wood and a hint of vanilla. The fiery spice of the blanco is back and lights up your tongue immediately. The finish is long and warm.

4673.Review: Smoothe taste with a strong nose

4674.Review: I want to like this tequila more, but I find that the peppery flavours border on harsh. I would prefer it to be a bit less bitter as well. There are some good flavours going on in this anejo, but they are overpowered by the peppery and bitter flavours. I feel that it should be smoother. It's not horrible by any means, but I would not buy it again.

4675.Review: Agave Taste And Aroma Nothing Special But Quite Drinkable @ $15.99 Not A Bad Deal %100 De Agave I Enjoy It.

4676.Review: House tequila at El Matador in Newport. Pretty decent all around. Great in their margaritas and ok as a sipper. Itâ€™s listed in TequilaMatch maker as mixto but says 100% agave.

4677.Review: quite a bit of agave on the nose that follows through on the pallet and finish. medium heat especially being higher proof with some pepper. not bad, needs time to open up

4678.Review: Good juice for making bloody Marias.  Agave, earth, pepper, nutmeg, and jalapeño

4679.Review: When I see a brand that makes flavored tequila AND has "produced by" on the label I avoid at all costs. I'm glad I got bored and tried it. A little higher proof than the usual suspects at 85 and it shows... in a good way.Nose- Agave is immediate, followed by earth, clove, grapefruit juice, alcohol, and pepperTaste- Vegetal like baked agave with clove and nutmeg, then my palate gets dominated by spicy jalapeno. It shocked me how much I loved this combo. Finish- Spicy jalapeno and cinnamon that lasts! A little alcohol heat coats the throat but never knocks me backValue- $38 in Michigan makes this a great deal for those that crave the heat. It would make an amazing Margarita but there are cheaper options. Overall I'm shocked that this is so good and additive-free.

4680.Review: Cooked agave, vegetal nose with clove, wet earth and black pepper. Nice mouthfeel with spice on the finish.

4681.Review: This is the perfect tequila to stock up on and bring to social gatherings. You can sip it if you like but it really shines in cocktails. You can find it for 29.99 which makes it ideal for any situation. It’s honestly remarkable how good it is especially at the price point. The 92 rating is more about the value, but removing the value aspect id still rate it high at about an 86-88. Cheers to the Tanteo distillers, appreciate the hard work!

4682.Review: This is easily my favorite everyday sipper. I get tons of agave, minerals, black pepper, and a floral spice of some sort with good viscosity and a light warm finish. the best part: it's under 40 bucks.

4683.Review: This is a good Blanco. Aroma has some vanilla sweetness to the agave but is excellent. The taste also carries the vanilla and adds some decent black pepper and is good. The finish is fine. For a fairly low priced tequila this is terrific. I was skeptical when I got so much vanilla in the aroma and flavors, but I’m happy to see it’s on the additive free list. The rep from Tanteo was also talking up the additive, free qualities of their tequila.

4687.Review: Tanteo's blanco ($35-$40USD) is a great value. While it is rated a little  below some truly great balncos like G4, Cascahuin Tahona, and Terralta, it is priced very competitively. Works great as an every day sipper, but could easily be used for a killer Margarita.Nose: Cooked agave, Jalapeño, black pepper in the nose and taste.  Citrus, grapefruit and earth on the back end.  Taste: A medium oily mouthfeel with peppery heat that are in perfect balance with the mild sweetness. Capped off with a  medium to long finish.

4688.Review: Nice and clean on the nose.  A nice peppery heat on taste with a decent earthy finish.

4689.Review: Stop the press!!!! I need Not Expect for this to taste this way & Smell this way Beautiful black pepper taste(taste buds love the Sweet Heat) Agave smell is right in your nose. Update on 01/05/2023. Yes it’s a 89!!!

4690.Review: fresh cut grass, light citrus, herbal, black pepper, dry chiles, earthy.

4691.Review: Grapefruit & pepper on the nose. Mostly some sort of hot pepper (jalapeño?) dominates the palate & finish. For me, definitely not a sipper but should make a nice Margarita…

4692.Review: Agave and light alcohol nose with a clove/pepper taste. The finish was a light pepper/spice and only a touch of heat. Additive free which is important to me.  I like to taste a distiller's work and judge accordingly.

4693.Review: On the nose I get a lot of  agave, some alcohol, and citrusTaste: cooked agave(more like nutmeg and clove), citrus (like an grapefruit peel) , pepper. Not bad, has some heat that last on the tongue  most likely from the pepper

4695.Review: NOM 1465|At 35% ABV, you are not getting a very robust nose, but pleasant enough. Caramel, a blend of cedar & pine, a dash of vanilla, and ripe berry like fruit. The flavor volume is turned up significantly as compared to the nose. Vanilla wafers, black pepper heat, brown jerk spices and roasted almonds. Finish is “shortish” with a sweet/ hot/ velvety feel. Available at El Búho for $330 pesos - a bargain tequila.
